description:
Let me just say that Olive Garden is my partner's fav food but we don't go often bc the service is just slow. Like not even just this OG, most of the ones that we've been to are slow. We been to this one, the one in Sac, and the one is Hayward; and service is like always slow for some reason!? Like I'm sure the pasta and sauce is already made so idk what be takin hella long.

Anyways, last week My partner and I were able to sneak out of the house for dinner while the baby slept.  We were on a time limit because the babysitter needed to leave by 10, so we were hesitant to come here. We were helped by this nice gentleman but then passed off to Gloria who was amazing. She was fast and efficient and got us out of there in 40 min! Thank you Gloria for your wonderful service which let us enjoy dinner at one of my favorite places!
author: Melissa P.

description:
Ordered the chicken and shrimp carbonara for $23.99. The shrimp was edible. Chicken was coated with a slimy layer of what I believe was batter. 

Regrets. Poor life choices. That's all that went through my head while dining here. It took all my will power to remain seated and not walk out of the restaurant. 

Salad was edible, but looked extremely sad. Breadsticks were dry. Minestrone soup looked like regret (imagine a whole tomato boiled in v8).
 
Our server was courteous, yes. But she seemed busy.

Management and the kitchen need to improve the food at this establishment ASAP. This is a restaurant after all........... and the food goes into your customers' stomach.
author: Tina S.

description:
We went for dinner on 10/4 - I can't recall our waiter's name unfortunately but she was great. Super lovely and attentive. We were a party of 5 this time. We had a super long day (and week, actually) and were staaaarving. So much food. All of it yummy. Lots of leftovers to enjoy later. Thanks for not making us cook dinner. 

The new creamy mushroom sauce could use more mushrooms though.
author: A. I.

description:
I'm so sad to say that the quality of food here has gone down. I don't visit this Olive Garden branch often but I used to live in the Sunset district and would occasionally venture out here.

Service:
Let me just say that our server was a delight. She was sweet, relatively attentive, and wasn't hesitant to admit any of her flaws if she knew something was wrong. She was very knowledgeable about food and gave us pretty good recommendations. She is the reason I give two stars instead of one. Kudos to her. It was hard sometimes to get a server or food runners attention. We had no plates to eat off of for a bit. Even though our sever was great, it was hard getting her attention sometimes. 

Food:
The food quality is absolutely unsatisfying and kind of gross. We ordered the appetizer trio sampler with stuffed mushroom, mozzarella sticks, and zucchini bites. The main course of pasta with sausage. And for something that tasted so bleh, I'm surprised that our food took so long to get to us. It seemed like a rushed job the way it was presented but all of the food was cold, and the fried food was soggy. 

Stuffed mushrooms - was the worst thing we ate. You can definitely tell (especially with this dish) that it has been frozen for a while and then popped in the microwave. The mushrooms itself tasted like soggy mush. There's a heap of water at the bottom of the bowl. 

Mozzarella sticks - not bad. The server recommended it and it was quite pleat. Could have been heated up more to have that gooyness that comes with cheese. 

Zucchini bites - one of the worst things we had. Soggy and such a weird taste. Nothing was crispy or even warm in the middle.   

Build your own pasta - it was so sad. Seasonless sauce, no variety, and the presentation was pretty bad. It looked like someone just threw up a bunch of pasta on a plate. 

Overall, really bad food quality. I hope to see some improvements soon.
author: Leya S.

description:
I don't quite understand the low rating for this place--the several times I have been here, the food has been consistent and the service pretty decent overall. 

I came on a Thursday night this time with my family, and the place was quite crowded. The server dropped off a bread basket right away. Unfortunately, the bread was way too salty, even if very soft and chewy. 

For entree selections, everyone has the option of unlimited soup or bread. I always opt for the zuppa toscana soup, which is delicious. There was ample potato chunks, sausage, and kale that formed a light, creamy soup. Following that, I received my main, the seafood alfredo. The dish was very rich and creamy, especially topped off with a tad of cheese. The scallops and shrimp are on the firmer side and very tasty. All in all, a yummy dish that left me very full. 

My one complaint is that the entrees took their sweet time to arrive, but this is understandable as the entire restaurant was quite full. In terms of service, our waiter didn't mince words, but was very efficient in terms of checking up on us, asking if we needed anything, and letting us know that our entrees were on the way. 

Paying for the bill is also made simply by their Ziosk machine, which lets you pay with credit card and print the receipt at the table itself.
author: Karen Y.

description:
The service here was great, professional and friendly. There was no wait and we got seated as soon as we got in. We came at around 11:49am. It was my girls first time and my third I believe. We ordered the tour of Italy which consist of a chicken parmigiana, lasagna classico and their signature fettuccine alfredo for $22.99. We also created our own sampler Italiano. We decided to get 2 choices and chose the calamari and stuff mushrooms(with clams) for $11.99. 

The first to arrive was the salad bowl. It was Caesar salad and it was a pretty big bowl and was more than enough to feed 2 people. We also got breadsticks. There is a bit so salt on the top but it tasted good and different than other places that served bread. Both the tour and sampler came out and the tour of Italy looked great. Our waiter also offered if we wanted cheese on our tour of Italy and of course we gladly said yes. I've ordered this before but haven't had it in years. The chicken was cooked perfectly. The lasagna was okay and the Alfredo was good but not really different than other places. The stuff mushrooms were different due to it having clams but I gotta say it was a pretty good combination. Also, the calamari was a good snack on the side. There are also dipping sauces that came with the sampler. Overall, it was a good experience. Food tasted good and filled us up and staff were great.
author: Mark D.

description: This is more like a 3.8 rating. Yes it's a chain restaurant but it is a good location and the free bread sticks are good. I did enjoy the the tour of Italy which this time was fresh and delicious. I also enjoyed the appetizer plate with calamari, mushrooms and beef fried ravioli. This is no means the Golden Mirror or the Italian restaurants in North Beach.
author: Juan V.

description: The food was excellent but the server named sam was rude it seems shes not happy with her job .  10/26/18.
author: Applezane A.

description:
My significant other and i attended an evening hosted by the Olive Garden staff this past Friday. To prevent waiting 30 min for a table, we deferred to sitting at the bar. 

We had a pleasant interaction with our server who was very excited to serve us.  We had appetizers, drinks and took part of their latest promotional deal. Buy one take one.  

The rest of this review is about the take one portion of the deal. 

The following evening I prepared the take one fettuccine Alfredo that my significant other purchased for us (i would never give my hard earned money to Olive Garden or any likeness of this brand).  I heated the Alfredo sauce in a pan and added in sautéed vegetables. While this was warming up, i grilled chicken to pair with the pasta. As the sauce began to boil and turn into a oily base, I heated pasta in this as the meat finished cooking.

This meal i crafted warrants the 4 star review and it would have been 5 stars if it wasn't for the fact I was forced to use the Olive Garden's pasta and sauce. I should have gone to the store. Olive Garden warrants a negative review.
author: Hamid S.

description: Received great service at this location.  Server was very helpful and friendly. He was busy with other tables but managed to take care of my table as well. The restaurant looked clean. No complaints from this location.
author: Isa L.

description: This is the generic Italian restaurant. Great breadsticks that are always available. Salad was really good. The chicken Marsala was delicious. There are so many entrees I wanted to try but my stomach could only hold so much! If you have to wait, the hostesses give you a buzzer with a number. Perhaps instead they should take your cell number and text you when they are ready to seat you, that way you can look around the mall while waiting. Also my friend said the cheese ravioli dish was great.
author: Gabrielle R.

description:
Mother daughter date with my older daughter found us here. Her favorite chain. Her treat, her choice. 

I enjoyed my lunch because I had things I never tried before and maybe that was my problem at previous visits.

I enjoyed my gnocci soup with tender chunks of chicken breast and whole leaf spinach in a creamy soup base. I also enjoyed my fettuccine with grilled chicken. It wasn't a huge portion, nor was the sauce overwhelming and super fatty. It was perfect! 

Our server was outstanding. I was really happy. 

Chains serve a purpose and on this day? Olive Garden met that purpose: an afternoon date chatting with my older daughter while enjoying a great lunch. 

I am one very loved, extremely blessed mom. 

Thanks for a fuss free mother-daughter lunch, Olive Garden!
author: Jennifer C P.

description: What a waste of time and $$$... in a city like San Francisco where there are endless amazing unique restaurants, OG is my sister's favorite... OK whatever, she's a great girl and invited me to dinner. We arrived around 4 on a week night, it was quiet but were told we'd have to wait 20 minutes, no biggie, I wanted to have a cocktail before dinner anyway. We go to the bar and there are only two other people sitting there. We sit down, the bartender, who's showing off about his "body art" to the only other 2 people in the bar looks at us, doesn't say hello or acknowledge us, and proceeds to keep control talking this poor couple at the bar about his tats. Finally, I had to say rather loudly "Excuse me, we're ready to order our drinks, please... again, no hi or hello... rather, it was "What do you want"... not like what would you like to drink tonight... puts our drinks in front of us, we say thank you, he doesn't say you're welcome or enjoy but walked away pissed off that he had to do his very easy at the moment job. Needless to say, he was paid in small bills and lots of change, no tip, because in the hospitality business you have to show at least a little ability to be friendly and helpful. Next, our hostess seated us. There were quite a few empty clean tables but she took us to a dirty table with used cups, crumpled napkins, dirty utensils and food smeared on the table. I said is someone going to clean this table before we sit down, or if we can have an already clean table that would work even better. She said, oh sorry, picked up every thing but left the table dirty, I had to say would someone please wipe it down too... yikes! She was perfectly nice but you could tell, not trained at all. My sister was there for advertised season items ( Black cherry coke with Makers Mark and Pumpkin Chunk cheese cake ) but the waitress (who was awesome, BTW ) was not aware of these specials but did her best to accommodate. My sister ended up with a rum and coke with a sad wilted cherry on top and a piece of black and white cheesecake. Needless to say, between the bartender's dismissive can't be bothered attitude, the hostess not having the common sense to not seat people at a table full of the last party's garbage and the heavily advertised seasonal specials not available we will not be going back, ever. The waitress was the only bright spot, hope she does not stay there long because she's better than that place, for sure! Epic fail, OG!!!
author: Cool B.

description: Honestly so so horrible. First off, the server seemed super distracted constantly. Focus on the customers bud. Ordered the calamari as an appetizer and wow, it was awful. Pretty much just a breaded, soggy circle with nothing inside. The shrimp scampi was so greasy and the bowl was just filled with oily liquid. My boyfriend got the fettuccine Alfredo, it was mediocre, that's what they're getting the one star for. I got a lemonade and it was still warm & the glass was just filled with ice. I try to give this restaurants a couple different chances but I'm never coming back again.
author: Natalia C.

description:
I've been coming to this particular Olive Garden for a few years now and I can safely say that it's definitely a must if you're looking for a decent fine dining establishment to dine finely. The food is delicious and the atmosphere encourages a tranquil environment.
However the only thing keeping this review from being a 5 star is the rat problem. While I was dining in the other night I peeked from the corner two rats playing tag under some of the tables. Nobody seemed to notice, however. Rats are both a health hazard and a nuisance to a place like this, and sure enough, I couldn't help but maintain cautiousness while digging into my braised beef bolognese.
author: Ohmar S.
Eduardo F.

description:
My family and I were in San Francisco on Saturday to spend some time with my mom who lives there. When asked what she wanted to eat for dinner she responds with "Olive Garden" only I think it was a ruse because she wanted me to go to Sephora with her...lol! 

The Olive Garden we chose is in the Stonestown Galleria shopping mall which is a hop and a skip around the corner from SFSU. So the fact that it was located in a mall means ample parking. We arrived at about 4:30 and didn't take too long to find parking, within decent walking distance of the front door of the restaurant. 

For a party of 8, Olive Garden gave me an estimated wait time of 20 minutes, not too shabby, especially for dinner time on a Saturday. Although I think there wasn't much of a wait because everyone seemed to be next door at Marugame Udon and maybe part of it has to do with the reason I could only muster 2 stars for this review.  Marugame Udon had the line snaked in front and then even had to split it into two because of how long the line was. I of course made a mental note that will need to try it next time. It was like that when we left Olive Garden and when we finally left the mall at 8PM.

So the hostess at Olive Garden was pleasant and didn't ask how to spell my name (America), you have no idea how many people ask. Our party was then called and we were escorted to the back in what seemed to be a more private room. Come to find out it's where they stick the families with the crying babies...lol! Didn't bother us too much because we are kind of a loud speaking family so we may have had the crying babies beat by a few octaves. 

Our server was prompt with our bread and took our drink orders. While everyone ordered their arnold palmer's and water, I also ordered their special: Blackberry Watermelon Margarita. When it came, it tasted like Minute Maid juice slushy in a salt rimmed glass, not even a hint of alcohol. Bleh and disappointing! She brought us our drinks and then took our appetizer and dinner orders. The appetizers came (fried mozzerella and calamari) and when I asked her to take the wine glasses on the table as we would not be ordering any wine, she forgot to take them when she set our appetizers down. The table was kind of small for our party of 8 and I was trying to make good use of the room we had and remove any superfluous items i.e them wine glasses! I hadn't realize how small the portion size was for the appetizers and we only ordered 2 because it's all that tempted us. Only our waitress did not come back until she had our dinner's ready but I put in another order of calamari anyway since my mom enjoyed it. 

We ordered 2 shrimp and chicken carbonara's, a pasta chips nachos, 2 shrimp scampi, spaghetti, shrimp alfredo and salmon with broccoli. My husband tends to gauge all his meals against my cooking and he was NOT happy with his shrimp and chicken carbonara. He had me taste it and the chicken had a weird texture to it as if it had been previously frozen after being lightly breaded (almost the same consistency of a McDonald's chicken nugget if you take the breading off) and the shrimp was gummy. My salmon and broccoli were delicious. My son ordered the shrimp scampi and was unimpressed because the asparagus that came in the dish was raw and hard. My mother's boyfriend ordered the pasta chips nachos and he said he was a fan. The chips seemed to be a fried won ton consistency and held up against the meat mixture they topped it with. 

Our bill came out to be $230 and I would not have flinched at that price had we had a more attentive waitress and the quality of food was better. I know it's Olive Garden and not some world renowned Italian restaurant but come on, people work hard for their money and make contingencies to enjoy a meal away from home. This was not our first time here and my mom was just here for Mother's Day with my sister and brother and she said the service and food was the same then, but she wanted to give it another try. I don't give 2 star reviews, I really try to give establishments the benefit of the doubt because I get there are off days. I unfortunately could not take that approach this time and I think it should be duly noted that Olive Garden you are a pretty well known restaurant and there has to be some sort of second look of your quality control standards and maybe someone should watch to see how often your servers are checking in on the patrons. When I spend money and take the time to travel and decide on where I want to spend my hard earned money I want it to be at a place that takes pride in their name and food and are attentive to my needs.
author: AmErica A.

description:
Food is over priced good taste ok.
service is realy goodvery friendly.
place is pretty clean
author: Maria R.

description: Went here against my better judgement. Their food is not bad, it's not authentic Italian but tasty. The service here was so slow and they seem so disorganized. We got handed off multiple times between different waiters.
author: Sunil R.

description:
So this is what life is like after you get dumped from yelp elite after 10 years...

For some reason I always look forward to going to Olive Garden...even though of course it's not the absolute greatest pasta place on Earth, this time I was shocked by my experience.

We were seated at a table that didn't have any utensils until the meal was served, we had 8 of us, but they only brought out 4 cups of water after we asked for water for everyone, the salad was more chunks of old white lettuce than actual greenery, and when we asked for parmesan cheese, they brought the cheese grater to our table and we had to grate our own cheese...that's totally not what I remember it being like before...

So the salad was amazingly sub-par...one of our friends even asked if they still put dressing on the salad because it was so dry.

The fried pasta chips were surprisingly good.  It's like nachos, but w fried pasta...it it quick though, as it can get a bit soggy after a while.

Some people had the shrimp scampi, a dish definitely more fitted for somebody who trying to carbo-load before a marathon than an actual meal.  I don't think they even made it through half of the noodles, so if you're hungry, this is probably a good dish for you.

The braised beef Bolognese was pretty amazing, but I think it is only a temporary special.  Lots of meat and a very generous portion.

For my meal, I had the tour of Italy. Lasagna, fettuccine alfredo, and chicken parmigiana.  I think this is the best combo on the menu, with a little bit of everything... it almost made me forget how bad the service was...

Happy eating!
author: Bradley H.

description: Regular local customers for years. Always Good food and service from host to servers to bussers. Never a complaint...except today. Our server Edgar was exceptionally rude. Realizing everybody can have a bad day but it felt really uncomfortable and restaurant was not busy.  Too bad we didnt have the other server Maribel who is kind and welcoming. Unfortunate, disappointing unpleasant experience.
author: Susie P.

description:
Decided to eat here last Saturday evening with my bf and left disappointed. The night ACTUALLY started out okay though. The best part was the FIRST part which included the breadsticks, unlimited salad, and soup. They were just as I remember and worth eating and ordering over and over again. Breadsticks were soft and warm, lightly brushed with melted butter on top. We ordered the zuppa toscana soup and it was creamy and spicy with kale and Italian sausage bits. I really liked the soup and would recommend others to try it if you can handle spicy. Famous house salad was good too, as expected! The pepperocinis were a nice twist. The breadsticks, unlimited salad, and soup was what drew us here, and all that was delicious! Everything else though was disappointing and the night went downhill from here. 

Service was either MIA or fleeting.  Our table didn't even have utensils. Server didn't notice, neither did the host. We were served our salad and soup but couldn't enjoy anything until we had to flag a staff member down. Would've told our server, but she wasn't around! She barely came by to check on us, also forgot about our appetizer until we asked her about it, and that was 10 mins after when we were already finished the salad, soup, and breadsticks. So everything was really slow. I could tell she was stressed. 

The appetizers and entrees lacked flavor or had TOO MUCH seasoning. We ordered a three sampler appetizer - stuffed mushrooms, fried mozzarella, and parmesan crusted zucchini. Zucchini had too much salt, didn't finish. Stuffed mushrooms were meh. Didn't finish either. Best appetizer of the three was the fried mozzarella. As for the entrees, my bf ordered a create your own -- grilled chicken, angel hair pasta, and asiago garlic alfredo sauce. I ordered a shrimp scampi. My bf's create your own pasta was dull and did not have enough sauce. His angel hair pasta was dry af. The grilled chicken was good, but he couldn't finish the pasta. My shrimp scampi was meh. Compared to my bf's, the shrimp scampi had too much sauce to the point the noodles were soggy. I was disappointed because the presentation definitely did not look like their advertised photo on the menu. There were more than 3 shrimps though! I ate it but probably should've ordered something else on the menu.

It's been years since I've eaten at Olive Garden and this recent experience delays me from wanting to come back. Both food and service needs improvement. 

ALSO... they should remove the self-order game machine. It's deceiving and charges $1.99 for just touching the thing. I was tempted to touch it until my bf yelled 'WAIT'! LOL
author: Debby N.

description: You can't go wrong with Olive Garden! Food is always great! The server we had was friendly and on top of it! But the hostess can definitely use more training on How-to-Great hungry, paying customers. YIKES GIRL YIKES! I'm trying to eat not catch a case!
author: Kely R.

description:
Three stars, not more not less. An Olive Garden is an Olive Garden. We all know the warmed breadsticks with seasoned olive oil, the salad where they put one black olive per person in the big family style bowl (yeah, count next time - two people on your table ordered salad? Just two black olives for you), and we all know the high calorie pasta is decadent. Paired with the perfect wines though, you can have a pretty ok Americanized chain version of Italian food here. You probably won't go wrong but you won't be blown away either.

The last time we went here was this past Saturday night. My little love turned 6 that day, and her special birthday request was a trip to the zoo and then dinner at the Olive Garden. Awww, so cute. It is typically our ritual to go to this Olive Garden after enjoying a long day the SF Zoo.

We also go to Olive Garden because my picky pasta loving child will very happily eat here - and that makes for a very good night for me.  All in all, it was pretty decent as it usually is this past Saturday night.

But beware - the later into the dinner hour you head over, the longer the wait. The wait can be anywhere from 15 minutes if you're super lucky to over an hour if you're super unlucky. Heads up, they don't take reservations and that's why the wait is so long. But if you're down for a wait, then ok. A-OK for this Olive Garden.
author: Liza W.

description:
The bread is warm and tasty!
I love the flavor of the bread, so yummy!
The service was great and nice, but the pastas were very terrible.
The sauce of the pasta were very salty, and the grilled chicken were also hard to swallow, because it were too dry.
I really don't recommend this restaurant.
author: Amanda H.

description:
I am a regular at this Olive Garden, and the food has gone down! 
I Ordered the lunch special speg with meat sauce it comes with your choice of soup or salad 
I always order the soup which is what I go there for, it's my favorite.
Waitress informed me that soup will not be ready for another 15 or 20 mins or so I told her I'd wait , instead she brought me my pasta first which I would've wanted after my soup!
Being hungry I ate it first .  
Waitress was very nice she was also new, which I understood .
Well 15 mins goes by my waitress apologizes that soup is STILL not ready and will take another 15 to 20 mins I had finished my pasta by this time.By the way the bread sticks were way over baked and hard enough to break your tooth! 
 by now, I politely asked for the manager.
The manager himself comes out and serves  me the soup himself! 
But the potatoes were Still hard !t 
Would've been nice if he had explained what the problem was instead of just dropping the bowl of soup and walking away like it was my fault for waiting for  over half an hour!
Not planning to go come back  to this Olive Garden !
Service from the waitress was great though, not her fault!
author: Virginia C.

description: I haven't been here in YEARS.  I would classify it as generic, over priced Italian food.  I can't justify spending that much money on something that's "average".  We ordered the lobster ravioli which came with tiny bite sized scallops and literally 2 pieces of shrimp.  Soup, salad, breadsticks and appetizers (stuffed mushrooms and calamari) were all good as usual... no surprises there.  Also ordered a strawberry and mango margarita that was refreshing.  My qualm is about the customer service.  It was horrible! We were seated at the bar and it took awhile for them to get our order, clear our plates, get our drink, and bring the check.  Did not appreciate that at all.
author: Quynh D.

description: I am horrible at buffets in general. I get really creeped out by all the massive amount of food and also by hoards of people peering over food. This place has one of those components - the massive amounts of food. Food that isn't really good. The salad was the highlight of my meal. I had the ability to try pretty much everything they had on the menu. It was all "meh". Hard pass on this place. 2 stars for the salad and tea they have. I brought home food and I didn't even eat it. I have it to my fiancé who liked this place lol. It gave me heartburn for a full day.
author: Bella B.

description:
I just love macaroni even when it's overcooked.
Shrimp covered in breadcrumbs, bread, salad, pasta carbonara. 
Fat-rich food makes you feel like you are visiting grandma.
You can have the whole table covered in food for $70, so your eyes also will get fed feeling( eating with eyes)

This place is better for groups. 
If you want spend romantic lunch/dinner choose something different.
author: Marianna P.

description: I don't know why i keep coming back, maybe because my favorite pasta place in west portal is harder to get parking and i hate looking for parking.   Olive Garden has pasta, salads, appetizers and soups, all of which i feel is too salty.     I normally get the stuffed pasta but I feel the cream is too heavy.  The unlimited soup is good but it also fills you up quick.  the Gnocchi soup is my favorite.  and goes perfectly with the breadsticks.    The appetizers are usually better compared to the main courses, and the desserts are a tad too sweet by perfect for sharing. The service is so-so, some servers are great and some have horrible service.  They have a little ipad wannabe thing, for your to order food and check out.  It also provides a paper receipt that prints out right there.
author: Belinda C.

description:
Look, it's pretty consistently good. This location is nice. The decor is classy. I truly recommend this place for nice date with your honey. 
Normally my fiance and I go for soup, salad and bread sticks. I think it is pricey. But having 4 different soups to choose makes it nice. And I like my salad with extra black olive. They were more than willing to accommodate me. 
Now my fiance was wanting to try one of their fruity drinks. Moscato Citrus Berry Cocktail. It was quite tasty. Only bad thing I had empty some the ice to get to the blue berries. And she absolutely loves them. Something about anti-oxidants but then I went blank. LOL. 
David was our server. Truly this guy went above and beyond. As I made the mistake of ordering the wrong soup, I did not have look like that customer searching the Serengeti for waiter. He had 4 tables but still kept an eye on us. Like a stalker but one you want. LOL.
Over all we truly had an enjoyable time. I did not get any pics. Sorry about that but I say come check it out. You will have a nice time
author: David S.

description: If you love Olive Garden and dont want to pay the high prices, go for lunch!! The Spicey calabrian chicken sandwich is amazing with unlimited soup or salad. Everything was awesome the last time we visited the port richey location. Food and service were fantastic. Thank you Lisa R. you were great!!
author: Nicole H.

description: ALWAYS THE BEST!!! the new alfredo chicken lasagna is on hit!! also you can get  it with meatballs which was also delicious!!
author: Jenny P.

description: The only reason I am giving this review 2 stars is because the service at dinner was great.I had a very bad experience at the bar and am greatly disappointed. Brendan,the bartender, saw us approaching the bar, but did not acknowledge us at all--he was too involved in his conversation with a customer about tattoo artistry!!! We sat on the right end of the bar and he was in the middle of the bar carrying on his conversation FULLY aware of our presence. We quietly and very patiently waited and he took his sweet time with his conversation and completely ignored us. So at 5:23 pm after 5 minutes, my sister very politely asked him if he could serve us. He was bothered because we interrupted his conversation and asked us what we wanted in an unfriendly fashion. My sister told him we wanted wine and I proceeded to show him my buzzer so that we would get the discount on our wine--he was annoyed and kind of snapped -oh I see that. I wanted to get a manager- I was so angry and upset, but my sister wanted no drama and advised me to contact corporate directly. It was a very, very disheartening experience--it was and is his job to be friendly and to provide us decent service in a timely manner and not be discussing tattooing techniques with a random patron. Otherwise the service we had at dinner was excellent. Our server Anna was super friendly and sweet. She went above and beyond the call of duty in her service to us. She was knowledgeable and enthusiastic. I went to redeem my birthday dessert coupon and she brought out a piece of black tie cheesecake with a candle and 2 other servers and they all proceeded to sing Happy Birthday to me. It really made me smile. I hope this review is helpful
author: alexandria s.

description: Olive Garden - an American version of Italian food. It's actually about as Italian as Chef Boyardee canned ravioli, but I did not expect anything more. It is just fun casual dining. I give them points  for unlimited soup, salad, and breadsticks.
author: Robert B.

description: Dumb pasta with heavy tomato sauce. The food was served cold. Waiter payed no attention to to our table...Too busy to talking with other employees... Never come back!
author: Hicran K.

description:
Haven't been to Olive Garden in years! I seemed to have forgotten the reasons why I would avoid this place. So when I went to the restaurant I came in with an open mind to try things out again. 

I ordered the Chicken Piccata, which was delicious. The portions were right and the zucchini's crust was just right. One thing I did notice was the pricing of the food does not match the quality of the food. Sure everything was tasty, but not $25 for a dinner plate tasty. (No I'm not being a cheap yelper). However if you're trying to find a quick spot to eat some Italian cuisine, come here. 

Oh, and breadsticks are probs the reason why I'd come here.
author: Robert B.

description: The food has changed. Seafood Portofino is very dry. Calamari is Also very dry. It's not the same as before.
author: Jaime L.

description:
Came here for a late fam dinner after driving for 6 hours. I had shrimp fettuccine and it didn't seem
Fresh. The shrimp tasted really shrimpy. Almost fishy. I had asked for a raspberry lemonade and I never got it. 
Service was ok. We felt a bit neglected but the server was nice. Doubt I'd be coming back because I don't visit SF often and it isn't because of bad service or food. I'd rather try something else.
author: Alexia V.

description:
Food Poisoning!

I'm finally well enough to write this review after making the mistake of eating at Olive Garden a few days ago. I should have turned around as soon as I opened the door and was engulfed in the strong smell of greasy food. I ordered one of the Mediterranean chicken dishes, listed as being served over grilled veggies with pasta. What I received was a mountain of pasta, gluten-free rotini, with a few strips of chicken and tiny pieces of zucchini. The taste was strictly mediocre and I made a note never to return. My disappointment was greatly magnified in the middle of the night when I became explosively sick, from both ends simultaneously.  I strongly recommend that you stay away!
author: Deborah H.

description:
We had a large party and it took an hour to get seated. The hostess told us the table before us was all paid and boxed up, but the restaurant policy says they can't rush them, so that table chatted for at least an hour after paying.

The food was not impressive at all and overpriced at $20 plus for pasta.  The create your own was the best value, but was plain unless you pay for the add-ons.  The unlimited soup, salad, breadsticks was nice, except everything was loaded with sodium and very oily.  I'm already bloated.  So many other places to get sub-par food for cheaper.  Would not recommend it unless you're in the area and desperate for food.

Bathrooms were super nasty too.
author: May L.

description:
It has been a long time since I've eaten at one of the Olive Garden restaurants. Every time I see the tv commercial, it makes me crave dining at an Olive Garden because I remembered how good the food was.

So it was surely disappointing when I finally dined today. I ordered Shrimp Scampi and as you can see in the photo, it had literally only 5 pieces of mediocrely-sized shrimps in a huge bed of angel hair pasta. Definitely not the way it was pictured in their menu :(

And the taste, well let me just say that it was tasteless to say the least! I should have just gone into Chipotle next door and would have gotten my money's worth.
author: Lea M.

description:
The female waitstaff was so meh. That was the beginning to the end. No more chain restaurants for me!
The starters: calamari & fried mozzarella were good. Crispy calamari with lemon and meaty cheese rectangles. 
Had to practically beg for more breadsticks. 
My tour of Italy was shipwrecked. The chicken Alfredo was the better-of the dishes, it looked good. The chicken & shrimp cabonera was sad. Even the salad was depressed. 
Shouldn't have to ask waitstaff for better service. The other person waiting tables in the area was so much easier to talk to and offered us things. 
The waitstaff had the nerve to ask if we wanted dessert. Yeah right!
I only left a tip because I knew the busboy needed his share & did not feel like being that "let me speak to the manager" person. 
Olive Garden, you got me good last night! Never again
author: Rene C.

description:
I wish I hadn't let my friend choose our lunch spot. We came at 11:45 and there was a 20 minute wait. I'm not really sure what makes this place so popular to have that kind of wait. As I later learned, the food here isn't good at all, especially if you consider the prices being charged.

I ordered the cheese ravioli. You get a lot of cheese, but it was extremely salty to the point of being inedible. I was taking swigs of water with every bite. 

I don't have any complaints about the service. It was busy, but our waiter still managed to check up on us every now and then.

The best thing about this place were the bread sticks - no lie.
author: Taylor K.

description: Been to other olive gardens but this place is crap. The chicken chowder soup was not chowdery. It was like water, bred sticks had so much damn salt. Scrapped off two bred sticks.  Pasta is so bland.. this Oliver garden sucks!
author: Jim C.

description: Stopped here for a drink only on a Thursday evening around 5:30. Place was dead. Like maybe 5 or 6 other people. No big at the time but in hind site it should have been a red flag. Bar was out of most beers other the  generic Bud, Coors and such. Asked for Champagne for the wife and ......You guessed it, they where out. I ended up with a beer I didn't like and she got a barely above warm glass of white wine. Would have been better off at the local convenience store.
author: Ray L.

description:
So it's been 30 min since we  got seated and ordered our drinks. I ordered coffee, which came with out creamer and spoon to stir it with. So i ask for creamer and spoon, but only creamer came. It is now 45 min since we ordered and i have been stirring my coffee with a butter knife. Now I see why the bad rating. Will not come again. 

Never-ending  soup, salad and pasta, a joke. Never ending wait for the order to come. The wait between service is 45 min. In the meantime keep drinking water until the order comes. Didnt really get to the next refill due to servixe wait is about 45 min to an hour  and the restaurant is not even busy. 

Appetizer came last. Main course came first.
author: JC J.

description:
Wonderful service the waitress by name of Seng was great.
He was very helpful and very knowledgeable explain everything would we needed to get show the different varieties and accommodators in wonderful way.
The food is probably 4 * but the service is an excellent
author: Yevgeny D.

description:
We we're here and waited 40 minutes to be seated. Half of the room in the back was empty, tables not clean. 
We were told someone will come and take our orders in a couple minutes.
We waited another 20 minutes, no one showed up, servers all around and not one of them even bother to stop and ask. 

We  got up and left indtead. Worst place we've ever been. I will not recommend that place to my worst enemy!

We drove across the street to Red Lobster, and they were awesome!
Our servers, Chastity and Erika, we're just wonderfully great. Michael the manager very attentive, the food was awesome!
Thanks Red Lobster! You guys are just awesome! My family enjoyed not just the food, but the overall experience!
author: Mercy M.

description:
First of let's call it Olive Garden without the Italian part. Food is not Italian. Doesn't have anything at all to do with Italian food so if you are looking for Italian food just go somewhere else. 
The service is horrible. The waitress came with dishes that were dirty af. She started scratching the dirty off my plate with her nails. I was shocked. In the drink of my husband there was a huge hair.
About the food I was positively surprised. My linguine with shrimp and Alfredo sauce were actually good. The lasagna of my husband was ok but nothing special.
author: Kira B.

description: My first time to this place after 5-7 years and I was not sure what to expect. Back then during college time, I considered this restaurant was fancy and everything was delicious. Now, fast forward, as I have many opportunities to dine much more expensive food, and coming back here I prepared myself to not expect much. However, it turns out that the food here is still pretty good, we have the unlimited house salad, trio sampler (fried calamari, stuffed mushroom, and parmesan zucchini bites), and tour of Italy (lasagna, fetuccini alfredo, and chicken parmesan). Everything still tastes the same and the bill was cheap as well. Despite being so full, I have to get their delicious classic tiramisu. To top it off, the whole experience is better because of our awesome server, Michael D. He was super busy but he managed to be attentive and brought out our food just at the right time. We did not have to wait ridicuously long for our food like at some other busy restaurant. I could see that the other waiters and waitressed helped him out too, great teamwork to them. Definitely worthy to go back after ages!!! Thanks.
author: Melanie Thu D.

description:
(5 STARS FOR ZOE K)
So we all know Olive Garden has its pros and cons. Also from time to time going to one could be a gamble.
But today me and my family were very eager to make sure I put 5 stars up for there customer service today. We were seated fast and on top of that Zoe K are waitress was amazing. She went over the top with service they definitely need to step her position up.
author: Jay V.

description: Good food and good service. Our go to place when we are in town. Fresh, hot bread. Mmmmmmm
author: Teto S.

description:
San Francisco has a muni line (M line) that takes you directly from stations downtown to Olive Garden - how amazing!

Reasons for coming:
 - Unlimited breadsticks
 - Prompt service
 - Unlimited breadsticks

Reasons for abstaining:
 - Unlimited breadsticks

Also, I came here last Valentines Day and the wait was 2 hours which goes to show how many people love olive garden and want to share that experience with a special someone. They're not wrong.
author: Andrew C.

description:
Came here for dinner with relatives out of town. Had a 40 minute wait which is typically understandable considering it was around dinner time. 

We had placed our order and everything came out except my entree. I had order the chicken Alfredo which had accidentally been sent to another table. Kitchen had to remake my order. Finally got the order but the Alfredo sauce was broken and was salty. Not the usually creamy texture that an Alfredo is supposed to be. Had sent it back and asked for a different pasta.

Changed my order to the Shrimp and Chicken carbonara. The sauce was much better and not too salty. Although I had to wait a while for the order to come after asking a female shift manager the status of my order , the shift manager - Carlos brought out my order. He apologized for the long wait and mistake with my first orders and it's remake. 

The chicken and gnocchi soup wasn't like it used to be. The soup seemed to be broken and a tad on the salted side. The breadsticks were salted a little more then usual. Had to wipe the excess salt off with the napkin before eating it  

Appetizer: stuffed mushrooms. 
It seemed as though it wasn't cooked all the way. The top where it was stuffed but towards the cap it seems a little cold. 

Breadsticks:
I love the breadsticks and would usually ask for 2-3 baskets and some to go home. However, we barely got through the first basket, leaving only 3 left due to the salt on top. I had to wipe it off before eating it. 

The tablet devices on the table should make this a little easier by ordering and calling the server but the call server button doesn't seem to be as efficient as it should. It just flashes and the patrons would have to turn the flashing red light off. 

Most of us order refillable drinks, not once did the waitress come and offered a refill. 

The shift manager - Carlos was very friendly and helped take care of our table and he even went after us after we left the restaurant to once again apologize for the service and food and gave us a $15 gift card to come back. 

Not sure if I will come back in the near future since it seems like their food quality has become salty. Maybe in a few years I'll give olive garden another try.
author: Maile W.

description: The picture is about the Ziosk Food Ordering system. It's on every table. My 2 year old accidentally clicked on the game and was charged $1.99. What a shady practice to charge customer money !!!!
author: David Z.

description: So let's not skip the fact that the restaurant smells like a dirty mop bucket upon arrival, even my toddler noticed a funny smell, she said "mom it's stinky in here". I should have listened to my gut feeling about just turning around and walking back out. The overall experience was enough to reassure me that it's best to stay at home and eat. everything just ended up being gross and I think because I was disgusted from the moment I entered. You can't just keep sweeping the spills of soda out of carpet and feel it's clean, manager ended up accommodating because I was absolutely not satisfied... won't be back, stay home and eat, look up their recipes online, at least you know everything is clean but then again most people don't even wash their hands leaving the restroom so who am I really giving advice to?
author: Jiavani H.

description:
The breadsticks are phallic in shape.


Will recommend to a friend.

10/10 would come again for lunch
author: Justin C.

description: Came in on 5/25/18 and a young lady named Diana P was my waitress. She was an absolute delight. She was patient and helpful when I asked about certain dishes. It was my best friends birthday and she just made the event so special. I'm not sure if it's something I can do, but next time I go in i would love to ask for her again. A++ service
author: Mandy M.

description: Came here on Sunday afternoon with my 6 year old granddaughter and my son-in-law.  We waited an hour to be seated.  The children's menu had her favorite mac and cheese, but it looked a little dry. She ordered strawberry smoothie for her drink,  and chose two sides,  grapes and French fries to go with her entree. I ordered grilled chicken parmagiana with spaghetti. We always love the bread here.
author: Stillupcooking Y.

description: Me and my husband our favorite restaurant coz when we got married we celebrate there and once a while or both a day offs in our work we ate there our favorite food there is spaghetti with meat sauce and soup and salad and fettuccine Alfredo is yummy.
author: Robert S.

description: Great customer service, nice ambiance. My waitress was great, very attentive to her customers. I will definitely return.
author: Charmi M.

description: Went to the Olive Garden in Stones-town SF for the first time.  Were greeted at the door. The food was delicious.  Although our server had a good attitude, I think he was a bit overwhelmed. My grandsons order was missing his fries which I mentioned and was told they were coming but never came, the Pepperoni on his pizza was missing, me and my daughter got 1 glass of water and no re fills, and our take out was almost forgotten. Fortunately my grandson was ok with only a cheese pizza and no fries. Always make sure the customers have water.
author: Paula G.

description: Lets start off by saying it is greasy Italian food. If you want authentic pasta, salad, and breadsticks go to an authentic Italian restaurant. There isnt really a review necessary. EAT AT YOUR OWN RISK.
author: John M.

description: I went had lunch w my 2 friends. We sat down in the Bar area. The table next to us had bad smell. The afternoon manager & waitress. They both went above&beyond out of our way . Paid our lunch. By far truly was awesome. Great manager& waitress. Thank you kindly!
author: Karen B.

description: They should rename this restaurant chain   The Olive Pit.  Pit as in a hole in the ground, it's about as Italian as Bruce Lee is Jewish. The food is just like the frozen dinners at the supermarket made by Mama Sarducci. My linguine with ham, cream, and Batta Bing Batta Boom was cold and the garlic bread was stale. My friend Goldar Methuselah Corleone had the meatballs and they were mushy for some reason, the tomato sauce tasted synthetic or not natural with no flavors of basil or garlic. On top of spaghetti all covered with cheese I lost my poor meatball when somebody sneezed, it rolled off of the table and onto the floor and then my poor meatball rolled right out the door, it rolled into the garden and under a bush, and now my poor meatball is nothing but mush.
author: Gamera B.

description:
This is my second time here and the first time I had amazing service from the lady bartender with glasses. This time around there was another one, tall blonde guy that "helped" me. 

He took my order and got it going. Food was great but he then starts complaining on how he made no money on Labor Day. He said that people were not tipping him. I get it but don't cry about in front of customers, unprofessional. 

After my order all comes he never checked in if I needed anything or remove any plates until I had to ask for more bread. The rest of the time, he was just talking to his coworkers the whole.entire.time. 

His coworker, the lady bartender is the only person who checked on me and asked if I needed anything else and processed my check while the guy continues his conversation with his coworkers. 

I can tell why you don't get tipped, you give bad service. Maybe you should be trained again on how to give great customer service all the time. (Note to management) I did not want to leave a tip but I did anyways maybe the lady bartender who stepped gets a piece.

I only came here because I work near by and it's only a 5 min walk. I'll just request the lady bartender if/when I decide to go again.
author: Sylvia V.

description:
I can't remember the last time I went to Olive Garden, so it's safe to say it's been a while.
I got here around 1:35 pm and got seated right away. 
The customer service was pretty good, except that the girl who seated us took a few minutes because she was busy doing something else, and didn't even bother to greet us until she was done. 
Now, the food.
We ordered two soups to start off our meal - I can't remember the name of either, but mine had a yellow broth, kale, and bits of meat. It was good, and the right amount of spicy. 
I ordered a typical spaghetti with meat sauce - definitely disappointed. It's such a basic recipe, one could have easily done the same, or better, at home. The sausage and meatball weren't anything special either. The only thing is all the pastas come in large amounts, so maybe 2-3 people per plate is a good idea.
The only things I actually liked about this Olive Garden were the breadsticks and the chocolate they gave us at the end.
Next time I come to Stonestown though, I'll probably try out another restaurant.
author: Gabby O.

description: Tried for dinner on a Saturday night. They do not take reservations at this Stonestown location. We wanted dinner at 730pm. With no reservations at this location, we arrived at 8pm, waited for 45-60minutes to be seated. Salad, bread, and calamari eating approximately 9pm. Bread sticks had lot of salt stuck to it, maybe serve butter instead. Breading on calamari had lot of salt and not needed because dipping sauces was sufficient. Main course was make you own pasta (choose pasta, choose sauce, choose meat for additional cost). Garlic Alfredo sauce a little light. Tomato meat sauce was tasty with oregano. Overall food was 3 stars. My grandma made better Italian food,  so maybe my Italian food standards are too high.
author: Clifford W.

description: The food and service are great! But watch out for their "self order machine".  If you touch the "Game App", no matter you play or not, it charges you $1.99.
author: Daisy C.

description: Whenever I go to this Olive Garden location, I always have a great time and the food+customer service is really professional. My only complaint is my most recent experience there, as my waitress forgot whether or not I asked for a refill of my soup, when I told her a few minutes prior that I wanted a refill. That startled me, as a waitress/waiter needs to remember those kind of things. Besides that, my go to place when I have Olive Garden.
author: Kangaroo K.

description:
I'm not usually a fan of Olive Garden but I do enjoy their soup and salad on occasions. Our server arrive about 5 mins after we sat. Took our orders and disappeared the rest of our meal. No wonder they made up the pay at the table station on the tablets located on the table. Cause they never come back.

I had to flag down a different server to request a box 
-__-
author: Liz N.

description:
Tables are perfect, but the seats are not comfortable. 

The coordination of staff is out of sync. They need to train their staff to be more natural in their work, not confused or overwhelmed during an afternoon shift.

The server was doing her job, but looked like she was preoccupied with procedures rather than giving the customer a good comfortable experience.
author: J L.

description:
We came here on our trip from LA and it was extremely mediocre. The waiter messed up my order giving me only half of the portion I ordered and the Toscana soup was cold and watered down! 
I also ordered the spaghetti kids meal and it had hardly any meat sauce. Honestly this is by far the worst Olive Garden I've ever tried. I do not recommend it. Food quality is the worst.
author: Azu C.

description: A favorite restaurant for me and my husband until this past Sunday;food food but service was horrible the waitress was more involved in friends at table next to ours we had to wait several moments for everytime we needed something we visit with manager before we left hopefully he took care of employee who needs to visit with friends when not clocked in at work;was at Joplin, Missouri location!
author: Phyllis E.

description:
I came here today out of shear convenience, I knew the food and service were gonna be....meh.....I wasn't disappointed 

Oh let me count the ways:
Timing
Tea service
Server duty fulfillment
Scoffing and long sighs
Female server gave me attitude when I asked honey
My friend exclaimed, "this is the worst scampi I've ever had"; he started with the chianti braised beef, it was low grade dog food. 

I came here after a bad start to the day finding out my car was stolen right before driving home across the country. With all my earthly belongings inside. 

The one thing which would have put a smile on my face was  chicken picatta. Capers make me happy, if I could taste them. I can see them, but I taste nothing, too much salt, too much wine.

The manager came over and tried her best to salvage the restaurants shortfalls. She comped the whole meal, but I'm in such a salty mood, I went one further 

Yea service
author: Mark F.

description: Soup is good!  Bread is good!  Drinks no taste.   Pasta sucks.   Boiled on the sauted shrimps.   Sauce bland.
author: D F.

description:
Alright, alright. This is OLIVE GARDEN. This is a CHAIN restaurant. I'm sure we all know that whether we hear the name, see it across the street or dine in. Walking through their door and sitting down for a meal, please don't expect chef Mario Batali in the back making fresh pasta from scratch or expecting sauces and soups simmering for hours. 

This is the place when I want a hearty meal! The price can't be beat with all of their deals that seem to be constantly going on, in addition to their unlimited soups (zuppa toscana!!!), salad (I actually really love their salad, despite having excessive dressing on my last visit here), and the famous breadsticks (buttery, garlicky goodness!). The dish that I always get is the five cheese ziti al forno (which is the dish that my bff introduced to me back when I was literally 15 years old and still to this day, is the same dish that I always get! Don't forget to mix the dish so that all of the cheese can be incorporated!). What I usually do is get full off of the soup, salad and breadsticks, and take the majority of my entree home =)

Service is always friendly, but.... unfortunately, always slow. I'm all for supporting local mom and pop restaurants, BUT I'm also all for eating here at Olive Garden!
author: Kris C.

description:
After taking an 8-yr hiatus from Olive Garden, my family and I decided to see if things have changed. Our server Derek/Derrick was really nice and patient! I've never seen such good service at Olive Garden before! 

-On the drive to Olive Garden, I discovered that there's an app for this restaurant that shows a wait list. I thought it would literally show who was in front of me, but I was only able to submit an entry for my family and I. When we arrived, I told the hostess I signed up for the wait list through their app, and she gave me an electronic coaster. When I came back from using the restroom (like 5 mins), my family was already seated at a table.

-They now have touch screens on each table, so it makes ordering from the menu or paying for the tab easier and more efficient. 

-Since the entrees come with unlimited breadsticks or unlimited salad, I expected our server to serve us slower. But, he was actually really speedy and didn't seem so judgmental on the fact that we were asking for refills! 

I really enjoyed eating at Olive Garden, surprisingly. My family and I came around early 6PM so the setting was really calm and quiet. When it gets later, I know that the restaurant gets packed and noisy. Although the prices are higher than your usual restaurant, I thought it was pretty worth it considering that there were unlimited breadsticks/salads. Watch out for possible Olive Garden coupons to be used!
author: Erica K.

description: If I could I'd give it no stars because I'm pregnant and they served me almost completely raw sausage. I'm going to be pissed if something happens to my baby.
author: Alyssa W.

description:
Good, convenient spot for huge family gatherings and other big party socializers.

Spacious restaurant.

Their unlimited soup and salad is a great deal.

Standard pastas you get from a chain.

Servicing was attentive and on point.
author: Tiffany D.

description: Every week we sit at the bar and order some dinner.  Brendan the bartender is the BEST!  The food is great, the price is awesome (we usually have enough leftover for the next evening), and the service is terrific :0)
author: Laurie L.

description:
Honestly the worst Olive Garden I've ever been to, my server was fine though! 

When I walked in on a Saturday there was a small wait outside, the hostess had 0 smile on her face and was frankly very rude. She asked how many and told us it would take 15-20 minutes, no problem, my friend and I got a drink from the mall and came back. When we returned there was some people still waiting in their area and we were called to our table, walking through the restaurant was so confusing--there were empty tables everywhere! Why was there a wait? At first I assumed it was because they were short staffed but near the bar and the front desk area, employees stood around and talked so I doubt that was the issue.

When we were brought to our table it honestly was family sized--giant table for two people--it was confusing and awkward to sit across from a really big table. We asked to be moved to a more intimate table (there were many that were empty) they told us no...ok...fine... Our waiter came and immediately asked us if we were ready to order, before he even asked us if we wanted drinks. Friend ordered pasta with soup and I had their unlimited soup, salad, and breadsticks deal. My first bowl of soup came cold, his was luke warm. I returned my bowl and the waiter apologized. The bowls after were fine but the soups were more bland than I remember. My friend's pasta was cold, the cheese on top was melted but hard and when he cut it with his fork, the whole thing of cheese that was "melted" on slid off. His ravioli was cold in the middle. For a restaurant that has premade food, you'd think they would at least know how to heat it properly? 

Our waiter was honestly a nice guy so I can't say too much. By far not the best service I've received but he himself wasn't bad at all--I think he was just overwhelmed ? Felt like it was his first day on the job and frankly I care more about the food anyways. Sadly, the food all sucked. We left 35+ dollars poorer and still as hungry, would not return to this location.
author: Cindy M.

description: Hosts are rude here. Walked in with a friend and received no greeting after saying hello. Two of the hosts were hunched over the podium WITH a manager behind them who also did not acknowledge us. If I wasn't so hungry I would've walked out. I am in the restaurant industry and previously worked under Darden Restaurants, but never thought to act in such an unprofessional manner (this goes for the manager too) despite my dislike for the job. Ladies if you don't know how to behave in the workplace and lack customer service skills, I suggest you work Back of the House as a prep or as a busser. Our server was really nice though and he was on top of everything.
author: Michelle R.

description:
4 stars for location, food and service.

I purchase eggplant parmigiana with salad.

My friend gets chicken fettuccine with minestrone soup.

We are too stuffed to try the desserts. But next time will give pumpkin cheesecake a try.

Plus you can pay at your table with credit and debit card. Another huge plus!
author: CJ C.

description:
We were here a week ago to celebrate my husband's birthday last week and was really disappointed. I didn't really expect Olive Garden to have great service but I didn't expected to be that bad. 

Hubby ordered a glass of house wine and the server brought a bottle of wine and pour it table side. When the server pour the wine, I thought my husband ordered a bottle because she only pour half a glass. When we question our server about it, she said it's a standard 6 oz pour and that's what she learned at training. She's obviously new. So she doubled checked with her manager and came back to say she's not wrong. We order wine all the time and we know it wasn't 6oz. We were with our family and didn't want to make a big fuss about it but we used my baby's milk bottle to measure the amount of wine after. It was merely 4 oz. Anyone who worked at a restaurant business would know, if your customer is questioning your pour, no matter what it is, you pour a little more. 


Oh, the hostess at the front also rolled her eyes and look like she didn't want to be there when we checked in. 

Sadly we will not be back at other Olive Garden any time soon. With the way that it's going, I don't think it will be around for long.
author: tammy c.

description:
Relatively expensive place given the mediocre food. 

This is my first time being at any Olive Gardens. I've heard about the free breadsticks and soup before--the breadsticks are actually pretty good. Nice, warm, slightly salted, and right amount of fluffiness. The soup, though gave me a running stomach for days. The pasta portions were huge--lasanga, spaghetti, and pasta dumplings for a "small" dish. There was not way I could finish it.

Overall, the quality of the food is ok. If you're hungry or in a large group, this place is great. If you're looking for small bites for a date etc., might want to go elsewhere.
author: Henry L.

description: Chicken Fettuccine Alfredo with "Chicken Frita", Zuppa Toscana and unlimited breadsticks are the perfect combination for dinning out on a budget. The flavor combination of these dishes are excellent and you are guaranteed to leave the place full almost to the point of a food coma. I've been going to various Olive Garden locations all my life and this is the only thing I order because it's the best thing on the menu. This location can have a long wait so skip the wait and eat at one of the tables at the bar, the experience will be just as good if not even better.
author: Thomas B.

description:
It's been a long time since I last ate at Olive Garden, let alone Stonestown's location.  2001, I believe.  And despite all the changes since then, it all still feels and tastes the same to me, even after 15 years.  And that's a good thing!

First things first, Olive Garden's breadsticks still rule!  It's hard to resist eating them up, especially with their soups and salads.

For my lunch I decided to start with their Chicken & Gnocchi Soup and then ordered their Sausage Stuffed Giant Rigatoni for my main.

Chicken & Gnocchi Soup -- http://bit.ly/1K0Akxn
A creamy soup made with roasted chicken, traditional Italian dumplings and spinach.
The soup was good.  I still think their Pasta e Fagioli (White and red beans, ground beef, fresh tomatoes and tubetti pasta in a savory broth.) is their best soup though.

Sausage Stuffed Giant Rigatoni -- http://bit.ly/1Jnkc9h
Large pasta filled with flavorful Italian sausage and topped with our homemade meat sauce and fresh melted mozzarella.
Oh yeah, these were huge pieces of rigatoni were stuffed, meaty, and cheesy as written.  It was a very robust and flavorful pasta dish.  And the breadsticks paired nicely with this too!

I thought it was interesting how they had every table had their own touchscreen tablet where you can order your food, drinks, and dessert, buzz for a waiter, play games, and then pay using your credit card after you're done with your meal.  It's cool tech and all, but I think I'd rather go old fashion and interact with a waiter.  Maybe down the road if I come back to visit I'll give it a try.

Service was really good!  Not just from my waiter, but I was looking around and noticing that all the waiters in my dining area were very helpful and polite to their customers.  Ours in particular was great in having replace my mom's Chicken Parmesana because it was overcooked.  Came back with a new one and it was way better.  Thumbs up!

No complaints from me here at this Olive Garden.  The whole experience was great and definitely took me back to my college days when I ate here more often.  Food and service was great and that's pretty much all that matters in the end.
author: Rodney H.

description: Wait is always way too long for an empty restaurant with 8 tables open and lobby full of people waiting. We have been in que for almost an hour for a party of seven and there's an open table of 8 eempty the past hour. They are calling the names in order, not by table size.
author: gordon g.

description:
The food is like any other olive garden and it tastes good and that's why I am giving it 2 stars. The service however, was poop. I was greeted by a girl who had no interest being at the reception. She looked and sounded frustrated. I asked if I can order to-go and she pointed at the bar and said "go there". I decided to order food/drink at the bar. The bartender was super busy flirting with the waitresses who were just hanging out in a group next to the bar. They were super loud that I got frustrated by that. After 15 mins of sitting there the bartender made me a drink which was super weak and very sweet - not worth $10. No fork/knife were given when the food arrived. Had to wave at bartender multiple times to even get water refilled. 

My overall experience was horrible just because of people working there. Not sure why someone hires people to work for customer service when they have no skills. Not going back ever.
author: Ankit A.

description: Terrible. Our server was disrespectful, condescending, and extremely patronizing. Our pasta came out cold and clunky and when we asked her if it was supposed to look like that she got the biggest attitude and said "I'll just get you something else then." In the most rudest tone. Food is trash and servers are disrespectful. AVOID at all costs. The 21/2 stars is very valid.
author: Chelsea R.

description: The food here is not like other olive gardens. I've been to other olive gardens but this location is just so off. They'll make you wait at least 10 minutes for a table even if there are 30 other tables open. The food is really not good, AT ALL. I ordered the chicken Alfredo which is a basic but not to them. The sauce was extremely chunky and thick, not creamy at all. I honestly couldn't finish my food because it just did not taste even reasonable. Everything about this restaurant is just way off and I wouldn't return here.
author: Grace H.

description: First of all, the people at the counter are dense. We wanted to do a walk in for 13 people the lady was clueless than asks us if we wanted a reservation at 4:13 when it's 8:30 at night (they don't take reservations!) than they take our order and take 3 of our orders with the five cheese entree and don't tell us they don't have it, until another waitress has to tell us. Also, our first person ordered a lasagna than when it got to the last person she said they don't have lasagna. What is there to eat ?! The coconut no more coconut water inside.
author: Shaira Lee S.

description:
I have though they were great but a good place to during lunch and from time to time dinner. The last two encounter have been bad. The first was my lunch visit for my glass if Proseco and flat bread the flat bread was still frozen in the middle not cold frozen. 
I never order to go not feeling well so ordered fettuccine Alfredo and a salad.. First to go you are limited to only two bread sticks even it is eat as much as you want when you eat in. I said ok. There was sauce or cheese on the Alfredo I did not check until I was home. The salad had no green lettuce only ice berg and no olives as a result this once a month visit that I normally have lunch at I have not visit since Dec 2017 and I do not plan to go back. Unless it is just for the Proseco when I wait for my car repair
author: Darlene S.

description: I love going to the Olive Garden whenever I am in the mood for good Italian food. It has always been a great experience whereby you can expect to experience a good service with minor flaws, friendly faces and a hard-working staff. They work extra to make your evening a delight, and I love the fact that I can have as much salad as I want without having to pay an extra coin. The last I was there with my dad I had the chicken and gnocchi and the eggplant parmigiana breadstick sandwich. Both were extraordinary and I was quite delighted that day. The gnocchi was perfect to say the least. The Olive Garden will always be my first choice!
author: Amy W.

description: This Olive Garden is not good. Very crowded, food made from not so fresh ingredients, unprofessional staff. Avoid!
author: Dennis Z.

description: I went to olive garden in Bloomington yesterday with my 6 year old son. We got a table about 4:30 pm. Sat there for 35 minutes nobody asked us if we 2anted drinks or anything.  We walked out. Three servers and three hosts. Not one even cared to help us at all.
author: Jesse B.

description:
Haven't eaten at this place in a long time, years, but thought I'd stop in since was in the neighborhood.  Big mistake!  Would be no star or a negative star if had option.
Calamari appetizer was the worse ever.  What was brought to the table were lightly fried scrapes of bits and pieces of left over crumbs (near the end of an empty bag of frozen items), my shrimp scampi entre' with what looked like it was suppose to be angel hair pasta I guess, was over cooked to point of just plain soggy, mixed with who knows what!  It practically just went through the fork when tried to pick it up!  Was just one of the worst dining experiences in regards to the quality of food that they can think bringing out to the table!  Unimaginably disappointed.  Furthermore, usually very tolerant and not a practice to write bad/negative reviews.  Was just plain awful!
author: Ray L.

description: My family and I went here yesterday for my sister's birthday but we were all disappointed. This is like probably the worst Olive Garden that I've ever been to, I mean the service was good and the server was very friendly but the food was horrible it has no flavor at all. I thought the Hayward location was bad but this one oh my goodness it was worst. I'm surprised has 3 stars. Never again in this location.
author: Mjay N.

description:
came with a friend on new years day for lunch~ got seated quite quickly

Pasta portions are huge and can be easily shared between two people (I mean $20 a plate is to be expected) but honestly the appetizers, soup, and breadsticks are enough to fill you up (probably tastier than the entrees too)

you can choose a side of soup or salad (unlimited refills!) and top your orders with as much grated cheese as you like lmao

breadsticks - only. come. for. the. breadsticks. 

chicken scampi - noodles had a strong wine taste, chicken was bland 

shrimp alfredo - alfredo makes everything better i stg

stuffed portobello mushrooms - mediocre.. way too little for $9. go get yourself a nice big bowl of pho at a vietnamese restaurant instead

chicken gnocchi and minestrone soup - much better than the two pasta dishes~ go for the zuppa toscana if you're looking for something warm and creamy :D minestrone for something lighter to prep you for the heavy entrees

total was around $60! plus an extra $1.99 for accidentally playing the table games haha...... better to waste that money at an all you can eat buffet. 

only things worth complimenting are the soup, breadsticks, and customer service. unless you're starving or don't know how to cook your own pasta at home i wouldn't recommend coming to this place.
author: Yuzuki K.

description:
No no no. I really think the quality of the food has gone down a lot over the years. Either that or I was just not good at determining food quality until living here in SF (with so many good foodie places!)

Everything tastes like it's been frozen, re-deep fried, and thrown together in a microwave. I played it safe and got the gnocchi soup and had some of the famous house salad. The soup was good and probably the only reason why I'll ever come back. 

However, within minutes of signing the bill, my stomach did a weird rumbly thing and I had really bad cramps. Every step I took towards the bathroom made me want to throw up! It was so weird. I had a bad feeling about it all. We sent back a plate because the parmesan chicken was burnt and everything was so salty. Disappointing, but I guess I'll have to go to a real italian place to get my soup/pasta fix.
author: Cathy N.

description: Not sure why this Olive Garden gets such a bad rap. I've had way less/worse foods costing me much more. Now Im not saying this is the place where date night goes down but it is a place where you can get some somewhat italian food for the low. We got minestrone, salad, eggplant parm and fettuccine alfredo. The only issue was with the alfredo. We ordered it with Shrimp but didn't get any shrimp. Then when we told the waiter he pushed the message to the kitchen then they brought out a plate of shrimp separately so my gf had to eat cold bland pasta with hot shrimp. No bueno. Everything else was great though.
author: Navdeep D.

description:
I found myself dining here just before the rush on a rainy Saturday afternoon.  I don't usually venture out here save to attend trivia finals or visit a friend.  It happened to be a couple of hours before trivia for this occasion and I found coming here at five the right time.  Had I come here 10 minutes before without a reservation, I would have found myself with a wait of 30 minutes or more.  Maybe it was due to the rain for the sudden surge of patrons, but I was ever glad to be seated as the line piled out the door in a sea of umbrellas.

Once I sat down with my husband, we were greeted quickled.  We were also advised that our waiter was near the end of her shift and we were kindly introduced the person who'd take over our order.  That was very classy, in my opinion, as often I've had the opposite experience and been left in the dark when shift changes happen.  Our orders were taken promptly.  I thoroughly enjoyed my endless Tuscan soup bowl with their ever addictive bread sticks.  My husband opted for the salad.  We then got our main dishes, a nice steak for me and a seafood pasta dish for him.  Both were so delicious and large in size that we couldn't even think to order dessert.  Although, if I did have room, I'd recommend their tiramisu.

The newest experience we had at this chain is how to pay for our bill.  At each table their is consol to pay by card.  We simply tapped in, selected our amount of tip, and then swiped our credit card.  The receipt came forth and off we went without a hitch.  It was a very pleasant meal.
author: Angela K.

description: Horrible experience: and let me tell you why we got there at 5:30pm on a Saturday asked for a table for 16...... the wait was 2 hours because they're waiting for the ONLY BIG TABLE THEY HAVE. So we waited...... 2 hours later STILL WAIING......3 HOURS LATER they finally sat us down and NO WE DIDNT SIT DOWN ON THE ONLY BIG TABLE THEY HAVE they ended up setting us down on the regular tables they put two tables together that fit 12 and 4 on a separate table that fits 4...... very annoyed already.we sat down at 9pm SERVERS WAS HORRIBLE brought us salad with breadsticks....we got seconds on salad and asked waitress where's the breadsticks??? She said "i thought they brought them" who is they? Your our waiter??? As a waitress I'll be on top of my shit she apparently wasn't! Started eating at 10 food was disgusting waiters was terrible NEVER AGAIN
author: Mimi B.

description: I went to Olive garden with 6 of my friends. We ordered 6 plates of Italian food. 2 Chicken Marsala, 2 spaghetti, 2 Chicken Alfredo. The amount was pretty descent and the food was delicious. My only complaint was it took an HOUR from the moment we sad down for the food to come. We even timed it. We were really hungry too so that made us very frustrated. Other than that, our waiter was really really nice. She even recommend her favorite food for us to try. She was prompt, efficient & very good at everything on Olive garden's menu. Oh yeah, the breadsticks were REALLY REALLY GOOD. VERY TASTY, WARM, SALTY & GARLICY. The salad was really good too. We got a really big portion of it. We loved their unlimited breadsticks especially. The price was a bit too expensive.. but it was descent. Overall, I would definitely be back if I had a chance too next time!
author: Jonathan Z.

description:
