We arrived and found there would be a 20 minute wait. Okay, fine. We asked if we could wait in the bar area until our table was ready. We were told that would be fine. 

We sat at an elevated table for a short while before being approached by a waiter. He tried to take away our restaurant pager. He said that we wouldn't need that anymore. We told him that we were just here waiting for our table. We said we'd like to order drinks while waiting. He seemed confused and left. 

Then another waiter came and told us that if we were not going to have our food here, then we only could wait at the bar itself (which was about four feet away). He was quite adamant. 

What was going on here?  We hailed the manager and she apologized profusely. We could stay just as we had been informed. She took our drink order and thanked us for being patient. 

Our drinks came quickly. Then almost immediately or table was ready. We got seated and were offered free appetizers. Nice! 

Our actual waiter was very nice and the service was great hereafter. 

I ordered the Italian sausage stuffed rigatoni. It sounds like a simple dish, but it was very good. The sauce... the cheese... the sausage... it just worked so well for my desires at the time. Well, maybe "desires" sounds strange. Perhaps "palette". Anyway, I enjoyed it. 

So, what started out as agitation was made right by the manager. Not just by the free appetizers, but with a genuine apology. 

That's good in my book.
author: Sira V.

description: Holy shit this place smells like puke and the waiters told us they "ran out of a lot things so not much is available tonight". Who owns this chain?! Does anyone care about this place?! -- update: our food just came and w t f ... dude. Why is this place even open? Omg this is so disappointing I can't stop laughing
author: Sasha G.

description: Between a dirty restroom hostess saying she just cleaned it letting animals into the restaurant waitress that didn't know what she was doing I would never returned and I am a huge Olive Garden fan
author: Ryah T.

description:
I would NOT be coming to this location ever ever again. We got cold coffee TWICE. I kept asking the waitress ESTER  for straws , she kept saying She was going to bring them, took about 20 minutes for straws. We got our bread after the appetizers!!! REALLY!!! our waitress made us wait for ever for every single little thing we were asking for. We asked for soups,she said she had to charge for them because we weren't allowed to order to go, so we decided to order them there and eat them. We asked for the receipt and to go containers for our left overs, our bill was $265 !!!! She had charged us for the soups we ordered. When asked why? She paused and said " oh because you're supposed to eat everything here"!!!!! Are you serious olive garden??? 
I've been a costumer for more that 10 yrs. 
we called the Manager GEARY! Only to be told that we are LIERS! I expected way more from Managment and staff. My mom had 2 gift cards that we couldn't use to pay in the station they have on the table, so we decided to asked for assistance, it literally took about 30 minutes for them to help us pay our bill. 
It was a nightmare!!! What a disrespect to loyal costumers.
author: Ivonne C.

description: Ordered to pick up at 6 pm.   Placed order at 430 pm.  Still waiting here at 617 pm and not ready.  Be another 10 mins.   But that was 10 mins ago.    Gone down hill  in the last 11 years I've been here.  Sit down dining us worse.  And lots of employees standing around.  "Not my job " syndrome
author: Robert S.

description:
You're supposed to be family... if that were the case, someone would have gotten off their ass and run to the bevmo to grab some triple sec, and swung by the luckys to grab some shrimp for the scampi.  How the hell does a restaurant run out of triple sec and shrimp?
With no appetizer then, our entrees and salad came out at the same time.  Mine was okay, my wife's was sorely lacking in pasta sauce.
Sad sad sad.
author: Roni L.

description: Usually only here if there's a promotion, otherwise, no time to wait 45 mins for over-priced pasta. Current promotion is never ending classics and my favorite is the chicken parm. In my opinion, they need to upgrade the bar area.
author: Jen L.

description:
The Olive Garden use to be amazing in the 90s so were alot of other things too. 
My server was fast and efficient it was around 4pm so I was seated as soon as I walked in. The presentation of food is just thrown together. Ordered shrimp scampi it was $20 . Hey is what it is it tasted good.
author: Athena C.

description: Update of recent visit to the Olive Garden: Worse than ever!  The soup was loaded with hot pepper flakes making it impossible to enjoy.  After returning it back to the waitress and selecting another choice of soup, that 2nd soup was cold.  Informed the waitress in which she said she would re-heat it in the micro.  I said forget it.  Then when my angle hair pasta w/shrimp arrived it was floating in oil.  I should have learned from my previous past visits that were a let-down.  NEVER AGAIN.
author: Anuhe'a K.

description:
I haven't  been here for a long long time. I checked their  menu on-line and i was disappointed that they no longer serve bruschetta. Oh well. I ordered the Tour of Italy but only enjoyed the alfredo part of the dish. The other 2 pasta dishes were chicken parm&lasagne.  
Nothing really wowed me, so i won't  be back.
author: EmmettsGuRL C.

description: Presentation looked like it was microwave food.  Took one bite and it was a no but I only gave two stars because service was good
author: Steven E.

description:
Was a Big Let Down we went there with a 50th
Birthday party for a friend an the food was all bad gummy noodle. They for got some one shrimp ... some one sausage and one plate has no meat just noodles the salad was not fresh and half the party did not get bread 
What Happened to Olive Graden
author: Don H.

description:
4 of us bestie's had a hankering​ this evening for some Italian food. So upon deciding where, we ended up at the OLIVE GARDEN. 

It was pretty packed when we got there. Was told it would be a 20 minute wait. The girls were anxious to get this party started, so we went straight to the bar and had shots of Patron. Ouch....I know. But we had a DD.
Within ten minutes our buzzer went off, and our Table was ready. Whew! 

Once seated, our waiter introduced himself as Anthony, we all ordered a Frozen Margarita.  Looking over the menu, there was so much to choose from.  I settled for the salad (instead)  of the all-you-can-eat soup, with of course, the signature garlic, warm bread sticks, that are so freaking addicting!  Couple of the gals opted for the soup and said it was wonderful. For my main, it was a no brainier, I ordered the Chicken & Shrimp Carbonara with a creamy Alfredo sauce. It was DELICIOUS!!
The gals all ordered different dishes & were pleased. We also had Chardonnay with dinner.
For dessert, we all forced ourselves to have the Tiramisu.  No words. Yum!

Our waiter, Anthony, was truly polite and friendly. Not just specifically our waiter, but looking around, I noticed all the waiters and/or waitresses we're polite and engaging with the customers in a happy fashion. It was a nice vibe.

No complaints from me for this Olive Garden. The whole experience was great, and it definitely took me back to the day when I took my Mom there to eat. I use to eat at the OG way more often then. 

Food and service was spot on. And that's pretty much, all that matters anyway. 
.
author: Janet T.

description: $95 for 3 adults and 1 kid and we didn't even order alcohol. Bread was dry, chicken was salty. Such a disappointment from the last time we visited a few years ago.
author: Michele H.

description: I've been coming to olive garden a long time.  we all know what it is. there chicken scampi was great .  my mother got the stuffed marsala and it was bomb.com  but the star of the show was Michael D..  I'm a server myself and when I go eat and be picky . I asked for extra lemons with calamari more parmesan cheese. he didn't miss a beat.  and he was helping other servers out . menu knowledge on point and and over all outstanding guy . stones town olive garden 5 stars mike d 20 stars .
author: Daniel C.

description: I mean.... Great service! But damn have the prices escalated so much? We paid around 18 to 22 per dish. The dishes mostly come with bread and salad or soup. I always get the pasta e fagioli. Delicious!! This time around I got the shrimp pasta with asparagus and tomatoes. The flavors were great and tasty but so little asparagus in the dish. I think I'll frequent other locations for my Italian fix!
author: Natalie M.

description:
So this is my second visit to an Olive Garden. The last time was a few years ago and after the second jug of sangria things got hazy. This time I am with the family so just settled for a Long Island Limoncello (it was strong as I had a ball the whole meal).

Unlimited breadsticks, salad, soup where surprisingly tasty. I am happy I was talked out of appetizers as they just aren't needed with the normal extras. We got the chicky chicky parm parm (chicken parmigiana) which was pretty nice but a bit squishy, fettuccini alfredo which I was expecting to be too oily/creamy but it too was pretty nice. We also got the "take home" spaghetti with meat sauce, love that part of the meal is a take home meal, it fed the daughter and me for dinner so worked out well!

Service was good, never had to strain the neck looking for our server. Price was about $50 all up for 2 of us (and a toddler who just ate breadsticks), definitely didn't go home hungry and had our take home spaghetti (plus some extra soup) for later. Still pricey for fairly standard meals but have to experience Olive Garden occasionally.

A few other things I have learnt:
- Always say "yes" to complimentary wine tastings even though you know you aren't going to order the chianti
- The Killers hit "Mr Brightside" was covered by Paul Anka in a swing/Sinatra style
- The bathrooms in Olive Garden play covers of The Killers hit "Mr Brightside"
author: Tristan L.

description: I am never coming back here. I came in for lunch with my girlfriend and were seated right away. We were given breadsticks and salad after we placed our order. 20 minutes later, our waitress asks if we are doing okay. We say yes, expecting our food to come out shortly. Another 20 minutes later, she hands us our bill but we haven't even received our food. We ended up having our food in to go boxes and leaving paying full price for everything not to eat comfortably when asked. We were not going to wait another 20 minutes for our food. Very disappointed.
author: Cody L.

description: Sooo disappointed in this Olive Garden. We came here after the the Lupus Walk. There are 9 of us and we are blacks. They sat us in a room by ourselves manager continued to walk in and out of the room on multiple occasions never said a word. Room smelled like urine. So unsatisfied with the customer service. Waiters continued to walk in and out of room as well. Food was decent had to continuously ask for refills. Will not be returning.
author: Lanei B.

description: Don't usually come here b/c Im not usually in this area, but fuck...the food was disgusting. I had the chicken pasta dish and it was low quality and smelled like shit. Stay away from here if you can help it. At least until they start serving higher quality food. My dog eats better food than this.
author: Chris V.

description:
Ok, I know this is Olive Garden and not some crazy awesome Homemade Italian...but...every once in a while I get a hankering for their breadsticks and salad dressing. 

I have to look back at this review before I decide it's worth it again.

Sat down at 4:45 on Sunday. Bonus: no wait
Ordered featured menu drink - Italian Margarita 
Ordered my fav app - shrimp scampi
Ordered salad, breadsticks, and alfredo topped pasta.

Waitress comes back - no triple sec for the drink. Bummer! I'll stick with water. Got a glass of warm water, no ice. Thanks.

Waitress comes back - no shrimp for the scampi. Ummm what??! Ok, I'll skip the appetizer.

5 minutes later she come back with everything. Bread, salad, and entree all at the same time.
Annoying!

Bread was overdone and outside was crunchy. Refill  was slightly better, but not by much.

Pasta had one medium scoop of sauce right in the middle. Definitely not enough to make for a nice pasta dish. Oh, did you know a side of sauce is $4.49? 

I'm really not expecting a fine dining experience at Olive Garden, but I do expect the bar to be higher than this. Skip it!
author: Victoria L.

description:
Took 45 minutes to get our food
A table sat after we did got their food and left! Before we even got our food
Not to mention we had 2 kids meals
Messed up our order twice
Unreal...

Food was good tho but not worth it, at all
author: Tomas K.

description:
Bartender is waaaayyyy to GREEN to be behind the bar by himself. He doesn't understand the flow and how to keep the counter moving smoothly. 

Out of the liquor we wanted that you serve. 

Drinks took 10 min. Suppose to be within 5. 

Refills not offered, big mistake when serving alcohol to hard working thirty adults looking to unwind on a Saturday. 

Also, Critical error is to keep any guest waiting for their check when they are ready to go.
author: Jessica M.

description:
Came down to visit San Fran for the weekend, waited for 30 minutes, not bad of a wait for Sunday night. 
As soon as I walk in the hostess seem to be out of it. One of the girl doesn't look like she wants to be here. The other girl was on her phone. And another girl with the blonde hair was standing in the back with her arm cross. It's so unprofessional.  
The girl who walk us to our table was not enthusiastic as well. She talks like a robot. The Olive Garden by my house in chino hills has way better greeter than the one over here. 
They smiled at you as you walk in to the door and they even open the door as you're walking out. 

The food was great. But our waiter was horrible too.
author: Krystal Y.

description:
We arrived on a Sunday during peak dinner time. There were four of us. We waited about 30 mins to be seated. We skimmed through the menu during the wait to make the ordering process quicker. We noticed that some of the menu items were only available during the week, not on a Sunday. 

The table was not clean; had plates and bowls still there. Floors were dirty; food bits and a fork behind my chair. Table was sticky and so was the little gaming console. It was a table for two, which meant that there were only two chairs there. We had to rearrange the condiments and drinks to all four corners of table for the food to fit in the center. We also had to move the gaming center to the floor. I saw unseated booths. 

Ordered the green apple Moscato sangria. That was delicious. We got the unlimited salad and breadsticks, Artichoke dip to start with. Entrées were stuffed chicken marsala, spaghetti, chicken piccata with minestrone soup. Everything tasted okay, we were starving. No complaints. Our server was friendly so we gave her a big tip. 

As we were leaving, a male server, walked past us in the hallway and said he needed to go on a break because he needed to use the bathroom. Capital T - Capital M - Capital I! I haven't been to an Olive Garden since 1997, but the experience I had then compared to now is a complete 180.

1 star for the sangria. 1 star for our server. 1 star for the food.
author: Ana V.

description: We dined here with some friends last Friday & it is as good as I remember it.  Yes, it is a chain, but one of the better ones.  We only had a 15 minute wait & the hostas & our servers, Alexis & Jessica were wonderful, very attentive & not leaving anything to chance.  I love the warm bread sticks; very soft & the parmasan & butter baked in yum.  The salad is pretty good; I generally will not eat iceberg lettuce, but this is pretty good with pepperincinis, olives, tomatos, crutons, & parmasan in a wonderful dressing.  The chicken giardino is wonderful, only 500 calories, but full of flavor with aldentae pasta, tender chicken, brocolli, & peas in a lemon sauce.  For dessert, you have to get their terimisu which is lite, smooth, & creamy with marscapone, a little espresso, & moist lady fingers.  Next time, I hope to try the Italian donuts & apple crestata.  Round it off with a cold Peroni & you will not be disappointed.  Everyone in their party loved their food.  Since my mother was able to get the Buy one get one free deal, she took me home the five cheese zeti with wonderful aldentae tubes of pasta, parmasan, racata, & other cheeses in a lite marinara sauce; it definitely went well with some frozen meat balls..  So, for some3 decent Italian food at reasonable prices with friendly service in a casual atmosphere, Olive Garden cannot be beat.  Keep up the good work guys.
author: Brian S.

description: Came to this Olive Garden from out of town and we were helped by Devin. Devin was amazing from the beginning! He was very friendly and attentive. He made us feel really welcomed and took the time to recommend some things to do while visiting SF. He was prompt and knowledgeable. Such a great experience thanks to Devin
author: Connie C.

description:
Waitress  really bad
Take the drinks late
Didn't offer water
Breadstick hard as rock
Salad look  old
Chicken and shrimp  carbonara
Not enough  Alfredo sauce 
Overpriced  for the mediocre  food
I use to love this place but  not no more, the food quality  and the service  went down
author: Margarita L.

description:
WHAT HAPPENED??? What's wrong with this place??? Our family has been a big fan of this place for yearsss!!! But unfortunately, we feel disgusted with the food & the service here tonight!! Worse experience ever!! Definitely won't go back for good! Didn't even wanna touch the dishes with their looks...yucky!!!!

We asked 3 times for the napkin....but the waitress just didn't wanna give them to us!! No water served after 15 minutes seated!!! The waitress even argued with us because we asked for soup!! Yuckyyyyy!!!
author: Aimee J.

description:
I highly recommend not spending your money here unless you're only coming for breadsticks and soup. 

The service was okay and the wait was long. But the food was HORRIBLE. We sent back 3 of the 4 plates because they lacked sauce, flavor, and my pasta sauce tasted like it was drowned in wine.

I order their new limited Baci cake and it tasted exactly like a TV dinner brownie with hazelnut. Not to mention this tiny cake is priced at a winning 9$. 

They were nice enough to remove one of my plates from the tab but we spent about 2 hours here and it was a horrible dining experience. Please just save 80$ and make your own pasta from home this business is  falling.
author: Lexy C.

description: i like coming to olive garden haha. it's a chain restaurant but it hits the spot. usually you should come when they have a good deal going on! like buy one bring one home or the unlimited pasta bowls! it comes with soup or salad and me and my bf always get one of each so we can share. they tell you that you can't go into the mall with the buzzer but i do it all the time and it works fine haha. the pasta is good here kinda like typical pasta. sometimes the soup isn't hot and just warm but i'm okay with it. parking is easy since it's at a mall.
author: diane d.

description: They forgot to sign a waiter for our table, so we wait there for nothing about 20 mins... !!!!! And the food.... sigh... the taste is not better than the Safeway frozen food, how come? The two star for the nice waitress smile
author: Hao W.

description: Is Olive Garden the greatest place in the world? No, but at least they could try to not suck sometimes. Now I know better than to go near this place at dinner time or when SFSU students are moving in but sometimes I really question this business. Their food isn't really Italian but honestly I'm lazy and the best part of their food is always the breadsticks. So I place an online order to pick up after work and it's like $35 cause your girl likes to eat. I walk in to pick it up and of course it isn't ready yet but the bar staff is always hella nice. So I'm waiting and didn't you know that this woman walks up to me with my order and says directly to my face "so we're actually out of breadsticks today, you're total is $35" and keep in mind half of my order is breadsticks I literally order a shitty entree so I get 6 for free and order an extra half dozen to warm up and take to work the next day. So I literally start laughing and tell her she has to take off the breadsticks from my order and the extra sauce I added to my meal and she says "idk if I can do that but I'll ask" um bitch you better, what the hell am I gonna do with a "boat of alfredo" like its literally butter I will not put that on perfectly good pasta I would have to make myself at home. So they end up taking off the breadsticks but because I've already touched the alfredo I have to keep it. So great, now I'm stuck with just the shitty food and not the good part. Put a sign outside if you're completely sold out so people know not to come in damn. But I went there again like 2 days ago and the staff was wonderful as usual and the food was way better but these idiots gave me a boat of ranch dressing instead of alfredo. Ya know, one day they'll get it right.
author: Shawna M.

description:
3 stars for good customer service. The FOH was really nice but when we asked for the bill, took about forever arrive

As for the food, I didn't like the minestrone and the spaghetti tasted bland. It needed more salt.
author: Kat P.

description:
Despite the reviews, I had a really nice first experience at Olive Garden.

Came here on a Tuesday evening and there was a 25 minute wait. Olive Garden is more of a walk-in restaurant so no reservations. They have a nice seating area for maybe about 10 people to sit.

Service: When we got seated, our waiter was very friendly. He has the voice of an announcer which was pretty cool. He came by asking if we wanted to start off with drinks or appetizers (standard procedure at any restaurant) and he came back to check in if we were ready to order. During our meals, he would check in if we needed anything else and if we were satisfied with our food. Overall: service was great.

Food: Breadsticks were good. I honestly don't see what the rave is about. I eat a lot of bread and this just wasn't to die for IMO. Probably because I had high expectations and it just didn't meet it. The salad was standard. Didn't expect much but they did give a big bowl of it.

I got the Strawberry-Passion Fruit Limonata $3.50 and I really liked it. It might be a little too sweet for others but I think it was just perfect for me. It was a nice blend of strawberry and limonade.

We ordered an Italiano Sampler $12.99 for 3 choices. We got Calamari, Fried Mozzarella, and Toasted beef and pork ravioli. When we got our appetizer, it was not what we ordered. When I told our waiter, he went to check and brought out what we actually ordered. He asked if we wanted to keep or not. I bargained that if it was free, we'll keep it and he said sure! Awesome free apps! I loved the calamari and the ravioli. Really nice frying.

For my main entree, I got the Tour of Italy $17.99 which comes with Chicken Parmigiana, Lasagna Classico and our signature Fettuccine Alfredo. This dish was great because I got to try a couple of items rather than just one. The Alfredo was good. The fettuccine was still a little hard but the alfredo was tasty. The Chicken parm was delicious. And the lasagna.. was not lasagna. I don't eat Italian often but I thought lasagna was not in shapes of dumplings... I think I got trolled and noticed just now as I write my review LOL. Was too hungry to care. If I come back, I would probably just stick to the Chicken parm since it was my favorite of this dish.

Overall I had a nice experience. Got trolled twice in one visit but I won't ding any stars. Our waiter was lovely. Food tasted great. It's almost as pricey as authentic Italian food so you take your pick.
author: Benita M.

description:
Of all Olive Gardens in the Bay Area why do I always keep coming back to this one? Perhaps because it's conveniently located on the outside of the stylish Stonestown Galleria where you can dine and shop at the same time! What's not to love? 

The real reason my family and I always go is because of the "Buy One Take One" Deal that always seems to come around every four months or so. I can honestly tell you the deal is so worth it. In fact, it really is the only reason to go to "The OG" as I call it. Look the place isn't perfect, It's large, loud, service is decent if somewhat lacking because they're always so busy, and the food is well at its Olive Garden best.

I only go to the OG when there is a "Buy One Take One" deal because not only is it a ton of food to eat while you are there, but you get to take a full dish home. You start with the all you can eat soup and salad with a side of breadsticks. Then you pick between four pasta dishes or three meat and/or shrimp dishes for an additional sum.

But since this meal deal also comes with the all you can eat soup and salad, you know what I plan on feasting on while I'm actually dining at the OG. First off my top priority is to enjoy all the soup and salad and breadsticks you can, and have a few bites of your pasta that your dinner plan actually consists of, and then get a to go box to take that one home on top of the one you order to take home. That's what I did and I'm not ashamed! 

I start off with the Zuppa Toscana soup which is a wonderful creamy hearty soup with plenty of sausage, kale and potatoes. And then I move onto the Minestrone which is decent if not remarkable, and then I finish with the Chicken & Gnocchi soup which is so hearty I don't have any room for anything else. It helps that my fellow diners get salad because they don't like soup, so I happily sponged off a few bites of their all-you-can eat salad. Clearly I have no shame!

I found the pastas the OG is offering BOGO taste decent, but not great. Sauce was lacking on my Cavatappi with Asiago Garlic Alfredo, and the newest pastas they offer with this meal deal, the Penne with Basil Garlic Marinara tasted rather unremarkable. I also remembered to sign up for the Olive Garden Eclub, in which you get emailed a coupon for a free appetizer or dessert. (Which our server had to ask his manager if it was allowed with the Buy One Take One Meal Deal, thankfully it was!) So we started with the trio sample appetizer with fried calamari, mozzarella sticks, and toasted ravioli. They were okay, but nothing I would order on their own. 

At the end of our meal despite being stuffed, we decided to try a dessert. We agreed on the Zeppoli, which are the Italian doughnuts. To my amazement, the doughnuts tasted delicious. They were light and sugary and perfect when paired with the chocolate dipping sauce. It was the perfect end to an overstuffed meal.

Olive Garden is not like eating in Rome or even San Francisco's North Beach, and it's no were near the quality or overall deal that Maggiano's has to offer. But it's a decent place with affordable prices that does tend to get really crowded on weekends for dinner. But that's what still makes the place so amazing: the fact that people still enjoy this place after so many years. I know I do.
author: Jason F.

description:
OG does it again! I'm always impressed with OG's amazing customer satisfaction guarantee. 

I ordered 4 pasta dishes (rigatoni with Asiago garlic cream sauce...bomb dot com) online for a pick up in 20 minutes. When we got there, the restaurant was having issues with their burners and my order was delayed. Completely understandable. We finally got our order and when we got home, the pasta was so dry because they didn't give much sauce. We ate what pasta we can that had sauce but not much of it because there was so little sauce in the entree. We were so disappointed.

I called OG and I spoke to Gary, who was the manager on duty, who was super kind. He was very understanding as I voiced my frustration. As a result he sent me a OG gift card and offered to deliver another set of meal to us. I think he said he would deliver it personally or something like that. I was touched by that sentiment, but refused it as I've had my fill of pasta for the day. 

The food is good when you are craving some Italian food, but the service exceeds my expectation again and again. Good job OG!
author: Em P.

description:
Drinks are good and the customer facing staff super friendly! 

The advertisement/trivia serving terminals they place on tables are a decidedly odd choice. They hearken to a cheap smokey diner off the Vegas strip that contrasts with the 'classier' decor branding of Olive Garden franchise locations. The soft glow ever so persistently demanding attention from conversation every few minutes when the ad flickers - we just flipped the thing backwards and butted it up against the wall. This culminates in the ever so awkward pay-your-bill moment while the server uncomfortable shifts their weight from foot to foot lingering behind to show patrons how paying with it works, while the patron uncomfortable slides the tip scale up and down. I'd recommend either removing the terminals completely, or having them default to a black-screen when not interacted with. 

The food is another opportunity for improvement at this location. It tasted fine, but the visual presentation needs immediate attention. What was served at the table looked nothing like the menu or OliveGarden website photos we reviewed before placing orders. This is something I've not noticed before at other franchise locations, albeit its been some years since I've visited an OliveGarden. I suspect it's most likely this particular location in need of some retooling but who knows. If instead lies with supply available to the kitchen the speaks to a bigger problem. Regardless, may be a good exercise to occasionally compare orders coming out to photos presented to customers as a quality control check. If it's an unattainable standard, perhaps the photos should be replaced with ones that better resembles what comes out.
author: David G.

description:
Writing this review a little late. 

Came in May 31, 2017 around 1:30 pm. Sat at the tables by the bar since I was on my lunch brake and the wait was wayyy too long. A lady came to our table let us know she was the only one there so service was gonna be a little slow which we didn't really care. Got our food before our drinks. Silverware wayyy later after our food came. I understand she's alone serving 2 other tables but when we asked for drinks or silverware she was so rude and rolled her eyes. 

I witnessed other customer come in sat at the bar asked for a menu and the lady responded very rude I am helping other tables I will get you one once I am done. The lady responded okay I am on my lunch brake only have 30 mins, and waiter responded you're not the only here you know. Very rude. Customer just walked out. I understand the frustration and being alone and being very busy but this is not the way to treat paying customers.  I wish I would remember her name. Shame on her for giving shitty service.
author: Jen M.

description: Food was good. We sat at the bar for dinner and the service was mediocre at best.The bartender seemed scattered and she seldom checked back with us unless we flagged her down.
author: Sandra T.

description: Honestly, I don't know why I continue to give this place a chance. I guess because every time I'm ready to give up, I randomly get good service. Which leads to my main issue: the service is constantly terrible and disappointing. I'm only going to focus on my visit tonight because no need to bring up the past. Anyway, we're sitting there for 25 minutes with just our glasses of water (which I've learned that you don't want to rush and drink because you'll never see a refill), no bread, no sign of the waitress. She finally comes back to the table after I ask another waitress to get her. I ask her about an item on the menu, she says "you can read the description in the menu" I kindly inform her that it's actually not a description in the menu but more of a statement about it being a classic dish. Then she actually answered the question that I asked. Later on I feel like our request were pretty standard: refills, more cheese, etc. I'm not sure if she was having a bad day but every time we asked for something there was huffing and puffing and neck and eye rolling. Eventually, I asked her if we were asking her for too much because it seemed like we were. She said no she's fine and she apologized. All of a sudden we have a new server who says that the first one "got really busy"... The restaurant is half empty but sure. This new lady was unprepared and seemed like she actually was busy considering the amount of things she was carrying in her hand... Anyways, I say they need to do a much better job either with prescreening or with training their servers.
author: Kenia J.

description: Been here for the first time ever in my life. We had to wait for a table for 10-15 minutes. Understandable because it's lunch hour. Where we sat. On my side. The seat was in bad shape. Saw a doodle from a child on the wall. I can understand why. A long wait to place an order. I thought their side dishes was a one person meal. Nope. Way too much amount. Too much that it's better to eat with a family or party of 4 or more than couple. Food was some good. Nice waiter too. Got our food before drinks too. Unusual. I might go back again but only order appetizer and dessert next time or go with a group of 4 or more. Not recommending for a date unless it's a double date or your with a hang of people.
author: C G.

description: We came here on around 4 pm on a Sunday with some friends. Had a 45 minute wait before being sat. They mistakenly reserved us a table for four when we asked for a table for 6. They were able to get us a table about 5 minutes later. The waitress sat us down and then asked us if we would like to order drinks so we would have time to look over the menu. Then we should came back we started to order only to be told that they were out of everything we wanted to order. 6 out of 6. Then we tried to order something else to be told they were out of that as well. They were out of all steak and beef. The waitress told us that they always run out on Sundays. She should have us right off the bat that they did not have certain items! Or maybe they should say something before making us wait 50 minutes! I then remembered that the previous time my wife and I came through San Francisco we stopped here and we had the same experience then. They really need to plan better!
author: Manuel H.

description:
Where to begin.

Loved this place back in my younger early 20s.  I'm only 25 but....things have changed.

Mind you I hate writing bad reviews but I just left this establishment and have not had such a horrible expierance at a restaurant for a long time now.

Hostess were great , sangria delicious (only good thing about tonight)

After being seated, our server promptly greeted us. It seemed to all go down hill from there. My husband ordered a steak medium and I the salmon.....the steak had NO flavor it tasted like cardboard on top of it being cooked more on the well side. Kitchen needs to prepare and actually learn to cook. Sorry not sorry . Salmon was overcooked. 

Service wise, it seemed as if she had no clue what was going on with her section and then at the end after food was dropped off she completely disappeared. We asked for what beers were on draft and she told us shed go find out from fhe bar......she left for 20 minutes .....never came back. We tried ordering dessert on fhe ziosk.... we left after 25 minutes. Thank you no thank you. I've worked in the service industry for 4 going on 5 years now & though I know its olive garden and not expecting 5 star dining but come on.
author: Yamilette C.

description: Perfect for brunch!  Came in with the kids and Emma our server, she is awesome!  Attentive and great Services!!
author: Cici C.

description: Wow. I went there on my lunch break from class and the service was terrible. It took forever to get our food and we ordered the lunch specials which were supposed to get unlimited soup or salad. We chose the soup and only got one bowl and was never asked if we wanted more. My friends chicken and gnocchi had ONE gnocchi in it. Main entree was subpar. Our breadsticks were stale and our server had an issue fixing our bill a couple of times and didn't seem to know what she was doing. We were trying to pay for our bill for almost 30 minutes and I had to find a manager to get things taken care of. Absolutely terrible.
author: Samantha A.

description:
Ouch, tough crowd. Olive Garden is not too shabby for a chain restaurant. This location is a pretty good one too. The seats are comfortable. The staff is very friendly. You can reserve a dining room if you plan to eat with a big group. The food is alright. 
Yes, there is usually a ridiculously long line that makes me question some people's priorities. But then I remember why there's a wait. A lot of people shop at Stonestown with their friends and families. All of whom roll up in their extra large vans, minivans, SUVs, tour busses, what have you, and they all seem to want to eat in a sit-down restaurant with waiter service, because the food court just won't cut it. A lot of the younger crowd from several neighboring schools have appetites and time to spare. Then there are the out-of-towners who don't have an Olive Garden in their local neighborhood. I'm assuming most of them arrived just after watching a hunger-inducing Olive Garden commercial.
 
So you see, there's no reason to get mad at Olive Garden for having a long wait time. Well, sometimes I do notice that they quote an insane 45min -1hr estimate when there are empty tables. I don't know what's up with that. Poor communication? *Shrugs* I don't know.

The menu offers the usual Italian dishes - pastas & pizzas, and other typical mainstream dishes that chain restaurants offer. What do you expect? Chain restaurants cater to the masses and stick to the familiar, comfort dishes that most people have heard of. It's not meant to be innovative and exciting.

Ok, to be honest, the only things I like here are the breadsticks and the zuppa toscana soup. 

Breadsticks come warm and wrapped in a napkin. They're buttery soft and salty. Don't take breadsticks home. They always harden up like a rock. It's never fun trying to revive hard bread.

Zuppa Toscana Soup is spicy and creamy, with pieces of kale that give it a good texture, minced spicy Italian sausage, and potatoes that soak up the broth. Yum. Can I just order this to go?

If you've never had Italian food before (and I'm pretty sure most people have), then try the...
Tour of Italy - includes Chicken Parmigiana, Lasagna, Fettucine Alfredo. 
a taste of all 3 for under $20. All of them are okay.

But you have had Italian food before? Then skip it. Most of the dishes are typically around the same caliber. Just get the zuppa toscana soup and enjoy your seat with wheels and the villa-esque ambience as you gaze out the window into a view of the parking lot.

I've been here once or twice during the off-peak times and it was quite alright. I don't think it's worth anyone's time to clutch a cumbersome square beeper and wait around an hour for the food here though. Every so often, they bring back the Never Ending Pasta promotion, which is only a good deal if you can eat more than two bowls of pasta.
author: Joy W.

description: The reason for the two stars is for the waitress who is constantly check in with us and to see if we needed anything. The Hostess was being Extremely unreasonable. She told we have to wait an extra 15 minutes even though there were a numbers of open tables. She continue to be unreasonable due to the fact we requested a table for four by the window. In that very same section of the restaurant there were people seated and was eating their food in that section of the restaurant. We ended up taking the table way close to the front door. It's a pain to have a table so close to front door due to the fact it too noisy and the constant people going in and out. The food was bland and tasteless.
author: Chris Y.

description:
Ok let me tell you about the service. It is terrible. First of all we got here the 3 girls at the front said it is a 1 hour wait. 

So we waited

Then we went to the bar to get a drink and took forever for a peach sangria and a bloody mary. Wtf. 

While waiting for my drink we finally got a table but let me tell you what pissed me off the most. There was a family of 6 that arrived while we were waiting like almost an hour?? The family of 6 got seated way before us! Wtf hostesses get your shit together. 

We all ordered the food came out fast my food was good but my grandma's tortellini was strong of the wine and my sisters salmon was crusty and a little spicy my mom's dinner wasn't cooked good and took longer for her food to come back to the table.  

Over all food is good and the waiters know on point but the food is decent and the hostesses very poor service seriously. How can u seat a party before another party who waited 1 hour for a seat. Just terrible.
author: Alyssa C.

description: Had an enjoyable dinner here the other night. The staff were friendly and polite, and the waiter checked on us regularly. Only reason for the star deduction is our food came out so fast we hadn't finished our soup and salad and were left with a table quite crowded with plates and bowls.  Other than that it was a pleasant and nice experience. It's an Olive Garden, so it's not that different from other locations because their brand is (in my opinion) pretty good at consistency.
author: Liz Z.

description:
Update: last time I came to this location  service was so crappy that I contacted the manager and made a complaint. That resulted in a 20$ gift card (mind you we had paid over200$ last 3 visits NO discount whatsoever). When I called again and spoke to a different manager, she was so much nicer and gave me an additional 70$ gift card). Tonight we decided to give this place another chance. The experience was worthy of 5 stars The waitress was very attentive, making sure the whole order was good, hot and yummie.  She asked if we wanted more soup or a refill on our drinks. We wanted dessert but we were too full, and she offered us ad sample of wine go with our meal. The last 5 times we've gone here we'd have to two phenomenal service and that's the kind of people you need in this restaurant to be attentive doesn't matter if your customers are male or female Everyone should get the same service. 
(Thanks for Reading!)
author: Lizzie G.

description: Great food. Service and Food was quick and delicious. I like this restaurant. This restaurant needs more branch in bay area
author: Andrew F.

description: Food here is mediocre! Decor could use an upgrade. I came here with friends and can't say that I will return.
author: Jt T.

description:
I've insist on going to Olive Garden cause i love the food. The service has never been that great... But since i love the food i always give it another try. Yesterday, the service was ok, but the food was horrible. We just started to eat our salad and soup and they brought the main course. My husband asked for the chicken and shrimp carbonata with extra sauce, and it came extra dry with no salt or seasoning. My parmigiana the same thing. No sauce, no spices, no flavor. 
Really disappointed.
author: Tatiana B.

description:
Despite it being not "authentic" Italian food, I have a soft spot for the Olive Garden.  I wish they were located in a place where you didn't have to fight mall traffic and mall parking to be able to eat there.  It's enough of a logistical problem to keep me away when I might otherwise choose this for a leisurely Sunday lunch.

4 for the food, 1 for the location.
author: Foodbag B.

description: Our waitress kimmy was amazing!! She was so friendly and had amazing customer service!! Thank you kimmy!
author: Lydia P.

description:
This was the worst experience ever... and we didn't get to order anything!

Me and my girlfriend showed up to put our names on the waiting list. We we're told it would be a 20-25 minute wait. So we took the buzzer and briefly walked around for 10 minutes. When we came back we waited 25 minutes and we observed people being walked to their table except for us. We approached the host and they informed us she gave away our table but we would be next in the queue.

15 minutes later, we still waited and we told we've been waiting for over half an hour.
Finally she walked us to our table, dropped our menus on the table and left without saying anything.
When we finally were ready to order, the server just walked passed us on several occasions without greeting us.

We left without getting our orders taken, and rude service. We won't be coming back ever!
author: Chris T.

description:
This one star is not about the food.  The food is as expected for any chain restaurant.  It is about the outrageously bad service.  First of all,  they closely monitored move of every single table and we happened to be at the entrance of one of the dining room. Constantly,  every 2-3 minutes,  you see one of the receptionists, including the manager himself,  standing over our table and announcing into their microphone " 703 is turning" "702 is moving" ... how annoying!  How would you like to know that all they care is you are "turning " when you are trying to enjoy your evening? 
Then we have the worst waiter in the century.  He is outright lazy!  I asked for hot water,  the answer was " I'm waiting for the kitchen". It took me 15 minutes to get my hot water with a reminder to him.  But the table next to me also asked for hot water and they got a carafe of hot water in 1 minute!  When it finally came,  the water is lukewarm and served in a coffee stained cup! My soup was served cold with almost just clear broth.  I have to ask and wait for the cheese on top.  When we were done,  we were given container to doggie box our food while you looked around,  all the other table,  other waitresses boxing the food for the customers.  Then,  I have to ask not once,  but twice for the dinner to take home since we ordered the special that included a take home dinner.  So now we have three boxes to go and we have to ask for a bag! Really?!? To top it off,  as I was getting up,  I heard "table 701 is getting up"! 
Horrible experience and no way I'll come back!
author: Kit L.

description: This was mediocre at best. We waited 35 minutes for a table. The salad was boring and the minestrone soup was bland. I will say that the service was prompt . They did give us tepid ice tea with no ice. My Ravioli was tasty but it appeared to be microwaved as it was stuck together in one large lump. We did want dessert but in this instance the server didn't return promptly to take our order although we had said we were going to have a dessert. We needed to get to a movie and had to get going. Over all I wouldn't go back . It was expensive for what you get. You can get much better Italian food in San Francisco for the same price .... but then it was the Olive Garden ‍
author: Kathleen M.

description: I don't understand how people don't like this place.  The food is so good and it comes out super fast!! Plus you can get as much salad and breadsticks as one desires!!
author: Anonnymous U.

description:
We were entertaining friends from the U.K. and let me tell you, they don't have a whole lot of chain restaurants out there so when they come out for a visit, they go HAM on them.

Which brings us to the Olive Garden at Stonestown Galleria (right next to the revolving sushi bar and Chipotle)... we're in one of the greatest cities in the world, known for some of the best eats - but yes, we are at the Olive Garden!! Le sigh...

For what it's worth, the endless breadsticks and salad is not something to piss on. It's pretty satisfying and can be a meal in itself. I like that they offer rosé by the carafe. And I didn't really mind my Parmesan shrimp pasta or the lemon cake for dessert. Service was pretty good, too. 

Moral of the story is: there's no shame in dining at the chains. Everyone goes there, they just don't brag about it. How else are they in business?!
author: Julie B.

description: I went there with my friend with an empty stomach but was quite filled just with salad.. amazing food+ good service . This was my 1st time there and was kind of worried for not liking the food instead i was wrong and delighted to be there. Will visit u guys soon.
author: Sujana K.

description:
In order to have a good experience here I feel like it depends on the waiter/waitress. My family and I went here on Thursday night for dinner. Our waitress was delightful and very sweet. We asked a lot of questions and asked her for a lot of refills for the sides (breadstick, soup, salad), and she didn't mind at all. She deserved a great tip! 

I thought the food was delicious and too filling. For appetizer we got a sampler, two items which consist of calamari style rings and toasted beef and pork ravioli. The calmari rings were small pieces but good! The ravioli is square shaped and I tasted more of the beef than the pork. 
We ordered two entrees: sausage stuffed giant rigatoni and baked tilapia with shrimp
- sausage stuffed giant rigatoni: it's a lot of food. Some pasta wasn't really cooked cause it's hard in some areas, that's ok cause it wasn't that noticable. There's a lot of sausage pieces, my favorite! The sauce is amazeballs and so cheesy! I thought this entree was rich and very delicious.
- baked tilapia with shrimp: shrimp was tasty, yet small. The tilapia was something I could've made easily and also small. This plate did not please me. I feel like their seafood entrees aren't as great either. There's way too much broccoli too, but the portion size for the broccoli and fish was even.
For dessert we got chocolate mousse cake. WOW I LOVED IT! Melted right inside my mouth and I think it's a good dessert to share after eating so much food. Always have room for dessert. But warning: it is really sweet.
author: Vanessa L.

description: This was a really good choice to go out on a friday. The service was excellent, and the food was amazing. The portion size is big but for me thats good so I can take some home. Highly recommended if your looking for a nice Italian place to celebrate.  The music fits the theme and the place feels very alive with beautiful architecture, thx 10/10
author: Diego V.

description:
I love this place.    I know it's a chain but one of the nice things about chain restaurants is (usually) their consistent standards, though no place is perfect.

I visit this location every so often and usually sit in the bar, ordering soup and salad.   Nothing too expensive, but I consistently get good food, and fast and friendly service.   Val works at the bar, but is so fast and wonderful I sit there all the time.  She knows my order and gets me in and out in no time.   Even today I missed Val, but had excellent service.   Kudos to Val, Jasmine, and this location.  I appreciate you!
author: Jason P.

description:
Had lunch there today, ordered salad, my husband started eating his salad and happened to look down and realized there was a bug.  Called over waitress and decided to have soup instead. Was served my sandwich and the waitress came over and asked if we found anymore bugs in the food. The bug was one thing but for the waitress to ask if we found anymore. 
WOW. Speechless. Just watch what you're eating.
author: Linda S.

description:
Usually service is horrendous here (for the past few times i've been here anyway), but today I had an awesome lunch with a friend!! We got there around 1pm and were seated quickly despite how full the restaurant looked. We were interested in the "buy one, take one" lunch promotion and of course, the endless breadsticks, soup, and salad!

We started with breadsticks, salad, and the chicken and gnocci soup, which is my favorite!! I love dipping the breadsticks into the soup.... mmm. I finished that bowl off and then we ordered a bowl of zuppa toscana, which was really good as well. You can really taste the sausage and I love the kale in it! FYI you can always mix and match your soup if you finish your first bowl and want another kind for the next bowl. I didn't even know you could do that until my last visit here.

For our entree, we ordered the smoked mozzarella chicken and were both pleasantly surprised!!! I didn't expect the chicken to be so well cooked (honestly, I kinda expect dry/overcooked chicken anywhere hahaha), and the sauce was really flavorful. The "take home" entree you get is actually cold when they give it to you at the end of your meal, and they give you reheating instructions too.

The main standout thing about today's experience was definitely the service!! Our waiter was a young man named Anthony and his customer service was amazing. I was seriously so surprised at this because last time I was here, our waitress was a girl that was not in a very good mood... And was often no where to be found. However, Anthony kept checking up on us and our food was served in a timely fashion. He definitely changed my mind about Olive Garden's service!! 

3 stars for food and 1 for service :-)
author: Tara A.

description: My friend and I went into this location yesterday evening for dinner, since there was a wait, we sat at the bar top. Our server Brendon was friendly, knowledgeable, and always smiling! It was a great experience and I'll be coming back on my next visit to the city!
author: Lauren K.

description:
we are here on a rainy Sunday night and wait is around 45 mins. The hostess are super nice and their janitorial service are constantly cleaning the floor to ensure everything is dry and clean on this rainy night.

Moving onto food. It was decent. Unlimited bread and salad was a nice touch. Quantity was average for the price paid.
author: Begum L.

description:
The food was good, the one star is for the customer  service or should I say lack of customer service. 

Upon walking in, the head hostess Alexis had a moody face on her already. No smile, no greeting. Nothing. It really looked like she didn't want to be there. The girl who walked us to our table was the same way. I brushed it off because I was excited to eat. Our waitress was nice and bubbly but she seemed frazzled with her tables. After bringing us our entrees we never saw her again. My boyfriend's soda was empty for over 30 minutes and was never refilled. 

I understand Olive Garden isn't a fine dining establishment but paying $65 for our meal I would've appreciated some type of customer service. I've gotten better customer service at a McDonald's drive thru.
author: Anne P.

description:
UNLIMITED PASTA BOWLS ARE BACK! (for now)

For $10 it's a pretty good deal - compared to everything else on their menu. Even when you build your own pasta dish its about $12-13. I came with a group of friends and we all opted for this option. To be quite honest, I couldn't even finish the first plate (which is the largest), because of all the breadsticks/soups/salads before. 

But a great option here is to ask your waiter for another bowl & get it to go!
author: Carrie L.

description:
We gone here many times, but coming here this Thursday night was particularly bad.

The sirloin and lobster ravioli special was disappointing compared to what was pictured.

But the worst part was the service from our waitress Susana V... After serving us our food, she stopped returning to our table. Three times we had to flag other waitresses for more water, salad, and drinks. We even used the machine at the table to call her and it took a considerable amount of time.

Susana, you've really put a sore spot on our time here tonight. I hope you get an opportunity to learn from this experience.
author: Frances S.

description:
The facts of this visit:

Was seated in a dirty booth

Moved to another booth, still not clean

Soup was barely warm, had no gnocchi and only a few specks of chicken. 

Breadsticks were not heated / toasted-blah 

Received my Tetley Black Tea with very hot water... Very happy about the brand of tea and the hot water, however server forgot my creamer and I had no utensils or napkin at my table

Had to flag down another server to obtain creamer and a spoon for my tea (received a soup spoon).

Main course was hot and delicious. 

My server was very nice.
author: Laura F.

description:
Today was excited 
Really good food 
Really great waitress 
Thank you for your Great work
author: Mukhammadiev B.

description:
Here's the thing, this is an AMERICAN CHAIN RESTAURANT claiming to be Italian food. They win at that. They serve excellent American chain style Italian food. They capture what real Italian food is and they commercialize it. It's perfect. It's warm, delicious, and filling. It's clean here. The staff is mostly friendly. If you get the chance, have your entire experience take place at the bar. From drinks, to appetizers, to the main course and desert. The bar staff is excellent! I have enjoyed sitting at this bar over the passed few weeks as a regular and they make you feel as though you are family. 

This is San Francisco and we have some of the most delicious food places in the world. But for locals, sometimes it's nice to just enjoy a soft environment with friendly people.
author: James I.

description:
Services is sucks. I called server for 10+ mins, no body coming, some other server walked by our table, just faked it.

There hv buy one get one promotion, (order one for one, give u another one take home) I ordered for my friend and me, after i pay for the check, no one bring the print receipt also no one didn't give me the to-go ones.

Really mad with their bad service.
author: Yvonne D.

description:
I've only been to this Olive Garden once before and I don't remember it being this bad. 

Food-wise: one of the worst "restaurants" I've been to.I got the tour of Italy and it was so bad. My food was cold and some of the pasta wasn't even cooked. I got the fettuccini Alfredo, chicken parm and the portobello ravioli. I started with the fettuccini which was cold at first bite and also hard. For the portobello ravioli the inside wasn't even cooked and I felt like I could have done a better job buying Costco portobello ravioli which I've made before. For the chicken parm I barely ate any of it because it was so dry and the fried part just made me nauseous. Just overall this dish was bad. It wasn't even because it tasted bad but because it was cold and some of the food wasn't cooked all the way. The bread was okay I imagined it being way better like maybe cheese cake factory level at least. What I liked the most was the salad which funny thing is came free with the meal. In the end me and my friend ordered one of the cheesecakes. I was excited because I have been craving cheese cake but this cheese cake was so frozen it almost broke the fork I was eating with. I gave up trying to eat it half way because it wasn't worth the hassle. 

For drinks: me and my friend ordered the Italian margarita and we had high expectations since it was the most expensive one and it said Italian...but yet again we were disappointed. My friend even said I honestly just felt full and didn't feel that margarita after drinking it. 

For the service: our first server seemed a bit unprofessional because the way he talked was so abrupt. He didn't really offer us bread which surprised me at first so I had to request it. We didn't even know that they changed our server until after they changed to a new guy. They actually didn't even say anything at all. The new server was at least nicer and more attentive that's why I give it two stars but besides that I don't think I'll ever come here again because my food turned out to be $30+ which I don't think is worth it for a dry, cold, uncooked plate of food.
author: Leslie F.

description:
fucking hate this place! So racist.
The worst service ever, they refused to serve us. A party of very interracial group, I will never visit another Olive Garden again.
author: Tunechi J.

description: food was expensive and service was mediocre, wait was about 30 mins, young lady who give you the buzzer and takes your name down was pretty rude.  I wouldn't go back.  Plus, the serving portion looked like it was cut in half
author: James C.

description:
Slow service, expect a 1.5-2 her dinner for two, because it will be hard to get s hold of a server .
Food is nothing amazing, average $20 per entree and $13 per Apetizer dish.
Usually a one he wait for dinner 6pm and after. No reservations. 

Calamari is poor quality and does not taste fresh. 
Unlimited soup and salad is fantastic but server may forget to refill you or take your bowl and never come back. True story.
author: Veranna N.

description:
It's Olive Garden. What can I say. It's gonna be OK or a complete miss. Sometimes the service is amazing; attentive and pleasant. But when you're placed into that little hidden room they sometimes open (the one that's usually bare w/windows facing Sports Authority), you are often overlooked. 

The 2 times I've dined in the section of the restaurant were terrible. Service was sub par, we were extremely overlooked (you would have to hound people to get their attention), and the food was more than disappointing. Now I've been guilty of dining here countless times b/c of convenience and I love their peach teas, but this experience was so especially bad, I felt I had to leave a review.

Besides the uneccesary slow service, our food that came out was horrendous. I ordered chicken alfredo and bf ordered spaghetti w/some kind of tomato sauce and meatballs. Mind you, we also ordered an appetizer of calamari, stuffed mushrooms, and fried ravioli that came out literally 5 min before our entrees. After the fact we had waited forever and had finished our bread sticks and had 2 refills of zuppa toscana. 

As you'll see in my pictures, my chicken was clearly burnt and when chicken is cooked to ashes, it becomes dry and inedible. The meatballs were unappealingly gray. To serve those dishes out...my goodness..yes it's a chain, but jeez, have some standards and respect for your food! 

This experience was truly disappointing. Look at your food carefully as well, there were numerous times where OG had to comp my meals and my roommates' meals b/c their dishes included hairy situations..
author: Emily M.

description: Service was HORRIBLE. Went out yesterday for a Valentine's Day dinner for 2. Wait was about 20 minutes, got seated, waitress was alright. She asked if she could get us started with any drinks and I asked if we could please have some time because we weren't ready yet. She looked at me very irritated. Then came back about 10 min later to ask us again and I told her I ordered my drink from the kiosk on the table. She again looked annoyed. Got our food about 25 min later, chicken Alfredo pasta is very bland and such a small portion for almost a $20 plate. Our waitress told us that she would be going on break and a guy would help us. We are a bit then waited for over 30 minutes to simply GET APPROACHED by a waiter. They all made eye contact with us as they helped other tables. Then got ridiculous for waiting so long so I got up and asked a waiter if he could get us some to go boxes when he could. He said "I'm cleaning this table right now but I'll get that for you when I'm done" so rude. Never coming back.
author: Cassandra G.

description:
What are the chances that I would run into my Middle School crush here? 

I was walking out, and she was walking to her table.

I saw her across the room, and though she was older (of course) I recognized her right away. She was still as beautiful as I remember. Curly long brown hair, dimpled smile...and 3 children?!? What? Well, that's new.

She recognized me too, and I still felt embarrassed all these years afterwards that she remembered how thrilled I was to have received a Valentine's Day card from her when we were kids and how I used to keep it in my velcro wallet.

She was here for their family meals...the all you can eat stuff and the kids meal too.

I came here for their soup and salad combo. I really like their soup and salad but don't ask me to eat any of their Tv dinner pasta or crappy breadsticks. 

She's on her second husband now. Not surprising since I'm sure she'll go the Elizabeth Taylor route and marry over and over until she finds the right one who will buy her all the clothes and jewels she's ever wanted.

That's how she was in Middle School...wanting diamonds at 10 years old and a large house to live in. I still remember when I asked her out in Middle School and she said she would only go out with me if I would buy her a gold bracelet...and at that time I barely had enough for lunch money.

She wound up dating this gangster guy instead.

She still reminds me of Christy Turlington, and for a minute I felt my heart race as I wished her well.

There were no numbers exchanged. Why bother...she would only break my heart again. But, I managed to get a hold of her waiter, and gave him my credit card to pay for her tab.

I told the waiter to tell her that it was a surprise from her secret admirer.

And that she would know who it was.
author: Jack R.

description: Horrible, Horrible, HORRIBLE our waiter Jennifer was horrible and rude, food no taste, dishes dirty salad plate dirty, glass dirty. She acted like the dirty dishes was no big deal, well it was a big deal to me. I ordered Minestrone Soup instead I got a bowl of stewed tomato soup with a few veggies and 10 pasta shells smh I ask for another bowl of soup without all the tomatoes and she says it comes already mixed like that then she brings me a bowl of soup on a COLD salad plate that had refrigerated. She ignored us, didn't ask if we wanted ice for our water. She brought us a second bowl of salad and didn't remove the previous bowl, she left empty dishes on the table I had to ask her to remove them. She served another table dessert without clearing off their table first. Then we were told to pay on this device at our table so in personal. NEVER COMING BACK HERE EVER AGAIN
author: W M.

description:
I've never been a fan of Olive Garden. And never felt the need to write any review for them. Today, a friend of mine had this coupon for $5.99 unlimited salad, soup, and breadstick meal. I didn't really care for it even at a nice prince. In the past when they would advertise unlimited soup or salad, the wait in between to get the next batch can be hour. I which case, "unlimited soup" can just be two bowls, because you get tired of waiting for the next bowl to arrive. Takes the waiter forever to come to your table so you can ask them for the next bowl, and it'll take them forever to come out with the next bowl. You think all it would take is for them to just go in the kitchen, ladle in another bowl and take it right back out. Yet if feels like there's going out to buy stock and bring it back to start cooking that one bowl of soup from scratch. 

Today was worse. We had coupons. When we got there, we asked the seater name caller ID we can use these coupons for the few of us. She said "sure, just let the waiter know am they'll deduct the discount off your total". When our name was called, there was a different person that lead us to our seat. Once we seated, we asked her "we have a few of these $5.99 coupons, can we use them for the each of us? This other person also say "yes, just let the waiter know and they'll adjust your total for the coupon." Then the waiter comes and hands us a menu. Asked us what we liked to drink and we just said ice water all around. Came back with water and left. Few minutes later, comes back and ready to talk our order. We talk him we have a few of these coupons for the each of us, can we use them. Immediately he says "that deal is over, it's regular price now. We asked, are you sure? Because the coupon has today's date as the last day of expiration. The waiter takes a look at the coupon and says only one per table. We asked, "are you sure? The coupon reads just one per person." He takes another look at the coupons and changes his response. Then says "it's one coupon per email. So your first order would be the discount and the others would be full price." I take a look at the coupon and no where does it print any email or barcodes or serial numbers. I asked again, are you sure? And he starts taking about some kind of email program. Then I tell him we need a few more minutes. 

He left, and I tell my friends "classics bait and switch. No wonder there's hardly any customers in here". Let's leave. 

While we were leaving, another waitress saw us and asked what's wrong. We explained the coupon and how it made us decide to eat at Olive garden. But the waiter said no to us. She said "let me ask the manager if it's okay to give you that deal. We told her, that's absolutely okay. The only reason we decided to come here was because of the coupon. If we weren't honored it from the beginning, than that means either it's a Bait and Switch, of the customer is always wrong. 

And so we left and ate elsewhere. 

I would have rated this a negative star if possible. Wasted our time going there and going to another restaurant. Never again. 

Trust me, there must be a reason that this Olive Garden has gone from a large location to a smaller one. Give it time and it'll close down.
author: Jack L.

description: What can I say about Olive Garden and their long waits just to get a seat? It's simply worth it! I love this place , it's absolutely amazing. From the soups & salads to the breadsticks then pasta.
author: Jika M.

description:
I had a small family brunch here earlier this week. 

Olive Garden is not really a brunch place. We basically ordered lunch-dinner during brunch. We also got to sample a lot of wine though my brother picked out one of the white ones. 

Pretty accommodating, as a party of 7 we were seated at a large table in the middle of the place but it was tucked away like it was a private little party. Isolating but okay. Staff was patient with us and were pretty good about making sure we were okay throughout our stay. 

We all shared stuffed mushrooms and calamari as appetizers. Calamari is a safe choice for appetizers since it's pretty juicy and consistently good. I usually douse it in lemon. The mushrooms are generally inconsistently made but okay this time around. Tasted better when I ate it with the sauce provided for the calamari. 

I ordered one of the newer dishes, the Salmon Bruschetta at $20.99. Pretty good, salmon wasn't dry. The risotto...lol the cheese was in a chunk in the middle under the plate and I needed to mix it with everything for it to be juicy and evenly distributed. I'm not sure if they did it like that on purpose or not. I was full by the time I ate half my dish.

Shared a Seasonal Berry cake with my sister. The wait time to get it took maybe like 10 minutes and I assume it's because they needed to wait for it to thaw in time. It was still partially frozen when we got it and I'm not convinced that the berries on top of it are all berries. 

Olive Garden is Olive Garden.
author: Sofia R.

description: I went with my family there and we actually waited for almost an hour setting outside in the cold although when we got in we saw many tables are empty , the food was not deserve the waiting . Also I ordered grilled chicken parmigiana but the chicken was fried !
author: Talal A.

description: If you are looking for good food, please take your stomach and money to another business. I made the horrible decision of treating my 12-year old twins to Olive Garden the week of March 19, 2017. the pasta was mushy and over cooked. Once we made it home, my twins complained of a stomach ache. I contacted the manager who was combative and attempted to talk me out of my complaint." Are you sure? We usually don't comp people. We would have to investigate if you want your money back."  He finally agreed to send me a $40 gift card (my bill was $86 + $14 tip) which I never received...UPDATE 4/6/2017.  I received my gift card yesterday.
author: Yummy S.

description:
Golly gee, what happened to Olive Garden?

I remember this place as a friendly family place with servers and hosts smiling at their customers and being attentive and now? Now it's sort of the opposite.

I walked in here for lunch with my cousin and mom. The hostess that was working the table looked bored and didn't even offer me a smile or a "hi, welcome to Olive Garden!" Nope. She looked at me like she was going to fall asleep in a second. Okay, fine. Wait service will probably be better, right?

Service was bleh at best. Sure, the waiter was nice, but he wasn't really that attentive. Was it 'cause he was shy? Nope, can't be because we saw him conversing with a table across from us a lot. Even when he was packaging our leftovers, he would walk over to the other peoples' table and talk. Uh, okay. And when it came time to give us the check, he didn't even give it to us personally and thank us for being there. Someone else had to deliver it. 

Food was mediocre. We ordered the calamari as an appetizer and it came out in a dark brown color meaning it was deep fried too long. You couldn't even tell the calamari pieces from the pepper pieces. And what's worse? Dipping it in sauce didn't even help. We ended up taking 95% of it home and it was like eating crunchy potato chips. Ugh.
My mom's chicken alfredo lacked a lot of sauce and the chicken was dry. My cousin seemed to enjoy her dish, but then dessert came and it all went downhill again. We got 2 of the dolcinis - arametto tiramisu and limoncello. The tiramisu one smelled like soap and the top part tasted nasty, according to my cousin. And the limoncello was insanely sweet.

Overall, Olive Garden's going down and it's probably going to take a lot for me to come back.
author: Venus L.

description: Horrible service, server was very rude to us, and the food took forever to come out. The food also was not very good
author: Tyler C.

description: We came again on Sunday for a drink and something to eat. This restaurant it's a hit and miss. One day they do good and you are happy to come, the next day you regret that you came back. Very slow service, even when you see employees chatting and having a good time. Nobody cares that the drinks are getting warm on the bar window, no utensils on the tables, I saw people getting up to get utensils from the service station or tables nearby .it's kind of "not my job thing". Anyways, I will think hard to come back here.
author: Harold F.

description: Really disappointed in service. Bartender (female), lacked customer service. Will not be returning. Also no happy hour prices, which isn't a big deal if the customer service would have been great.
author: Valerie M.

description: Omg so I went online for reservations and it said 55 minutes and when we got there they said the wait was 2.5 hours so my review is on the website don't even bother I showed the staff and they were like yeah sorry I'd be mad but we can't check you in till you actually get here. Waste of time!
author: Tracy G.

description: Its my moms 55th Birthday we have been here since 5:30 waiting the customer service stinks the hosts keep lying about 70min ago ot was we are just waiting on a table that has packed up to leave then it is we only have too tables that fit 8 and on weekends we dont merge tables now it the same thing i wvwn asked since we have been waiting for almost 3hr if my mom can get her food for free there is no manager to talk to there way to busy to handle customers concerns it grove her all the way back to sf so we can meet here with family now im upset my moms birthday has just went down hill her and the 3 kids we are with are now tired this doesn't make any since
author: Adrianna M.

description: Went there at 4pm Sunday and have to wait 40mins. Not sure why people love this place. Over priced and quality of food was not that great. There are paper in my soup and different noodle in my spaghetti. The quality control is bad. See the photo and you know what I mean.
author: Sandra A.

description: It's little bit expensive. We just order two pastas and a starter only, it cost us fifty something. And it was too salted fo me.
author: Lu Y.

description:
The reason I am writing this review is because for some reason Stonestown Olive Garden decides to charge more for their food than any other. The website, including yelp distinctly say 12.99 for the buy one take one home. I got the fettuchine alfredo, and for whatever reason I was charged 16.99. I guess at this Olive Garden the minimum is 16.99. 

I understand SF is an expensive city. But it's BS that there is a $4 difference. It's literally for no reason at all. The food is great. The Alfredo is the best. But I'm not going to come here anymore because it's false advertising.
author: Raymond A.

description:
After a long day and not wanting to cook, we decided on the Olive Garden. 

Yummy part of our meal. 

The bread sticks! SCORE!
The house Salad! SCORE!
The Ice Water! SCORE!

Spicy Shrimp Scampi Fritta: 
Lightly breaded fried shrimp, with a garlic and spicy cherry pepper sauce. 

Stuffed Mushrooms: 
Parmesan, romano and mozzarella cheese, clams and herb breadcrumbs baked in mushroom caps. 

Sucky part of our dinning experience at the Olive Garden:

The Chardonnay - Twist off bottle (enuff said)

2 looooooong hairs rolled in my cloth napkin. YUCK

Steak Gorgonzola-Alfredo - Disgusting! Never again....
We split this order since we ordered the above mentioned appetizers. The grilled beef medallions (ordered medium rare) were like cafeteria tasting meatballs. Drizzled with balsamic glaze that was way too sweet. The fettuccine was tossed without the spinach we did not want it. The gorgonzola-alfredo sauce had no taste to it. It was bland. 

We ordered some dipping marinara/alfredo sauce and our waitress brought us bowls of this stuff, which seemed kind of odd. They usually come in smaller dishes. I should of asked why, because we were charged over $3.00 a bowl. We got one of these reversed since we were not advised of the hefty charge.

Oh did I mention that the waitress kept dropping my silverware? yeah, about 3 times. 

And we were not offered the:
Buy One, Take One is back! Enjoy 1 delicious entrée now, and take a 2nd entrée home for later! Starting at just $12.99 

Pasta Pomodoro, here we come.
author: Carla F.

description: We had a ladies gathering today and Olive Garden is warm and inviting as well as cozy.  Our waiter was very attentive and friendly and 4 of us ordered the Tour of Italy where you pick 3 items and they had combinations of eggplant Parmesan, chicken Parmesan, ravioli, lasagna or spaghetti while I just ordered the rigatoni with meat sauce and Italian sausage.  We were served choice of soup or salad which was unlimited as well as nice warm garlic breadsticks.  So much to eat that we had to take our entrees home.
author: Karen W.

description:
Breadsticks, pasta, good service...this is the place to go to if you're looking for these. I took my mom and brother here since they brought back the get one take one deal, which is pretty good for 13 bucks. You get 2 meals for that price.
