Everything was cooked to perfection. If you're looking for appetizers, definitely get the calamari and stuffed mushrooms because they were so gooood! Don't get me started on the bread..

Our waiter always tended to our needs and made sure we werent lacking in anything. He kept his cheery kind attitude stable throughout the whole duration of our visit. 

The only downside is that you have to wait pretttty long to get seated and that buzzer doesn't let you roam too far in the mall. But what can you do about it? It ain't olive garden's fault.
author: Tina R.

description: Pretty good place to eat as well to shop to after works Stonestown Galleria as well if you available special coupon"
author: Anthony V.

description: Been going to olive gardens throughout the years and they've always been pretty good, this location was no exception. The only draw back is the wait time which can be excruciatingly long.....other than that, the food is good and the service is not too shabby either.
author: Marco M.

description: Should have known from all the other reviews. Really should be a 1 star for service and experience. I gave the extra star because the food was good. Unfortunately, the 4 hostesses at the front couldn't get it together. We waited over an hour to be sat. Just to wait again on the server. Best part is the soup and salad was served and we didn't have silverware. Had to ask two different people to get some. The server who took our order ended up leaving and the server her took her place had an attitude. No good!
author: Amber R.

description:
Been here several times before and after several times I have to say that this Olive Garden is no different than any other Olive Garden. With big chain restaurants like this you can't really tell the difference besides the service. Although I will have to admit that the service here is pretty decent in comparison to other locations I have been to.

Every time we have been here we are seated right away (even on weekend nights) and our waiter comes out really quickly to assist us. The food here is pretty good and freshly made. The times that I have been here the food comes out really quick, hot and tastes great. The place is located near other stores and there is huge parking lot which makes it easy. 

Overall a good place to come and eat and defiantly recommend. Better service than the Vallejo location for sure.
author: Anne R.

description:
Visiting the area from Vegas we weren't used to everything closing early and the only thing open after 9 was Olive Garden. We walked in and were seated immediately. The waiter looked less
Than thrilled to see us. He didn't bring water for about 20 minutes. Asked for plain salad with dressing on the side and twice he made the same mistake and the salad came pre-drenched in dressing. He blamed "the kitchen" for the repeated mistakes. Food was mediocre at best. Disappointing.
author: Jen V.

description:
Came here for lunch yesterday to chat and catch up with a family friend. And I rarely write dissatisfied reviews but this is one of those times where it's warranted.
First, we had to wait approx 10min for a table despite seeing empty tables throughout the restaurant. Second, after being seated, our server was nowhere to be found. The busboy did a much better job of taking our drinks, orders and bringing us breadsticks. He should be commended for his prompt service and going above and beyond his job description. 
By now, we've gotten our meal and still haven't seen our server. 
I turn a blind eye to most service discrepancies but this was beyond terrible. Our water was never refilled, finally saw the waitress/server who asked if we were ok but never checked for refills on soup, water or breadsticks. She was prompt asking if we needed the check though. However, she never came to pick it up. Had to go up to the counter myself. Then a gift card was refused but never told until 15 minutes later even though it said expressly on Darden's website, it was valid. Took another 10 minutes to pay by card and again, our server was nowhere to be found.
Probably one of the worst customer service experiences I've ever had.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
Why, why, WHY do I continue to support this sad excuse of a chain??? Only because my grandson loves pasta and my husband reminded me that we hadn't eaten at this Olive Garden in years (yes, dear Hubby, there is an excellent reason and this is it!)

Saturday evening, 6:30pm. Average wait time = 1 hour. OK. Accepted. Hubby and grandson go off into Stonestown mall and shop. Bring back a large loaf of french bread from Boudin.  We then chatted with another family who were waiting in the crowded waiting area.

We then were escorted to our table by our server. She took our appetizer and drinks orders pleasantly enough. We trusted that she wrote everything down correctly. Calamari/fried mozzarella sticks combo to share; minestrone soup for Hubby, who ordered an entree.

Fifteen minutes later, drinks came.  The appetizer combination was wrong: mushroom came instead of the mozzarella sticks. Server takes back appetizer. Minestrone did not appear. We figured it would be brought later.

Calamari/mozzarella arrived after another 15 minutes.  Looked and tasted like the calamari had been sitting under the heating lamp all those 15 minutes, then shoved aside to make way for the mozzarella sticks.  Still no minestrone, so we followed up on that.  Server this time was not the same one who took our order.  Server #2 says she will be right back.

Another 15 minutes passed. Hubby calls on a busboy, who says he will tell the server.  Still no minestrone.  Daughter calls on a server who was seating others to another table.  Server tells us she will tell our server.

We see our original server/order taker bringing in others and tell her that our minestrone has not arrived.  She looks at us and says, "I am NOT your server." Then turns and leaves.

We call the manager and tell him what happened. Manager apologizes and after that, our server #2 brings in everything else quickly.

For the service and food quality that we got --- this is the last time Olive Garden will see us. Maybe they don't care, because their lobby is always full. But hello, Olive Garden --- know this:  your customer base is made up of people like me and my family.  Get enough of us, and you will go belly up. So TRAIN YOUR FRONTLINERS HOW TO RESPOND TO CUSTOMERS.

Server #1 could easily have told us that she was no longer our server in a more pleasant, positive manner. How about "I will see to it that the one assigned to serve your table brings the soup out right away." Because it was obvious that it was SHE who was responsible for the soup being left out the orders! NEVER AGAIN!!!
author: Cecilia S.

description:
Me and my girlfriend went there this afternoon to eat lunch. It wasn't busy like before. The service was good. The only disappointing was the pasta we ordered. Taste awful. It was like left over pastas from yesterday. My girlfriend called our server to let him know there's something wrong with her pasta. He offered her to order a new one but the next one was also disappointing. So, we decided to leave without finishung the food. We still paid for it but swore that we won't eat there again.

Sorry for the bad review but they have to know what's wrong.

Good luck next time.
author: Joven G.

description: I don't normally have a problem when coming to this restaurant, but this last time I came just didn't go well. The service was good, but the food was bad. It was so bad that I ended up with food poisoning :( It was my first meal of the day too. I am forever traumatized! I ordered the tilapia fillet with the zucchini btw. I'm not sure what ur people are doing back there, I honestly think management should keep a better eye on how long the food has been sitting & make sure they label the stuff that's prepared.
author: Maria P.

description: Fast, friendly service & I did leave full. They also have the self check out option on the table if you are on the go.
author: Janice L.

description: Looking for something nearby and good for families, we chose Olive Garden.  I felt like light fare and found shrimp scampi over angel hair weighing in at about 500 calories.  The flavor was OK, garlicky.  But the shrimp were undercooked and I suffered sharp gas pains from food poisoning that night and for the next 5 days.  Never again.
author: Heath K.

description:
Gross! I used to love Olive Garden, but haven't been in a few years. This place has changed. The endless salad was drenched in dressing and I picked out all of the blatantly rotten tomatoes. I got the "tour of Italy"-three pastas for $12.99. The pastas were sitting in what looked like tomato runoff water but the tops were hard from the heat lamps they had probably been under for the entire 45 minutes we waited for our food. 

The service was pretty bad. Honestly it does not take 45 minutes to open a can of tomato sauce and cook pasta, which is what we got. Our waitress was nice and looked busy but most of the waitstaff was standing around behind the bar and doing nothing. Literally nothing. A staff member was talking very loudly next to our table about how she wanted to take a cigarette break and did not care whether she got in trouble. 

It's dirty, put nicely. Granted, we were there around 8 pm (maybe it is better in the morning) but the floors and the whole place really smells like it has been wiped by the same dirty mop for the last decade. I walked out feeling dirty from having eaten there. 

We came here for cheap Italian food. However this place is not cheaper than most of the much nicer Italian restaurants in the city. Menu items, other than the 3 pasta special, start at $16. For this price, one can get the same thing, but much better quality, at many other places in San Francisco.

I don't understand how people can walk out not feeling totally ripped off.
author: Elina P.

description:
Olive Garden has been an Italian restaurant I would dine on occasions. However this location it doesn't matter whether your waiting to be seated for an table or getting take out the wait time and customer service is horrible. I ordered pasta fagioli soup which I love however it lacked seasoning. I hope this review will 
helpful.
author: Tanya G.

description: I used to be a regular patron. 30 mins ago today, I went here and was seated in the room to the right, as you enter. We were at a corner table but still very visible. The waitress (long Asian girl in a ponytail) passed by 3-4 times. We were sitting not looking at our menu cuz we were ready. Nobody came up to give us water or ask us anything. She served 2-3 tables that were seated after us and still no service. One of the last table she served was right next to our table!!!! And she walked away so we got up and left. They need to re-train people. Customer service sucks here now.
author: amanda t.

description: I have been here numerous times. Not my favorite but.decent enough for me to go here on a holiday or Sunday afternoon. The pasta is Okay. I like my fettuccine but this place does something stage with the pasta. I tend to miss the flavor off the pasta because of all the cream used in the preparation. Salads are big and filling. The bar it's okay. It is a short bar but quality drinks all around.
author: Robert F.

description:
Horrible service this weekend.
Kitchen forgot to make my dish. Server neglected our table. Had to ask hostess for a drink refill and to get the manager to find my food. No pre-bussing. No wine samples offered. No pace between salad and entree. Had to box our food ourselves
The only thing good was the taste of the food.
author: Cassondra B.

description:
I was hoping it'd be better given the coupon hype in the Sunday paper and TV commercials featuring mouthwatering, rustic Italian dishes that seemed the perfect dinner solution on a rainy Friday night at Stonestown.

It was just alright. 

The spaghetti is clearly done in big batches and too far in advance so when it arrives on your plate, the pasta is starchy, sticky and barely warm. 

The shrimp and chicken carbonara featured a sauce that was separating, indicating it'd been kept too hot and not stirred. And why did they feel the need to add breaded chicken pieces in this dish? It's not like it wasn't rich enough. Grilled slices of chicken would've somewhat redeemed the dish, at least to make up for the separated sauce.

The marinara on my little boy's pasta was the standout, chunky with a rich, deep tomato flavor. The accompanying dinner salad was also alright.

Service? Well, all I can say is it's the "B" team with haphazard timing (could be the kitchen), switching servers mid-stream who promised diners one table behind us they'd "get out of their hair" now that they'd ordered/had their food delivered/another round of water poured.

(I don't know about you but eating and hearing "get out of your hair" made my stomach turn after the fourth time I'd heard it). 

Our server tried and he did accommodate the comped children's meal that I'd earned after giving up my email address to Darden Corporation (that owns Olive Garden) though I couldn't find the discount code. 

I tipped generously because I felt the badly timed service (drink took 20 minutes to make, arrived with the main and my entree arrived two minutes after my salad which he tried to immediately whisk away, huh?) was the fault of the bartender and kitchen.

The server was harried but nice enough, he did try and after all, it's Christmas. 

Would I go back? Maybe for soup and salad if I was really hungry and shopping at Stonestown. Then again I might walk 150 fewer feet and try the sushi place next door.
author: Jennifer O.

description: Today was the first time we went in this restaurant as my daughter wanted to eat some "authentic Italian food"! We went in with our small service dog which was a miniature poodle and told them that he is a service dog.  The waitress was very pleasant and attentive. While we were starting to eat, a middle age man who was most likely the manager came to our table with his long, sour face and said to me in a very cold tone that if he ever heard the dog bark then he would kick us out the restaurant in a superior tone ! He was standing there for minutes and repeated again and again about his statement until I said to him "Sir, you don't need to repeat this as we were not deaf people". He left after scoffing at us. This really spoiled our mood to enjoy the meal as the price for the food was quite expensive to us!!! We decided to leave at half way of eating since we were feeling really bad. This guy may be a manager but he was so rude and had absolutely no manners and was low class. I am afraid that my spiritual service dog would bark at him since this guy had very negative energy !!! The waitress was very nice and polite young girl with good manners. She even apologized for this happening to us and said that she has a dog and she loves and understands dog feelings. Our service dog is very sweet and special! We felt this guy should be removed from his position because he has zero warming feelings towards to customers! We believe that he really damages this business and sets a bad name and impression for this restaurant! After all, restaurants are businesses that rely on good services and communication skills are essential!  We will never go there again and would not recommend this place to anybody else.
author: Lydia J.

description: What happened to the Olive Garden we used to love?!?! My family loved going to Olive Garden because it was affordable to have a good quality Italian meal with fast friendly customer service. Since we live about 30 minutes from this location (which is the closest to us), we usually pick up and take out our dinner when coming through on 19th from the airport. But the last few times we would get home and open everything up to eat and have one of those "we spent $50 for this?" moments. Everything was eatable, but the quality and value is not there like it used to be. On top of that, we received an emailed survey about our experience and let them know our thoughts. We were connected via email by the manager the next day, but told we should call him to discuss the issues even though we gave plenty of details via email. What more is there to say and who has time to do that? It's much easier for me to go elsewhere. You'd think they would try a bit harder to make loyal customers remain as such. Probably won't return.
author: Christian M.

description: This Olive Garden dinner was absolutely horrible. The only thing good was the salad. First we had to wait about 30min for the salad and breadsticks and when they did arrive the breadsticks were not seasoned at all. Then we were never given silver wear and it took me about another 10min to finally have a server follow through with my request. Once the food came out my girlfriend and I were greatly disappointed. There was no taste to either of our meals and my girlfriend actually sent her's back. They did remove her meal from the bill at least. I can say that our server was fantastic, aside from not providing the silver wear. However I don't think that was her fault because the tables are normally prepped before hand. She greatly apologized our disappointing meal. I would neve return here again. It reminded me why I have not been to an Olive Garden in over 4 years.
author: Matthew W.

description: My first experience here, I wasn't impressed with the steak + fettuccine alfredo.  The cheese used was odd but my other friends had a different experience.  However, the next times that followed at this same location, I ended up getting cocktails over other kinds of pasta.  My current favorite is the braised beef and gnocchi ricotta with a side of zuppa toscana and an alcoholic peach bellini.  The service here is always so friendly and I have loved every server here!  I've been coming here once a week and I might just keep this streak.  Tip this location well!
author: Quyne V.

description: The lady at the front desk needs to smile/unfriendly  shes like a robot and she dosn't say anything she just drop the menu on the table then left. I think her named is stephanie.
author: Arnold V.

description: Saturday night my fiancé and I decided to go to dinner at The Olive Garden. I had dined at this location several times throughout the years and never really had many complaints about my experiences. Well, Saturday night was different story. We were seated 15-20 minutes after arriving; which wasn't too bad but we seemed to be virtually invisible as we sat at our table waiting for service. A kind server; who wasn't our server was very polite in checking on us and was very surprised our server hadn't approached us even though 10 minutes had gone by. So he brought us a sample of their wine for that night as well as breadsticks. After 20 minutes and countless servers passing us by I waved down another server and explained our dilemma. This server was also surprised at how we had been ignored and offered to take our order. Upon taking our order he came back to our table and informed us who our server was and said that they had been really busy. There were many servers  several empty tables and it was 9:40pm. Honestly I'm inclined to believe the color of our skin had much to do with our invisibility that night. I told the server he could go ahead and cancel our orders because we would be taking our patronage elsewhere. He tried to convince us to stay, apologized on behalf of the staff and offered us a discount on our meals. But why would we choose to spend our money at a restaurant that doesn't want to serve us, that treats us as if we don't exist. No thanks I'll shop where my patronage is appreciated.
author: Maya W.

description:
I love how they have the Ziosk tablets now. My 4 year old actually entertained himself & sat throughout the entire meal. 

I love their marinara sauce. My absolute favorite!

Our server Jeremiah was excellent! Very patient, pleasant & attentive. If all servers were like Jeremiah, we'd be eating at Olive Garden on a regular basis 

Our only complaint is the food wasn't hot enough. We didn't bother sending it back because it was tolerable & we were very hungry
author: Food F.

description: Folks, it is the Olive Garden.  If you are expecting authentic Italian food, you will be REALLY let down.  I went in for lunch and ordered the unlimited soup, salad and bread sticks.  It was $11.00.  There are four choices for soup but I can't eat that much and I choose the creamy chicken soup.  It was ok, nothing special but tasty.  The salad was a huge bowl of house iceberg salad (but I like that) and four bread sticks that I could not finish either.  For the price point, it was filling and the food was hard to screw up.  The reason I give it a 5 star was my waitress Brenda, what a welcome relief from the usual snotty twerps in the food and beverage industry.  Brenda was polite, fast, friendly but not overly so, attentive and smiled.  This made my day as I played the little trivia game they have for you at the table, ate my soup and salad and was waited on by a nice person.  She even left the cheese grater at the table in case I wanted more.  Amazing folks but when did small things like this become such a surprise when going out to eat.  Sorry but can't talk to the rest of the menu... frankly if I want lasagna, I will go to North beach.
author: Rusty G.

description: Went in yesterday with a party of 9, the food was good, but stuffed mushrooms and chicken appetizer were only ok.  Miles our server was excellent! He was super nice and attentive!
author: Keriann D.

description: I won't go there again. Menu for lunch is very limited with no sandwiches or hamburger type food. I settled on calamari and it was unacceptable because the pieces were so small it was difficult to dunk in the cocktail sauce. And our waiter brought the food in disjoint deliveries. First one dish came to the table, then several minutes later another dish. It wasn't the waiters fault, just bad management at this unacceptable restaurant.
author: Dave B.

description: I've been coming here for lunch almost every weekend with my daughters.  Service was always good, but the amount of toppings the kitchen gave us for our pasta are getting less.  It used to be 3 meatballs for Cucina Mia, now it's only 2 meatballs.  So I changed to Crispy Chicken Frittata.  It used to be 5 big pieces, now it's still 5 pieces, but very tiny.  I'm thinking about not coming anymore.
author: Angela T.

description: I've been coming here for years and have finally had enough. This place has gone downhill!!! The food lacks so much flavor and isn't worth the price and the service is just as bad. The workers here make it so damn obvious that they hate their job like I'm not here to deal with your shitty attitude man I just want something decent to eat here. Pretty sad considering I actually enjoyed eating here before, but never again
author: Cee H.

description:
The last time I was here, I was in college. Yup it's been a long time!  We dropped in here for dinner.  Since it was around 5 PM, we got seated right away - no wait.  The restaurant is pretty clean.  Our server was Bond and he was very attentive.  The kitchen did make the mistake of forgetting to give DH his sausage with his pasta but they made up for that.  Love the salad and all you can eat breadsticks.  I do wish the salad had something other than iceberg lettuce!

I had the rosemary chicken with mashed potatoes.  It was really good. Elephant Bar, this is how you grill chicken.

Do not get ravioli for the kids meal.  It is very small.  The pasta and chicken fingers was huge.  They need to recalibrate the kids meal portions.
author: Wendy H.

description: I came here with some friends and Danya was our server. She is the epitome of what an all star server. Our drinks were always full, our starters came out promptly and entrees followed seamlessly. I throughly enjoyed my experience and look forward to my next visit AND will be sure to request Danya!
author: Scott T.

description: If you enjoy dry, over cooked spaghetti, this is your restaurant. I ordered it to go for my family's New Years party and was very disappointed. With a party of 10, it was the right size; however, the quality was so disappointing that no one really wanted it. Right when you take the aluminum foil off the top, you can see that there is hardly any marinara sauce. Maybe that was my fault for not checking as soon as I picked up the order. From now on, I will no longer trust restaurants and expect delicious food. I will always spend those few extra minutes and open every order in front of the waiter/waitress to confirm that quality of my order is perfect. Thank you Olive Garden for the great beinning of 2017.
author: Bermel L.

description: We went today for my daughter birthday dinner and the manager Carlton did a amazing job. He made sure it was a great birthday for her just wanna say thank you because he went above and beyond
author: Carla E.

description: Olive Garden is like this endless void of a family restaurant where old people and tired early 20 year olds congregate. There's decent pasta and prices, their breadsticks which everyone seems to ignore the oil on, and actually pretty good appetizers. I've been here a few times and it's great that there's a mall nearby. Which by the way, if they say the wait will take 40 minutes and give you the little notification disk, it will register as too far from the restaurant if you go too far into the mall. And it will beep, noticably and until you reenter the twenty step radius of Olive Garden. Enjoy.
author: Stephanie R.

description: The unlimited bread sticks, soup and salad is one of the best things Olive Garden offers. Their food used to be really amazing, but now it's just not the same so I try to be full by the time I get my main course. I'm not saying it's disgusting or anything, it's just not what it used to be or perhaps is the seasonal menu that wasn't too good. I went there last Thursday for a work dinner and ordered the Fettuccine Alfredo with chicken. It was good, just not the same creamy sauce that I remember and the chicken wasn't cooked enough. I was really pleased with the service though, our waiter was never rude and responded quickly to each one of our requests. I'll probably return and give it another go in a more casual setting sometime in the future.
author: Diana S.

description:
Wanting a relatively quick lunch due to an appointment so we chose this place as it's close by.  Since it was a weekday we hoped that there would not be a wait; there wasn't one.  Not sure why there were that many people at the front desk when it was not so busy.

The server was friendly and efficient.  So we've no complaints with our service.

Firstly we ordered drinks:  Cocktail and wine.  The cocktail hardly contained any amount of alcohol, but at least it was refreshing.  Wine was a pinot grigio which was ok.

As for appetizers, I'm not sure why they serve mussels that comes with alot of sauce but with no spoons nor any bowl for the shells.  Had to request these which was no problem, but they ought to be standard.  As for the mussels, well, many were closed.  And those that were opened were the smallest ever & also were overcooked so most were shriveled up.  

Mains were the pastas.  One included the mussels and prawns, the other was pesto with sautéed shrimp.  The former tasted well according to my dining partner.  Mine, however, was awfully bland.  And loaded with oil.  The shrimp were as tiny as bay shrimp.  Needless to say I could not finish my meal & just boxed it to take away.  I even ended up putting spoonsful of the marinara sauce from the mussels appetizer onto the pasta.  Anything for some flavor!

Could not believe the tiramisu was a tiny piece for the price ($8+).  Strangely they serve Irish coffee but with the whiskey on the side.  Never experienced this until now.

All in all, it's a place that's good for a quick meal (if you are there at non-peak times).  Truly I would not waste time and money to wait and wait to dine here; one is better off going to an authentic Italian restaurant instead.  Also I feel that their prices are quite high for the non-stellar food they offer.  They need to improve on this if they insist on charging these sorts of prices for a chain even.  It's so meh that it makes Red Lobster seem like gourmet fare.  The minestrone soup was even tastier than my main dish.  Even the lovely Italian decorated plates and platters have been replaced by boring, generic white wares; the latter remind me of institutional food.
author: Luisa T.

description:
A few weeks ago I visited the Olive Garden located at 3251 20th Ave Space 187, In San Francisco. 

The restaurant was very busy, but the condition of your restrooms was unacceptable. 

Before I had a chance to mention anything to her, my daughter complained that the women's restrooms were dirty. She said the floors were wet and sticky, and two of the four stalls were unusable due to fluids and toilet paper on the seats. There also happened to be 4 other ladies in line. There wasn't any paper towels as well. Another customer mentioned that she told an employee about the bathroom and the employee said "ok" in a rude tone.

Two employees walked out of the occupied stalls and quickly washed their hands and got out. Instead of apologizing and assuring us that someone would be cleaning the bathrooms soon, they both avoided eye contact. 

My daughter and I both complained to the manager, who claimed his name was Luis. 

I understand that on busy nights, your staff is busy multi tasking, but you need to make sure someone checks the bathroom on busy days at least once an hour. I hope that this does not happen frequently at this location.
author: David T.

description: I had not tried this restaurant in an extremely  long time.  I was there recently and very disappointed.  I have rarely given a restaurant one star.  But, the reason  mainly is because the restaurant smelled awful.  I should have left the minute I walked in due to that smell, but I was very hungry, I do like Italian and did not want to go to the food court.  The smell to me was like rancid cheese and it was wafting throughout the restaurant.  I have not smelled anything quite like it.  I figured it would go away eventually which was true so I stuck it out.  The waitress was nice.  That is about it.  I could not eat the breadsticks as they were very oily.  I had the shrimp scampi which was not bad, but pretty  mediocre.  The problem I had with the food was how I felt afterwards.  I had to take a pepto bismal that evening.  That usually does not happen and I love spicy food.  This was not spicy.  So, I have to conclude that the food was just not that good.  I will never go there again.
author: Susan E.

description:
I can't believe i waited 40+ minutes to get a table. Of course it was a friday on the day i went. By the time i went to my table, everything cool down since it was 1 hour before closing time. Friendly service and service itself was alright because of the business. 

I got the chicken scampi pasta. Its not bad. Had a lot of cream in this kind of pasta. There was a lot of noodle and decent among of chicken pieces and vegetable.

Overall, didnt enjoy the waiting but had a decent dinner at this place
author: Julie N.

description: Our party of six came around 9 Friday night. There was a short wait. We ordered drinks, appetizers and everything was fine until the main course came. For every plate we ordered, there was something missing or different. As for my order, herb grilled salmon topped with garlic herb butter with parmesan garlic broccoli, all I got is plain fried salmon that was dry and steamed overcooked brocolli, totally not like the one pictured in their menu. I was in disbelief so I prompted to call the waiter. He took back the plate to the kitchen and came back with it and said kitchen run out of the garlic herb butter so they will replace it with a different order. I reordered shrimp scampi, it came with 6 regular size shrimp, a few chopped asparagus and lots of noodles and it was bland! What a dissappointment! If they cannot deliver the order right, for whatever reason, they should not be serving it. Likewise, they should not be accepting anymore customers. We come to eat here once in a while but after what we had here, we are never coming back. The food deserved no stars but gave 2 because of the nice waiter who is only delivering the food so I don't blame him.
author: Marlen B.

description: Very good  ,Aníbal was very nice and patient, Good service' Good food, good atmosphere, We are coming back again,
author: Sam C.

description: Great food and service BUT I hate having to use the techno pay system. Our server agreed with me but he said he had to use it. If they didn't force tech on us I would give them 5 stars. I deal with tech all day and I don't like having to deal with it when I'm eating out. GET RID OF IT.
author: Gary C.

description:
I haven't been to the Olive Garden in maybe 10 years but it's a pretty popular date spot.  My girlfriend and I joked about checking it out for a while, and since we had a long work day ahead, we decided to give ourselves a break and check it out.

The thing that stood out to me immediately was the price of the food here.  I was in sticker shock at some of the entrees!  Luckily there was a $25 special for two entrees with either an appetizer or dessert.  I ended up selecting the fettuccine Alfredo and my girlfriend got the ravioli, and we shared the mussels appetizer.  She originally wanted the eggplant Parmesan but they were somehow OUT!  This is unacceptable, especially for an Olive Garden, and I could have easily gone back there and made it myself.  Other than that, the food was mostly so-so, but I did really enjoy the pasta fagioli and the cream soup, as well as the breadsticks.  My Alfredo was a little bland and the portion size was very small.

I was surprised by how heavy the meal was and I was totally stuffed afterward.  Service was friendly though I thought the table coordinator was a little obnoxious for talking so loudly as she constantly relayed open table information to the reception area from the dining room.  Olive Garden is really overrated and overpriced (would would have paid about double without the deal), and I'd probably be fine not going back again.

Food: 6/10

Service: 7/10

Price: $$

Atmosphere: 7/10
author: Joe M.

description: Not sure why their rating is so bad:/. I dig Olive Garden. Their soup & salad is bomb. I come here prolly 2-3 times a month. I've always got really good waiters, super friendly & informative!! Portions are huge (in my opinion)
author: Natasha P.

description: This is the fourth strike for this establishment. Today was the last straw first thing in the pager system is broken. It took them about 20 minutes to realize they could not get the system backup then they started to write out names like the old days before pager technology. By this time the lobby was cluttered and over capacitated and created a fire hazard where people could not enter or leave. The young girl took down my name it's very simple Paul and I gave them my last initial C. While waiting in the lobby there were two pregnant women and two senior citizen with no place to sit. I asked the bald headed manager if you could get a seat for the older gentleman. He looked at me and turned the other way and walked off. I found a seat for the older gentleman as well as asked younger people sitting down to make space for the pregnant women. At this time we are all packed in there like herds of animals and surely enough there was a confrontation between a group of customers for the first available seat in the bar. Of course the bald headed manager was nowhere to be found but the other manger was doing his best. The front desk began to call my name but they could not pronounce it correctly Paul was pronounced Paw Ki for table of 3. I went up to the counter and said I am Paul C we have a table for three we were not given a pager and it was written down. He shows me on screen and says are you sure this is you I said yes it must be us I'm pretty sure my name is spelled correctly but the last name and initial is incorrect I told her it's Paul last name initial C like cat. There was major confusion between the employees if they had the right person to sit down. After five minutes of scratching their head they gave us a seat. Once we were seated our waitress came and took our orders for drinks and appetizers. We asked for soup but when the soup was brought to our table there was only broth and the bowl was only filled up one third of the way. She said they're out of soup and they're making more. The appetizers then came out but the meatball pizza appetizers we're cold and disgusting. The food finally came out which was not the same as I had ordered before in the past. They have a problem with changing the recipe and maintaining consistency. Also there was no Parmesan cheese offered. Our waitress finally came back and left us with bread sticks halfway through our meal and tried to give us parmesan cheese but the grinder was broken she said she would be back and never returned. A relief waiter presented himself and said your waitresses is on break. Ask them if you can get us two to go boxes and the bill. He came back with the bill and boxes but never return to collect the tab. I had to use the table automated device to page our waiter. Once he came back he asked if I would like change, yes I would like change I told him. 15 minutes later he comes back and tell's me that I cannot ring up the bill because your waitresses is on break and my manager is taking care of it now. Once the manager came back and gave us our change he quickly tried to walk away. I called him back to our table and said I would like to give you some feedback. I explain basically what I did to you above he tried to offer me a gift certificate. This was offered three times in the past. This time I didn't want nothing from them but for them to hear my feedback and maybe do something about it next time in the future. Of course this manager was the one that was bald headed one who ignored me before which I blatantly pointed out to him when I asked him if he could provide a seat for the senior citizen who could barely stand. Also one thing that has disappointed my family for the past two years is that this place is called the Olive Garden but most of the time they don't have any olives not even to give you on your salad. If you are lucky you will find one to two olives in your salad which feeds 3 people.
author: yelp m.

description:
Today was the first time I went to olive garden with my boyfriend, and it was over my expectation. Breaksticks, salad, and the chicken Alfredo and Lasagna fritta are amazing. We ordered to dishes, but it's too much for us. And because we were so full, we couldn't finish the breakstick, which kinda upset me. I really like the breakstick!!!!! 

Good place, good service, and food, definitely will go back next time. Worth 5 stars!!!
author: Carmen L.

description:
We came for a quick lunch. Parking was easy,and we didn't have to wait.The staff wasn't the best but was okay for a chain restaurant. We were served quickly. The salads were good but not the pasta. The  shrimp scampi had a strong taste, I could not eat it. ( $20 with a salad). A simple Fettucine Alfredo with a salad is $16.
I will not go back.
author: Martine P.

description: Good service but the food lacked something....flavor.  Shouldn't all Olive Garden's taste the same? Ordered their braised beef & tortelloni and the waitress stated that they were out of it. Really? It's out of season? So I ordered the shrimp scampi and was disapointed that it lacked....flavour. It tasted like a frozen tv dinner. will try a different Olive Garden not this one.
author: Roland F.

description:
This petite Canadienne has been trying to eat at an Olive Garden for almost two years. Most Americans aren't willing to go, particularly the one I spend most of my time with, and it's proven to be quite maddening... until last night. 

Last night a very fun colleague agreed to take me on a lady date to the only Olive Garden in sunny San Francisco. Hooray! 

The OG is larger than expected, and the servers are really friendly. I had the fettucini alfredo with their salad and bread sticks and a bottle of chianti. The saltiness was delicious. Really, really delicious. 

I know it's not even a little bit close to authentic Italian food. I know that it's bad for you. I know that it brings me joy.
author: Evelyn A.

description: Decent service, over priced frozen pasta that gets microwaved or whatever. $20 for lasagna? Eh.
author: Kalei M.

description:
I'm not ashamed to admit that I love the food from this chain.

One of the more expensive chain restaurants.

It is pricey for what it is (nothing is made from scratch) but if you happen to catch their promotions it brings their prices down to what it should be . Like the 2 for $25 (app/dessert and entree for two), you can't beat that. They have a way to keep me coming back. 

Service most of the time is good.

Love this location. Free parking. But I don't love the wait. I wish they take reservations.
author: Andy W.

description:
I just love their desserts. Their appetizers and main dishes could use some work.

This is the usual spot for me and the bf whenever we're celebrating a special occasion. The ambiance of the place is quite nice for moments with just us two :).

Their main dishes can get a bit overpowering, especially with the cheese. For the most recent visit, my bf and i ordered the sampler platter with mozzerella triangles and stuffed mushrooms. What came to us was very disappointing. The stuffed mushrooms only came in 6, and were pretty small. And only 3, yes, i said 3 MOZZERELLA TRIANGLES. I'm paying $10 bucks for just 3 triangles? and they weren't even that big. But our server was so nice, so i didn't mind it at all.

Their salad however, is pretty good. And it love their chicken and gnocchi soup. It's yummy! I ABSOLUTELY LOVE THE ZEPPOLI  DESSERT! So yummy dipped in chocolate.

Service is very nice here. They always have some sort of deal too, so go check it out if you're desperado for some Italian food.
author: Jerianne G.

description: I wasn't disappointed with their foods but the services they have had. It took a long time to get the attention of the people working in this restaurant.Jeez!I think they need more people for the restaurant or idk...
author: Bella A.

description:
My husband and I came here on a weekday afternoon for a late lunch prior to going to the beach.  We were pleasantly surprised that there was no wait to be seated.  
I ordered the zuppa Toscani and salad, my husband wanted to order the tilapia but was told that they were out.  Instead he ordered a combination appetizer which included muscles stuffed mushrooms and calimeri. 
My soup was good but the salad was very ordinary, romaine and iceberg lettuce with a few olives and tomatoes. All three items on my husbands appetizer combo were too oily 
The waitress was nice, however the food does not merit return
author: Sheila F.

description:
I came in at 5:30 and there were tons of empty tables that I saw, but I had to wait for about 30 min for a table. The food was not very good. The Alfredo was really buttery and cheesy. It tasted like I was eating just plain butter and cheese. Bleh! I felt like I gained 10 pounds! Waste of my money!

Food: Greasy

Service: Bad

Tables: Too short and uncomfortable

Price: Too expensive; over price

Will I ever come back? NEVER
author: Yelper G.

description:
Food: 
I ordered the unlimited chicken gnocchi soup and bread sticks on the side. My water came in pretty fast before my soups. To be honest, they never give you enough gnocchi or chicken. My first bowl literally had 3 gnocchi and 1 piece of chicken. The second bowl had 2 gnocchi and 3 chicken pieces. Not to mention the chicken looks a little pink so I guess it was not thoroughly cooked. I love gnocchi, but this is so disappointing to its name. The total cost was ~$7. Minus 4 stars for amount of gnocchi&chicken, uncooked chicken, sad tabling, and unworthy price. 

Service:
I wasn't greeted at the door. About 4-5 employees just stared at me until I ask for a table so that made me felt unwelcomed. I was placed at the back of the restaraunt by myself when there were empty seats by the window. The lady didn't seem to like her job, but my server was helpful with my orders. The server deserves a star for being patient with me without getting irritated. 

Will I be coming back? 
Not anymore. I want my gnocchi, my chicken cooked, and my window seat when it's available.
author: Jackie T.

description:
Pretty good. The servers were mean. I prefer this place. They have good mints. I have nothing else to say. 

Literally my life changed there. The menus were good and organized. You should order lasagnes.
author: Joanne J.

description: What the hell has happened to this place over the years? It used to be one of my family's favorite Italian restaurants. I hadn't visited in a couple of years, as was sad to find out that everything had worsened. The food was yucky and cold... the waiter didn't even give me another knife after asking for one three times... we wanted to order other drinks and the waiter was nowhere to be seen. This is really disappointing because I have many great childhood memories at OG, but won't be creating new ones. We definitely won't be returning!
author: Janette S.

description: The was a horrible experience. We went to this Olive Garden tonight and the food came out semi-warm, the bread was terrible, and when I got home I projectile vomited. It honestly needs to be shut down.
author: Lalaland651 ..

description: I came to Olive Garden on a Thursday night. Pretty empty and got seated right away. At first the waitress was very nice and greeted us and took our order. I ordered a salmon which came with unlimited salad and breadsticks. I also ordered another house salad for the rest of my family. When the house salad came we all started eating it, but then a waitress, who was not the one who took our order, said that she would have to charge us because we were eating it. I explained to her that we had ordered a separate house salad, but she merely ignored me and said "ya i know, I will charge for that." She walked away and I was extremely mad, but let it go. I was just disappointed that she was talking to me and not the waitress that took my actual order. The service here and communication amongst employees and customers is subpar. Instead of enjoying a night with my family, everyone was in a bad mood. Thanks Olive Garden! But with all seriousness, I strongly don't recommend coming here if you value customer service and food quality.
author: Katrina W.

description:
The last time i went to Olive Garden was about 5 years ago and it was a good experience. I came here for dinner last night and it was horrible.

I ordered the fish and shrimp combo and it was nothing like the picture they showed. 2 pieces of sad looking tasteless tilapias with frozen shrimp on top and a side of broccoli. My BF ordered the fettuccine/lasagna/chicken parmesan combo and it was not satisfying. The soup and bread sticks were overly salty. 

I dont think i'll be returning for maybe another 5 years.
author: M W.

description:
(First off our waitress  Alexis was awesome. 5 stars!)

Well... here's my tale.... Two bowls of soup and we're ready for our spicy chicken sandwich with fries.  Well the sandwich arrived, but the fries were absent.  Ran out of fries... at 1:30pm? Wow. If this was the first time our meal went wrong I wouldn't be writing.  However, this is the third time in a row something went wrong with our lunch. 1st time, risotto bites and stuffed mushrooms were still frozen in the middle. 2nd time my soup (that we were told was taking a bit long because a fresh batch was being made) arrived in a super hot bowl, but the soup was cold. 

Three times in a row.... I love olive garden,  but I'm not sure if we'll be coming back to this one.
author: Saki N.

description:
I have been coming here for at least 15 years
The quality of service is always great
Endless breadsticks
Huge salad portions
Great cocktails too 
This last time I ordered a margarita and they brought some amaretto drink in a shot size glass. 
I definitely will return
author: Jennifer G.

description: Jiovanna was an absolutely phenomenal server! Got our food out really fast! Made sure we were well take. Care of! Come to find out it's her 4th week as a server! If you come here ask for her!
author: Laila A.

description: Came here for a lunch with my family. A Friday afternoon was expecting a little wait because of day of the week and time. We came here hostess told us the wait would take 10-15 mins. Her tone and attitude was not the happiest camper. Her coworker did try and cover up for her saying that they were working since 8 o'clock and they were tired. Eh I guess me going to 2 schools working 2 jobs is nothing compared to that but idk her life. Ppl that gets hired there should have a better attitude yes it's not a career but it pays so be thankful. Well gf and baby got the calamari and five cheese ziti with the breadstick and salad that was excellent as usual. Me, I'm the type of guy that always want to try something else on the menu so I ordered the chicken and shrimp carbonara with the chicken and gnocch soup. Pasta was lacking flavor needed garlic salt or powder and some more sauce. My soup came after the salad and breadstick and right before my pasta dish because the waiter forgot my order and which soup it was. sigh.... this place went from good service to somewhat affordable food to young kids that don't want to work there with mediocre tasting food. The chocolate mints are still on point though! :)
author: Jordan S.

description: What started to be a bad dinner turned out good thanks to Grant.  The place is empty, the hostess tells us 15 minutes for a booth, why? the place is empty...lol...after two minutes exactly we get seated.  Now why aggrivate me by saying its 15 when you have empty tables and it took 2 minutes?  Dumb door girl imo.  Our waiter had great vip skills, Grant, he was attentive, informative and generally pleasant. They messed up our order and Grant was very apologetic, be sure to ask for him, we will, hes probably their best.
author: Cooper C.

description:
The only reason I'm being generous enough to even give one star is because of the service and the great soup. 

I ordered two tour of Italy for my girlfriend and I. Unfortunately on my plate my chicken was not cooking so I returned it a got a new plate. Surprisingly, the chicken on my girlfriend's plate was uncooked. Then when we returned that plate and got a new plate the chicken was once again uncooked. 

It's hard to believe that the people in the kitchen can't even cook chicken right. I don't think I will be coming back anytime soon. A restaurant that can't cook chicken can't serve right food in my opinion. 

The server was really nice to us. So shout out to him.
author: Sai B.

description:
You have to rate it for what it is, a chain Italian restaurant. In that regard, I like coming to this location because of it's consistency. I like going to a place and knowing what to expect. The portions are really huge here. My favorite things are the the Zuppa Toscana soup and the Chicken Marsala. I also got the fried risotto balls which were really cheesy, crispy, and yummy. My girlfriend got the lobster ravioli which were nice and al dente with a lot of lobster flavor.

For $20 a person, soup, salad, breadsticks, and enough food for dinner and lunch the next day, it's a steal. The service here is a little lacking because of the server to table ratio but their use of these iPad style kiosks help mitigate some of that because you're able to call your server with a press of a button. They should wipe down those kiosk a bit more because it was greasy when I used it. My only gripe is that I was charged $2 for acidentally hitting a button on the iPad that was to play Candy Crush.  No thanks, thats a mistake. I could see how it's a plus for families with kids though. But only 1 kid; more than 1 kid and they would be fighting for the iPad kiosk.
author: James K.

description:
You just can't go wrong with Olive Garden. 

The service is always really friendly. I often go alone and sit at the bar, have a class of wine and endless salad and breadsticks. I'll sometimes write or quietly read a good book. 

It can be a little expensive for dinner, and is by no means True Italian Food, but the quality of their dishes be is Seafood, Pasta or Chicken is always solid. 

When I need a mellow meal with girlfriends, but don't feel like searching for parking, or am craving quiet time and crazy good salad Olive Garden will always be my Go-To spot.
author: Meghan L.

description:
What can I say? When you're here, you are truly family. The salad was superb, and my garlic lemon chicken was heavenly. Don't be shy to stock up on the breadsticks, how can you resist. 

10/10 would recommend 


Secrest out.
author: Nat T.

description: I love their food here but for some reason every time I eat something with chicken, I always end up getting sick. My friend and her daughter and I went to this restaurant a couple weeks ago and I ordered the endless soup and salad and she ordered something with lasagna pasta and chicken and she told me to try her food so I took a few bites of her chicken and about 30 minutes after we headed into the mall, I had to immediately rush to the bathroom. I couldn't focus on my shopping because I felt sick, dizzy, sweaty, and hot. My friend noticed I was turning pale and her and her 2 year old daughter also felt sick while we were shopping and once we got home. The chicken may have been undercooked but that was one of the worse experience I've had with food from Olive Garden.
author: Danielle L.

description:
You know how people always rave about Olive Garden breadsticks? Yeah they're delicious.

This is a restaurant for a restaurant's sake with aesthetically pleasing decor that isn't too overboard. There is no dress code and is enough booth space for a family of 4 and some bags, if you're coming from the mall next door. I waited 15 minutes for a table around 630, and the place was filling up quick by the time I left at 745.

They have a good variety of light to heavy Italian meals on the menu, ranging from light 200-400 calorie appetizers to 1200-1800 calorie items that you wouldn't really believe it by looking at them. Portions are generous for their entrées and each comes with a soup or salad (only if you ask for it, apparently). Appetizers tend to be light, and there's a nice "sampler italiano" if you don't want to commit or want to split a couple choices. 

We paid $50 for a dinner for two including appetizers and a dessert. A bit pricey, but if you're looking for something cheap you could probably get away with $20-30 for two people. 

I've ordered takeout online previously, and everything was nicely assembled at pickup and I had no negative comments on the quality of service or the food. 

All in all, a nice place for an early evening dinner when you don't feel like making "going out for Italian" a formal venture.
author: Brian M.

description:
We went here for lunch. The wait was only 15 mins which wasn't long. We got seated order the tour of Italy, appetizers ( calamari, mozzarella sticks, and stuffed mushrooms.) Also the salad. 

   The calamari was really crispy ( broken pieces not even whole calamri pieces.) The mozzarella sticks and stuffed mushrooms were just okie, nothing to really want to go back and rave about. The tour of Italy was awful no taste like their rushed it ( we asked for chicken in the Alfredo.) They forgot! 

    Lucky our waiter was nice but I felt they really need to train the waiter what happen to do you want parmesan our granted cheese with your salad or your pasta. This use to be my favorite place to get my Italian food, disappointed seems like this franchise went downhill.
author: Hoa T.

description:
solid dining experience.

I love the endless salad bar. however, if you come evenings or weekends, be prepared to wait a long time in a crowded waiting area.
author: Zachary M.

description: Bad Service!!!! Sat at the Bar waiter said some will come to clean the table 10 minutes went by (I can see the waiter doing nothing but watching) finally after 10 minutes he picked up some dishes and then another 5 minutes before he came back, we finally decided to leave because all the servers are standing around! Not a way to run a business-Management where are you guys?
author: Erwin O.

description: Decided to try the restaurant for lunch with my family today. I was extremely disappointed.  The waitress wasn't very hospitable and it took forever for our lunch. Our soup was very late and was served with our main dish. The soup was terrible. It had a taste of cleanser.  The salad had bad pieces of lettuce.  This would not be my choice again for any meal. Go into the mall, you will find better choices.
author: Miracle B.

description:
I am updating my review for one reason only: Cameron.

I've been going to this Olive Garden for many years and the service is usually pretty good, but the last time before we went this past week, it was terrible. We went in August for my niece's birthday because she loves it there and likes the parmesan cheese. I don't know what it is about this little 4 year old and her cheese, but she always wants it on a plate to eat separately from bread and pasta. The server that time was really bad. She never checked on us and was too focused on one table in our area. It was such a bad experience.

Fast forward to this past week when I get a text from my bro-in-law asking if I wanted to go grab dinner with our family at Olive Garden. We got there and had to wait about 10-15 minutes since we had a group of 7. Cameron was our server and he was excellent, deserving of 5 stars. He was patient with our family which included a couple a kids and my older parents. He was very attentive and added personality to the service. I enjoyed that he joked with all of us and with the never ending pasta bowl in season, he was on top of our orders including refilling our soup. I think I'm addicted to the zuppa toscana.

When you go to Olive Garden, you know what to expect when it comes to the food. We are talking breadsticks, salad, soup and pasta afterall. BUT what will make the difference is the service and next time my family comes here, we'll probably ask to be seated in Cameron's section again.
author: Ruben P.

description: Hahaha what am I supposed to say about Olive Garden you come here already knowing what to expect. Let me just say that their breadsticks and water and salad better keep coming , because that's what keeps me coming. The only thing that I can think of was that they might need to improve on their parmesan cheese grating skills since there was more of it on the table then in the plate. Hey, but it's Olive Garden I kind of already expected that
author: Abraham A.

description: Terrible food!!! We normally order the Alfredo pasta and Gorgonzola Alfredo except that it was swimming in grease/ oil so we didn't even eat half of it because it was too oily to eat.   the server was fine not his fault he is not the chef but this chef sucks!!! Sloppy cooking!  Trust me we've been to other olive gardens and had never had these dishes swimming in oil!!
author: MIRNA A.

description: My first server Kevin was awesome and very caring. He made the night so good and kept asking if everyone was good. Also asking if we want any cheese added to our soups salad he did the works. Got my soups and friend drinks refill in a good matter. The person that replace him was just there to be there. This server took his time after take another person shift which I find it to be funny cause we was just finishing our dinner and he took care of the customers after up cause it was a couple. Instead of taking care of my wife and our friends we asked for the check and waiting a long time. Had to get another server to get my server to get my check. This black gentlemen made it a black experience near the end. This only reason this is getting a 4 star instead of 3 or 5 is because of your server Kevin. I did food service and never before had service that bad at the end. Please get rid of that employee. If given a task that was supposed to be fast it was longer then it was supposed to be.
author: Douglas L.

description: What happened to this restaurant. There today and food was terrible, service bad and the place was dirty. Will not go back again.
author: Kathleen S.

description:
I don't come here very often but when I do, I remember why it takes me a long time to revisit. Here's just a few reasons why:

1. I sat at table for 10 minutes before someone came by.
2. Had to ask to have the table cleaned.
3. A few.more moments before it actually happened.
4. Sat for another 5 minutes before someone came to take my order.
5. Had to ask for utensils 
6. The server not assigned to my table made me feel like I was inconviencing him.
7. My server disappeared with my card for a really long time.


On the upside
1. Hostesses are always nice
2. Servers are friendly 
3. Salad and breads ticks arrived in less than one minute.
4. The food was good when it finally arrived.
5. They gave me lots of mints.

I know. I sound petty and critical. But in today's business it's all about customer satisfaction. They fell short. Should have gone to Sizzler.
author: Cristina V.

description:
Deliziosa! I love coming here! :D

Bread is addictive & hot/warm/yum.
Salad is great as well.

I always get the Tour of Italy. Always MmMmmmM :D

The Triple Chocolate Strata is rich & chocolatey! Soooooo fantastico! :D

Service is almost always superb & the decor is pretty lovely.
author: Amy C.

description: The prices keep on going higher and higher. The food is mediocre. The only positive side is unlimited soup and salad. Not a fan on paying the extra fee for being in SF so forced to pay the SF healthy.
author: Tasha L.

description:
I haven't eaten at this place in a long time, and while my friend and I were shopping at Stonestown, we got hungry. We decided to eat at Olive Garden because it's one of the few sit-down restaurants at this mall. I ordered the Parmesan crusted tilapia, and my fish was cooked perfectly! I got the zuppa Toscana with my entree, and that was delicious as well. The breadsticks were really really salty, though. And the service was awkward.

I also recently ordered food to-go, and after getting to the restaurant 30 minutes after placing my order, I still had to wait 20 minutes just to get my food. It was ridiculous.
author: Rachel H.

description:
Online ordering to go meals makes no difference if eating in. 
Both are slow. Kitchen management needs improvement.
author: Ulysses B.

description:
Superb service. Waited approx. 10-15 min, got seated and was welcomed by James. He was such a fantastic waiter! I came here for a friends birthday and wow were we impressed. I been here multiple times and this time had to be the best experience. 

First thing is we were told wait time was 30 minutes but that was a given. since it was dinner time. We got seated half the time so that was nice.

Second, We were greeted by our server James. He gave us the specials and since it was a birthday, he recommended wine and gave birthday boy a glass on the house. Although we ended up purchasing the bottle anyway, it was a very nice gesture.

Third, our order was taken right when the last person put their menu down. It was as if he was watching us but obviously it was just perfect timing. But I'd like to think he was on top of his game. After he took our orders, he brought bread and was constantly on top of serving us. Filling our glass with either wine or water. 

Birthday boy dinner came out last and it wasn't that great so James took it back and got another similar dinner that was recommended by the chief. Food came out hot and James actually came out with the chief. We were so surprised that she made sure the birthday boy liked his food.

So by this time, obviously we ate and got merry. the check came out and we noticed birthday boy meal wasn't even included so we asked if it was correct. They gave him the meal on the house. Say Whaaaaaat?!?! OK, now that is what I call superb service right there.

We obviously gave James a big tip which included the cost of birthday boys meal only because we know how difficult it can be to make a dime now a days. 

Thank you Olive Garden staff for the great experience.
author: Julie B C.

description:
If you're expecting fine dining and fresh Italian cuisine, Olive Garden is not the place to go. Yes it's a chain and some of the dishes here are pretty decent but the overall experience at Olive Garden is nothing to celebrate.

If it wasn't for the unlimited breadsticks (which I personally love and can never eat enough of), and the unlimited soup, which you have three choices of. There's really no reason to rejoice. Olive Garden has a pretty solid menu when it comes to options for Italian cuisine. They recently have changed their menu to showcase some of the newer flavors and taste to the consumers but overall most of the dishes are lackluster and nothing too special. Yes it's a chain restaurants so most people ask what what do you expect? But I've been to a few chain restaurants were at least they had a few dishes that stood out from the rest.

However the seafood Alfredo, in my opinion is pretty tasty. The scallops and shrimp are sweet and savory and it's close to Freshness you can get at this Resturant.  Unfortunately especially at this location the waiting time between courses is generally 20 to 30 minutes, and in my opinion unacceptable. The Decor is worn out and outdated and can definitely be touched up for a more classier modern look. The utensils even have a beat up worn out look and feel to them and I have found them to be dirty 80% of the time that I've been here.

Ultimately it comes down to the customers choice whether or not to continue to come here. Yes it could definitely be a hit or miss but if you want a Italian food without paying high Italian prices. That's especially at restaurants in or around the North Beach area or even downtown San Francisco, then why not stop at the Olive Garden. Just don't get your hopes up too high and expect to be blown away by anything and that's including the service.
author: Donald W.

description:
I had not been to an Olive garden in many MANY years and last night reminded me why!! We walked in about 5:30 is last night on Sun...We were told it was about 20-25 m in wait and we wandered in the bar area?? Opps I should have said "other dining room".. There were 4 stand up bar tables, three other tables and about 6 places at the bar on stools..... There was NO place to sit an enjoy a before dinner beverage as EVERY SEAT was taken by people eating!!! What happened to a nice area to enjoy an adult beverage or what ever before dinner...??? we were called to our table by one of the lighted vibrating thingies...we were given menus and asked if we wanted a mother drink or some other kind of beverage. My partner ordered a drink and I had my seltzer water. We were brought our salad and bread sticks, They were the best of the whole dinner, Salad was nice and flavorful. Dinner came and bit disappointed. My partner had the eggplant parmigian  with a side of spaghetti with a runny plain tomato sauce... Chef Boardi would have been better... I had the stuffed shells and they were almost decent.. By the time I had way through they was cold...
Our salad plates and the salad bowl and plates that was pushed out of the way sat on the table for the entire meal... and we had to ask for it to be taken away. My partner had asked for water and the waiter brought one only and never asked if I wanted some too??We ordered dessert, with the other plates and everything still sitting on the table...We were never asked if we wanted coffee or anything else for that matter.. At one point I had to go the the mens room... What a mess.  towels all over the floor and we will NOT discuss what else was not the floor...I had to have a word with the manager... We had a gift card and and the bill was still above $50. above the $25. gift card... We were sorely disappointed in the service and the food at best was really no even marginal.... We made our last trip to this establishment. It was very expensive for the lack of good service and frankly, lousy food.. Clean up your act people!!
Stefn W
author: Stephen W.

description: My sisters and I enjoy going to the Olive Garden as you can simply get full from the breadsticks and salad alone. Great ambiance, speedy service, and nice wine selection is a plus!
author: Tammia H.

description:
Now that the Olive Garden franchise discontinued the Chicken Gnocchi Veronese, this place is a hit or miss.

Our past love affair with the Chicken Gnocchi Veronese has left us hoping that the franchise will come up with something else that might just be on par. Unfortunately, each time we go back we grow further and further disappointed. The long wait times for a table don't help, either.

Our last trip to Olive Garden nearly a year ago will probably be our last for a long time.

Our Chicken & Gnocchi soup(s) had a combined total of 1 piece of gnocchi across two bowls. Really, it was just chicken soup. And they weren't even generous with the chicken. The salad was mostly iceberg.. disappointing, though understandably a decision that the powers that be probably thought smart budget-wise. At least before more of the American public decided to educate themselves about healthier eating habits. We've tried a number of entrees, most of which were just OK. 

The garlic bread is still delicious, of course... but can you really justify going to a restaurant just for the garlic bread?

I'll probably be back again at some point over the next two years, if only because it's often one of the most convenient and reliable options when you're in suburbia.
author: Asha S.

description: I called to inquire how long the wait may be for a party of 11 on Wednesday night. The first gal I talked too was rude, abrupt, and said, "I don't know".  I asked if she could give me a estimate........since she works there!  Is it 20 minutes or 1 hour at 530pm.  She again said "I told you I dunno".  I asked her, "Who there does", and she said "nobody".  I asked her if can ask someone else and she said, "wait", put me on hold, and I waited, waited, waited, waited.........and 4 minutes later concluded she did not come back on purpose, no surprise as she was so rude.  I called back and spoke to very nice young gal in take out who said it can be between 15 to 45 minutes.  An honest answer and more importantly she was sweet and friendly, which makes me want to eat at this restaurant.   If management cares, get rid of the other gal on shift at 815pm tonight, because she is costing you money, not making you money like the gal in take out working same time.
author: Kevin B.

description:
We went in on Friday 3-6-15 our party was 12. We waited 2 hours (expected) when we went to check on our table we were told possibly another 1 1/2 hour wait. I said that was not acceptable as we were quoted 1hour to an hour and 45 it had already been 2. We were seated about 10 mins later.

We sat at our table for 20 mins or more till I finally went to the hostess area and asked if we were going to have a server. We had 4 servers and none of them knew what the hell was going on. Needles to say it was a mess. We rarely got refills, for a party of 12 we got 1 salad. Only 3 of us ordered soup. Never got refills. 

When we were done I went in search of a manager, he was apologetic but that was it. Our bill before the tip was a few dollars under $200, money NOT spent well and our family did not enjoys time out. And that is sad as we were celebrating my Nieces 11th bday.

We come to this Olive Garden about once a month as it is the closet one to us. However we have decided it will be our last time for a long time.

Needless to say we are very unhappy customers.
author: Cristina B.

description: Food was very good. Dejah the waitress was very good. The Giant stuffed rigatoni with sausage wAs awesome. The bar waitress Angela was very rude when a member of my party asked her a question otherwise it's a 5.
author: Ross P.

description:
A five star review has long been due since my friends and I have been here several times indulging in the most flavorful and tasty food. 


Anyway, before making a judgement of the Olive Garden I must keep in mind that the cost of the food here is about half of what I pay at other chain restaurants such as Il Fornaio or the Cheesecake Factory. In my opinion at the OG the pasta is great, the salad is freshly drenched with light dressing and the bread sticks rule. No doubts. 


Sometimes, this restaurant even has a 3 meal course for 10 bucks! I wonder how better this can get. The Olive Garden has been among my favorite restaurants for more than ten years and I do not expect this to change unless something goes wrong but I do not see that happening any time soon.
author: Pepi R.

description: While visiting SF we stopped here for a bite to eat. Our server Moustafa was EXCELLENT! He was friendly & efficient, checked on us and made sure we were happy. I would definitely recommend this location for lunch or dinner if you're in the area! Food was delicious! No complaints at all. From beginning to end- dining here was a pleasure :)
author: Carrina J.

description:
Gourmet meal this is not. But I don't really mind this chain Olive Garden.

My friends that have been staying with me (went home today sadly) wanted to come here for their last meal in SF.

My biggest gripe is this place doesn't take reservations. Our server had told us they DO take reservations Mon-Thur just not on Fri-Sat-Sun.

We all had salad to start. They do kinda rush you because 2 min later our mains were served. I had the Pasta Pomadoro and my friends ordered the Shrimp Scampi and Chicken Marsala. I liked mine. I really did. And my friends enjoyed their meal as well. I mean it wasnt the Wow Factor...but definitely not bad.  For dessert we had Tiramisu. My friends had an after dinner drink. I had coffee (DD, and that's getting old...lol).  Our server was chatty but kept things rolling. 

Not a bad dinner. There was a crowd waiting when we exited.

Parking was crowded but tis the holidays!
author: Janet T.

description:
Four of us went to Olive on Saturday evening for dinner.  There was a long line to be seated and it took 50 minutes for us to be seated.  On staff member was very organized and kept things going while the others were disorganized and seemed to be new to the job.
Once we were seated, our server, Kevin, was very good - pleasant and attentive.
We split an appetizer of fried calamari which we found to be too bready.
I had the capellini pomodoro which was okay, but not great.  It was bland and there was no sign of any basil.  I took most of it home where I will dress it up.
It was a decent meal but not a great one.
author: Philip C.

description: Rude bartenders on Tuesday night. 2 stars cause food is always good but my boyfriend and I felt ignored by the bartenders. Had to keep asking for water refill and our dinner came before we even got to order our second bowl of salad.
author: Geena G.

description:
Plus 1 star for the great staff
Plus 1 star for the good portions

Negative 2 for the salads that are not fresh AND the burnt plastic hole that forced me to throw them away.

Negative 1 for the disappointment in having a good high quality meal with major shortfalls due to the bad quality salads. I want to give then another shot but this is already the second try....
author: EJ K.

description: Went to Olive Garden for my daughter's graduation lunch. While the food was good, the service was right out of a SNL comedy sketch. There was no soap in the bathroom. 1/2 hour later, after 3 requests soap was put in 1 dispenser - didn't have enough for both - they'd run out of soap until tomorrow. (Glad we came at lunch) The waitress dumped our drink order on the end of the table spilling on my daughter's new shoes.  My daughter ordered scampi, but they were all out.  And the wait to be seated for all of this was ridiculous - We were told it would be 40 mins; at 35 mins the gal insisted that she'd said 50 minutes. At 50 minutes they "were clearing the table" At 60 minutes were finally seated. We had to request basics - milk for coffee, etc. Don't know what's going on at this place! The food was delicious, but management of basics was ridiculous!
author: Christiana H.

description:
Visited the area and decided to stop at this restaurant. The quality of the food matched that of other franchises and the service was very good. The wait time for a Sunday dinner exceeded 30 minutes which is not as convenient for those in a hurry. The pseudo Italian fare is average and the portions are big enough to share  (may have to pay a fee to split the salad and plate but it is worth the overall savings).

There are better places in the area but if you are lookimg for a familiar place to eat this place will suit you just fine. Parking wasn't difficult and the location was easy to find outside the mall.
author: Aimeé R.

description: Bad service, bad food. The food definitely not fresh,  tastes like it was frozen food. I  would give no stars if yelp would let me.
author: C H.

description:
Strike One - Hair in my dinner.
Strike Two - The senior at the table got her meal ten minutes after everybody else.
Strike Three -The bill was incorrect. It was a minor error but there was an error and the bill had to be rerun. 

 I got a free coffee because the bar would have taken 15 minutes to make my Moca.

I came with a party of four in the middle of the Saturday lunch rush and we were told twenty minutes for a four top, well OK, not a problem. I went to wash my hands and my party was being seated when I returned. It wasn't even five minutes after we walked in.

Our server was great. She was attentive, listened and was patient with our indecisiveness while keeping our soup, salad and bread sticks in abundance. 

The manager came out to apologize about the hair in my pasta and reassure me that everybody was wearing hair nets. I thanked him for his attentiveness and asked when the senior would get her meal. He said it would be out soon. My replacement meal came out before her meal did.

This is decent pasta for a great price in a chain restaurant. You know the quality your paying for but hair in my meal and forgetting to give a meal to one person is inexcusable. If I could make a suggestion, slow down and make people wait a little longer for quality. This could easily be a four star experience with a little direction.

The bread sticks, soup and salad are excellant.
author: Justin S.

description: This is my first  time eating at the Olive Garden and my experience is just okay. The  waitress was very nice and friendly, but however my food wasn't the best. My pasta was so dry and my chicken was overly cook. My husband plate was tasteful, but my food  was the nasty i ever tasted.
author: Delia W.
