description: After 5 years of not coming here..I am reminded today why. Why didn't I review then? I'll leave a review just to save myself from making the same mistake again. Everything is SALTY! From the breadsticks, to the house salad to the trio which I shared with my hubby (thank goodness I didn't order my own). After the first two bites, we stopped. Our kids didn't like their meals either. The plates were hotter than the food that were on them, the kids' meals were too SALTY and MUSHY. Service was great though, so they can have the one star since zero stars is not possible.
author: Robie B.

description:
I hadn't been here in years, but we didn't want to drive to San Mateo to the Cheesecake Factory. Well we totally should have. Parking...... horrible....... The wait 45min-1 hour...... The Service 2 out of 5 stars. The Food a big fat ZERO stars. 

We were seated, we ordered appetizers and our meals since we already knew what we wanted. Our waited let us know that our food would take a little longer so said the apps would come out first and our daughters food, which is fine. We waited for our apps but they never came, then came our dinner. My chicken was rock hard, where the knife couldn't even cut through it. When our waited came by I told him about it and he said "oh did you want to order another piece?" umm well duh! He goes and "places" the order for the chicken to be replaced and well it never made it to my table. Once I realized that it's been well about 45 min of us sitting here I asked for our apps, he said "I don't know what happened, I did place them in". I was shocked at how "whatever" his attitude was. All of a sudden our appetizers come out and he asked if there was "anything else", apparently he forgot about the chicken. He brought us our bill and said he comped our appetizers, when he brought that up I asked why I was being charged for my meal when I never received the chicken and mind you there was also a extra charge for the "extra chicken" I never received. The manager came over, we explained the situation and he comped my meal and the appetizers. While all that is fine and dandy I still left really hungry, I will never come back here again and I would recommend anyone to dine here.
author: Irma R.

description: Seriously - anyone who rates this place higher than 2 stars has never actually been to a real Italian restaurant.  I got the rigatoni with chicken and  marinara sauce on the specials menu and it actually tasted worse than buying a jar of sauce and box of pasta at Safeway.  The salad was good but the bread sticks were nothing to write home about.  And whomever assigns the servers their tables is an idiot.  We were in a room with about 8 tables and there were THREE different servers!  Our server only had our table in this room and between visits he would disappear for a good 10-15 minutes every time.  So it took forever to get drink refills, napkins, more bread, etc.  People that came before us by other servers were served quicker too.  Won't be back.
author: G. R.

description: This is my first time at any Olive Garden, and I'm disappointed. The service is exceptional, but I'm afraid it's unbalanced with the food. The entire course had a sort of ongoing theme of creaminess (in a bad way) and saltiness. The wings were tasty, but way too salty. The soup is horrible, and the salad is ridiculous. They call it famous!? I don't know if I'm being too harsh, but I just didn't have a good time. Would not recommend?
author: Christopher X.

description:
I enioyed this place.  Our server was amazing and very cooperative and helpful. Went for the classic unlimited soup and salad. The minestrone is one of the best. My friends enjoyed the chicken gnocchi.  

I find it a little strange however that they placed a lasagna fritta out of the entree and made it an appetizer. Its delicious on its own!
author: Sofía A.

description: Saturday late afternoon ... was going to a different Italian place, but at 4 pm they had a 2 hr wait.  Left and wondering what to do.  Niece said ... Olive Garden just up the way.  Boom  Hostess sent us to the bar to wait... got a round of drinks and there was a table.  Got right in less the 5 min.  service was fast... kept our salad and bread FULL ... as well as our now Ice Teas.   Had leftovers to take.  Love the Eggplant Parmigan .... Chicken Marasla...  Lasgune    ... all good.  Going back.
author: India G.

description:
No complaints at all!! 

James was an awesome, outstanding server.  

The food was very good, great temperature and presentation was outstanding.  

Great job!!!

Men's bathroom had paper towels all over the floor but I brought it to the waiters attention and I'm sure it was cleaned up. V
author: Jason C.

description: The wait for a table is always long even with open tables without enough wait staff. If you want a so called Italian dinner after a day at the mall then this the place for you. The food is so so and the service is hit and miss as well.
author: J S.

description: I have come from Europe and I am new in US everything in this restaurant was excellent (food -serving- cost....and all others) one star is empty because the lettuce in my salad was not fresh
author: Siamak S.

description:
(Sunday - December 7, 2014)

Olive Garden...oh, Olive Garden where have you gone. I know this is a chain restaurant but come on guys you really must step it up. The "Almost Famous" breadsticks are clearly not going to make it on 20th Ave. They were practically burnt, with little butter and even less garlic. 

On this, the Lord's day, they were out of chardonnay (really?) and the next best option -a blend - was warm and borderline rancid. We were also still waiting for utensils when we received our appetizers, and the calimari was barely edible with the consistency of a microwaved rubber band.

The only reason I am giving this place two stars is because I liked it as a kid. Sadly, you can't eat nostalgia.

Sincerely,
Disappointed
author: NJ A.

description:
I truly understand why people give the Olive Garden so much shit. I used to hate it. I used to call it "Italian Denny's" and I still hate the "Wonderbread" bread sticks. They are an insult to Italians who have long tradition of making fabulous breads. 

But in all fairness, this chain has come a LONG way in improving their menu. Soups are actually pretty good. I like the minestrone soup and the one with sausage and potatoes. The desserts are good too. Try the lemony "Limoncello" cake. The calamari and stuffed mushrooms appetizers are filling enough to be a whole meal. Some of their new steak and chicken entrees are better than things I have ordered at pricier restaurants. 

If you haven't been here in a while, give it a second try. I think you will be pleasantly surprised. Save room for your entree and don't load up on the awful iceberg lettuce salad which is still pretty weak. I see people going on and on about the salad. WTF? Iceberg lettuce is cheap, has no fiber or nutritional value. You would die if all you ate was iceberg. And for real people, if you get excited about two olives and a little slice of tomato you shouldn't reviewing places. rather than disappointing people by saying " I know where we can get great salad" .... raise the bar and say " I know where we can get some cocktails, appetizers, awesome steaks and heavenly limoncello cake! 

They have lots of cool desserts, a good taramisu, triple chocolate strata and piccoli dolci which is like little shot glasses of different desserts in a kind of sampler. The wine menu is good. Lots of solid California offerings. They make a respectable Long Island iced tea and the steak Toscano and herbed salmon are two good entree choices. The better food items are the  real reason to give this place a second chance!
author: Sara N.

description: Usually very good service but, came here for dinner with my wife and sister in law. It wasn't busy at all, and we waited 25+ minutes without anybody even saying hello, offering water, ANYTHING!! So we just walk out. I am very disappointed because it was one of our favorite places to go This was the worst customer service experience.
author: Eduardo R.

description: They charged me an extra $1.99 for using the stupid tablet on the table . They should at least let people know that it isn't free. Why else would it be on our table?
author: Nelly B.

description: please tell me how there is a two hour wait when we can clearly see that there is so many seats and tables open and there isnt many people waiting to be seated. i really dont understand this and i would like to. they told us it would be a two hour wait and they would be closed soon... then i saw two women walk in a make a reservation and they were seated shortly... if anyone would like to explain to me so i can understand why this happened it would be very appreciated because i did not get any explanation from them.
author: Nikki D.

description: This restaurant is so bad and waiting for Togo order take so long looks not busy ,never come back again
author: Lohu K.

description: This place is a good place to eat when after shopping at the mall.  It depends on who's cooking because occasionally I'll get salty food or bland, or just right. There isn't a consistency in their preparation. Staff is usually friendly and attentive.  Sad that some of their menus I grew up with are gone, but soup, salad, and bread sticks are still a favorite for me.
author: JJAMZ C.

description:
What a weird time today. 
Usually would get 3 maybe 4 stars but today was super weird.
Our server was way to quiet. And when my girlfriend asked him to speak up, he just bent down and stayed at the same volume.

Later when we were about to leave, a waitress and what looked like the floor supervisor were having some sort of personal conversation. I called to the waitress with my hand up, we made eye contact... And then she looked away and continued her conversation.
I found that extremely rude.
author: Ross K.

description:
Suuuuper slow service... we got there really early for dinner, and the food took FOREVER. Even the bread took forever...

I ended up ordering the endless soup and salad... I think they strategically took forever to refill our soups and salads so we would get fuller, haha. The salad was just ok, and the soups were pretty good. A bit on the salty side for me, though.

Speaking of salty, our first batch of bread turned out REALLY salty. I haven't been to Olive Garden in years, so I was just thinking that was the way it was supposed to be. But when we got our second batch, it was a lot better and just a tinge of saltiness. 

Food was just average. Service was my biggest gripe... our server neglected us practically the whole time! At one point, the manager or someone other than our server told us the computer server went down so it slowed it down even more... 

I would not come here unless you don't mind waiting and you're not too terribly hungry after shopping at the mall next door.
author: Janet H.

description: Our server Cory was great. Our food was delicious and everything I even got a ready and we also got a entrée to take home. The Manager Gary was a great guy he came over and spoke to us and said how we enjoyed ourselves and was everything to our liking he was great this is the first time I've been in Olive Garden in a long time and treat it like a guest in their home.
author: Evangela W.

description:
I don't usually rant about poor service but goodness... Shame on you, guy who served us today. And MORE shame on you, Olive Garden. Our party of 6 did not enjoy our service tonight.. Nor the food. 4 people in our party arrived earlier than the BF and I, so since we were running late, I told them to order first. They ordered appetizer and 2 entrees to share. When I arrived, the appetizer came and we were out of breadsticks. I was deciding on what to order and asked for a refill and the waiter gave me hella attitude and said he was waiting for me to order first. The other couple in my party asked about the status of their order and he gave hella attitude and said they told him to wait for the rest of the party to arrive. How are you going to tell your customers they said that when they didn't? And on top of that, you'll keep insisting and arguing about it? This guy needs to take some Waiter 101 courses. 

Next, the food. The salad was salty as hell. The food just looked like a blob. Ordered the Tour of Italy and it was horrible. I paid for blobs of cold food. I will NOT be back.
author: Vanessa Y.

description:
Seriously, Jay Leno wasn't kidding when he referred to Olive Garden as the McDonald's of dining. I feel like I really don't even have to describe the food - I can make better at home. So I'll just tell you about the farce they refer to as "good" service.

Yesterday, we called to make a reservation for 10. We were told that Olive Garden doesn't take reservations and that we had to wait like everyone else. When we eventually got the manager on the line and let him know that we had no problems taking our service elsewhere, he was more than ready to oblige and ensure that we would have a table.

Tonight, when we arrived, it took nearly 10 minutes to get the waitress to acknowledge my existence. Honestly, if you are unable to do your job, let us know so that we can form a line behind the guy that is doing his job. When we finally checked in, we were asked to follow one of the waitresses to the back. Our table wasn't set up yet, which was fine, there was a large empty space to the side (probably from the tables they moved to form our long table) and we all stood there being conscientious of other customers. However, the waitress who was setting up was definitely less than friendly. Different people in our party heard phrases like "can you not stand there, you are in my way" (we really weren't) in addition to "orientals can never follow directions" (you're just full of sunshine, aren't you).

When we got around to ordering, we were serviced by a waiter who clearly had some odd stereotype about Asians and how we share food. Instead of making his way around the table and asking what each person wanted, he stood at the head of the table and asked "anything else?" after each entree was ordered...um, okay? Not only did everyone at our table order their own entree, but we also ordered a few sampler appetizers as well as specialty drinks. Don't sort us into the same group with your stereotypical cheap Asian families. 

The only redeeming factor for most of this night was our server Dale, who was highly attentive of how filled our water glasses were and if we ever wanted additional cheese on our dishes.
author: Elaine Y.

description: Great stuff but very bad food beside the fresh bread. Don't expect much if you go there.
author: Dylan L.

description: Assembly line Italian. Now with table kiosks to order food and pay your bill just make the experience so impersonal. Food is more than taste it is the whole experience, including being served. Isn't that why we tip? Bleck
author: Matt A.

description: My waitress was Deja. (Day-sshhah). She's the best! She handed me Extra soup and breads ticks to take home! Fresh bread sticks and soup was loaded into a bag for me when she brought the bill. Totally complimentary! I told the manager how awesome she is. I'm going back because the service was splendid!!!
author: Anthony M.

description: Service was painfully slow. Food was good, drinks were watered down by the time they made it to the table. The hosts were excellent!The good thing is that I don't expect much from this type of restaurant.
author: Amy L.

description: white people food sucks:/ and now that trump is elected and i'm just like:://// hate this place ! breadsticks can fuck me though! that's like a solid 6 inches of pure joy right there!
author: Xavier L.

description:
Monday night for my Niece's birthday. Ordered Chicken Marsala. The chicken that arrived was made with soy sauce and no marsala taste whatsoever. Had it boxed up and pretended I was full from the other food. The Mango martini had no alcohol and tasted like you poured Mango juice into a glass. It did NOT look like the picture. $8 for a martini sized glass of juice? 
After years of staying away from here, it was not worth the trip.
author: DJ C.

description:
Please note this review is for the end of 2011  - I just posted it now

Shitty - I was seated at the bar ordered an hour ago but still didn't get my food - non - minorities in front of me got seconds on appies already and we still didn't get out first yet - I'm writing this while they're paying at 10:30pm

____________________________________

After waiting for so long and getting poor food service we told the manager and then he took care of our small bill.  we were only there for appies and dessert.  

I mean, If they didn't do that I'd probably never go back.  But since they're trying to change.  I'd go back for another try.
author: Juila L.

description: It was our first time me and my family at Olive Garden, I wasn't disappointed! The food was super delicious. The service was friendly and amazing! Definitely coming back.
author: Mohammed Z.

description: Went here for a friend's birthday dinner and decided to try the new "chicken and mushroom marsala ravioli", it was horrible!!! I'm a big girl and I like to eat but this I just couldn't. It was just so bad. When I asked our server where the mushrooms were, he tells me he doesn't think there are mushrooms on this dish smh the chicken is no where to be found also. It was such a waste of money and food. I wish I would've stuck to the usual and gotten the zitti or something. Chef boy-r-d could've done a better job with this dish. Also the lasagna my fiancé got looked as though it fell over and they just put it back together into a lasagna mush pile. Olive garden def dropped the ball on this meal. I wish this location would go back to how is was 10 years ago. So much more quality. The best thing about this meal was the obviously store bought lemon cake the brought out to song happy birthday with. My fiancé and i def won't be going here again.
author: Louisa T.

description:
I could not remember if I have been to an Olive Garden but I was at Stonestown and wanted a sit down dinner not the food court.

I was alone sat in the bar area. When I opened my silverware the knife was so gross I took a photo and posted it on my facebook. I ordered something like Steak Gorgonzola Alfredo? I did finish the steak part but left the other part it was just out of sorts.

The most annoying part of my visit was the waiter called me "Boss" every time he asked me a question. "Hi Boss what would you like to order"  "Boss did you want a refill on your drink"  "Boss how is every thing" "Boss" "Boss" Boss" I felt like I was in the mafia. 

I will never return. The "Boss" has decided that the Olive Garden is not for him.
author: John C.

description: Possibly the worst Olive Garden I've been to. To start off, all of the employees walk around looking like they hate the world and their job, and their service is lousy. It starts off with them asking what drinks we wanted. My gf gets water and I decide on the vanilla Italian cream soda. She comes back with a water and some carbonated water with no cream and barely and flavor. I was literally drinking a club soda. Then after about 15 minutes we finally get some breadsticks and wouldn't ya know it, they were stale crunchy pieces of bread. Needless to say we didn't stick around for the entrees. Never going to this Olive Garden again
author: Lance H.

description:
I used to like olive garden but something has happened to this place.. The service is horrible, they don't know how to smile and be polite. 

I came here with my brother and cousin because  my cousin wanted their salad.. we got seated rightaway.. we each ordered their build your own pasta dish which included either sour or salad.. 

I ordered an ice tea and did receive it until we got our entrees.. my cousin ordered a lemonade and wanted a refill which he had to ask two different servers for, and still did not get it. The food was meh too!!

The only good part of this restaurant is their salad and bread sticks.. everything else has gone down.. 
maybe ill come here only for lunch when they offer unlimited soup and salad on the menu as nothing else is that good anymore.
author: Rikki S.

description:
Waited two hours... Came on a Wednesday night around 7:30 pm. Water took 20 mins to get, salad and soup took another 10 mins, and appetizer took another 30 mins. 
When the food came out it was dry and flavorless. 
I felt like I was on Kitchen Nightmare and Chef Ramsey was in the kitchen cussing the chefs out for having the food orders backed up.
author: Eva K.

description:
It is unfortunate that I give a negative review but it's in hopes that their management will see this. 

The service is really slow. It took about 30 minutes just to get soup and salad which is usually pre-made. For something that doesn't really require cooking.. That is a long time.  I think there are opportunity for improvement and hope that it will after they finish remodeling.
author: Joe m.

description:
I went here for lunch today and ordered the Chicken Parmigiana Breadstick Sandwich.

Olive Garden is known for offering unlimited breadsticks and soup or salad with its entrées. I picked the salad and was given an enormous bowl of salad and three breadsticks to eat. Being the type of person who feels compelled to eat everything I'm given, I was still eating the salad (hadn't gotten to the breadsticks yet) when my entrée was brought out. Now, I recalled that Starboard Value released a famous PowerPoint presentation that led to Olive Garden's parent company replacing its entire board of directors. In the presentation, they argued that the default portion sizes for the salad and breadsticks were too large, leading to food waste. They recommended that servers bring out a breadstick for each person at the table plus one additional breadstick. This rule was not followed, since I was given three breadsticks instead of two. I agree that this felt like an enormous amount of food before I even got to my entrée.

I searched "Olive Garden" on Google News to see how their business is doing since it seemed that they had not made all the recommended changes. I learned that an Olive Garden restaurant in New York is charging $400 for dinner tonight because they have a view of the New Year's Eve ball on Times Square. Well, I got lunch on New Year's Eve for about $15 including tip at this restaurant in suburban California.

The sandwich I ordered is interesting. It's chicken parmigiana, which is basically breaded chicken breast, served sandwiched inside a wider-than-standard breadstick. It comes with a side of fries. It almost looks like fries and a hot dog when you look at it. I'm not sure I really needed the fries after eating an enormous amount of salad and three breadsticks, and I'm not sure I really needed the sandwich bread after eating three breadsticks. If I go back, I will probably order a more traditional menu item.

One thing that was kind of peculiar is that there was a tablet-like device at my table for ordering food. I wasn't sure if I was supposed to use it to order or if I was going to have a waiter. I was trying to figure out how to order a Dr. Pepper when a waitress came to take my order. A little bit awkward :). The only thing we ended up using it for was for the waitress to run my credit card at the end. She stood there while I picked how much to tip using the device after it presented me with a default, which was also a little awkward.

Overall, I think the food is a good value here, especially for lunch. Unfortunately, I don't go to Olive Garden very often because between the salad, breadsticks, and entrée, even without an appetizer, if you eat here often, you will probably get very fat.
author: Ryan L.

description:
Oh Olive Garden, how you frustrate me so.

I have no complaints about the food and service at this Olive Garden (although it is mediocre at best), but here's just something to look out for. I entered into the restaurant to get a buzzer (because it is always insanely busy) and the hostess told me that the wait would be approx. 35 minutes. Over 50 minutes later my buzzer still didn't go off. Fine. I get that it was busy. But what bothered me the most was how the hostess told all the people that came in after me that the wait would be approx. 35 minutes. Clearly when +20 people come into an already crowded Olive Garden, the wait won't be 35 minutes. 

So, if you are not the waiting type and hate liars, this place isn't for you :)
author: Vivian H.

description: The best bread sticks and best salad!!! You can never get bored with coming to this place, they always have new dishes all the time!!
author: Chrysanthemum R.

description: Food was awful!!!!  Ordered clamari and it was awful. Stuffed Mushrooms were ok. Shrimp scampi tasted like the noodles from a top ramen packet.
author: Celina A.

description: Good value for lunch, not as much for dinner if you are getting the soup/salad combo. The salad is really good, soup is ok.  I've had a few pasta dishes here and they leave a bit to be desired, however, it is an Italian chain so for what it is, it does the job.
author: Johanna W.

description: Poor service accommodating guests. It is my sister's birthday. The host told my sister that she will getting be seated in 30 mins and he gave her a buzzer, now that 5 hours passed she didn't still get seat. It is her birthday that day, and pretty good business for them because we are 15 people. Not recommend to celebrate a nice dinner.
author: Calvin Nicholei L.

description:
Why must your breadsticks be so salty?  They are warm and soft, but OH SO SALTY i must dip it in your SALTY soup and swipe it around the salad dressing just to satisfy my great hunger for carbohydrates.  

I have to say, the fact that there are calorie numbers at the end of each menu item really makes me rethink my food.  I ended up ordering this cheesy chicken with mashed potatoes and a salad.  The salad was good.  The dressing wasn't too heavy and it came with olives and red onions.  The chicken was a bit salty but the cheese was good and the mashed potatoes were really good too.

The BF got this chicken breast with noodles--he didn't like it.  He thought it didn't have much flavor.  I just didn't like the rosemary in it.  It tasted a little bit like toothpaste to me.  He got soup.  The soup was good--I dipped my breadsticks in it as mentioned before.

We both got water and no dessert.  I was full, but it didn't quite hit the spot.  I mean come here if you like lots of soup and salty breadsticks.  I know you never come here anyway expecting anything really great, but as long as your expectations are in check, you can have a great meal.
author: Aly A.

description:
Oh my, where do I begin????  

I give two stars because as usual if you go in for the soup and salad, they are both great and the servers really tried.  Not so much for anything else on the menu and the execution of the meals.  Peyton's Nation Wide commercial would have stated, "Chicken Parm you ain't so good!"

We were a party of 14 for a wake.  I know a large party, but this is a chain place that should be able to put decent food out fast.  Not so much, again.  EVERYTHING that was served (other than soup or salad) was; stale, bland, too hard, too soft, ZERO sauce, no seasoning, no garlic on any of our fries (and when we asked for it to be brought out to the table they brought a shaker with powder in it, really no *real* garlic at an Italian chain???), and we finally got the last meal when the check came.

Now mind you no one aggressively complained, because we were there to remember our lost one and wanted a celebration regardless of what was put in front of us.  Pick your priorities, they gave us a nice space and their employees were accommodating to us and tried their best.  Now that I'm home, thank you service staff and shame on your management for not better executing on what they are being paid for!
author: Kelly L.

description: I went to lunch here with one of my students. The staff were very friendly and attentive. The manager also came by and said hello. I definitely will return as I felt I received excellent service. Our waitress was Jill.
author: Kay A.

description: This review is strictly for our server Tracy!! She delivered the best service by far from any where I have visited in the last year! Which is odd considering this restaurant is not usually a place we receive great service from! I will admit we had to wait a while for our check after asking for it, but I have all the patience in the world for this polite, sweet and charming sever! **Tip shrimp scampi on the light an fare menu, not so great! Tour of Italy was bomb!!
author: Yvette M.

description: I came here yesterday with my husband and parents.  To be honest, I didn't expect the food to be as great as it was.  My mom and I ordered the rosemary chicken and it was delicious. My dad usually is never impressed with any restaurant, but he sure was impressed yesterday. Olive Garden is his new favorite restaurant.  Not only was the food good, but the service was great!  Billy was our waiter and he was fantastic.  He was attentive and very friendly.  He really provided us with excellent service.  Thanks Billy!
author: Lila S.

description: My friends and I liked this place before. But today we are so disappointed. The service was very bad. After the waiter gave us two cups of water, he disappeared!! Nobody cared us. Later,Other waiters gave us food. But when we checked out, they charged us additional salad fee which we didn't ordered!! I asked them but they seemed like didn't believe us!! I hate that treat me unjustly!
author: Tess123 L.

description:
The food was not good! When I say not good I mean NOT good not even a little bit. I ordered the seafood pescatore. The pasta was overcooked and bland there was barely any sauce and the shrimp still had the tails attached; the scallops were mediocore and very chewy. My boyfriends dish wasnt any better he ordered the chicken alfredo pizza and was not satisfied either. The breadsticks were hot but were covered in butter and salt with no seasoning. The salad was by far the best thing and considering it wasnt too great thats saying something. 

The two stars are based solely on the waitress Nicole. She was very nice polite and friendly.
author: Lakeshia J.

description: Worst service ever. I kind of figured it would be that way from the moment we walked in. There was about 5/6 employees at the desk when you walk in, standing there fraternizing and it took them like  30 seconds before looking up and offering a greeting to us. Our server, Decorius (or whatever the hell his damn name is) if you even want to call him a server, Suuuuuccccckked!!! I don't know how this buzzard has a job here. He NEVER came to check on us, offer refills, he didn't offer dessert, he didn't even bring us a to go box, mints nor the bill. We could've just walked out and he would not have noticed. I'm a firm believer in tipping, when deserved. But as horrible as he was, I would not even leave him a stick of gum! We paid using the table kiosk and all he did was come and start to clear the many plates that his dumb ass should've cleared throughout the visit. He stood there and not once said "thank you for coming" or "is there anything I can get you." I had to flag two different servers for things. I guess since it was close to closing time, he carelessly walked by his tables. He would stand from afar, look at the customers tables and if HE FELT everything was ok, he keep going about his business without stopping to ask anything. He seriously looked like he did not want to be there. Newsflash, nobody is forcing you to work there, moron. Get another job if you don't want to do your current one. He should be fired. Bad representation of Olive Garden. My last words to this cornball would be "lick balls and die!" Never returning here, ever! I suggest you don't go to this place either.
author: Tesh R.

description: I hate this olive garden !!!! Why can't they get better service !! There are plenty of people with much better customer service out there who need jobs, I wish they would just start over with a better crew... I have been on the phone trying to make a reservation for over 20 minutes as of now !!! If it wasn't for the food I wouldn't ever come back to this horrible place ! Management obviously doesn't care! They need better people running their host desk !
author: Alex C.

description:
Came to have a late lunch and since I was in the area thought Olive Garden would help with my pasta craving.  The staff is friendly, very helpful. 
For a Chain it's not too bad. I tried the chicken parm with spaghetti as well as the stuffed chicken Marsala. For apps I had caprese flatbread. The flat bread was ok. It tasted more like I was eating a cracker. A bit bland. A bowl of soup came with my order so I had a chicken and gnocchi soup. Similar to a clam chowder, it was creamy with pillow soft gnocchi and bits of chicken. Very tasty.
The stuffed chicken Marsala was good too. Sundries tomatoes, cheese were stuffed in a tender juicy chicken breast. A creamy mushroom Marsala sauce accompanied the dish as well as creamy mashed potatoes. The sauce over the chicken and mashed potatoes was delicious! 
The chicken parm was good. The chicken was juicy and the crust was good too.
I would come back again for lunch and dinner. They always seem to have lots of specials which is good on my wallet.
author: Roger P.

description: The service here is just stupid. It takes minimum 1 hour to eat. If u get the soup salad and breadsticks, sure it's all you can eat but with how long it takes to get anything, it's not even worth it. There's a bough waitstaff standing around fraternizing to have 1 employee per table, but none of them want to work so... Guests just get to sit and wait. Not going back anymore.
author: Emma H.

description: Our server Carla was great , we never once had to look around for her , never had to wait for her to notice that we needed something ! Dinner was good but Carla made it better !
author: Desiree V.

description:
Generally, we like the Olive Garden.  However, this last time - we had a horrible experience!  We arrived and were told we had a 30 minute wait.  We patiently waited, longer than 30 minutes.  When I inquired, I overheard the THREE hostesses talking about how they accidentally sat another party at the table that was meant for us.  Obviously, not pleased.  I then looked at the bar area and asked if we could sit there.  "No problem" was the response I received.  So away we went.  Since we had been waiting 40 minutes, we all were hungry and knew exactly what we wanted.  I waited patiently for a server - probably 5 minutes and I saw her walking towards us, or so I thought.  I politely said, "excuse me" and not only did she not stop walking, she put up the HAND (talk to the hand gesture)!  WOW.  SO, I go back to the THREE hostesses who are doing nothing and I asked if we were going to get served since the  server told me to talk to her hand.  They then collaborated with the manager, discussing moving the people who they accidentally sat!  At this point, the bar server comes back and says, "I'm extremely busy so maybe you should sit somewhere else because I can't help you".  WHAT?  Keep in mind, the manager is now witnessing all of this, but proceeds to look perplexed.  We get up and go back to the waiting area and they end up moving the other guests..wow.  SO, we FINALLY sit (close to an hour, it is about 10pm now) and the manager comes over and says, I'm sorry.  THAT's it. I was kinda hoping the server would come?  Finally, she comes and is a nice lady.  We tell her we are ready to order, place our order.  She comes back with the breadsticks - we are a party of 6, she brings 4 - FAIL.  She brings our salad and guess what, NO DRESSING on the salad - FAIL.  Oh, we also have NO SILVERWARE so I have to ask for that as well.  Finally, dressing comes (after the meal has been served) - FAIL.  We obviously skip dessert at this point.  The bills are now viewable online and I had my daughter take care of it (the tablet was closest to her).  I ask for a copy of the bill, only to realize they OVERCHARGED us for an item.  So, again, waiting game for the server.  I show her the error and she says she will fix it.  She comes back with a gift card for the difference!  Are you kidding me?  I don't want a gift card, I would like my credit card refunded for the over charge.  AGAIN, I have to wait for it to be done.  I will likely not go to this particular Olive Garden again, or at least until I can be less upset about it.  

The most disappointing thing is that the manager was aware of all of our issues and he did nothing, except the obligatory, "sorry about that" and then disappeared.
author: Cathy W.

description: Hadn't been to olive garden in about 5 years, came to stonestown for chevys, thats gone so we opted for OG. I have been to OG about 10 times in the past, and I always order the same things, much to my friends amusement. Had the same things this time. Wow! What a let down. Had the appetizer sampler, calamari toasted ravioli and stuffed mushrooms. Just plain awful! The calamari was absolutely tiny, you could not even thread a pencil thru it, and completely dried out and obviously straight from the freezer. The ravioli was half the size I remember with almost no filling, that too was dried out, also from the freezer. The mushrooms were equally bad. Again, much smaller than before, flavorless and barely warm. there used to be 3 sauces with it (3 items), now there's only 2! Salad and breadsticks were the same, and the sausage kale soup was as I remember (good). Will only be soup/salad if I ever go back. overpriced for what you get. Server was a sweetheart and very attentive. Have had wonderful dreams about that angel .
author: terence r.

description:
It is the Olive Garden so you know what you are going to get. The food is solid and the portions are healthy.  The prices are fair for the quality and service you get is decent.  They also have plenty of coupons, which are great.  The salad and break sticks are incredible; plus you get unlimited portions.  You could literally fill up on those and be full before your entrée even comes.

Overall, I look forward to coming back to this restaurant and even try their other locations.
author: Justin E.

description:
1 Star for the food
2 Stars for the service
1 Star for atmosphere and cleanliness

We should have eaten at Panda :-)  

Came in with a friend hoping for an above average mall lunch.  What we got was pretty disgusting.  Almost everything served was warmed  up canned products, lumped together with a dash of dried oregano.  

Minestrone Soup:  canned beans, canned tomatoes, a little pasta, and two tablespoons of broth, no seasonings = no flavor.  All the kitchen did was to dump the cans into a pot and warm. No actual cooking. 

Eggplant Parmesan with Spaghetti:  Sauce consisted of canned diced tomatoes with some dried oregano. It still had that canned tin taste because it wasn't simmered/cooked.  Just dumped into a pot and warmed up.  The eggplant was sliced paper thin, overly breaded and had absorbed a ton of oil = very greasy.  

Breadsticks:  The usual tasteless warmed up bread.

Roasted Asparagus:  Not roasted, blanched.  It was served with jar mayonnaise that had a hint of garlic.  Not the citrus aioli described on the  menu.

I'm second generation Italian and grew up eating the real deal cooked by my parents.  I don't expect an American chain restaurant to serve anything close to authentic Italian cuisine, but I do expect more than warmed up canned foods. Weekday lunch for two with tip was $42. 

The food was much better a few years back.  Now, the only tasks required of the kitchen staff is opening cans and frying. 

My server was nice but only came to the table to take the order and drop off the food and bill, which he delivered at the same time.  We were very rushed.  
 
We should have stayed inside the mall and eaten Panda.  They have cooks that actually do some COOKING and the dishes contain fresh (not canned) vegetables.
author: Donna P.

description: Have not been to this place for a while and seems like nothing new.  Arrived on Sunday 12 pm.  Seems there was no room, so we sat at the bar to eat.  The lighting there for kinda dim.  The spotlight was only half on the table.  Salad came, nothing special, no different from the store bought salad. The bread sticks were really greasy, wish they provide butter instead of brushing it onto the bread, now my fingers are all greasy.  Food was so so.  I guess, sitting at the bar was too uncomfortable for me but I did not want to make a fuss for everyone with me to change.  Will not sit at bar next time, maybe my experience will be better.
author: Elaine Y.

description:
I'm not pretentious. I'm proud to say that I eat at Olive Garden and enjoy it! Friend and I went here after hearing about the unlimited pasta bowl for $8.99, and we came ready to EAT. The deal includes unlimited breadsticks, soup or salad, and your choice of 6 noodles, 5 sauces, and the choice to add 1 of 3 meats (unlimited) for $2.99. Everything tasted good, came out quickly, and for 12 bucks a person, it was worth it. 

Our server Sydni was very friendly and polite, and gave us a sample of free wine which we enjoyed. 

4.25 STARS!!!!
author: Stephen D.

description:
Not bad. 

I was actually pleasantly surprised. I came here to meet a friend for a quick lunch. I ordered the spaghetti with meat sauce and it was flavorful. It came with a house salad and bread sticks. The bread sticks were ok and so was the salad. I had a cranberry orange limonata to drink and it was delicious. 

Definitely not my go to place but it was a good meal for a good price.
author: Andreea M.

description:
I literally want to shoot myself in the foot for spending $50 + for 2 appetizers and 1 entree!

I normally don't complain about spending about $50 on 2 entrees and 1 appetizer dish (look at my Yelp reviews) but this is FREAKING OLIVE GARDEN... OLIVE GARDEN! I'd honestly understand if the food was good, but Olive Garden has mediocre pasta at best and the portions are tiny! First off, our appetizer plate had about 10 tiny pieces of Calamari and 3 Mozzarella Triangles, which isn't very much to share between 3 people who have been waiting for an hour just to get seated! After letting go of the fact that our appetizer dish was enough to feed a bunch of elves on the North Pole, I noticed that my sister's pasta dish was barely half full and my other sister's chicken marsala pieces were soooo tiny. And the bread sticks? How could anyone like those bland things? The only thing that made the bread sticks taste decent was the overly salted chicken gnocchi soup. 

Skip skip skip!
author: Joyce E.

description:
I am humiliated and OUTRAGED by how I was treated when I went to the Olive Garden​ at Stonestown Mall last week!  It's not because I am Mexican.  And it's not because I am female but because I am a mother with a newborn baby.  I am Completely SHOCKED by how this restaurant treats families, especially new mothers!  I experienced a new form of SEGREGATION and DISCRIMINATION and I am calling it out: Olive Garden subjects new mothers to PARENTAL DISCRIMINATION AND SEGREGATION!  

After finally getting a day out to shop and run errands, I needed a place to change my baby, feed her and get some food for myself.  Being such a fan, I figured that Olive Garden would be the perfect, family friendly establishment.  I never thought that having a baby would entitle me to being treated differently and segregated from the other patrons.

I walked into Olive Garden and the hostess (who's name is Sterling) decided to profile me as a disturbance to the other patrons and completely wrote me off.  She didn't greet me and was utterly rude.  I asked if I could sit in a booth (because it's much cozier and puts baby in a safe location where she's not blocking traffic.)  Sterling said with such annoyance and distain, "Sorry, we can't put that 'thing' in a booth."  I was so appalled that it caused me to speak up and I said, "This thing is called a stroller."  She rolled her eyes and turned around to seat me.  I decided to give her the benefit of the doubt because having a baby is new even to me and to be honest, I didn't understand how difficult having a baby is until I had one myself.  Plus, I really wanted breadsticks and baby was getting hungry so I followed her.  We walked past a slew of empty tables in the main dining hall and I started to get concerned as to where she was taking me.  As we got closer, I realized that she was putting me in a room all by ourselves, that was way in the back.  It was almost like a banquet room that had double doors that closed the room off from the main dining room.  It made me feel very uncomfortable because there was no one else in the room and I realized that she was segregating me from the other patrons just because I had a baby.  Phoenix (my baby) is a newborn and sleeps most of the time.  Especially after being fed.   Why would she put me in a dangerous situation where we were isolated from everyone else?  This was a total safety concern.  Being so humiliated really gives you the courage to defend yourself, or maybe it's the momma bear instincts but I said, "Wait a minute, why are you segregating us from everyone else?  We haven't shown you any sign of being a disturbance."  She said that it was because they were opening up for dinner but there were more than enough tables in the main dining room.  Not only that, but it was only about 2 PM!  I asked to speak with the manager and she rolled her eyes and walked away.

The manager came of course and was very nice about the situation.  She gave me a fantastic server (Jim or maybe Tim) who was upbeat and friendly.  I was so upset that I couldn't enjoy my meal.  I suddenly felt rushed, stressed and uncomfortable.  I had to stay put for a bit because I had just given Phoenix her bottle.  It's better to be safe in a restaurant than in the car or outside.  As calm as I try to be, I am always on edge that Phoenix will wake up and start crying, which would indeed disturb other people and I am aware of that.  It has never happened, but the last thing I want is to feel more stressed because people are now looking at me and annoyed.  It's a shame that people find babies to be a disturbance and inconvenience.  Especially in public.  I never realized how parents must feel until I had a baby of my own.  Am I not supposed to go out and enjoy life?  Am I just supposed to stay holed up until my baby is no longer considered a nuisance to the world?  On that note, why am I confined to places that are "family friendly" just because babies are obviously not accepted in all public places?

I am ashamed at the fact that I have brought my beautiful baby girl into a world that has not learned their lesson from 50 years ago.  Religious segregation, racial segregation, sexual orientation prejudice, gender discrimination and now parental segregation.  We have all experienced some form of intense segregation and prejudice but I never realized that parents are still experiencing segregation and having no choice but to accept it.  No one calls it out because I don't think they realize how terribly society treats them.  Most places don't even having changing tables.  Where am I supposed to change my baby?  Am I not supposed to enjoy these places like everyone else just because I have a baby?  Ashton Kutcher was right to petition more changing tables in men's restrooms but believe it or not, there are hardly any in women's restrooms either!

Martin Luther King Jr. would be ashamed at the lack of progress that Olive Garden displays!
author: Victoria C.

description: If I could give it zero, I would. Wrong wine, entree arrived before appetizer & worst of all, the food is reheated muck. Wouldn't feed this chewy microwave crud to my dog. It's a total disgrace. If I was Italian I'd picket the place. Vile packet food that hasn't even the slightest resemblance to Italian food. In fact, you'll get better on the plane to Italy...
author: Fi M.

description:
I came here with some close friends. The food was a little pricy but was splendid. It's a great place to go when your done shopping. Loved the pizza and pasta I ordered. 

Definitely coming back!
author: Rachel L.

description: My server was Michael D. And he provided excellent service, very attentive evem when busy and atressed. Provides his own preference in the margaritas and it was very good it was the italian margarita. I asked because i sont like frozen margaritas. The amount of food was a ton. And the bread ia salty people are giving 3 stars because their food is too salty but thats a personal taste and preference. Anyways it was a nice view good food and great service.
author: Victoria D.

description:
Cecelia had the best customer service evahhhhhhhhh!!! I would definitely go back just for her :) 

As for the food, I always come for their Caesar salad and their copellini something something. It's under the lighter fare category and is skinny noodles with Roma tomatoes and Olive oil. Soooooo good. And
not heavy like the Alfredo's or other thicker sauces. 

Anyways, this review was mainly for Cecelia. She's amazing! Thanks for the awesome service cecelia!!!
author: Philip Daniel S.

description: I've never been to Olive Garden even when I lived so close to it so I came here with some friends last night for dinner. It was around dinner time so the wait was kinda long maybe around 40-50 minutes . I wasn't too hungry so I shared the tour of Italy with my friend. The dish came with three different pastas so you got to try a little of everything. I didn't really enjoy much of it except for the Alfredo. The pasta and the sauce was so sweet and creamy it was super delicious ! I cleared that portion of my plate completely! Also it's unlimited soup and salad but don't eat too much of that or else you will get full! Service was good but overall it wasn't to special for me.
author: Vanessa L.

description:
Came here for their soup and salad special. The carpets smelled funny once we were seated. The soup was OK, the salad was overly salty because of the salad dressing and the bread sticks were just plain small loaves of bread. Had to order the second bowl of salad with dressing on the side. The bread sticks were not good enough to ask for more. The soup was pretty good but small shallow bowl.

When it came time to go, no one would take the bill except for the waiter who was helping us. Try to waive down the hostess, but she kept ignoring us until it was apparent to her that we weren't going to stop until she did, but still wouldn't take it.
author: M C.

description:
After a day of shopping, I wanted to have a quick lunch date with my mom. Upon greeting, I asked if we could be seated in a booth - the restaurant was pretty empty, so I thought there might be one available. The woman told us to wait a moment and ran off to check before we had a chance to say that we didn't mind sitting at a table if there was a wait for a booth. While she was gone, another host politely took us. The previous host saw him leading us elsewhere and seemed annoyed and came over and scolded us for apparently not waiting while a booth for us was being cleaned. We explained that we didn't mind a table and she scoffed before walking off and letting the other host seating us. 

Waited ten minutes for our server, Matt, to finally come by. We were all ready to order by the time he came. Took another ten minutes for our requested water to come, and then our lemonades. 

Other tables with larger groups that were seated after us were being taken care of a lot faster. And no sign of bread sticks... Finally I asked him if there were still serving the bread sticks and he explained that they came out when the salad did. Okay cool, another fifteen minutes of waiting. However, the table next to us got their breadsticks when their water came out. 

The food eventually came out, and the pasta was bland. Not nearly enough sauce so it was really stiff. They gave us a basket of two breadsticks.... Uh, they're supposed to be endless, so why the stinginess?

No sign of Matt for the entire meal - so it was fun waiting for the bill, too...

All in all, staff collectively seemed burnt out and irritable - I've had better service at McDonalds than here. Which is unfortunate because we used to love coming here when the previous manager was still around. Oh and, another waiter forgot his little stand of dishes, so sitting next to a pile of dirty dishes throughout the meal was super cute. Never coming back.
author: Michelle K.

description: This was an all right location - had better, had worse. Everything on the soups, salads, and bread sticks meal was pretty standard, although the soups seemed a bit runny the last time. The staff was timely and courteous. All in all, not a bad experience.
author: Kurt C.

description: Came back to give olive garden a second chance, still no peach in my bellini peach iced tea and across the room 2 guys received peach on theirs, I'm guessing it depends who is your waitress, still very sweet i had to water it down. Salad was better this time not soggy and the soup was just liquidy not that many potatoes or sausage in the toscana.  Waitress was nice but it still took a long time to get just water or any refills without me asking for it.
author: Jennifer R.

description:
Aside from the occassional dirty utensils and napkins, you seriously can't beat the all you can eat options here :) 

After 3 bowls of soup, 3 plates of salad, and 10 breadsticks, I call it quits.  BUT, I always ask for more so I can take it home and do it all over again ... (usually just the bread...salad would get soggs)  The all you can eat pasta is only worth it if you can finish 2 bowls..and then get the 3rd to go O__O .. portions are pretty big.  The toscana soup is my favorite.  Just tried the new Chicken gnocchi and didn't like it.  Toscana is a little salty tho... but cheap tastes sooo delicious..!

I'll admit, the amount of tip I leave depends on how many of those HEAVENLY andes mints they give me.  One waiter gave me a whole container filled with it after I told him that was the highlight of my meal... you knoooow I doubled his tip!  He even faked me out by giving me two... then saw my sad expression...then pulled out the container he was hiding behind him and dumped all the mints on my bill.  Quite entertaining :) (... I'm easily entertained...)

Eat here for the all you can eat options.
author: Kat C.

description:
Two words to describe today's Olive Garden visit - big disappointment!!!
Appetizers - deep fried calamari, ravioli and zucchini tasted like they were cooked several days before, were very dry and luke warm, same as the rest of the food. My salmon was overcooked and very dry, americano coffee had no flavor and cold.
One star for desert and one star to the server, who was nice.
author: Elena M.

description: According to my aunt, who is an old and loyal costumer in the past 3 years, the new menu has reduced the amount of seafoods and meat in some classic dishes. But that $25 for two is pretty impressive, and they tastes really good in my tongue.Wish I can have dinner there some time.
author: Jacob S.

description: Had a wonderful dinner with my honey today. Our waiter , not very sure his name, was amazing. The best experience at Olive Garden in the last couple years. The food was fab as well. Thank you. And im so sorry i can't remember the name of our server. My hubby thinks is Alex, but not sure . ( asian , tall, great knowledge and great server  )
author: Elena K.

description:
"mine looks worse than yours."

- my sister's comment half way through the meal with a disheartened look of dinnertime failure.

i burst out laughing. at that point you just have to laugh.

this was one of those situations where i left a restaurant feeling angry rather than satisfied. angry after eating?! thats pretty much foodie blasphemy. perhaps i was being punished for going to a chain :-/ 

great, so this is my fault? now im even more pissed off.

located in the mall near SFSU, it was absolute madness around 7pm this past sunday nite. graduations have been going on...oops...poor choice of location. chevys next door was no better. rather than waiting for a buzzer, we opted to be vultures in the lounge area where its first come, first serve. 

the intent (and typically safe bet) was to eat modestly and economically with the soup, salad and breadsticks. no longer advertised on the menu (at least here) but still offered...with the outrageous price of $11 something. not sure where that came from because i remember it being around $8. Im not paying nearly the same price as an entree for 2/3 of the items that come included in a regular meal (and yes, unlimited as well). sooo...i quickly flipped my choice to the chicken marsala for $5 more.

hello lean cuisine meal. no joke. it tasted EXACTLY like a lean cuisine meal. the 3 pieces of chicken had a strange manufactured appearance of chicken nugget form and the potatoes were overcooked and dried out. 

my sisters apricot chicken meal was abnormally bright and factory-like, same manufactured chicken, undercooked, stringy, ends not cut asparagus. she said the minestrone soup was heavily tomato-y and over salted.

bread sticks were smaller, dry, over salted, in a plastic basket with paper lining.

is this all due to being in a college area where starving students dont give a damn?

salad was fine. horray they havent messed that up. service, though a bit discombobulated, was attentive and good enough.

--

my sister and i split the bill...paying for our younger brother...and each paid $32 with tip.
 
$64 for a dinner for 3 thats comparable to lean cuisine. appalling. all of us took about 1/2 out food to go and my sis and i left our meals with our brother. 

which, sadly, didnt feel like much of a nice gesture :-/
author: Heather W.

description: These five stars are Mustafa our server. The little group of female servers who huddle around the front desk only chatted amongst themselves and did not greet our group warmly when are arrived. Mustafa totally turned things around for us, he greeted us with a huge smile, offered us drinks and explained the specials to us. We are a large group with several kids and he never lost patience nor did he show any exasperation. He is too good of a server for Olive Garden!
author: Audrey I.

description:
Our second venture to Olive Garden, and it could be our last...at least for a while. A very long while.

Came here for dinner on a Monday night with my family since we were undecided on where to go. Wifey wanted somewhere close and inexpensive, and not our usual Asian cuisine faire. 

Had to comply so we headed to Stonestown. Approximately twenty minute wait and we were happily seated. Our very "happy" server was at least very friendly and helpful...so no issues there. Our issues came later in terms of food quality.

I had the Chicken Parmigiana while the wifey and my two sons had the Four Cheese Pastachetti with Sauages. What the heck is a Pastachetti? Is that even a real Italian dish? I'm too lazy to google it. 

While waiting for our main dish, our server gave us the ubiquitous unlimited bowl of salad and some warm breadsticks. Nothing special here since it's the typical all-you-can-eat and fill-em-up-with-carbs type of food that leaves you full yet unsatisfied. 

When our main dish arrived, my Chicken Parmigian looked like two breaded bricks that could probably double as hockey pucks. It also came with some pasta and sauce that tasted like it came from a can. I had a sample of the Pastachetti and it tasted like Pastash*tty. I also sampled the sausage and wasn't impressed with the casing. It felt dry and was masked by the sauce it was drowned in.

I noticed the advertisement on their coasters boasted their cooks attended The Culinary Institute of Tuscany. Change Tuscany into Baloney and that should be a more accurate description of their food.
author: John G.

description:
The service here is horrible - 

The waitress took forever to greet us, and she told us her shift was over.

So another waitress came over greeted us, and took our drink order, and then came back to take our order after the drinks came out.  About twenty minutes had passed by then and still no breadsticks.

Our salad came out shortly, and then our appetizer's came out with the entrée.

Why would I want my appetizer with my entrée, and after my salad - seriously someone needs to buy multiple clues, and the manager needs to be replaced as does the serving staff, and the kitchen staff.

I will not be returning to this location - to many problems here.
author: Kevin W.

description:
I really wish a new restaurant took over this location. I have lived near by for the past 3 years but have only been here twice because it really isn't anything special. There is always a long wait to get a table and you can't call in to make a reservation. The person judging how long it will take to be seated has always been wrong. Last time I was here our waitress didn't come take our order till 30 mins after we were seated. Towards the end of our meal it took us about 20 mins after we asked for our check to actually receive it because she "met up with an old friend at the bar." 
Olive garden just runs on their own time, and doesn't like to take yours into consideration.
So don't come here if you are hungry or have somewhere to be after your meal.
author: Lissette V.

description:
My friend and I came here about a week ago for dinner.  The wait was about 45 minutes for us so we decided to walk around the mall a little and came back a little early so we can feel the buzzer go off.

We sat down in the back area and took some time with the menu because we didn't know what to get.  Our server Stellar helped us out when it came to picking our meal and she made some awesome suggestions.

We had the stuffed chicken with penne pasta instead of mashed potatoes and some of the small plates on the side to share.  Service was fantastic and food tasted pretty good. (I wasn't too fond of the breadsticks because they tasted a little overdone, but dass koo.)

Skipped dessert (although we were eyeing the chocolate donut thingy) and left incredibly full.
author: Eleanor E.

description:
Ohhhh....where to start. The service was horrible!!!! We've been many times and usually get great waiters who make for an enjoyable meal. Our server tonight just sucked....this review was from the last time I went and decided not to send it but saved it. 

...now it's been months and surprise surprise...their customer service is still horrible!!!  The sad part is we just walked in the front door.  It's 3/22/14 and 9:26pm....dear hostess girl standing in the middle with the braids...watch your tone and attitude. Because of you we left, it's not what you say but how you say it...also try smiling. We're now at McDonald's where the people are always so nice!!!
author: hac h.

description: Good quality was good, service was terrible, and no mint at the end. The server, Benjamin, spilled soup on my shoes , I let that go. But the mint was the last straw for him. I asked for a mint for my kid up front and they told me to hunt down the server . I just said thanks you but no. Than I left. I really wouldn't go back here anymore
author: Karl B.

description:
Why is this place still in business?

I miss the old Chevy's where while still not the best food was cheap and fun. This place is neither cheap nor fun. Stonestown recently remodeled the exterior of a few restaurants here and the outside of Olive Garden was for the better. The food quality however has gotten worse year after year. 

Came to Olive Garden to eat with friends. We were seated as a party of six. The server took our appetizer orders and brought out the drinks and breadsticks (my favorite part of the meal) 

I ordered the Seafood Alfredo thinking it would taste good. When it came it, it was bland and tasteless. It looked like food I could order from Safeway and just microwave; sadly, it also tasted that way. All my other friends thought this way and a few of us were unable to finish the food. 

With so many authentic italian restaurants in San Francisco, me thinks you should definitely stay away from this nasty chain.
author: Casey N.

description:
First time ever at Olive Garden, and I have to admit I had low expectations because I had heard bad things. BUT thankfully, those rumors were wrong! Food was great, waiter was great! No wait! Great atmosphere, everyone seems to be enjoying themselves. Great staff, very friendly! 

I recommend stopping by at least once if you're not high strung on what Italian food should be and want some Italian food but don't want to burn a hole in your pocket.
author: Charlene P.

description: I went here and ordered the garden salad, which I was unaware was the free salad they give to everyone. I didn't think I should pay for it because everyone else at my table had the salad for free and some middle aged dude with glasses was being very rude trying to justify himself.
author: Courtney A.

description: Was a few months back for the first time ever in an Olive Garden (this one was in Flagstaff) which was a pleasant experience our server was perfect. This time we decided to go in SF to the outlet. The service and quality were totally different. Wrong orders,oily food and dry pasta.  We won't come back here.
author: C S.

description:
I have been here more than a few times and the service is horrible.

I don't know if the servers are having a hard life or if the manger verbally abuses them or something but they are always so cranky!

I have been snapped at more than a few times since coming here.  I don't know if it is because I look like a teenager they hate me but I am a good tipper. I swear!

Why do I even go back?
author: Julia Q.

description:
I haven't been to Olive Garden in over a decade. But my former roommate is obsessed, and so when I moved back to San Francisco and called her up to hang out, we ended up here because she lives across the bay, where there is no Olive Garden nearby.

It was pretty packed for a Sunday at 5:30 PM... the host said it would be a 40 min wait, but he told us that we were free to sit at the bar, and if we wanted, we could order directly from there and skip the line. So of course we did that. We got a tall table to ourselves in the bar area, where it was a little quieter and the clientele was slightly older, while everyone else had to wait half an hour for their tables.

Roommate's frozen margarita was very, very strong and worth the $5. My cranberry-orange wine spritzer was much less so, but since I was designated driver, I was glad that it wasn't very strong. And for $4, what more could you ask for? Our food arrived quickly (REALLY quickly), the breadsticks were burning hot and delicious, the portions were large, and our server (Michael D, according to our receipts) was wonderfully attentive.

I mean... I've had better (and less salty) food. Who hasn't? But this Olive Garden delivered well tonight, and I might not wait another 15 years before coming back.
author: Sharon L.

description:
If you have read my review on Cheesecake Factory, you all know my love for chain restaurants. So on a rainy night when we decided to go to Olive Garden for dinner, I was extremely excited! However, what I didn't know was my excitement was soon to be killed by the waitress...

The Wait:
We arrived at around 9:05pm on a rainy Saturday night. The place was still very much happening. The host told us the wait should be around 25 minutes. However, after 40 minutes, we were still waiting. So we decided that since we have already been waiting for so long, let's wait a bit more to get a better table at the inner section of the restaurant.

This may have been the wrong move because we were literally the last people to be seated in the restaurant! There were other people who came after us but were able to get a table before us in the section we requested. After about an hour wait, we finally got a table...(sigh)

The "Diet Coke" Incident:
As soon as we sat down, the waitress came to our table with a bottle of wine and put it on our table and proceeded to ask if we wanted any drinks. We thought it was weird to bring a bottle of wine for no reason but we gave her our drink order of one diet coke (bf) and one Strawberry Fresco ($7.75).

When the drink came, my Strawberry Fresco looked nothing like the one in the menu's picture but, I know, the picture is always better so no surprise there. 

My bf took a sip of the coke and asked "Is this diet (he ordered a diet)?." The waitress replied, "No, it should be regular. Let me check." She went back and returned with a new coke. My bf took another sip and said "it's still regular coke" but before we were able to say anything, the waitress had left. 

When the waitress returned with salad and bread sticks, my bf said, "I would like a diet coke and these two are both regular." The waitress then said, "oh! I thought you wanted regular. Let me go get a diet one." So now we have 2 cokes on the side of the table, which we didn't know why she didn't take them away with her.

As we waited, a waiter came to us holding a new coke and asked, "you want regular, right?" My bf and I both laughed and didn't understand why they couldn't get a simple order right. So the waiter went back and finally got a diet coke and asked if we wanted to keep the regular cokes. We said no of course and for some reason, our waitress was no where to be found...

The "Water" Incident
So we also ordered water from our waitress. Another waiter came and he actually didn't know where the water was for. So he asked a table and they said no. The waiter then asked a guy behind us who was just about to sit down. He said "I just got here; I didn't ordered it. It must be for them (pointing at us)." Guess what happened next? The waiter didn't believe the guy so he puts down the water at his table and RAN away! The guy and us were laughing and brought the water to our table.

The Food
To be honest, the food was mediocre at best. I had Chicken & Shrimp Carbonara ($18.50) and bf had Stuffed Chicken Marsala ($17.50). I know they are not known for their food but we could totally had a better time and food at I Luv Teriyaki (please go read that review). 

The best part of the entire meal was the bread stick and salad...

The Service (need I say more?)
While we were eating, we found out the reason why our waitress brought the wine bottle to our table. Apparently, she was supposed to ask us if we wanted to try it on the house. We learned this by watching the waiter who brought us the correct coke asking people at his table. So yeah, our waitress just decided not to do any of that stuff with us...

By the way, we were both really nice through out this ordeal. We never got angry or raised voices. Basically I think the waitress ruined my very first Olive Garden experience.

The only way I would go back to this place is 1) not getting the same waitress (even that, I would choose another restaurant first) or 2) being blindfolded and taken to this place without my consent.  

Am I being too harsh? I don't think so. I was a waitress once and when you make mistakes, you drop everything and you fix it--not sending another waiter to fix it. Additionally, you should never assume because we all know it will only make an ass out of you and me!
author: Alice L.

description: Why did I come here?  Long wait for mediocre food. We never received our breadsticks, had to ask repeatedly for ketchup. Pasta was okay, not enough sauce. How do you have kids menus with activites in them with out crayons?
author: Jmarania M.

description:
I hate how there's a million people waiting outside aaaall the time. And when you need a table for 2, you need to grab the attention of one of the hostesses who are super occupied with their own conversations.. and then be told it'll take from 1hr-1.5hrs. I look inside, and theres a few tables empty. This pisses me off!! Really??

Also.. their menu? Maybe it's just me, but nothing really appeals to me. They have the regular things you'd expect to see at any Italian restaurant, and I had the Stuffed Chicken Marsala. Too bad I can't review on what it tastes like, because I didn't even eat any of it. It took 30 minutes to come and by the time it came, I was already full off my soup and breadsticks.

No, I will never return here, even if someone invited AND is treating.
author: Athena L.

description: We are BIG Olive Garden fans. After 3 bad experiences with Olive Garden in Stonestown we stopped going for  quite a long time. We figured it was time to give it another try. We are so happy we did! Our server was amazing and the food was amazing. We found out they changed managers. What a difference we will be regulars again!!!!
author: Penny P.

description: This is one of my favorite restaurants when it comes to pasta.  Food is really great! Service is great too! They are friendly and know how to provide the needs of customer. Super recommended
author: Jamie Q.

description: Food is good. This is about the Hostesses at the front desk. There were 5 of them standing around the podium gossiping and eating McDonalds!! It was very unprofessional and embarrassing, also gross. Get it together ladies!
author: Cherie N.

description: Since my last review of Olive Garden was roughly 5 years ago, I thought I'd update you all of recent experiences with Olive Garden.  Sine 2010, I have been introduced to the likes of authentic Italian Cuisine in Italy.  Specifically Rome, yes I said Rome, Italy!  Now I guess some would think it's unfair to compare authentic pasta to Olive Garden and maybe it is but since my palette has been upgraded, I find it that the restaurant I once thought of as "fancy cuisine" is now more of a last resort. Where do I begin though? The pasta is a bit too salty as I usually order the creamy pasta and I can honestly say that I enjoy their Zuppa Toscana over anything else.  The breading on the calamari didn't have flavor their sirloin pasta was less than average. Actually, the sirloin was the only enjoyable part of the meal. The pasta sauce tasted and smelled of bananas.  It's sad because i used to look forward to coming here when I was in middle school.  I guess now that I have experienced better food, my taste buds have grown picky...
author: Shelly W.

description:
If it weren't for their dam* All-u- can-eat Soup/Salads, I'd skip this place for italian and head to north beach. but the price is right and i do love their salad. 
The waiter we had was overbearing "Are you okay" every 3-4minutes lol @_@
author: Miss J.

description: One of the best olive gardens i have ever been to food came out fast and it was cooked to perfection. Also the server gave me and my girlfriend two orders of fettuccine alfredo to take home,  on the house. I would be coming here more often
author: Simran ..

description: Very very happy with the service . Ordered chicken and gnnochi, house salad, some starter set, shrimp alfredo and chicken carbonara, 2 unlimited drinks.. came out to 62 dollars.. and considering the amount that came in.... its TOTALLY worth it!!!will come for more!!!
author: Kevin A.

description:
DO BE ALARMED BY ALL THE 1 stars popping up! This Olive Garden has gone downhill :( Why pay $15-$20 per dish here? Overpriced for what they offer.

My Parmesan Crusted Tilapia was so, so, terribly bad. It seemed a more healthy option amongst all the carb loaded pasta dishes with its oven baked white fish and angel hair pasta mixed with veggies. Whoever is in control of the seafood station in the kitchen needs to be replaced! I haven't had such an awful dining experience in a while. The parmesan crust tasted as plain as cardboard. A little salt at least would have been nice. It wasn't actually a nice "crust" either, more like a dry and easily broken coating more like it. I regret not sending it back but having heard my fair share of restaurant horror stories I suppose its better i didn't.

I'm disappointed. Now i remember why my family tries to avoid chain restaurants! We used to come to Olive Garden regularly when i was younger and my elementary school would host fundraisers here. It's unfortunate we left dissatisfied.
author: Samantha L.

description: I love their chocolate mousse cake it is a MUST TRY. If you like Alfredo sauce I suggest asking for a side just of the sauce to dip your fresh baked bread to it. Whats really popular their is the Zuppa Toscana Soup YUMMM. Overall service and quality is pretty good. I will definitely go back. Sometimes the restaurant gets pretty packed especially on weekdays too so get their early so you dont have to wait long. After 8pm take forever to get a seat. BUT the food is good : D
author: Jaclyn B.

description: Service is a hit or miss! But I'm always satisfied with what I order. I love their endless bread sticks and soup!
author: Alyssa C.

description: Came here for lunch with one of my friends. We got the 2 for $25 deal! First, we started off with salad(unlimited). There was soup but we wanted salad to start off fresh. Breadsticks came along too and they were also unlimited. I really like their breadsticks. Then, we had the entree with two of the same dishes which was some kind of shrimp pasta(it was alright) maybe I'll try the chicken alfredo next time and we ended it with a slice of cheesecake. Btw, the service was pretty good. Must get this deal because it's so worth it!
author: Michelle C.

description: Horrible service! waited an hour just to pay !!
author: Jazmyne G.

description: Good family restaurant, but the long service and wait time are just not worth it.  A meal with appetizers, soup/salad, entrees and dessert normally takes about an hour and 1/2 for our family to complete took 3-1/2 hours at the Olive Garden... Just too long for a family restaurant.  P.S.  refill on sodas, bread sticks and salad were never offered during the 3-1/2 hours at the restaurant
author: J K.

description:
As a warning, I'm not really a fan of chain restaurants, but their breadsticks are just too delicious! I could seriously fill up on their unlimited soup, salad, and breadsticks option and leave satisfied.

It was my coworker's birthday, so we made 11:45am reservations on a Monday for 10 people. However, upon our arrival, we still had to wait about 5-10 minutes to be seated. Granted, they were pretty busy with the holiday season and being attached to the Stonestown Mall, but we had reservations!

Once we were seated, the manager greeted us and introduced the two waiters who would be taking care of us. I thought that was a nice courtesy... Anyways, I ordered the Venetian Apricot Chicken (trying to be healthy) and salad with the dressing on the side. They brought out breadsticks while we waited for our food. When they brought out the salad, they brought it undressed and the dressing in a bowl with a spoon since a couple of us ordered it on the side. They brought out the soups at the same time and once we finished up, they promptly brought out the entrees.

My dish was a small 3-4oz chicken breast accompanied by steamed broccoli and asparagus. Although it may sound bland, the sauce was quite good. I cleaned my plate and even dipped my breadstick in the sauce!
