There was a lull in our meal when they ran out of breadsticks and we had to wait for them to bake more... It was probably a good 5-10 minutes before they arrived at our table. 

Anyways, when our bill arrived, we all pitched in with a (probably annoying) combination of gift cards, cash, and credit cards. The waitress was nice and patient with us and we were out of there in a timely manner.
author: Leana L.

description: I love the place. BUT, I think it is very unprofessional for the employees that are females that wear yoga pants to work.
author: Kimberlie G.

description: Very bad service, waited at my table for 25min until I got up to ask for service. I saw the Mannager glance at our table but never showed her face, when requested. Horrible experience will never come again
author: Edgar L.

description:
I was in here yesterday for a quick bite in between Gymboree and trader joes. I sat in the bar area, it took awhile for our server to come greet us when he did I immediately asked for a water and ordered a drink. After being in the service industry for 15 years I could tell immediately our sever was overwhelmed. I felt really bad for him so I tried to make it easier by ordering as quickly as possible. The fastest thing possible. soup and salad. (Lunch) I also had a small child with me who was sleeping so I was in a bit of a hurry to eat. 
I received the water about 3 to 4 minutes later and was told my drink would be arriving shortly. 15 minutes later I had to get up and ask the bartender myself. She was nice and got it for me even though it didn't come from behind the bar and also refilled my water. Service was slow and could have been better had our server had some help. What really bothered me was that his coworkers about 3 to 4 of them were standing around , dressed in uniform, talking and eating. Two of them who were sitting down to lunch at the bar table obviously off the clock and others who came up to visit them  and who were clearly still working. (If you can call it that) these coworkers were dressed in uniform, talking to the two that wee eating and picking off their plates. I wonder what kind of service their tables were getting??? There was also another girl who was wearing  a different color apron, overweight who had her hair dark hair pulled back who was shoving breadsticks in her mouth and laughing. She was also make movements like a charging bull. I didn't get a picture of her I wish I did she was the worst.
author: Sabrina M.

description: Closest and Only location near me in SF.. my friends and I get random cravings for Olive Garden and when we do it is very convenient to go to the mall and get some. The wait usually doesn't exceed 10 minutes which is good.. the waitstaff is friendly... and the food is "olive garden"..
author: Tiff C.

description:
Once upon a time, I ordered a pitcher of Sangria with my dinner.  Of course, I could not finish it.  The pitcher was still pretty full when it was time to go.

Five stars for packing that Sangria in a large beverage container to take home!
author: Yasmin E.

description:
I would have given 0 stars if I could, but since one is the least I can do, it's the least I can do.

I came with a friend around 7:15 for dinner. We had to wait around 15 minutes for a table. Once we were seated our waiter quickly comes by and asks us if we would like to sample their house wine, and after we agree he then cards us. I feel he should have asked if we were of age then ask for the sample. I don't understand that train of questions that he chose with the wine.....anyways, the wine was nasty! I've had better wine  elsewhere. The wine was very very warm and I just didn't like how it tasted. 

My friend and I came because I wanted to try the special three course dinner for $13, but apparently that promotion ended. We chose the dinner for two special for $25 instead. The deal comes with EITHER appetizer OR dessert, and the choice of two entrees including the unlimited soup or salad and breadsticks. My friend and I chose the garlic chicken and the shrimp visuvio. I would say the chicken Alfredo was the best dish of the night. The chicken was the best part! The noodles...we're good but I felt the cream sauce was a little on the salty side. The shrimp visuvio was alright, nothing special.  You get a lot of little shrimps which was not too bad. The pasta noodles were a mystery though, they were like regular spaghetti noodles with striations on them. They were a little strange to me.....and the waiter said the shrimp dish was spicy, which I was excited to hear because I love spicy food. When I ate though, I was not feeling any sweat at all. Very disappointing. 

Onto the dessert now. I had asked the waiter what the triple chocolate strata was and he did not know so he went to the back to ask. He came back with the description of a cake that can be bought anywhere! A chocolate cake with frosting? Really? Can you not at least sell the product? When I see triple chocolate, I want to hear that it's made with fudge or with dark chocolate mixed with a German chocolate filling or something! Not just a chocolate cake with frosting.....my friend and I went with the tiramisu after hearing that lame excuse of a triple chocolate cake. BAD CHOICE. The tiramisu was probably a frozen cake from Costco cut into a 3x3 cake. It was not rock hard but it was pretty icy when my friend and I ate it. I would have preferred to just get it from Costco if I knew I was going to be eating Costco tiramisu. 

I was overall, not satisfied at all with my visit. I guess once its Olive Garden, I shouldn't expect much since its a chain but is till expected something better. The wait time was crazy between dishes and I did not like how our waiter kept coming by asking us how we were doing. If I need you, I will call for you. Don't bother me while I'm eating and enjoying a friend's company. 


C
author: Alex T.

description:
When in the area and boyfriend and I feel like pasta we'd come here. Breadsticks are still to die for and soups are great. The pasta has been hit and miss, some visits it's good and some visits it's not so good - pasta would be a little undercooked or there would be too much sauce to pasta ratio.

Service friendly and consistent.
author: Kathryn Y.

description: I come here before work for a snack. Friendly staff, good food at a reasonable price. Fast service and great music.
author: Donna S.

description:
I tried making reservations one day early; however, the hostess said that they don't take more than 5 reservations a night. I was told that if I show up an hour early I'd be able to get a table. 

The following day, I showed up an hour early and they told me the wait would be about 2 hours. Okay, I can deal with that. 

2 hours later they tell us that they're setting up our table. Turns out that they straight-up lied. Who does this? Are they incompetent?

20 minutes later, they attempt to seat us; however, the tables were not set-up properly (they decided to seat us while they were setting it up, WTF?). The GM came out and assured us that they were setting up another table for us somewhere else. We sat and waited even longer until we were transferred to another table. 

Service is lacking. I won't be going back to Olive Garden.
author: Iroquois S.

description: The service is despicable. We were seated at approximately 5:30, ordered at 5:40, and most of my party was served their food by 6:00. Except for my mom whom did not receive her food at all. By the time everyone else was finished eating, around 6:20, the server (who, by the way, only appeared to take our orders and bring us some of our food) came and said that she would package my mom's food in a to-go box. She never even gave us any refills on our drinks which were all empty a few minutes after our food arrived. Nowhere to be seen, she then sent another waiter to deliver our bill. Luckily, the manager was very accomodating and took that plate off of the bill. We still have yet to see her again though, which I don't mind but is of extremely bad manners on her part. We will not be returning after this horrible encounter with the service.
author: Preciosa M.

description: service is terrible! it takes them like an hour to just bring the water and appetizers. Only had 2 stars for the good Alfredo fettuccine and the complimentary chocolate mints also totally recommend the zoupa toscana. unlimited refills for soup!!
author: Alexis S.

description:
Will & Grace's irritating friends from New Jersey, Rob and Ellen, may have a point about the lure of Olive Garden. That's because the Robs and Ellens of the world flock here in droves in their SUVs.

It all comes down to the Zuppa Toscana, a creamy soup with spicy sausage, potatoes and kale. Oh, and the so-buttery-you-feel-arteries-clogging breadsticks. Neither would pass the requirements of the Zone diet, but there is something to be said for all-you-can-eat options. Unlimited salad, soup and breadsticks for $6.95 until 4PM. It may be worth risking the hairpin turns on Upper Market just to waddle on over to the Stonestown Shopping Center where it is. The rest of the food is typical and frankly non-descript. But you'll get plenty of whatever it is you order.

The thing that has to go is the irritating motorized buzzer the hostess gives you when there is a line of people waiting for tables. It's too big to put in a pants pocket unless I'm really glad to see you. And if you venture too far into the Borders bookstore (where else are you going to wait?), it gives off an irritating, Gestapo-type noise to scold you for being out of range. People stare and not for a good reason. Clearly Big Brother is watching..or at least keeping tabs on you lest you escape without telling Him. Expect to wait an hour at dinner time.

FOOD - 3 stars...two words, repeat after me...Zuppa Toscana 
AMBIENCE - 2.5 stars...a Tuscan villa envisioned by Wal-Mart
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...always nice but rather android-like
OVERALL - 3 stars
author: Ed U.

description: There is a reason Olive Garden has hung in there while other restaurants have not.  Their food is excellent, the atmosphere pleasant, and the service outstanding.  That was my recent experience just this afternoon when I stopped in for lunch at the Stonestown restaurant.  Their eggplant parmigiana is on a par with what I have been served in North Beach.  The wine was a good Italian, and well paired with my food.  I am glad I chose Olive Garden and will return very soon.
author: Steven Z.

description:
It was almost 15+ years  since I came here.
It will not be coming back! A server didn't come to us for almost 15-20 minutes. Then took another 30 + minutes to get my food. When the order came- it was not was I had ordered . Then another 45 minutes passed after repeatedly telling the waitress what happened to our food. Finally when the food came it was horrible. My frozen fettuccine Alfredo from trader joes tasted better. Chicken Parmesan  was like deep fried rubber.  The manager ended up not charging for my food. But it was a waste of our evening. I got my dinner at 10:30 pm and we left the restaurant hungry.   I would not come back. Bad service and bad quality food.
author: Arshia S.

description: If only if I could put a negative 1 I'll put it! Just HORRIBLE service! And it takes too long for our order to arrive!!!
author: Trinah M.

description:
Excellent job Dominic!!!
He was able to provide great service eventhough it was very busy at the bar!!!
author: Ji P.

description:
Mom and I were craving some pasta on a Friday night. We expected to wait a good hour for a seat so there were no surprises when they said I'd be 40-50 minutes, To kill time, we just went shopping in the mall.

We decided to split two dishes. We got the Capellini di Mare ($18.50): shrimp,clams, and mussels in white wine, garlic and a zesty marinara sauce served over capellini and topped with fresh basil and Chicken Parmigiana ($15.75): parmesan- breaded chicken breasts, friend and topped with marinara sauce and mozerella cheese. Served with spaghetti.

The food was not fresh. It really did felt like they just threw it in a microwave or oven.

Service isn't known to be too great here and I tried to cut my waitress some slack but in the end, she still disappointed. Our bread came out late, she refilled it once (one plus) but wasn't friendly and did small things that I thought was rude. She also opened up the bill right in front of us as we were leaving. Can't you just wait until we're not looking?

A few months ago my friends brought me here for my birthday and service was even worse. I know we were a bigger party but they were completely disrespectful and the waiter told us some people's meals weren't bottomless soup or salad when at the time, clearly the menu stated it was indeed bottomless. The waiter's response? The menu is wrong. How could a menu be wrong? He ended up giving bottomless to the people who's meals didn't include it. And one of my friend's pasta came out completely cold.

Summary:
Service isn't great. Food isn't fresh. Not worth the wait with so many other food options around here. Way too expensive for the quality of food.
author: Lauren K.

description:
I didn't get a chance to write a review but back on October 30, 2012, I celebrated my parents 41st Anniversary. We had mentioned to the restaurant that we were celebrating 41 years of love and my parents wanted to eat at the Olive Garden.

Later on that night, the manager came out and paid for both my mom and dad's meal. We did not expect this at all.  What a class act from the Garden and the Manager. Its little things like this that makes my parents including myself loyal to the Olive Garden. Thank you!!! 

Sincerely, 
Juan
author: Juan P.

description: This place is awful. You wait an hour to be seated and you also wait an extra hour to pick up the food even you paid online and selected the time for pick up.  For pick up, the food is always cold. Never again olive garden.
author: David L.

description: I am a huge Olive Garden fan. I love italian food and have been to many different Olive Garden restaurants. The reason I'm leaving a review today is because at this particular Olive Garden my kid left her brand new hoodie and was devastated (we live 2 hours away) I called when we got home and the assistant manager Gary told me he would "guard it with his life" until we were able to make the trip back to get it. 3 weeks later we showed up, Gary wasn't there but had left the hoodie in the capable hands of another manager Mike who returned the hoodie to my kid. Not many restaurants would do this in my opinion so thank you SO MUCH Gary & Mike for being awesome people!
author: Jessica C.

description:
Me and the wife went here last night at around 5:00PM. There was a little wait of about 15-20 minutes. We were seated and served by Josh. He was efficient, friendly and attentive. We went with the special (2 for $25.00) The wife had the breaded chicken and I had the chicken alfredo. We started out with the salad (I like ranch dressing which was served on the side) and limitless bread sticks. The entries came out after our second helping of salad. The dishes were flavorful. We opted for tiramisu for dessert which was served cold which I like/
The service was fantastic and I tipped 20% which was not bad since the bill was only $39.00.
In the old days, I did not like coming here because the food sucked and there were no specials but now things have changed so I am back.
After we left the wait was an hour and 20 minutes so I would strongly recommend coming out before 5:00PM.
author: jack d.

description: This is not my first time In this olive garden, actually, is my 5th time, but, im really dissapounted with this one... We ordered the 4 courses fiesta italiana, it was me and my husband, and my little daugther, husband food he says was ok, but mine was just HORRIBLE! im sorry,  BUT THATS THE CORRECT WORD TO DESCRIBE MY FOOD!  I ask sor the rissotto bites. And they came in a dirty sauce plate, they were cold and I cant taken with the fork, was too hard to chewed too, HORRIBLE, HORRIBLE! Then my entree was the fettuchine alfredo with chicken, that was even worse! It came a small portion of the pasta and three freaking slices of chicken, without salt and NO flavor! When I used to came here I always ordered the same thing and was delicious, creamy, and with a lot of flavor, thi one was dry, and it looks that they did it well but probably they leave it a long time waiting to ba served and they arrive to my table cold, but thats not all, even my little one who loves pizza, doesnt like the pizza because same thing, was cold and hard, she can chew it, ( she's 2), and plus of that our server, ESME looks like she was rushing us to eat and pay faster, of course I never came back after this terrible experience!
author: Marissa F.

description: James was great! Very attentive and a pleasant person to be around! He got our orders like a pro!
author: Josh M.

description:
This is:
* the place to take a group of people when you don't want to spend a ton of money on food
* not a place to drink wine w/ your meal. They overcharge extremely for very blase wine
* the place to go if you want very uncomplicated food and you just want to talk
author: Kevin F.

description: got the gnocchi and chicken soup came with only two small bites of gnocchi the rest was just creamy. other food was not hot and didn't taste good.
author: Margret B.

description:
I was sick and bedridden a few weeks ago for 3-4 days straight and didn't have much of an appetite the entire time. After enduring a hard day first day back at work upon "feeling better", I must have been delirious when I told my husband I was craving OG's Zuppa Toscana for dinner. Surprised, he asked if I was sure if we wanted to go all the way out there. I confirmed "yes, I'm sure. I'm craving hot soup". I also needed a gift for a friend so it was convenient we were heading out towards the mall. 

The wait was about 20-30 min so we opted to sit at the bar area. But we saw that a table was opened. Score! Those waiting for seats sorta gave us the stink eye because we had just arrived and already snagged table seating. Sorry you snooze, you lose.

We probably had the worst meal of 2011 thus far. We shared The Tour of Italy and it was dry, lacked flavor and there were what looked to be burned marks on our food as it seemed the plate was microwaved a full minute too long. The garlic bread sticks were also flavorless. One would think garlic breadsticks should have a somewhat of a garlicky flavor to them. 

I hadn't been to an OG in a long time and I don't recall their food tasting this terrible! Prices have noticeably shot up and you would think higher prices equal better quality. Wrong. Quality seemed to have changed for the worse. The ONLY decent thing we consumed was the bowl of Zuppa Toscana. But the bowl was piping hot and hit the spot just right for my nasty cold.

Hubs vowed that we wont ever step foot into an OG again. I told him I may have to come back for their soup but hopefully I won't get sick for a long while so we won't have to endure their lackluster food anytime soon.
author: Esther A.

description:
At this point, when you go to The Olive Garden (or, as I like to call it, "The O.G."), you know what to expect. Breadsticks, a great salad, and maybe a passable (but filling) entree of some sort. The breadsticks, salad and soup combo is probably the best reason to go there as adults.

HOWEVER, something I have learned in recent years is that this is a *great* place to have a reasonable sit-down dinner with kids. At least at this particular OG, the wait staff are very friendly to the kids. They're cognizant of bringing entrees faster and handling special orders for kids' dishes. Every time we go, the kids have a great time, I get to have that delicious salad, and the whole experience might cost $35.
author: Chris T.

description:
I came here on my birthday and I ordered the  Lemon Butter Linguni pasta and they made me wait 16 minutes after I ordered that pasta to only give me blank noodles because they forgot to put in the sauce.
So, i had a huge plate of Only Blank noodles.  That's Terrible!!!!  They made my birthday experience very depressing.
author: Sandra L.

description:
UGH. Let me break it down for y'all here:

Our group: 7 people including the birthday girl, gave the host plenty of notice that we were coming and waited patiently to be seated when we got there which we were, Thank goodness. Our 7th person was a half hour late in joining us, knowing this information I assumed this may be the reason that our waiter did not show up to say hello or offer us water, etc. we just WAITED there starving and thirsty. 

The service: Once our 7th person did arrive we finally got a waiter, the usual hustle and bustle of getting us water and, after requesting it 5 times, finally got ONE basket of bread sticks(OH YEAH, I know horrible first world problems right there). Got our orders in, I must say you can always rely on the unlimited soup and salad there. Except on this particular, special visit our salad had no dressing on it. WTF people? I ordered soup and SALAD not soup with lettuce and some veggies with cheese! The rest of our group that ordered entrees did not get their food until AN HOUR later. The waiter decided to voice his personal problems as to why his service was not up to par and OMG TMI DUDE. You need more help? I'm looking for a job like 1,000 others here in the city! I'll start right now! Psssh, please. 

The overall, get-to-the point summary: Go to f***** Chili's for Christ's sake. If you're going to pay money to be waited on, this place will disappoint you. "When you're here, you're family"? HA! I've gotten better treatment at motha-f*ckin' McDonald's I'M LOVIN IT!!!

But hey, if you love their breadsticks, unlimited soup and salad knock yourself out. I just recommend ordering that sheet TO GO.
author: Kerry S.

description:
Bad.  Ok, it's not like Olive Garden was ever a five star creme de la creme dining establishment, but I used to enjoy the occasional visit for the Neverending Pasta Bowl (literally the only time of year I'd visit).  However, yesterday's slow as molasses service combined with the less than mediocre food was just plain bad.

I get it.  Neverending Pasta Bowl, and the crowds flock like it's free.  But this isn't the first time you've offered this event.  Shouldn't you staff your employees accordingly?  Shouldn't you be able to churn out breadstick baskets, bowls of soup and salad, and plates of pasta like a well oiled machine?  One would think.

Took FOREVER for our food to come.  Definitely NOT efficiency at its finest.  We ordered our soup/salad and pasta at the same time, yet waited forever for the soup (how difficult could it be to ladle some soup from a giant pot?), then again forever for the pasta (it's not like they're in the back making each dish from scratch).  And the noodles were barely doused in sauce - what, were they worried they'd run out?  Or how about when I asked for chili flakes and was given a 95% EMPTY shaker?  Even the waiter had a sheepish look on his face when he handed it over (you couldn't take the extra minute to just fill it before passing it to me?) and then said he'd return with more (really, are you surprised he didn't return??).

Bad.  Maybe the painstakingly slow service is a tactic for diners to lose their appetites, so they don't go buckwild with the endless pasta.  Regardless, Neverending Pasta Bowl, you just ain't cutting it anymore.
author: Mel T.

description:
4 Stars because gluttony knows no bounds here. That's me, right here, putting myself on the line by saying that. Anyhow, the service was great -- the waitress that served us was super amazing in terms of just helping me select my wine. 

Then we ordered an entirely unnecessary amount of appetizers (calamari and stuffed mushrooms) because we were hungry, it was lunch and we forgot the delicious salad and bread sticks that came with it. Of course, when the entree arrived we were entirely too full so we had to take it home. Rookie mistake so I advise you NOT to do that. Put all your hunger into the bread sticks and/or salad basket.

Anyhow, I had the Seafood Brodetto and my BF had the Seafood Alfredo. Grant it we didn't taste these parts of the meal till dinner, they were still pretty good. So great service and food that Olive Garden is known for (which isn't the greatest in the first place, but it hits you in a guilty pleasure kind of way).
author: Shauna S.

description: Good food, and the staff was really nice, will come back, my son loves this place more than me.
author: Colleen Y.

description:
Ordered take out twice - once the order was not complete as ordered and was 20 minutes past the promised time I filled out on line. Second time - order not complete again again. Phone in a complaint to the Manager She told me they would send a $25.00 gift card - guess what it never came. 
What's even funny or not the $25.00 basically covered what they forgot to to put in my take out order. So I writing this nasty review in return. 
This is possibly one of the worst Olive Garden experiences I have ever had. Two visits two bad experiences. Never again here!
author: Grant H.

description:
Authenticity is overrated. So what if its not authentic italian food. If it taste good, it taste good. I would go here a handful times a year and im always pleased. Sure the food isn't so good i'm going to tweet about it. I always go for the soup and salad. Zuppa Toscana soup and salad for $6.95 you can't beat that! I also enjoy eating the stuff mushrooms and app sampler with cheese sticks.

Everything I come here i can always expect the level of service that im happy with for the prices that they charge. People are always looking for 5 star food with 1 star prices, good luck. 

In terms of chain food restaurant - Olive Garden is definitely up their on that list.
author: Ryan R.

description:
We came to this newly remodeled Olive Garden with a few friends for a nice Sunday dinner. Our server was Sydney? and she was probably the best server I've ever had at an establishment as busy as Olive Garden when the never ending pasta bowl is the special they're running. 

She had everything to the table in no time... had our plates freshened and our bellies full. 

Having been a waitress for a few years, I know how annoying it is to have a table of 11 request split tabs - but not for Sydney - apparently she wrote down everyone's orders according to numbers and just paired up the couples and had the tabs ready in 2 minutes. Pretty awesome in my book... 

We were told that we were going to have two waitresses as our party was 11 people, (8 adults & 3 kids) but the other girl didn't help do anything but bring random information and stories... lol sorry, no offense. Anywho - Sydney was TOP NOTCH and I hope they post this in their kitchen so that all the other servers can pick up a thing or two from her. 

The food was delish - of course... you can never go wrong with the never ending pasta bowl... however, I was not a fan of the sausage that I ordered with the pasta .... they don't offer chicken anymore with the never ending pasta bowl... so i tried the sausage - not a fan. 

Overall it was great.... really happy to see the new remodeled place. 

Can't wait to go back.
author: Cat G.

description:
I've have visited this place many times over past 10 years.

Their lunch and dinner offers are hard to beat - you can really stuff yourself with various "Italian Cuisine" on a budget. (Word of the advice - don't stuff yourself with a bunch of "bread sticks" - more interesting things will come later ;-)

Quality of food is OK, I cannot say it's best Italian Food in the city - but, when you are meeting bunch of friends, who are not "food junkies" or spoiled with "homemade" pastas and pesto's - don't ever seen anybody complain :-)

Wine selection is so-so, I wish they can offer more local choices.

Service is a hit or miss - sometimes we run into super-nice waitress, that not only does great job - but make us laugh and cheer. Yet, sometimes service seems to be "non-existent" or kind of give us pretty "negative vibe" - usually during those busy "weekend" dinners... Well, we all humans - I guess those guys just over-worked.

Also, please beware that you may have to wait LONG TIME to be seated on weekends for Dinner - it's good idea to get a "pager" and walk around...

Overall, more positive experience thru many times we had lunch or dinner over here.
author: Peter B.

description: The waitress Regina had the soothing voice of an angel, truly. Salad is exceptional, breadsticks slightly stale. All-around a good date night spot for rekindling romance.
author: Lauren P.

description: deja tore it up she  was amazing she made us feel special i really like her my experience at olive garden is so happy and i thank for her for her kindness no negativity or stank attitude. (ahem) not at all. she was cool thank deja promotion for u
author: Kaylie B.

description: Very horrible service, very horrible food. Olive Garden just is t what it used to be. This chain is going down hill and going down hill quickly. My salad was horrible, I could have bought a much better one at the store out of a bag. The waitress lacked the knowledge of the menu And didn't even know if they serve chicken Marsala. Never going back here! Yuck!
author: Jason K.

description:
Olive Garden is pretty good!!

3 Stars not because of bad service or terrible food or anything. I think their food is ok.
I think the only things worth getting are the unlimited stuff: breadsticks, soup, salad, and pasta bowls.

Their pasta dishes are pretty ordinary. Their commercials make it look delicious!

I will still come back to Olive Garden when I'm in the mood for the unlimited stuff ;D
author: Missy W.

description:
Olive Garden is a hit or a miss. It's the place I go for Italian simply because I have yet to find an amazing italian place in the city and is within reasonable driving distance. Eating here, sometimes the food is good, sometimes not so much. Likewise, the service varies tremendously. This past time we went, service was eh since we got stuck with the new guy.

I do like the Zuppa Toscana soup though. Great with the breadsticks.
author: Jessica H.

description:
I don't know what the rest of u dummies are talking about. Ur probably not ordering the right dish.

I went last night to Occupy Olive Garden to order the best dish they got which is the Chicken Alfredo & I ask them to add Broccoli & make the sauce thick & let me tell u, IT'S THE $H¡+!!!
Get crazy & break up some of there awesome breadstick thingies into little pieces & stir it all up in that beast :)

Plus our awesome waitress Alexandria Ball was by far the best personality ever with service to match & it was an all around great visit but becuase of her she made it the best so TIP her HUGE when u get her cuz she's worth it I promise. 

Once again, Mahalo's & Infinite Aloha's to Alexandria B. & Olive Garden for yet another great dinner. Even though I order the exact same thing every time cuz there's no need to test anything out on the menu, it's that good when ordered exactly how the master does it ;)
author: Makana R.

description:
I wouldn't usually review chain restaurants, but this experience was so bad that I needed to.

Don't get the tall, Black, looks high and uninterested and not happy to be serving you, as your waiter.
He will give you cooking oil instead of olive oil if you ask for it because he thinks you're young and can't taste the difference between olive oil and cooking oil.
author: Annamarie G.

description: The food here is basically what you pay for. Salty salad and plain noodles with breadsticks that barely have any flavor. For about $20 a person with unlimited salad and soup it's not bad but if you're looking for good quality food then here is not the place. The waiters were very nice but talked way too fast. Would come back if I'm looking for somewhere to go on a cheap date that my bf doesn't mind the bad food quality and we're just trying to get full
author: Jessica W.

description:
I love their unlimited soup. In my mind, soup is healthy for me no matter how much cream and salt are in it. My favorite is their toscano. Mmmmh. Their breadsticks are warm and soft. The salad is fresh and well tossed.

I am obsessed with their skinny martini. It is so delicious and doesn't taste like alcohol at all yet gives a nice buzz. I hate the taste of alcohol (bad college adventures) but love getting drunk. If all the drinks at bars and clubs tasted like Olive Garden cocktails I would frequent them a lot more. In fact, I've suggested going to Olive Garden to pregame. Ha! Can you imagine a bunch of skimpy clad girls entering a family friendly chain restaurant at 9 pm?

Anyway, back to their food. The entrees at Olive Garden are alright. Their alfredo cream sauce is usually too heavy for my taste. But anything chicken or steak is usually juicy and well cooked. 

The atmosphere is very comfortable. Seeing all the kids around really makes me want to have a family :) And the price is super cheap!

Save your Italian food snobbery for snobby North Beach restaurants and enjoy your experience at Olive Garden.
author: Alice W.

description: I love this Olive Garden. I came the other day with my mom & my little brother. Out waitress was TC. She was totally on top of it, A+ on customer service & speed. She took care of all our refills & everything without having to even ask. EXCELLENT waitress. There was also some slim little blonde girl with a braid, I wish I got her name. But she wasnt even our waitress & still made sure we were good with everything when she walked past us! & brought us extra bread sticks! Both absolute sweethearts! Deffinately wanna sit in their section next time I come in! :)
author: Lauren W.

description:
Came here on Sunday with my friend before work. It was about 12:30pm when we arrived. Luckily, there was no wait & we got seated right away.  

Hmm..what to order? We both decided to try something new. I ordered the Carbonara Ravioli w/ Chicken. It was delish! :) Carbonara, good. Ravioli, good. Chicken, gooooood. Haha. My friend ordered the Carbonara Ravioli w/ Shrimp. She enjoyed it. 

Our waiter was nice, but maybe a little too nice. He tried to make small talk, but it felt a little weird at times. 

Yay for being able to sample their wine! I've always come here underage..not anymore! :) 

Unlimited breadsticks are always nice. I wish that they came out warmer though. 

-1 star for no Andes mint/chocolate :) That's my FAVORITE part of going to Olive Garden! I was definitely looking forward to it & was disappointed.
author: Jessica A.

description:
As a first timer going I was okay with it. I had a seafood Alfredo with the Chicken Gnochii I believe and a Bruchetta for a starter. I was kinda scared seeing the big plate for the starter it was like for 5 people, but i managed, saved half of the bread slices to go with my seafood alfredo. I fell in love with the Berry Acqua Fresca: strawberry, blackberry, and raspberry purée, with açai berry and sparkling water. 
The food is not all authentic Italian because the gnocchi was I don't know kinda of like an American version or something. I prefer going to a real Italian restaurant in North Beach, but I was satisfying with the place as a first timer. 
The price for the seafood Alfredo was just a high, it went over a little bit over the roof.
author: Nadav M.

description:
My server was a great waiter named Johnny (Filipino man). What a nice, sweet man that helped me and my mother in every way! The food was fine, but with his service, it made it great! =) 
Thanks again Johnny!
author: Poison I.

description: After seeing a commercial on TV we decided to head to Olive Garden. This is the only location within miles of where we live. Considering the fact that this restaurant always has a ridiculously long wait the service is not that great. The salad we ordered was enough for one person and the waiter wanted to hand everything to us!  Hello, can you put the plated down!  The high chair we got for our son was filthy!  The food is subpar. I would rather drive down to a Macaroni Grill instead. Better food and better service overall. Very disappointed in this Location.
author: Jose M.

description: Restaurant was very nice and clean. The waiter was very nice and did a great job. The food was below average. I asked for a bite of my friends linguine and she said don't bother it's not with it. My other friend I asked how her chicken and pasta dish was and she said it tastes like it was cooked in a micro wave. I had rosemary chicken breast , it was very average. The bread sticks were good. If I eat here again I think I'll just have wine and bread sticks. The food needs a lot of work.
author: Peter G.

description:
There was no need for a 45-minute wait.  We saw many empty tables while looking through the window.

The food was only lukewarm.
author: Djl D.

description: The service is getting ridiculously slow. I used to love this place till today. Now they have this little desktop machine on the counter for you to order food instead of server. And guess what, when you click on the "Call Server" button, you can expect a waiting period of at least 10 minutes before anyone could come and help you. And they weren't even busy!! Like, seriously? I literally had the light on for a minimum 15 minutes and nobody ever came. Guess this will be my last visit.
author: Stephanie C.

description: Sadly, I was subjected to this HORRIBLE food more times than I care to remember...in multiple states...work related....I've tried to find one edible meal, but sadly it wasn't meant to be...so, let me be a bit more food specific....I ordered a chicken Cesar salad..safe?  Nope...the chicken was DEEP FRIED and the lettuce was wilted...whole nightmare salad was warm...who wants a greasy, wilted, warm salad?? I sent it back and ordered a bowl of their renowned minestrone soup..it was filled with canned vegetables and it was lukewarm...I'm sorry, but this is in no way Italian food....RUN from this chain!! Oh, wait did I mention that my 3 dinner companions were feeling quite ill after their "Authentic Italian Meal".....yuk...
author: Joanna M.

description: The employee who worked here two days ago didn't take down a reservation yesterday for a party of 30. Instead they had 2 parties of 20. We had to wait 3 hours to switch restaurants because of this BS mistake. Sorry doesn't help.
author: ABC Z.

description:
This place used to be ok. My wife and I went there today for lunch.
It had to be the worse meal we have ever had at Olive Garden.
My wife ordered Talipa with shrimp on top. The fish was over cooked and very dry as well 
as the shrimp.  She sent it back and ordered the Chicken Marsala. This dish was even worse. The chicken was burnt and so were some of the mushrooms. 
I ordered the tour of Italy. It wasn't to bad but the pasta was very dry to the point you could see it had been sitting for a while.
The service was fine but the food has gone down hill like a run away ball. 
We won't go back again.
That's to bad cause we are right up the street from Stonestown.
author: Tommy R.

description:
Yelpers who gave less than 3 stars rating need to get a grip. This is a chain restaurant.  You can't expect a fine dining experience.

Yes, service is hit or miss.  Most of the wait staff are young and are students from nearby SF State.  

Food is mass produced.  You're supposed to get as much tossed green salad or soup as you'd like with your entree, but again, it depends on the server.  Also comes with as much as garlic bread sticks as you'd like.

The tossed green salad consists of iceberg lettuce thrown in with a few slices of tomatoes, bermuda onions and a few olives with Italian dressing.  Very boring.

Go for the soup.  My favorite is the Zuppa Toscana.  Ingredients include Italian sausage, potatoes, and kale.  Again depending on who scoops the soup, you can get lots of potatoes with no kale or vice versa.

Best deal is the all you can eat soup & salad for $6.95.  The deal is off and on depending on the season, and for lunch only.  Sometimes there's the all you can eat pasta too, but again, depends on the season.
author: Shirley N.

description:
this place gets worse every time I go. I try to still give it a go since I have friends that like this place. I ordered the lasagna and I did not expect what I saw on the plate. It was dry with no taste and the pasta was hard. I did not want to complain so I just left it alone. After getting the bill the waiter asked me if I wanted a to go box I told her no and the reason why. She apologized and when she came back for me to sign my receipt she had told me that she took of the pasta. I thought that was nice since I did not ask her to do that I did not mind paying for it and learning my lesson.

Over all I don't like the food from here, but I think that the waiter made it much better. So I give them 2 stars for effort.

And at the current moment they are remodeling and are still open if you are wondering why it looks closed.
author: Scarlett F.

description:
It was just ok. I'm not going to rant and rave about how fantastic this place was, because it was just some place that wasn't McDonald's or Chevy's. The food tasted like any other Olive Garden however I found the bread sticks were really hard and not enjoyable to eat. The service was moderate although I did see this one server completely ignore some customers to go talk to some female customers and chat it up with them.

I highly doubt I am ever coming back to this place. If I want cheap shitty pasta I can stay at my apartment and cook for much less and maybe have the food taste a little more fresh.
author: Michael M.

description:
It was sooooooo salty!!!! We had the mozzarella cheese soup which was just mozzarella with bits of tomatoes on top. It was ok. We ordered the appetizer sampler which had stuffed mushrooms (very yummy), beef ravioli (okay with hard sides), chicken (it was ok, dry n salty), shrimp scampi (terribly salty n too much wine cooked with it). Breadsticks were sprinkled with salt on top too.
Overload of salt in their food!!!!!! Never again.
author: Jay M.

description:
Thursday 4/9/15 night at 7:30pm and was told the wait was between 45-60 minute wait.  The lobby area was packed, no where to sit and barely any room to stand.  At one point a family was asked to move so that an employee could open up the seat to get her purse... should have lockers for the employees. 

Exactly 60 minutes we were seated. Table was located in the very far back of the restaurant and it took 15 minutes for our server to come by and just say hello.  Another 15 minutes for him to come back and take our drink orders and by that time our food order.  When drinks arrived, he placed the drinks down and threw the straws at us.  The sodas (coke) were flat so we asked for another and when that came back 10 minutes later it was not coke but Dr. Pepper.  The salad arrived along with the bread sticks. The salad bowls, not plates were piping hot, must have came out of the dishwasher, so we had hot salad.  The entrees finally arrived and they were aweful! Could tell that the shimp came out of the freezer and the meal was just thrown together, like an asembly line process. 

During our meal the server showed up with another glass of soda and this time it was coke, yet no one ordered it and we were done with our meal.  

The server body language the entire time said it all... he didn't want to be there.  

As convienent as the Olive Garden Stonestown is we wiill NEVER return!!
author: CJ A.

description:
While there are so many better and unique places to eat in the city, it is always a safe bet to go with this chain. Olive Garden still has their unbelievable tasty breadsticks that you can get unlimited refills for. Their food looks gorgeous as always, although the taste isn't necessarily superb. 

One thing I do truly appreciate here is the quality of their service. Even though you almost always find yourself waiting to be seated, once you're in, they make sure to treat you well. The moment you're almost out of water or soda, they immediately appear to replenish your drink so you're never left feeling thirsty. So while I personally recommend checking out a local hole-in-the-wall instead of going to this chain, you can't go wrong with this place if you feel like playing it safe.
author: Gajan K.

description: Pretty solid place to have a family dinner or if you're feeling like Italian food. One bad thing is that the wait can be pretty long on a busy night (weekends mostly). Their appetizers are okay, just satisfactory since their calamari was mostly batter and not much calamari. Their meals are pretty good. I was super full from the breadsticks and salad + the meal itself. It was definitely a lot of food. I would suggest to come with a lot of people so you can get a bunch of different things to share. One plate is definitely good enough for 2 people. It was super filling since what we got had a lot of cheese. The service was alright. The lady that served us wasn't in the best mood that night, probably because it was busy. It was eh. But if you're in the mood for moderate price Italian food, and also get full, this is the place for you. The ambiance is pretty nice too. The waiting area is sort of noisy, but once you are seated inside, it is pretty quiet.
author: Julie T.

description:
I used to love coming here in high school! I went to Lowell just a 30 minute walk from here. Old people like to come here! 

I think I am more a fan of their soups. The salad was meager and the breadsticks (Glee restaurant hahah) should taste more like garlic bread. 

Since it is a chain they have to have the calorie count of each item. It was very disheartening but I ordered something "healthy" Grilled Chicken Spiedini (Skewered chicken marinated in Italian herbs and extra-virgin olive oil. Served with Tuscan potatoes and grilled vegetables.) 12.75 It was not good! The chicken was gross. I can make better potatoes and no wonder white people don't like veggies! Despite ordering healthy I am sure the calorie count for this meal was still high. I did have a bowl of soup and some salad. 

I wouldn't mind coming back just for the salad and soup. I would just order that if I ever find myself at an Olive Garden. 

Our waiter was pretty friendly.
author: Sarah C.

description:
Gourmet this is not. Don't come to Olive Garden if you're looking for "authentic" or if you're a food snob. It's a chain and the quality of the food is on par with most chain restaurants out there. There is absolutely nothing innovative or creative about the dishes served here. What they do do decently is churn out dishes that are catered to the American palate, meaning that some dishes could've used just a little less salt or a little less oil. 

The service here is great. The unlimited refills on breadsticks, salad, and soup is perfect for my cheapo Chinese family. I know everyone raves about their breadsticks but I personally found them a little too salty. I like that they come out hot and it's so soft but I could taste the sodium creeping into my body. The salad is just a bland garden salad. Yawn. The soup was surprisingly good though. I had the creamy chicken soup. 

For my entree, I had the fettuccine alfredo. Fettuccine alfredo is such a basic dish that it's hard to get wrong, right? Well, Olive Garden did not pass the test. The sauce had a weird texture to it. It wasn't creamy enough and it was kind of gritty and not very flavorful. Very disappointing. I've had other dishes here that were pretty good though, so it just depends on how you luck out with your order. 

For the prices that they charge, I'd say that the dishes are slightly overpriced. But if you're at Stonestown and you want a place to sit down and enjoy dinner, this is not a bad option. Hopefully you come on a weekday because the weekend wait time is absolutely ridiculous!
author: Nancy C.

description:
This place was super packed when my friends and I strolled in. It was graduation nights for the local high school and everyone took their celebrations to Olive Garden. I really just wanted to eat somewhere familiar while I was in town, I didn't want to mess around with something new because I was just hungry. . . you know the feeling don't you?! 
Anyway, we hesitated asking how long the wait was going to be when we saw the large amounts of families standing around waiting to be seated, but thought what the heck, there's only 3 of us, it might be about 30 minutes. 
So we asked the hostess how long the wait would be, with a smile on her face she said 1.5-2 hours. . . 2 HOURS?! Are you kidding me? What a joke. 
My friends and I got the feelings the hostess told us that time because she wanted us to leave. . . which we did. 

So I'm giving this place two stars, only because I still appreciate Olive Garden food. =)
author: Kat G.

description:
I always liked Olive Garden.  But I feel lately, they've been getting more and more expensive.  This time I ordered the 2 for $25 deal thing off their menu.  It was actually a pretty good deal.  But for the life of me can't even remember what I ordered.  I do know that it was good.  Almost like a ravioli thing.  But food here is consistently decent, it's usually the service that changes.  Alas, why I am writing this review.

Typical dinner night out, was told it would be a 30 minute wait.  I say okay, then I was given a pager and sat on one of the benches in front of the hostesses.  We wait and wait and wait while countless parties get seated.  Then I began to notice that people who I thought came after us were being seated first.  I chalked it up to different party sizes.  40 minutes came and went.  Now I hate bugging the hostesses because I know what time is always an estimate, and I'm sure they hate when people ask for a status update.  But this time, I just had to do it.  With an attitude, the hostess looked up our name and sassily said, well I paged for you a few times.  I told her that I was seated right in front of her and it didnt go off.  She took the pager from me and tested it, and low and behold it didnt work!  AHhh, I was not happy.  She then told me I would be next, nary an apology or any kind of acknowledgment that we should have been dining a long time ago.  Arrrggghhhh!!!!  Just say sorry....and I'm good.  But nope, nothing.

Food 3.5 stars.  Service 1 star.
author: Kris P.

description:
I dont understand why theres always a wait here.  Is it reallllllllly that good? no. at least i dont think so. i cant even think of anything else to say about this place.

Its okay food for a bit higher price than it should be.
author: kim w.

description:
Holy moly, I haven't been to Olive Garden since High school!  That was almost 10 years ago.  Came here with 3 other people to take advantage of their 3 course meal.  I ordered the salad, chicken pasta (white cheese sauce with penne), and dark chocolate cake.  We also ordered the sampler to share-calamari, stuffed mushrooms, and beef & pork ravioli.

Salad was OK.  The lettuce could've been a little more fresh. I asked for the dressing on the side, which they were happy to do.  Pasta was cooked perfectly al dente, but the overall dish was a little salty to my taste and the dark chocolate was yummy!

Although my experience this time around was good, I wouldn't come here without a deal.   The dishes are overpriced and although breadsticks are unlimited, they're so salty!  I wanted to dip my breadstick into my cup of ice water to wash some of the salt away.
author: Cheryl Q.

description:
It's good, and in the decent price range. Some foods taste better than others. 

Waiting is one of the major factors that lowers the quality. It takes about 30 minutes to an hour just to get a seat. What's worse is the waiters take a long time. I basically lost one hour and thirty minutes due to waiting.

I feel like this restaurant is better for larger parties.
author: Edward M.

description:
Obviously the food is always mediocre. This ain't Italian. Either way, I had a $50 gift card to spend and got takeaway on two separate occasions. Both girls who handle my to-go order were super friendly and gave me a deal on my order so that it was cheaper than the way I had previously ordered it. Awesome. I only have $16 left on the gift card though, so one more trip and they won't see me again.

Oh well.
author: Angela R.

description:
8:03pm - entered and waited for our reserved table to clear up. 

8:35 - saw a sweaty chef scratching his sweaty head. 

8:44 - still waiting...

8:59 - finally seated in a private room that was completely empty.
author: Mark R.

description:
Years of watching cheesy commercials and brainwashing finally got me to say, "Olive Garden" when asked, "so what do you want for lunch?" one day while I was shopping at Stonestown with my guys. I had personally never been to one and during the course of walking the mall front to back, I got nothing but silly questions like, "How have you never been to an Olive Garden?" "What do you eat?" and "You're kidding, right?" Apparently, most of the country has already been to Olive Garden so many times it's been compared to the McDonald's as the fast food for Italian. I dunno-every place deserves one chance. 

The dress was aptly compared to McDonald's and as soon as we stepped in, I realized why. There's nothing wrong with the decor as it is a corporate restaurant and that's just the way it looks. The host seemed unsure of himself and stuttered as we stood there. He seemed nervous when explaining our options, "Um, it'll be like a 10-15 minute wait unless you want to sit at the bar. They cut a bunch of servers and we filled up all of a sudden." I really didn't need all of that information and just smiled and said, "we'll wait over there on the bench." 

We were promptly sat in the quoted time and had the misfortune of getting sat with one of the rudest, surliest servers I've ever had. He couldn't remember what drinks we had ordered, made a snide comment when I asked for a water, and apparently was so busy talking to other tables, he had other servers drop off drinks and bread. We all ordered salad and somehow, at 2 p.m. they also ran out of ranch on top of common courtesy. 

The food isn't anything spectacular but it's decent to say the least. After the terrific service given by every staff member we encountered, I wasn't expecting better from the food but food is the one thing that stays consistent at corporate restaurants. I enjoyed my alfredo pasta and chicken parmigiana while my lunch companions continued razzing me about never having eaten at an Olive Garden. Again and again and again. 

I'd probably never come back to an Olive Garden again judging by the high price point for noodles and sub par service but at least I can say I've eaten here once.
author: Jessica K.

description: Constantly showing up as an ad on my yelp. Ive been there once it olive garden what can i say but the fact they show up telling me that hey are 3 miles away when I'm looking for a restaurant within 100 feet of me frustrating
author: michael d.

description: While wasn't expecting much from this place was fairly shocked at how bad service was. Rude waitress, forgetful, appetizers brought out same time as main course and then forgot my sons food. Not too cool to bring out a 9 y/o's food 15 minutes after the adults. No attempt to rectify anything and was told the manager was "unavailable." Awesome job at losing a occasional customer. With that type of experience sure there are a lot more.
author: Sean B.

description:
As far as chain Italian restaurants are concerned, my wife and I are at a disagreement.  She prefers Macaroni Grill, but when we tried the Olive Garden at Stonestown, I though that they were the superior of the two.

Let me say first that my rating for this place is for what it is and what it tries to do.  I know that no Italian joint like this is going to be serving primo food, but we go to places like this for mid-level, moderately-priced pasta and sides.  If I want this kind of food, I prefer the Olive Garden because of the proportion of food as opposed to the other places I have been to.  Last time I went here, I got pasta with three BIG Italian sausage links and unlimited salad.  For my buck, this offered me a ton more tasty food than the other Italian places I've been to. That's the difference here.  Add on top of that a pleasant ambiance and good service, and that makes for a great eating experience.

Of all of the Italian-type chains around (excluding pizza, which is another category altogether), Olive Garden is the front runner for me.  My wife still prefers Macaroni Grill, and while I don't think they're bad, Olive Garden fills me up for less $$$ overall.  Four stars--I'll be back.
author: Matthew D.

description:
This place had really gone down throughout the years. It's overpriced and the portions are too small.

I came here last night with some friends to celebrate a birthday. We arrived about 7p and did not have to wait for seats. How awesome was that! We had two servers because there was a total of nine of us. 

We were greeted right away and given menus. We were 3 short of menus, wine glasses, and utensils. They didn't even notice. Our appetizers came out fairly quick and then our sides followed with our entrees. Servers were really good. They were on top of everything. Attentive. Our breadstick basket was always full. They did however forget to fill our water glasses. 

The food itself wasn't that bad but it wasn't good either. I much rather take my business to Macaroni Grill. I have no plans of coming back...,maybe just for the unlimited soup n salad.
author: Serena F.

description:
I really like their food but warning, their foods do contain alot of sodium and calories. Love the endless soup, salad, and bread sticks. Seriously, you probably dont need to order an entree after this. But if you do, all their entree's are good. I always get the chicken scampi...with lots of garlic. I never have enough room in my stomach to get a dessert, unless you dont order an entree. 

The down side: They make you wait at least 30mins to be seated. They dont take reservations. And its always crowded on weekends.
author: Jean T.

description:
I always share an entree when I'm here because honestly, one big plate of pasta will make me sick, especially if it's not something I'm head over heels for. Plus, you get endless salad and breadsticks!!! That'll fill ya up! The food is not bad, but also not superb. However, I didn't come here to complain and review about the food. 

So moving on.... For those of you over 21, ROSCATO ROSCATO ROSCATO PLEASE TRY THE ROSCATO. It's like grape juice that'll warm you right up! Sweet, Very easy to drink, and Very yummy. And apparently Olive Garden is the only place that serves it. I give the roscato 5 stars. Try it!
author: Maiden D.

description:
I like their peach tea and garlic bread.  other than that,  the food is only OKAY.  the soup is too thick and toooo salty.  the salad is just like any regular salad, not something special.  

i don't like the seating, the spaces between the tables are quite far apart.  and i don't like the carpets. 

last time we went, the waitress asked if we would like some more refills, we said yes, thank you. but she never came back. you don't do that to your valuable customers!!

But if you want a place to eat with your families or friends after shopping, not looking for amazing taste or great atmosphere, and you don't want to eat at Mcdonald's. then this is a place you want to give it a try.

This is definitely not a restaurant that i would remember its tastes and crave for more.
author: Kentaro K.

description: Horrible service. This is by far the worst Olive Garden I have ever been to. Count yourself lucky if you get a great sever, I have been here 4 times because my fiancée loves the appetizers and only ONCE did I ever have good service. It was such a positive change that she wrote the company to compliment him. I wish there was a better one near by so we wouldn't have suffer going to this location..
author: Gabe A.

description: We just had dinner at the Olive Garden and we both ordered the Filet Mignon. It was the most expensive dinner on the menu. It wasn't Filet Mignon but Top Sirloin. It didn't even look like the picture on the menu. So we were charged for Filet Mignon but got a lower grade of meat. I had read several weeks ago that the restaurant was making changes because of declining revenues, hence they are making cutbacks on their food and charging premium prices. Don't go there if you think it was the Olive Garden of the past.
author: Janet H.

description:
One star is for lunch only. 

DINNER is the worst!!! my meal was cold and sent back over and over and so was half of the table only positive was that they comped the meal but after the waiting game we played not sure it was worth it. Actually felt sorry for the waiter who kept apoligizing for the food quality. Great wait staff! Kitchen needs to be fired and rehired for the dinner service.

Lunch service always seems to be great a few days before this came here with a friend for lunch and had the seafood alfredo and it was very yummy.

Go for lunch but avoid this place for dinner.
author: Michael W.

description:
My wife says we get $6 off our next dinner. We tell the waitress before ordering and the waitress say yes, fine.  Then the bill comes; and the waitress says I forgot to tell you about our computer doesn't accept the code even though it was a valid coupon and ALSO other people today were told this coupon was not working, before us. So, we waited for a manager for 25 minutes, then comes the bill with the $6 off. Great, THEN here's the kicker, the tip recommendation for 15% went originally from 5.29  to 5.22 even though there was a $6 reduction.  ME THINKS THE WAITRESS was overcharging the tip on purpose, because there was only a 7 cent tip reduction.  I tipped the 5.22 instead of the 4.22, but don't trust this place anymore. I expect better service since we were upfront with the information.  I have had better service previously from other waiters and waitresses at this Olive Garden, but when I don't get my chocolate mint at the end of the dinner, I know something is not right.  :)

Actually, I had to get my own bag for the leftovers, the cheese wasn't offered like normally on the entree so I had to get it from another waitress, I never saw the manager, I waited for the soup because they ran out, I waited, of course like everyone else in the front even though when we walked into the back room, there were many empty clean tables available.   Ya, we won't be back. The food has always been pretty good, however.
author: John L.

description: had dinner here a few weeks ago with a friend and ordered the shrimp/pasta/alfredo.  after 2 bites, i realized that the shrimp had a strong fishy taste and odor !!!!! the waiter was pleasant and took it away and took it off the bill.  Nevertheless, it was disturbing to taste shrimp that was going bad!!!  very disappointed.
author: suzanne e.

description:
[M]ona: 3 Stars
[W]ayne: 3.5 Stars 
Average: 3.25 Stars

+ Good Service
+ Attentive
+ Filling

- Food looks better on TV

[M] Wayne and I came here on a Wednesday afternoon for the Unlimited Pasta Special. We had attempted to go the night before, but they were packed and had to be an hour wait. We were expecting them to be busy but not that busy! We were like "Eh...no thanks!" and went next door to eat instead. We were here again the next day. There was no waiting this time. Woohoo!! X3

I ordered 2 dishes from the Unlimited Pasta Menu. The first was Alfredo Fettuccine, and then the Angel hair pasta with Meat Sauce. I wish I had ordered the Angel Hair Pasta with Meat Sauce as my first dish.The Alfredo sauce was really rich and heavy, I was full from the first dish. When my second dish came, I took a bite and was like @__@ "no more!" and started chowing on Waynes calamari instead.

Wayne ordered the Sampler Appetizer dish with Fried Ravioli, Calamari and Chicken fingers. We both liked the calamari. It was nice and crispy and went well with the dips/sauces. The Raviolis on the other hand were kind of hard, and the Chicken Fingers were... I honestly don't remember how they tasted like. 

Anyway, service was good. Food was decent. I was happy I got to try something from the Unlimited Pasta Menu. The End.
author: Mona C.

description: What does Olive Garden serve? Pasta is the answer.  You would think they could cook pasta.  Over cooked, to the texture of baby food.  The waiter did not come back until the meal was done. I was asked if I wanted something else.  When everyone was finished. If we would have been checked on, I would have.  Very disappointing.
author: Mark S.

description:
Been coming here since i was a little girl. The wait here used to be horrendous but thank the Lord, times have changed. I usually go to Olive Garden when I crave that soup - Zuppa Toscana. HMMMM HMM GOOD. All that potato, kale, sausage, and spicy goodness in one bowl! Definitely my favorite soup here and maybe of all time haha But of course, the unlimited soup and breadsticks are comp with an entree! The last time I came here I ordered the Eggplant Parmigiana because it was one of the options in the $10 promotion. This time, its regular price $14.99 but because i liked it, i wanted to eat it again. I usually cant finish my entree after all the breadsticks, salad, and soup. SO its nice to know i have a yummy lunch the next day. The eggplant Parmigiana was a bit lacking this time but it was still good. The eggplant is breaded so last time it was crispy where as this time, it was as little soggy. I also had a coupon for a free appetizer or dessert valued at $10. Got the Sampler and just paid the difference. The sampler consists of calamari and stuffed mushrooms. I usually HATE mushrooms but I have always been a huge fan of their stuffed mushrooms. There's a lot of cheese - well it looks like a lot of cheese ... but it goes perfectly with the mushroom. Sister ate the Fettuccine Alfredo as usual and mother had the Steak Toscano. She got it cooked medium and i like my meat medium rare so to me it was over cooked and hard but she seemed to like it. She was the only one who finished her meal but then again - she had less soup.

Overall, i usually love my experience at Olive Garden but i guess because this was a busy Tuesday night, service was a bit lacking :\ But I'll be back -
author: Kristina L.

description:
Do not come here hungry for dinner on a Monday night this place is packed.

Got here at 7:30
Got seated at 8:00
A server finally came at 8:10
Got food at 8:30
But missing an appetizer
And my sausages were cold inside.



Whoever thought of this place is a genius!!!!

The server really makes or breaks your experience here. 



We ordered the lasagna fritta
author: DOM d.

description:
JOSH. JOSH. JOSH. 
remember that name. 
don't eat here unless you're service is going to be with Josh. 

me and my boyfriend came here to eat the other day around 6:30.
i guess a half hour wait isn't bad around dinner time. 
but either way, we sat around the bar area and got waited on by josh. who was excellent!
our food came out, he served us our drinks with timely refills and was all around a great waiter! 
woo woo!
5 stars for JOSH! 
:3
author: Chelsea B.

description:
GO SOMEWHERE ELSE!!!

This place is nothing short of the word awful! Its greasy, it has no flavor, the noodles are usually soggy and the service is worse than mediocre.  

If you are looking for inexpensive Italian food, walk down the road to Trader Joes, pick up a package of noodles and some spaghetti sauce.  I guarantee that whatever you pick up would taste better than ANYTHING that came out of their kitchen.
author: Alena R.

description: NO SERVICE! We arrived before 2:00 pm on a Sunday to have lunch. We waited about 20 minutes for a table (about what we were told). The man who seated us attempted to show us how to "wait" on ourselves using the little tablet on the table, but we declined that, wanting to be served by a real server. Looking at the menu, we were surprised that the only meal options were dinner items--no lunch items such as the lunch duo or the soup/salad combo, which are shown online and which we've had at other Olive Gardens. We waited for about 20 minutes for our server to show up, but no one ever came to our table (even to give us water). We even pressed the "call server" button on the tablet, which blinked for a few minutes and then shut off. There were other servers in our section, none of whom ever acknowledged our presence. Finally, with no service apparent  in the near future and no appropriate meal choices, we left. We will not return.
author: Denise R.

description: I go here at least once a month. I have never had a bad meal and the service is always attentive and the waitstaff is very friendly and helpful. I usually order the "create your own pasta/sauce" dish. I order the wine sauce usually and recommend that as though I love tomatoes, I can't eat too much, and this sauce doesn't bother me. This is a great place to dine if you are craving Italian and don't want to eat in the noisy food court area in the mall. This place offers peace an quiet.  Best to arrive for lunch early (11:00 - 11:30) especially on a Saturday.
author: Debi L.

description: Don't dine at Olive Garden.  I ate lunch in SF two weeks ago.  They failed to give me my credit card back.  I called and they were supposed to send it to me.  When it didn't arrive a week later, I called and spoke to the manager.  He promised to get my card back to me.  Instead I was just called by my credit card company that there was $400 in charges at GameStop and other charges in New York City.  What a horrible restaurant.  I called them just now and they were too busy to talk to me.  Apparently pasta is more important than credit card fraud.
author: Mary S.

description: This is my second time to Olive Garden and my boyfriends first and it was GREAT. Not only because of the food, the unlimited soup, breadsticks, and salad, but because of this one waitress Savannah! My boyfriend and I looked at most of the other workers and they seemed to be bored with their job but Savannah ALWAYS had a smile on her face and I can honestly say that topped off my boyfriend and I's night. She always came back at the right time asking how our food was and giving us refills on our bread, soup, and drinks, and we didn't have to ask for anything! It's like she knew what she was doing and when to do it. Other than that, the food was great(should've warned us about how fast we'll get full LOL). But thanks again for serving us Savannah! When we come back, we hope to have you as our waitress again (:
author: Kayla G.

description:
I love the unlimited salad, soup, and breadsticks for $8.50 at Olive Garden. Yes, the salad is bare-bones minimum, but their soups are satisfying and filling. The Tuscan Zuppa and Italian Chili always seem to hit the spot like no other. And you'd be lying, if you said you didn't like the breadsticks. 

Tip: Opt for the cafe seating. There's typically none to little waiting and it serves the same menu.
author: Monelle A.

description: This Italian Restaurant is now one of favorite place to eat pasta recently ate at the Olive Garden a while ago for lunch... I had myself two servings of soup which was the Zuppa Toscana and then the Chicken & Gnocchi the Zuppa Toscana was a little spicy but I manage to survive that drinking that soup... The lunch entree that I ate and ordered for the first time was the Pork Milanese which I have never eaten before at the Olive Garden  until now, I have to say the Pork Milanese Pasta tasted really Goooooooood!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: William B.

description: Love the food and our server "Tracy Thompson-Burks" She rendered great service. She was so energetic and very happy person! Because of her we are coming back! Keep it up! See you next time!
author: Joanne P.

description:
Wait time: 45 minutes on a Saturday around 3pm. (after was told 10-15 minutes)

waiter: no where to be found

Food: 

1. Hubby ordered the Chicken Alfredo Pizza: Bland, dry, chicken was overcooked...blah! 

2. I ordered the three cheese penne pasta with shrimp: felt like I was eating a microwavable meal. shrimp was good. 

3. Kiddo had Mac N Cheese with Broccoli: I honest to god, think the Mac n Cheese tasted what I believe to be what dirty feet would taste like. the most disgusting Mac n Cheese that I have ever tasted...She had maybe 3 bites. ew. 

We also ordered calamari, minestrone soup and salad for appetizers. Soup was delicious, Salad was great, Calamari was awful. Bland, overcooked, just overall ew. 

I guess I had higher expectations, and was blown away at how bad the meal was. 

at $60+ tip, this meal was So not worth it. Won't be going back. 

I recommend Bucca Di Beppo in Palo Alto, if you're hankering for some Italian dishes. Only thing about Bucca's is their portions are WAYYYY too big, but I guess that's okay if you don't mind leftovers. :)

ETA: I can't believe I forgot about the bread sticks. Probably the best part of the entire meal...gave one star for those. mmmm
author: Gloria K.

description:
Surprisingly good beef short ribs with risotto and Portabello mushrooms. Good presentation with great flavors. Unfortunately, the Chicken Alfredo needed too much salt and pepper to give it any real flavor.

I've never found they toast their garlic bread sticks well enough to make them excellent.  They are like slightly underdone Parker house rolls redone in stick form. And these were served out of the oven, still barely turning brown.

The wait for us on a Saturday night was less than 15 minutes, our service was prompt and attentive. I thought that the meh quality of the Chicken Alfredo, and the underdone bread sticks did not warrent the cost of the dinner, so this was not a good over-all value in spite of the good short-ribs.
author: Glenn H.

description: A male to go person quoted me 20 min for my food to be ready.  I got it in 43 minutes, 23 minutes past my quoted time.  Furthermore the to go person told me, "Here's your order, you don't need to make sure what in the bag, because I bagged it myself."  But then!!! forgot to give me my drink and I didn't realize it until I was already home.  This same person helped me from my last review, but during this visit, she wasn't as outgoing.  Maybe today was a bad day at work.  However, food was still good!
author: Maria B.

description:
Olive garden. A place where I can't even drag one of my friends into because he'll complain about the lack of authenticity of Italian food. LOL. He'll only eat his grandmother's TRUE italian dishes, and honestly, I'll have to agree. Not about his grandmother's cooking, but if it's truly as amazing as how he makes it out to be, invite me to your next family dinner!!!

I looovvee Italian food, but this place is such a downer. :(

To me, Olive garden is just some plain average meal. It's comparable to those microwave foods that you find in the frozen food aisle. Sounds harsh, but it's true. Twice, I ordered different alfredo dishes, the last time I went I ordered the one with steak. Thei pasta is just... meh. Nothing special, or rather not a really good combination of flavor. I don't really know how to explain it, but one thing I do know is that I didn't give me usual "hmmmm" orgasm sound in the first bite. lol It was also pretty salty, I probably filled my stomach with mostly water or iced tea. Even with the steak, there was no pizazz.

I doubt I'll be coming to this place willingly. Probably only if my friends outvote me into coming here for food. I hope not though.

But seriously, if you guys want some more authentic, or must plain BETTER Italian food, I suggest going to restaurants around Northbeach area. Its filled with deliciousness around there :9 I recommend Vicoletto on Green st.
author: Harriet W.

description: This is the third time I have been to this location. They have embarrassingly bad service, but what can u expect from a place like Olive Garden. The only thing worth coming here for is the soup, breadsticks and complimentary chocolates at the end.
author: Kirsten H.

description:
It was 12:00 pm and me and my lady were at Stonestown attempting to finish up our Christmas shopping. I offered to dine at Olive Garden seeing as how she's a huge fan of pasta and pasta and sauce virtually runs in her blood.

We arrived and asked for a table with an estimated wait time of 15-20 minutes. We were starving so we decided to bypass the long wait for a table and opt for self seating by the bar in hopes of being served faster. 

Big time mistake. 

In our quest for a quick bite to eat, the first 30 minutes turned into a nightmare. We sat at our table hoping for a waiter to take our order. For the first 15 minutes nobody came to our rescue and we sat there helplessly seeing other people who arrived after us getting served at a quicker rate while nobody bothered to check up on us. Several people recieved their appetizers while we waited just to have our drink order taken.

To our rescue came the bartender to provide us our drinks. My girlfriend order the Pink-Mango Lemonade and I opted for a Blue Moon, but sadly, they run out of my choice, so I opted for a 20oz Sam Adams drink, which I would regret as the lunch went on. 

We thought our bartender had saved us and help was surely to come, but for another 15-20 minutes all waiters did were check on the other customers and not once bother to ask if we had been served. Even at one point, one waiter "accidentaly" brought someone else's order to our table and served as a tease and a slap in the face for the type of service we were receiving. 

So we waited helplessly again, slowly becoming agitated at the long wait we were subjected to. Again, roughly 30-35 minutes of just waiting there the bartender once again came to the rescue to save us making sure one of the waiters in the area paid attention and took our orders. The waiter, whose name was Anthony, quickly took our order and apologized for the wait. From then on, we received all our food FAST.

A bad start to lunch ended good thanks to the two individuals who saved us. Overall, a crappy start to a so-so start to a great ending. I'll be back but not anytime soon.
author: Jesus A.

description: if you are craving Italian food PLEASE Stay away from this place, thats all we have to say.
author: Luis G.

description:
I stopped being a loyal customer of Olive Garden 2 years ago due to a series of poor service, and  excessive waits, also experienced by many others.  Today March 5, 2015 , at 12 noon my wife and  I decided to give Olive Garden in Stonestown a new  try.  
To our surprise, the service was A+, Johnny, our server was extremely courteous, efficient and attentive. The salad and entrees came out in a timely manner, nice presentation and delicious.

The greeters at the door were professional and courteous upon entry and upon our exit..  We observed further and saw that 2-3 other servers were just as professional and efficient to their customers.  It seems owners and management have finally taken action to bring their standards up to a higher level.
author: Eric Q.

description: Valerie and Gary were FANTASTIC!!!
