My cousin and I came here to have a late lunch and at first there was no seating open but then the hostess told us we could go to the bar area... we sit down and here come Valerie... she brought waters and utensils... I have an allergy to onions so I really couldn't get anything on the menu BUT she worked it out for me... my food was good but the lobster ravioli aren't that great... a little bland... topped with shrimp... I should've went with my first mind and got the cheese raviolis!!! My experience is 5 star because of Valerie and Gary... I will be asking for them to help me from now on!!!
author: Racquell C.

description:
The service here is awesome but I only come here because its conveniently close to Stonestown and not necessarily for the "delicious Italian food". 

They do have free refills on soup and salad with your meals so you could technically order an entree and fill up on unlimited soup or salad and breadsticks!

The Mediterranean Chicken was surprisingly delicious but the beef ravioli dish my friend ordered was just alright. The beef was tasty but a little too tough and the ravioli was just filled with cheese (but not much flavor).

But if I'm paying $20+ per person, I want "authentic" Italian food.
author: Wilson T.

description: Went last week with my girlfriend and her daughter.. the wait THIS TIME wasn't bad at all. 10 mins. We get seated and then we were waiting 30 minutes and then I had to lightweight snap on somebody.. we cancelled our appetizers and just went to the entrees.. when the server finally came he didn't even apologize or shit! We get the bill and was relieved to see that manager comped us 2 of the 3 meals.. Cool right? Nah.. the bill was about $21 I gave $25 and da muthafucka didn't even bring my back my change! He ASSUMED that shit was his tip.. I just laughed it off and left. I paid less than what I was expecting anyway. But fuck them from now on tho str8 up!
author: Deo E.

description: Hardly ever do I write a negative review about one specific employee, but this girl was awful... She was a hostess and had a terrible attitude. When I walked up to the counter to put my name down she looked at me and said nothing, so I said hi, and she responded with "name" . She then stood there acknowledging no one and always answered rudely when people asked her anything. She then pulled her phone out and was typing away for quite some time. I could tell that even the staff was having trouble with her. Her name I think was Marissa. Gotta have a smiling face, honey... Try a little harder next time.
author: Yesenia C.

description: Good endless pasta and breadsticks you cant go wrong....great service from our waiter John
author: AVERY R.

description:
They've changed cooks several times but this last one caught my palletes attention. 

I usually order: Breadsticks and alfredo sauce (DELICIOUS)
                            Spaghetti and Meatsauce
                            Salad (DELICIOUS)

I've tried: Lasagna (pretty good)
                Chicken Alfredo (meh I'll pass)
                Appetizer platter with chicken, mozzerella sticks and
                fried zucchini (Pretty good)

Love the atmosphere and some of the waiters are the nicest waiters I've met. Ask for extra mints if you like them, they usually hook it up! Also if you want a salad to go just ask for a refill before you pack up, they will box it for you, 4 stars kablam!
author: Kristy F.

description:
Pros: I love their salad and breadsticks and its unlimited! Mmm. Relatively friendly service. 

Cons: Extremely long wait, they did not explain to us that a sound coming from the beeper means you're out of range as opposed to your table being ready, high prices for low quality food, water dropping a plate of food, then dropping an entire tray of dishes right behind me, bland yet still extremely salty food, disgusting pasta (whole wheat + mushroom marinara), gross drunk old women sitting behind my loverman, no reservations, etc. 

I find it funny people actually go on "fancy" dates at the Olive Garden. There is nothing fancy about a shitty chain with overpriced shitty food.
author: Tiffany V.

description: Ok so sometimes when your absolutely starving and in need of all you can have Salad, Breadsticks, and heavy Pasta, the Olive Garden just hits the spot! Its fantastic during a busy shopping day, particularly around Christmas. Although it is a chain restaurant its quite yummy and incredibly comforting. The servers and wait staff are lovely and incredibly hard working (but I HATE HATE HATE when they are smoking outside around and in Front of the Restaurant!!!) but I just have to give this place 5 stars. You cant find value like this in San Francisco for the price you pay and there food is just delicious. This is not a place for SF Hipster Vegan Veg Gluten Free foody snobs! This is a great restaurant if you have an appetite and need to get your fill up of good food.
author: Julian I.

description:
Aww shiiite! We're at the O.G.!

Ey.  Listen up!

Man, lunch iz da bomb! you won't feel getting ripped off, with the unlimited soup and salad combo?  and unlimited breadsticks!!

HELLA cheap foo!

So, here's wassup yo. 

Lil J-izzle sung a song for the O.G. and it goes sumthin like this:

"when your tummy's growlin,
and your wallet's hurtin,
head over to the O.G.
let's get this shit rollin..."

WORD.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Yeeesss, occasionally, my ghettoness comes out, thanks to an ex who WAS an O.G.
author: Janice C.

description: I love this restaurant! I always want to come here whenever I get a chance...my favorite place to go to, I love their pasta, their garlic bread, the soup of any kind sooo yummy. And the staff are friendly they greet you with the smile and will take care of you. The place is nice and clean too. I highly recommend this restaurant...thumbs up!
author: Donald W.

description:
We waited half an hour despite seeing that may tables were open and by the time they seated us and by the time they seated us it was dinner time which made us feel like we been ripped off as prices go up during dinner. 
Service had pros and cons. We felt rushed to finished but we never had to ask for a refill, our waiter usually refilled it before we could even ask and they gave us a handful of mints towards the end of the dinner despite us only having two people eating in. 
Food and soup was good though, same as usual!
author: Vivian A.

description: This Olive Garden is really big! Lol most of the ones I've been too are average but this one is nice and has a really nice bar area. My fettuccine Alfredo was cold on the top and warm in the middle, maybe because they wait to serve everyone's food together? Not sure. My server was a bit rude. Although I don't remember her name, I believe it started with an F? Although my receipt says Esmeralda. I was trying what to decide on my beverage and she seemed sassy whe waiting as if impatient. That made me not want to tip her well. But overall it was a great time, it was busy and I get that but she should be more friendly.
author: Celeste F.

description: Food came out pretty fast. Quality was good. And even though our server didn't come to help us a another came to assist to make sure we were taken care of. Good job yall keep it up. They tend to stay late also and you don't have to worrie about parking at all
author: Alonzo T.

description: Used their online ordering for take out.  It gave me a time of 38 minutes.  Okay, seemed a little long as a deep dish pizza takes 35, but okay.  Get there on time and wait an additional 17 minutes for my order.  Taking a total of 55 minutes.  Not reasonable.  Got home and the food was piping hot, but had very flavor.   Some of the pasta wasn't even coated.   I had to add seasonings and ended  throwing most of it away.  Very disappointing.  I won't go back.  Years ago the Olive Garden was a reliable place for a good, convenient meal.  Not any more.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Came here for lunch on a Sunday with my sis & mom, there wasn't a wait. We were seated right away.

We (or maybe it was just my mom) were offered a free sample of wine. I've only been offered once before out of the several (6+?) times I've been here, do I not look old enough to drink?

We ordered:
~2 UNLIMITED soup, garden salad, & bread sticks
~Sampler Italiano: calamari, stuffed mushrooms, & toasted beef and pork ravioli
~Smoked Mozzarella Fonduta (3 different cheese with Tuscan bread)

-Salad would have been better without olives, red onions & pepperoncini...I don't like any of those, I guess I could have asked not to add them in. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/3d9fGSDpuNQl7XI7zmmzmg?select=9HeawIvBbTky5xvWMAfHaw
-Soup, my mom & I each had the Chicken & Gnocchi soup http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/3d9fGSDpuNQl7XI7zmmzmg?select=Rb39PuzWsqaPqqIIys5z2g and the Zuppa Toscana soup. Both were good, I think I've tried them all, including Minestrone & Pasta e Fagioli. I prefer the Chicken & Gnocchi without the dumplings. The rest are good, but they can be too salty or something, because they make me want to drink a lot of water.
-Bread sticks are so good here, my sis ate 2 & was so full after, but she ate her appetizer sampler anyways.
-Sampler: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/3d9fGSDpuNQl7XI7zmmzmg?select=Jdxk0C0nhLLqFGCjXKifwA
*calamari, I've had better
*toasted beef & pork ravioli, the best sampler item
-stuffed mushrooms, came with 6 mushrooms stuffed with cheese
~Smoked Mozzarella Fonduta: bread with cheese, what's not to like. It was nice and cheese-y in the beginning but later it started to harden which didn't look as appetizing. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/3d9fGSDpuNQl7XI7zmmzmg?select=3mUGdTab23NjiCCCB6om9g

Our waitress was nice...Valerie? I think that was her name...
author: Kylie L.

description:
I always get the bubbly guts after coming here...

i'm not really sure what i'd recommend getting because truth is, i have no idea what's good. i don't think i've ever had anything that's left me wanting more.

maybe the fettuccine with the beef medallions? it's SUPER rich and heavy though, so you might want to share that with 2 or 3 people. maybe even 4...
author: Bianca W.

description:
We have been to this restaurant previously a couple of years ago.
Oh boy - it has gone downhill.

The quality of food is comparable to frozen dinner.  No taste whatsoever. Some of the $5 frozen dinners from safeway will probably beat the food here that costs between $12-20/dish. 

Chicken parmesan looked and tasted like it was heated multiple times, I am talking more than twice.  Taste of a cardboard smothered with melted cheese.

Capellini pomodoro had overcooked burning hot capellini on one side and a pile of topping on the other side of the plate.  It think the heap of toppings was some form of heated tomatoes - no taste whatsoever.

Short ribs are pieces of boiled beef covered in some really odd tasting sweet sauce. 

Should have gone to Denny's or had frozen dinner instead.  Cheaper and better.

Soup/Salad and Drink were good, however.

I do not think I will be visiting this place any time soon again.
author: Mike B.

description: Good for groups...can't beat the unlimited soup or salad...but being in sf...there's a lot of competition on good food.  So I can't really complain about the food...its more for a convenience location better than sitting in the mall....I preferred Chevy's their happy hour really was great!
author: Sandra S.

description:
Fairly cheap place for lunch or dinner! The side orders are usually expensive. I usually order a plate of alfredo which comes with soup and UNLIMITED BREAD. The bread is the best. Remember not to eat too much before the main meal. This only costs $12-$15. It's a great place to go out to dinner with friends. The service is great! And the chairs are very comfortable too!

Dinner: a long line.
Lunch: no line.
author: Kelly H.

description:
you guys, OG gets a bad rep! 

my husband and i thought it would be funny to swing by the Olive Garden a few weeks ago after hitting up the apple store in stonesgate. we walk in and the wait was an hour and a half to which we were like okay this joke isnt that funny lets go somewhere else. but we were really craving italian! so we drove around and around looking for a casual environment where we could enjoy some warm breadsticks, share a salad and have some hearty pasta. guess what - that like doesn't exist and that is why the OG is so successful! DUH!

anyway we ended up going back and putting our names on the list and chilled at the bar for an hour or so while we waited. the wine is so cheap and not that bad, i mostly drink cheap wine anyway so i was happy that it was actually priced low as opposed to be marked up by 300% because we live in sf. they finally sat us and it was amazing! our server was so nice - they're all young and sweet and attentive. the food was also so good. i mean those salads! and it's like free!

it was also the best time of my life because we have a two year old who throws tantrums all the time so each dining experience is a lot like hell because one of us is spending all of our time trying to talk him off the ledge and entertain him with the itsy bitsy spider or elmo on youtube videos from our iphones. it's just normally really tragic. but there were fully like three other kids in the room who were climbing over tables and stabbing people with their butterknives so we felt right at home to let him eat his crayons while we enjoyed our 3,000 calorie appetizer (deep fried lasagna, i can't even!!!!). 

you mostly fill up on the salad and breadsticks so you can always take your entree home after two bites and take it in to lunch the next day (if you're one of those people) (or you can eat it with your hands in front of the fridge at like 2am). they also totally give you fresh breadsticks in your togo box case you want to die of gluten. 

since our funny little joke we've been back twice. five stars OG!!!!
author: J R.

description:
This is what happens when you spend a lot of time together, even your minds are in sync.

So after a round of golf, he asked me if I was hungry...and I answered "heck yeah"..."so where do you want to eat?' he asked again...i dont know "where do you want to eat" i asked back...and at the same time we blurted out "what about Olive Garden"...oh that is too funny we were cracking up, I mean of all the places that we can come up to we said the same thing...lol...to think the last time I was there was more than 5 years ago...hecka long time...and he hasnt in a year or two.

We drove there, parked and waited for our table which took longer than the actual meal.

I super like our Server Josh, I like it when they introduce themselves, it feels like they're really saying "I will take care of you, my name is Josh"...you know it has a personal touch. So we were talking to him like we have been friends forever, which is actually good because now you know that he will give you the best service ever.

I orderd Shrimp and Scallions while Cholo ordered Seafoods which almost the same as mine except his has mussels..."No Malou its different, taste it"...and yes although they were both white sauce, it definitely taste different. He ordered 2 Strawberry Daquiris, Salad and the Appple Cobbler or something like that for dessert.

Josh keeps checking up on us making sure we have enough cheese...lol.

Food is great, conversation was interesting, service is pleasant.

I would have given it a 5 star if not for the long wait.

5 star to Josh.
author: Malou C.

description:
This OG used to be my favorite location, but not anymore. Have not been here for a over a year, so I went for a special occasion. The first thing I noticed, that the long time manager used to be there is gone and a new person is in place. Seating host wasn't very cooperative not very nice. She said the wait of about 30 minutes, it is what it is, so I felt offended. Second, we were placed in the back room where they had a wedding dinner, big tables with more than 30 people and half of them are screaming kids. Enough said. The waitress seemed tired and out of the mood, so smiling wasn't an option and I felt like I am begging when I ask for something. Salad and Bread, and appetizers came at the same time with the food, whats the point ?
Half of the food came cold, so I guess while some food was being cooked, the other dished were waiting under the heat lamp. 
Bottom line, wasn't a pleasant experience, but might visit if I see improvements in the future.
author: Shadi K.

description: FInally gave it a try for a takeout. This place is always crowded, and i heard really good reviews from friends. Was quite disappointed for the price that I paid. It was not bad, but not as good as my expectation. Service was fast and nice for a takeout service. It tastes ok, however the fettuccine is slightly overcooked and wet for my taste. They also forgot to gave me additional cheese that i asked for. They also did not have pepper, really?? Which for me is a must to eat with any italian dish. Overall, i think i can find many other better italian places around the city, i would not waste an hour to wait to eat here.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
So I came here just a few hours ago so my memory is fresh. My friends set a reservation and the wait was almost an hour; the place was packed. This was my first time coming here (along with Vivian L. and a few others). We got to our seats and ordered from the 3-course 12.95$ meal. Our server was named Joshua and he was really nice and polite. He forgot to give us an extra utensil set and water refill though, but that is forgiven since there's many other tables to care for. In the restroom as I finished washing my hands, I waited for a fat lady with a gold sequin beret to move so I can get paper towels. She didn't move so I reached over her to get it myself and she screams "EXCUSE ME, there's another one over there". Like B*TCH, MOVE THE F OUT. How was I supposed to know there was another paper towel dispenser. I noticed she was picking up paper towels left by the sink, so I believe she was a janitor whom dressed fancy. Correct me if I'm wrong, but this place needs to fire this lady and hire a real janitor who isn't so rude. 

1.) Soup: Chicken and gnocchi - I had it with some cheese and I thought it was creamy, but not too thick, and delicious. It had little wonton balls, some green vege, tiny carrots, etc. After the soup, I felt kind of full.
2.) Entree: Asiago and roasted garlic tortellini with grilled sausage - This was something new for me to try. It's similar to ravioli where there's cheese inside. They topped this with chopped tomato and some marinara sauce. It was okay. I felt so full after eating this. A bit too full.. even though I thought I would kill the food like nothing since it looked like a small portion.
3.) Dessert: Amaretto tiramisu - This had some cookie crumbs on it and it came in a super tiny cup. It was delicious but sadly I couldn't finish it because I was too full :(

Everything was good except for the dumb janitor.
author: Julian Y.

description:
Food was okay, but not worth the price. I think that the location is really bad for this Olive Garden. They are located near SF state and in Stonestown mall. An area full of college students who usually don't have the money to spend on Olive Garden. I also believe it's in a bad location just because it's in San Francisco. There are wayyyyy better Italian places in San Francisco and even near by. 

If you want actual italian food, head down to north beach aka little italy. Olive garden cannot even compare to any restaurants there. If you don't want to head that far, then make your way over to West Portal Paradise Pizza and Pasta where the italian is waayyy better for the same price. 

The food and service here isn't that great. It's always a hit and miss with me. Sometimes you get really good service and sometimes you get service that you just want to get up and walk out. 

The food is usually pretty consistent. I guess there's not much you can mess up on right? Just cook the pasta and pour the sauce and meat over it. But it's nothing compared to the home-made pasta you can find at north beach.
author: Christina L.

description: Went to OLIVE Garden for lunch during SFSU move in days. It was busy and our wait was long, but Devon, our server, was attentive and provided excellent customer service. His demeanor made up for the wait... I was impressed and will go back. I was also surprised by the quality of the food. Had a good time.
author: Lynn F.

description: Olive Garden Sucks! I use to come here from time to time and the experience was usually ok, nothing to complaint about. The last time I came here (Oct. 4th,2014) it was a very bad experience. My food was way over cooked and to top it all off My wife forgot her glasses there, so I called Olive Garden to see if they had found them, the person told me that they DID find them and that they would hold it for us.Although I didn't go back that same day I did return that week. I spoke with the manager Alex which was rude but did check the back and to my surprise they were no longer there. I gave Alex my phone number and two weeks later I'm still waiting for a call back.
author: Armando M.

description: Kevin was our server on a Saturday afternoon. We were seated right away and he was very helpful. I told him my dietary restrictions and he was wry knowledgable of what I could eat. The food was delicious and service was quick. I would definitely come back!
author: Jay B.

description:
Their Chicken Parmigana hit the spot! The portion was great and the overall quality of the dish was superb.

Our waitress was extremely kind, I asked for my dressing on the side and when she brought my salad out, I began eating it. A few minutes later she came up to apologize that she forgot to put it on the side and asked if I wanted a new one. I'm glad that she remembered, most people wouldn't give it a second thought.

This is a great place to fill up and have a nice talk with someone that you want to talk to.

Their hostesses and waitresses are all very personable.
author: Juliette R.

description: went here with friends and family.... how come the food tastes like its microwaved..... I mean target might do something like that but at least they charge like a few dollar for it. I love Italian food, but maybe I shouldn't be too demanding for a chain. its crowded but its around a mall, a college so that's probably the reason why it is so. the staff try, I don't blame things being a little intense.
author: Debby D.

description: only time i'll come here is if i don't have to wait. the food isn't all that. but of course, you get the soup or salad and breadsticks with all meals. i always shoot for the zuppa toscasca. i do like the fact that they offer a sampling of wine. mMm... moscato. a couple times, they even undercooked the meatballs... so if you're going to order it, cut it open with a fork first.  i'll say... desserts... the tiramisu here is so good!!!
author: Ann T.

description: Had terrible customer service! The waiter got my order wrong on top of that. The food is not so great, it's bland. And I don't understand why the prices are so high for a such bad quality of food and the portion size is almost nothing! yea there is unlimited soup,salad and garlic bread but it's so BLAND!!!! never going to Olive Garden again... Waist if money sorry.
author: Jacqueline J.

description:
I'm born and raised in San Francisco.  I share the same default reaction to roll my eyes at chain restaurants as other "sophisticated" diners in this great city.   

I went to Olive Garden, however, before I became a food snob and knew about the local versus chain distinction.  And I'll be honest:  I had a lot of good times here, as it is the only one in the city.  I have come here during very different stages of life, and I can appreciate it in a different light now, in the sense that it is family and kid-friendly(has changing station in restroom, kid's menu, etc.).

I won't bother comparing this to "authentic" Italian cuisine since I have been to many Italian restaurants but never one in Italy.  I think I know what Italian food tastes like.  But here's what you'll get when you come here:  a wait, nice ambiance, pretty good service, tasty food, a full stomach, and an above average price for the check.

Waiting:  They don't take reservations, so if you are coming on a weekend, either come really early(and still have to hang out nearby for 20 or so minutes), or expect to wait for an hour or more during peak dining hours.  I am a fan of their seating, as the booths and tables have adequate space within themselves and between each other.  Their sangria is always good.

Ambiance:  Modern, spacious, clean, including the restrooms.  It feels comfortable without being pretentious here, and because tables are spaced fairly evenly apart, I would not consider the noise levels to be loud.

Service:  The servers are usually friendly and helpful, and they will have others assist them as needed for larger parties.  Think clearly of what you need and ask for it when your server is here, because on a busy night they may not be able to check on you that frequently.

The food:  you need to go in with a good plan.  Certain things you should avoid: 

-Skip the appetizers unless you have a large group and want everyone to be able to try a little something to accompany the bread and salad.
-The Tour of Italy will leave you greased out and loathing anything Italian for days because it's just too heavy.  I advise skipping it along with most other lasagna-like dishes.  My advice instead is to stick with a simple entree because you will not be left hungry from the unlimited bread sticks and salad/soup included with your meal.  
-Chicken Marsala over the stuffed version.  There isn't that big of a difference between the two.  Since this is a chain, the menu also points out how many calories are in each order.  That will be helpful to at least some in making a decision.  
-They also have great after dinner mints that comes with the check and are fairly generous with them.  Take them home if you're too full!

Price:  
-Spaghetti with meatballs costs $15, and the one without meatballs is among the cheapest items on the menu. Sounds expensive, I know, but the meatballs are huge.  
-The herb-grilled salmon costs $20.
-Even a slice of heavy lemon cream cake will cost around $8--not cheap.
People will complain about the cost because it isn't cheap, but I think that between the generous portions, the free accompaniments, and the nice atmosphere, it's worth it.  Remember that the prices include all the freebies, of which I am a fan.  It'd be hard to get out of there without paying at least $25 per person for an entree, drink, and splitting a dessert(you will only need a single slice for two people).

Aside:
-The reviews for the unlimited pasta/soup lunches that occur seasonally should be taken into context:  those will not necessarily translate to an equivalent dinner experience because it is a very different setting and menu.  Try for yourself--I think chances are you'll have a good time here :)
author: Stephen N.

description: This location's service changes almost every time we come eat. I have had good dinners and not so good dinners. about a week ago we went back to try their all you can eat pasta deal, and both of our orders got messed up and wrong at one point. On top of that, our salad had little to no dressing or croutons. disappointing.
author: Nicole C.

description:
Love the sopa Toscana, my fav!! 

Good atmosphere and the wait for a table can be long depending on the time of day your going.
author: Rogelio V.

description: Loved the place . Was there with my wife more than the food the server(Chris)was great, very attentive . Great cozy evening spent what exactly I was looking for
author: Ajay M.

description: They straight up told me that they were unable to serve al dente pasta. That's just unacceptable.
author: Nicole L.

description: The service was the worst I have ever had!!! It took us 2 1/2 hours. I will never go again and will tell everyone else DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY OR YOUR TIME!!!
author: Lynn H.

description:
I strictly come here for their Steak Gorganzola pasta. Its amazing! 
chicken and gnochi soup and steal a couple of bite of my BF's side salad. 
Oh and those lovley breadsticks!
author: Jess G.

description: Refreshing great service was 5 stars!!! The wait was soooo long, my moms beer took 30 minutes, my Chianti was not good....food took at least an hour and was not that great....
author: Dee D.

description: I saw a mouse run from under my table to the one across. When we told the waiter, she didn't do anything but tell her manager who also didn't do anything but blame it on the Chevy's across from them.
author: Ana R.

description: I went to Olive Garden and let me start off with they seated us and took forever for us to get a waiter and when we did, she took our drink orders and left for 15 minutes and never came back to our table. Then, when we were still waiting, another waiter named DECORIUS B came up and asked if our orders were took and when we said no, he was kind enough to take our orders....or so I thought....THEN, he came back with our soups and he forgot to put a spoon on my plate. I understand if it were too busy or it was the end of his shift and he was tired, but it was really slow and it doesn't take that long to run to the back to get something as simple as a spoon. and he then proceeded to go to another table and take their order and took about 20 minutes to get my spoon, who knows how long he would've taken if we hadn't reminded him multiple times. When we finally got our main dish, he didn't even bother to come back to our table and ask us how our food was once and didn't even ask us for a refill on our drinks. And every time we asked him for a refill on our soup, he seemed annoyed and like we were bothering him. I get if it was a long day and he wasn't feeling it anymore, but I work in retail and customer service as well, and it's all about fake it til you make it! RUINED MY OLIVE GARDEN EXPERIENCE AND I WILL BE REPORTING TO CORPORATE.
author: Jenallee G.

description: This place is kinda loosing its touch .the soup is inconsistent as well for the chicken Alfredo .I find my self wanting to comeb here even less especially with the price hikes .olny reason I will go back is for my wife . You want to try a great Italian spot no one knows about got to taraval and look up marchelos restaurant.
author: Sal L.

description:
Service was fast and attentive
The ravioli and shrimp dish was very tasty
The spaghetti with meat sauce was bland/boring
The salad and bread sticks were both great

Overall a good experience, though I won't get the spaghetti again. 3.5 stars
author: Captain B.

description: This place don't take any reservations and the host has a really bad attitude i highly DO NOT recommend this place has no potential at all
author: Marcos R.

description: This Olive Garden is always crowded.  It is a high volume restaurant, expect a wait.  Lots of families frequent this location.  Food is standard Olive Garden faire and the staff does a good job handling the non-stop crowds.
author: David M.

description:
Olive Garden... those commercials really suck you in! 

I come here ever so often and I've never really had a problem. I don't even bother with the waiting, and I just grab a table at the bar. Makes life easier without waiting for a nice booth. 

Ordered the Capellini di Mare. Delish! Everything was cooked perfectly. Forgot what the bf ordered, but he devoured it. And he even asked for Tabasco... and they obliged. LOL! What a weirdo! 

Love the breadsticks! mMm.

I also love coming here for unlimited pasta but I can never finish more than one bowl... but I like choosing simple pasta dishes. 

Will be back!
author: Jeannie L.

description:
I go to Olive Garden now and then, once in a few months maybe longer.  However quite recently I've been returning continuously - and at one point went twice in one day (crazy, right?).

From that short span of time, I have tried a few things, and others I ordered automatically.  And I figured, I might as well share this with you from what I have noticed.

The first few times I've been to Olive Garden, I experienced a wide range of horrible to incredible service.  Most of which were horrible or barely adequate.  However, I keep coming back because I admit I love the bread sticks and the darn zuppa toscana.  The salad - it depends on who made it that day.

The food also has its own range, and I'll just list the ones that I can remember:

Appetizers:
Grilled Chicken Flatbread - Do not order at any expense! We had it as a dinner appetizer and it was not worth it.  The chicken tasted too bland, the cheese tasted disgusting and dull, and the flatbread it came on was... a bit soggy.  

Stuffed Mushroom - I've had wonderful stuffed mushrooms in the past, none of which were priced this extraordinarily high.  Is it worth it? Not on your life.  It was just as they described it - Mushrooms that were stuffed.  In the way that you wanted it?  No.  It was just Mushrooms that were not baked correctly, and then stuffed with breaded cheese.  I suppose it was cheese that was mixed with bread crumbs?

Lasagna Fritta - Something that I admit, I have grown addicted to.  It really is a good piece in my opinion.  If you must order an appetizer, I highly recommend it if you love cheese and you love marinara sauce.  On the plus side, it's a great appetizer to share for a group of 6.  Or a group of 3.

Classic Recipes:
Linguine alla Marinara - I used to order this in the past.  You can never go wrong with it, if you want a pasta but don't desire to have any heavy meet sauce over your noodles.  I do admit to it being overpriced for a linguine...

Capellini Pomodoro - Another good pasta that I have experienced, and like the linguine, overpriced.  But it's pretty decent and I love the garlic and the basil that comes with this dish.

Eggplant Parmigiana - I haven't had it yet, but my mother had.  It seems that it has become her favorite dish by far.  She loves eggplant, she loves pasta.  It's a good combination. No complaints from her - and she is a picky eater...

Chicken

Stuffed Chicken Marsala all the way! Every bite is so good that you can't help but want more even though you're bursting by the seams.  At least, that's what I thought when I tried it - it was only one time and I haven't ordered it again.  But there are times that I am tempted to just go ahead and order it. ... 

Beef & Pork:
Chianti Braised Short Ribs:  My new favorite.  When I tasted it, I just wanted to horde it all for myself.  No, seriously, it's THAT good.  The ribs were cooked so perfectly that it felt like they could melt in your mouth. The chianti wine sauce it came with drizzled to perfection that it makes your mouth water.  The only complaint that I had were the risotto. But I can ignore that so long as I had my ribs.  (Too bad that I couldn't finish it in the end and packed it for home.  What's wrong with that?  Well... it's because the next day someone ate it in the middle of the night.)

Filled Pasta:
Braised Beef & Tortelloni: Good beef, almost as good the chianti short ribs, but I suppose beef is harder to cook because the braised beef was slightly harder to chew in comparison to the ribs.  The tortelloni were okay, In my opinion, the pasta was slightly too limp for my liking.  

Ravioli di Portobello:  Super good.  Who needs stuffed mushrooms in Olive Garden when you can have ravioli di portobello?

Manicotti Formaggio: Tastes about as good as the fritta - like seriously! We ordered the fritta for an appetizer and then I had the manicotti - it was too much cheese for my liking. But it was SO good.  

Dessert:
Torta di Chocolate - love chocolate?  Hello Torta! However, I will say this:  it won't always be as perfect as you hope it to be.  I had it a few times, and it always either became the absolute perfection as it is in the picture, or it wasn't cooked correctly and when you cut into it, the chocolate did not ooze out.  And you have to wonder, where's the chocolate filling?

Tiramisu: C'mon you're in an Italian restaurant...!  It's creamy custard with lady fingers.  It's bound to be good.

And lastly some last minute advice that I found interesting during all my trips to Olive Garden:  
If you're in a small group of 3-4 or less, go ahead and sit in the Cafe if you manage to get there early enough.  You won't be disappointed - at least I have NEVER been disappointed.  The service is faster, and it's like the waiters can read your mind.  Whereas when I sit in the booth, they take longer and they are not as personable.
author: Nina M.

description: So expensive for mediocre pasta. Good thing we have a coupon...
author: Cindy C.

description:
First off, I would like to say that I used to defend Olive Garden from people's bashing, but now I don't think I can anymore.
In the past, I've always loved coming here for the unlimited bread sticks and salad, but my recent visit here has changed my opinion about this place.

My boyfriend and I decided to have lunch here for his birthday. We got there and got seated in about 5 minutes. So far so good. We were seated in the booth- which seemed like it was a conscious decision made by the people seating us. (Later on I commented on how there were lots of other seats available elsewhere in the restaurant- I physically got up to look around- but we were placed in the booth. Seemed like it was a place for younger folks or people with kids or I might even dare say "minorities").

Anywho, our waiter came to get our order and he did not seem too happy but that's okay I guess the only bad part was that I felt extremely rushed. We ordered our food; the food came. The toscana soup tasted great like always but it seemed like it was poured messily into my bowl- there was soup everywhere around the edge of the bowl. The breadsticks- which I LOVED (note past tense)- were horrible! They tasted like cardboard and felt like they were once frozen. (I LOVE CARBS but those breadsticks made me sad...)

Our dishes were disappointing too. We ordered the chicken parmigiana and something else I didn't bother to remember. The portions were extremely small! I could've sworn it used to be bigger. The parmigiana came with only one small piece of chicken breast and the tiniest bit of pasta and the other dish was all thin pasta with red sauce over it. We could've made these at home and it would've turned out much better.

Food usually makes me a happy lady, but the food here and part of the service just made me become one pissed-off lady. I left the place wondering about how the seatings are arranged, angry, and very unsatisfied. I didn't even want to take the leftover pasta dish home but I didn't want to waste food. My boyfriend left and felt sick afterwards- he blamed it on the salad. Thank you Olive Garden for making my boyfriend sick for his birthday and bringing the *itchiness out of me.
author: Pearl V.

description: Came here with family for a dinner. The food is good, our server Regina is awesome, but her co-helper Katie was extremely rude! She mocked our 13 people party for asking for more bread sticks, telling Regina to not give it. How did I hear this? Well Katie's not the best whisperer. I would have gave this place a 4 star which is way better than what I usually gave them. But the extremely rude Katie just bumped this place down a star.
author: Jessica T.

description: Mah, it was okay. Pretty expensive in my opinion and the food is really regular.
author: Joanne C.

description: I love the zuppa toscana. I ordered it thinking it was endless just like the commercial says... but the server didn't honor that for me. I didn't wanna be a diva about it only because my boyfriend ordered his food plus I was munching on the appetizer we ordered also. But still! I was pretty bummed about it... I'm only being generous with my stars because this is my man's fave restaurant...
author: Navy C.

description:
I'm actually a little partial to this Olive Garden. Yeah, the lines are sometimes too long but you can always eat in the cafe which may not have the best ambiance but you can sit there immediately. And it's Olive Garden, so it's not like you're there for the scenery anyway.

I also like that most of the servers here aren't as pushy as many other Olive Gardens where they try to sell the hell out of you.

But the real hero of this place is the salad/breadstick combo of course. Not that this place does it better than any other OG, but they do it and I love it. The minestrone soup is also pretty solid.
author: Paul C.

description:
Sometimes after school, I always asked my friends to have meals here. The first thing I like there cuz their mixed salad with the dressing and the butter breads are refilled as much as you want and tasting so good. Service is ok. My favorite drink is frullato, its texture is smooth and you could ask them mix the kind of fruits up to your fav. 

Two of the best  I tried were their seafood portofino and alfredo, I like the creamy garlic sauce over the fresh seafood....Since the restaurant is located next to the mall, so it's convenient that If you have to wait in line, you could walk to the mall next to and hang around waiting for them to call you back when your turn come. My roomate used to have Bday party there, and it was super nice, we couldnt get any discount thou.

...Just thinking about the creamy garlic sauce over clam, scallop with long pasta making me hungry. However, again little too pricey ~unless you live near here , If not~I dont recommend it.
author: Hallie N.

description: Olive Garden is a four star restaurant and the extra star is for GRANT!! He was very attentive and thoughtful. So glad we had him as a waiter! He sang my friend happy birthday (almost solo) and went the extra mile to take care of us!
author: Jenni A.

description: Our recent dining experience at this restaurant made an endearing impression with me.  I ordered spaghetti meatballs in arrabiata sauce. The pasta was cooked the right way.  It was, I must admit it was only a pasta in a red spicy sauce with meatballs.  So simple but was combined to make a truly excellent and satisfying meal.
author: Kit P.

description: It's in a mall. The service sucked. The waiter only came around every ten minutes but the the food was decent. Of you want Olive Garden I guess it would be ok if your in the neighborhood, I suggest just going to chipotle next door
author: Austin S.

description: The place was clean.....service was horrible. There were only three tables in our section yet it took forever to get our food. Out waiter, Alan L., never asked to replenish the unlimited salad and breadsticks, never checked on us after our food, brought the bill and left it without asking if we wanted anything else. Food was bland, but not waiters fault.
author: Leonidas M.

description:
I use to HATE this place.  

Last time I went was in High School, back in the mid 90's.  I was broke and impatient. Also, the service there was super slow.

Started going back a couple of months ago since our friends love this place.  Bottomless bread, salad, and soup deal rocks.  Sampling of overly sweet wine is also a nice touch.  Everything tasted fresh.  Service the last 3 times was eager, awkward, but attentive.  Also a great place if you have kids because it's a loud restaurant. 

The secret is to get there at 6pm.  Any later and you will not eat until 7:30.

Also, Zuppa Toscana is the truth!
author: Sam T.

description:
Hipster friend from Williamsburg came to town, so we took him here as a gag.  He whined and complained every minute of it, but I'll be damned if he wasn't bragging about going to Olive Garden on Facebook the next day.

Prices aren't great, and the real horror story is the price your arteries have to pay for a meal here.  You can all-you-can-eat your way up to 4000 calories in a breeze!

It's kind of a fun epilogue to "Suburban Day" at Stonestown, but it makes me sad that in a food mecca like San Francisco that you can wait over 30 minutes to get a table here.
author: Ryan P.

description:
I'm sure none of you would ever go here for the fine dining aspects, the innovative decor, or upscale location...because this place has none of the above!  So WHY would one go here, you ask...

I have no idea.  I used to go to the Olive Garden when I lived in rural North Carolina and there weren't really a lot of options that weren't Applebee's, Chick-Fil-A, or a steak house.  I love Italian food, grew up in an area of the North East where most restaurants serve really fabulous Italian food made by actual Italian people, and so once lost deep in the South, I was left craving the food I grew up on...but none was to be found!!  So I went to the Olive Garden.  I'm not proud of that.  I probably wouldn't admit it in mixed company at a party.  But, my dear Yelpers, I will readily admit it here so that you know without a doubt, I have PLENTY of experience with this chain.

It sucks everywhere.  Trust me.  On both coasts, the North and the South, it's all the same:  true, unadulterated shlock.  The breadsticks taste like the ones in the Pillsbury cans (with some garlic powder sprinkled on top, of course!), the salad is "pre-mixed" (be afraid, be very afraid!), and all of their food is pre-prepared in some way, so that if you have allergies, this restaurant simply cannot accomodate them!

So....

GARLIC ALERT:  If you are allergic to garlic, you really cannot eat here, unless you are fine eating loads of salad without any dressing or some of the gross, fried, over-priced appetizers they offer.  Everything else already has garlic in it, and unlike other restaurants, this one doesn't feature actual chefs who might be capable of using fresh ingredients to create something garlic-free to appease your systemic intolerance of the single most over-used ingredient in modern American cooking.  This also applies to other allergens:  this restaurant chain is pretty inflexible because they aren't making your items 100% fresh with your order; they are simply reheating, or assembling items that have already been prepped.

Why didn't I give them only 1 star then?  Well, the staff here is extremely polite (especially for being located in a shopping mall!), the dining rooms are spacious and clean, and the restaurant is WHEELCHAIR ACCESSIBLE.  So, if you must eat here, at least it won't be a horrid experience.

At the end of the day, there are so many fabulous Italian restaurants in San Francisco, there's no reason to waste your time, money, and palette here...unless you fully understand that this isn't real Italian food, aren't allergic to garlic, and consider this a guilty pleasure.  That's totally cool.   We all have our fast food fetishes.  But for the prices they charge, you can get a much better quality meal in any of a thousand other restaurants, including really excellent Italian joints all over San Francisco!
author: Amy L.

description: Was good the last time we ate there. Allan was a great server and always checked to see if we needed anything. A few months ago was a bad experience. Another waiter name unknown never checked on us. Forgot to bring us stuff after we asked twice. Hopefully it was a fluke but this last time everything was tasty and great service!
author: Mark A.

description:
I usually have a high tolerance for heavy and fatty food, like pasta and spaghetti because I down gallons upon gallons of Chinese black, Oolong, and green tea to flush out everything.  I also give a place a second chance if the first time was no good.

I had the eggplant parmesan on both occasions. After each visit, I experienced tummyaches and diarrhea no matter how much tea I drank...the breadsticks were yummy though.

I'm never going back. I like my own versions of Italian food anyways.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
I only like their soup-salad-and-breadsticks lunch deal.  Service is always good though.  Even when they are busy.  I like their bellini-iced-tea.  All for the price of under $12, after tax and tip.

Not a huge fan of their entrees.  It's kind of microwave dinner to me.  Most of the food boring...and I am hard-pressed to spend that much dough for such mediocre food.
author: Fannie S.

description: I had this amazing server James who made the entire dinner memorable! He brought everything out on time and made several trips to our table throughout the night ! The wine and appetizers were amazing and the entree's were a little basic, but the overall experience was fun !
author: Brandon K.

description:
I didn't leave a great first impression the first time I came here because I was laughing adn choked on water so it was embarrassing.
The next time I came, everyone seems to be in a rush and we didn't even get to enjoy our meals. We barely got our food and the waitress who served us brought us our check a few minutes later. Wouldn't stop coming by and asked if the bill is ready and she kept hovering. How unprofessional. Not to forget, I didn't even bother to give a big tip because of the rush and when we got up and leave after finishing our meal, she rushed over and opened up the check to see how much she got. We didn't even bother to see the look on her face but I'm sure she must think I'm cheap and disappointed. Should be happy you even got a tip. It wasn't busy either and everyone was in a rush, I don't understand but I won't be coming here for a while.
author: Hayden N.

description:
Unlimited Pasta Bowl event or Unlimited Soup n Salad are the only times I really come here. 

Wine selection here, forget about it. Better to just order a soda. 

Bread sticks are bland, oily and not that great. A slice of french bread would be cool. I guess I shouldn't really complain since this place is considered mall food!
author: Jason C. J.

description:
It's been awhile since I've last ate here. So decided to stop by with my boyfriend.

We were quickly seated and we had a choice of sitting at a table or booth. Our server CC was really nice who checks up on us once in awhile and was really friendly. 

I ordered a Seafood Alfredo and Berry Acqua Fresca. The Berry Acqua Fresca looked really nice and sounded really good but after i took my first sip.. ELCK!! it was really fruity and it gave a medicine aftertaste! And when my seafood alfredo came i was just shocked! It was so little in a big plate! i literally just moved all the alfredo to one side of the dish and it looked like i ate half of it already when its actually untouched.. 

I was really disappointed and shocked at how small the dish was. I dont' think i'll come back anytime soon.
author: Angela L.

description:
God truly must love the Olive Garden because it has such undeserved success.  One of the reviewers says they have "descent" food.  I agree, the quality is constantly going down.
After our first experience there we only went back because, when in San Francisco, it is in such a convenient location for us and Chevy's next door is even busier.
I just learned from Yelp reviews that they have a drink refill policy.  I have never received a refill there.  I do know about seconds on soup or salad, but our entrees always arrived before we were halfway through the first course, discouraging us from wanting any more salad.  Recipe for O.G salad:
             One half of a package of supermarket salad mix
             One small tomato cut in quarters (if you're lucky)
             Three peperoncinis
             A few slices of red onion
             One-eighth cup of Wishbone Italian Salad Dressing
             Be sure all salad dressing sinks to bottom of bowl.

My Eggplant Parm was totally void of Parm and sauce and my husband's spaghetti with meat sauce was presented as a vision in white.  So stingy with sauce.
The wait staff congregates while visiting at the tables of their friends.
They lie about the price ($6.95) of their soup and salad entree.  We have paid $8.95 for it at lunch and $11.95 at dinner.
I have a friend who regularly asks for a side of Marinara and pays for it because he considers the food too dry without.  Imagine doing this at an Italian restaurant.
Maybe you've guessed. I don't like the Olive Garden and I'm not going there anymore.
author: Adrienne T.

description: This was definitely the worst Olive Garden I have been to. The food was okay, but the service wasn't. We had 2 waitresses and the first one was snotty and rude. The 2nd one was nice. A woman cleaning tables walked by and made racial slurs into her headset . She also pocketed my expensive makeup compact off of the table.
author: Benjamin T.

description: showed up at 9 30 and they told us they are closing soon and that we had to eat quick. they didnt take our order till 9 50 and our food did come out till 10 20. needless to say we were very mad and will probably never come back ever again.
author: Bill H.

description:
Unlimited zuppa tuscana and salad for $6 = the only thing worth getting.
Everything else is overpriced. 

but Zuppa tuscana is the way into my heart. *hint, fellas*
hahahaha MAKE ME SOME BITCHES!
author: Susy C.

description:
Two stars, just for the service and the average food. The waiter and waitresses definitely attend well to your needs and often check up on you. They are also very familiar with the dishes and can give detailed descriptions on them. The food however, is just unfortunate. I've have the ravioli, several pasta dishes here, and their   dolcinis(chocolate and white chocolate raspberry). The food is mediocre at best, very bland and salty. I could make something better microwavable. The desserts are overly sweet and taste oddly artificial. Plus if I'm  paying $25 for a meal I expect to be served much better food. The cheese ravioli was average, the fettucine alfredo was basically just pasta and overabundance of salt. Unfortunately, the highlight of the meal was the drinks. I had the Strawberry-Mango Limonata, which was refreshing, sweet, and flavorful. Too bad I couldn't say the meal was even close to as good as the drink itself. 
Wouldn't come back again, nor would I recommend coming here. Not even just to try it out.
author: Veronica L.

description:
Sitting in the cold, foggy San francisco wind outside of the mall has gotten me dreaming about those warm, fluffy breadsticks! After an hour wait on a Sunday night, we finally got into the lightly dimmed table in the corner. But we didin't care... We were there for the unlimited pasta deal!! With my sample of wine in hand, i tried to patiently wait for my initial salad and breadsticks (which actually took a while) but it was worth the warm, buttery breadsticks, lightly salted of course. The salad was light and crisp with a mix of different veggies to provide it with more of a crunch. Then came our awaited bowl of pasta. The meat sauce was pretty plain with little pieces of meat mixed into it. The sundried tomato and mushroom sauce was pretty good but not too flavorful. My favorite was actually the five cheese sauce. It was packed with flavor for a cheese lover lke me! The pastas were well cooked and not over/ under done. 
The service was pretty slow (it was really packed!) but our waiter was more than friendly and helpful. It at least gave us time to digest before working on our second bowl so who's complaining? Walking out there with a pasta coma, i wish i saved room for dessert!
author: Stella Y.

description:
Olive garden is generally not one of my favorite places. The food at each branch is consistently heavy on the sauce and calories, and the portions are troubling. 
This branch was no different. I ordered the stuffed chicken marsala. The chicken was sketchy--the outside topping of the chicken looked and tasted like chicken skin but it wasn't supposed to be--that would be all wrong. The portions were too large and the entire meal itself was quite dry, sadly. The service was fine. The atmosphere was family friendly and nice.
author: Idk A.

description: I haven't been to this Olive Garden for a while and this place definitely stepped up their game. I came here with my friend and we had the 2 for $25 dinner deal. AND MY GOD IT WAS QUITE THE DEAL. The service was pretty good. The servers came to help when needed and didn't bother my friend and I too much went we were eating.  I was able to eat and sit around for 1-2 hours talking to my friend. The food is always quiet generous and usually I get full off the bread sticks, salad and soup before I even get the entrees! I use to feel meh about Olive Garden, and now I'm actually excited to go eat here!
author: Ruhjeenuh Z.

description: Awesome waitress !her name is Tara . She was on it ! The food was great I love the eat one here take one home deal
author: Tanya H.

description:
Olive Garden is very overrated in general. I enjoy their unlimited soups, salads and breaksticks, but I hate when the server looks at you crazy when you ask for refills. Hello, it's unlimited. Don't look at me like a cheap pig when I ask for more.

Other than that, everything else on their menu is drenched in butter and cheese, which isn't what Italian food is. There are so many good, little Italian places in the city... Nobody should have to resort to Olive Garden.
author: Sara K.

description: This is a great Olive Garden! Since it's at a mall, you can actually get parking! We parked right out front (on a weekend I might add!). There weren't any tables at the time we got there so the hostess offered the bar area for immediate seating. I'm not normally a fan of eating dinner in the bar area but this was a really nice, quiet bar area. We sat in a corner booth and had wonderful service. I had a peach tea and chicken alfredo and it was yummy. The salad was awesome as always and the waiter kept the breadsticks coming. Definitely the best Olive Garden in the bay area. I highly recommend!!!
author: Dusty N.

description: Joshua is one of the best servers at Olive Garden. Very attentive, polite and professional. Great time here at love garden
author: Ryan G.

description:
Never ending pasta bowl is the reason to come here but be prepared to WAIT a while especially during peak hours like Sunday night!

B -- S
-- Hour plus wait
-- Good luck with parking (shared with Stonestown)
-- Did I mention the WAIT?!
-- Decent service
-- A-ok pasta

Olive Garden is just ok when it comes to Italian. If you're coming here, it's because of a marketing gimmick (never ending pasta bowl) or because you haven't had real Italian (see: Bacco in my reviews). 

You can't deny that unlimited soup, salad & breadsticks isn't awesome. I mean it's decent salad, a good selection of soup and the breadsticks when hot & fresh are delicious.

Our first bowl of pasta is usually the best one you get because it's the biggest and the freshest. From there it goes down hill. Olive Garden is pushing out these bowls with minimum taste and maximum efficiency.

We ended up sitting at the bar counter because the wait is just way to ridiculous. If you can, grab a seat and act like a vulture waiting for someone to leave.
author: Daniel D.

description: Overall great dinning experience, our waitress Regina was super sweet and very easy going! She gave us amazing customer service.
author: Gloria C.

description: I come to the Olive Garden a lot, and I've never had service as good today. Our waiter's name was Moustfa, he was perfect. Friendly, attentive, and checked up on us often. He was dope!
author: Justine L.

description:
Horrible. Visited your Stonestown location in San Francisco last Saturday 9/27/14 at approx 5pm. 4 of us waited approx 20 mins to be seated. Once we were seated we were not greeted for at least 10 mins. Many waiters and busboys walked by and finally one waiter asked if we were being helped. His name is "Mous." We were clearly not one of his assigned tables so he at least took our orders. Still seeing that we were not being services he finally just took over the table and proceeded to give us what I would call "Excellent" Service. Couple things however:
1) It appears they were way understaffed here. Way understaffed. There was no manager in sight until we asked for one at the end. 
2) Most of the staff was appropriately and neatly dressed. However a few of them were very sloppy dressed with their pants half way down their rear-ends. Unacceptable when you're serving the public.
3) Men's bathroom... disgusting! Garbage can overflowing on to the floor. Sinks and counters completely splashed making it hard to wash up. All stall's floors wet with urine where you just simply didn't want to sit.
4) We spoke to a manager just as we left. Mainly to compliment our specific wiater and  his efforts. It just simply appeared that he was the only one going the extra mile. The Manager showed no signs of caring in any which way shape or form. This Management Staff needs complete retraining! Again that's if what I described above is unacceptable to The Olive Garden.
author: Peter M.

description:
- Food: 6/10. It's Olive Garden. Pretty good for the price actually.
- Vibe: 4/10. Sat in a huge room in the back which is basically a big hall. Very little in the way of decorations. We arrived late and by that time the room was hot and smelly.
- Service: 5/10. Sticky table and I had to ask for a wipe. Had to wait a while for check. Nothing terrible but wasn't impressed.
author: Alistair P.

description: All you can eat buffet for only 8.50! Kristen, a fun looking waitress did a great job.
author: Stan Y.

description: ok so I may be a bit biased because I LOVE Olive Garden! My friends and colleagues always joke with me because I've been to a million highend Italian restaurants and have even traveled around Europe but somehow Olive Garden makes its way to my list of favorite restaurants!  I will admit I'm not always impressed with the service but the food is always great. This location is cool because you can wonder around the mall while your name is on the list to be seated. Let me warn you, I've had to wait up to 2 hours to be seated so plan to wait, but it will pay off in the end for the all you can eat salad and bread. I really don't understand why yelpers think OG is expensive, its average $15-20 per person.. That's pretty cheap in my book for dinner.
author: V I P.

description:
I don't know why this location is always so busy.  This is not the place to go to for authentic, quality Italian food.  When a place uses small, frozen shrimps in their pasta, you know it's not quality food.  

I give this place 3 stars for their Unlimited Soup & Salad Special.  Their salad is nothing special, but their Toscana soup is delicious! Filling up on soup and salad for under $10 is pretty good to me!
author: Uyen L.

description: I am so feeling the lunch specials of all you can eat soup, salad and breadsticks. It's a decent price for a good lunch. The only thing is this place is always packed even at lunch and weekends. There's always different waitstaff here so it's hard to comment about the service.
author: Marie P.

description: Was shopping at stonestown with my gf when we got hungry and decided to just try this place haven't been to one in a while and now I know exactly why. Place was not that busy yet after we were seating in a room with shitty chairs on wheels and given our menus no server came to even acknowledge our presence or MAYBE take our drinks. You figure a place that's a national chain would maybe have better standards for waiting tables, maybe a HELLO WE SEE YOU would work. Corporate is getting a very nice email from me...
author: Anthony M.

description:
Who would want to eat at Olive Garden?  I certainly would not!!!  Here's why...

1. Slow paced - I went here for Sunday late lunch at 1:30 and got seated at 2:25!  It wasn't a holiday, just a regular Sunday.  Ok, I thought maybe the long wait was just for the seating, but no, the servers take their sweet time to bring us our order.  In fact, the food was delivered to our table at 3:30.  I decided against ordering a dessert for fear that it might reach our table at 6pm.

2. Small portions - I ordered a 3-item sampler and was surprised when I saw the amount of food!  It was not even enough for 2 people (not heavy eaters, may I say) to share.  For the high prices of the food lists on their menu, I was expecting a big portion, but again, I was dismayed by the very little food on my plate.  I could've gone to other restaurants with cheaper prices and bigger sizes.  Oh and the taste is not that great either, just so-so, average food.

3. Service sucks -  Our server put away our salad bowl and didn't even ask us if we wanted a refill.  He proceeded to get our salad plates etc.  So I asked for another serving of the salad.  And there it was, just the salad!  No salad plates, nothing!  I asked for plates and up to the time we finished the salad (we just used our entree plates), no salad plate came.  Also, the waiter won't ask you what kind of dressing you'd like, he just served the salad and that's it.  He was asking us if we wanted a refill for the breadsticks though.  I don't know if he was even looking at our table because he could've seen that we were overflowing with their plain old breadsticks!  Man, the breadsticks were so bland I wouldn't even take it for free.

And now I got an Olive Garden gift card for Christmas.  Trade, anyone?
author: clark f.

description: 5 stars for amazing service. Came in around 8:00pm 4/16 for dinner w/ my partner. I was under dress just with my Cal sweater and some sweat pants. Glad that I was not judge by appearance and age bcus he gave amazing customer service. As we got seated he made sure to introduce his name. And I heard it loud and clear "My name is Chris and I will be your server for tonight" I mean I hope his name its Chris bcus that's what I heard. He was a tall, male, late 30s, with glasses, I believe he's Caucasian. He ask if we had any questions about the menu and when I did ask he answered all my questions politely. We gave him 20% tip, I hope he got it. I hate when it goes to the wrong server. I appreciate and acknowledged great service and I thank you for that Chris. And the food was good. $11.99 unlimited breadstick soup or salad with duo classic. And my partner got the tour of Italy which is my favorite. I actually told him to get that. The bread sticks and salad got me so full by the time I got my entree I only took a few bites and I was done. Overall it was a good experience!
author: Boo Z.

description: I got a salad and it was great! The breadsticks and appetizers were also awesome. I'll definitely be back
author: Helena B.

description:
Came here for lunch with coworkers once, and got the unlimited soup. Since I only drink soups that I can see through, I only really got the minestrone, but I thought it tasted fine. Maybe a little on the fatty/oily side, but nothing that really bothered me. They also had unlimited breadsticks - lots of yum, but fills you up quick since they are also lots of fatty/oily.

Service was alright. We had called in ahead to see what the wait would be, and they said that there was none, but when we showed up we still had to wait for 10 minutes. I don't know if they suddenly got really busy or something, but you would think that a restaurant would know how busy they are during lunch. When I went to find the waiter to pay (my group had cash & card), he took the money and then neglected to count it. He had to ask me how much cash I had actually given him. I mean, he was still a really nice guy and everything, but...yeah.
author: Melody L.

description:
5 stars for the excellent customer service. 

Checked the table enough times so we didn't have to look for him. Very friendly and responsive. We also has a change in waiter and he was willing to box anything we could possibly take home for free. The staff seemed really chill and bettered the experience. 

3 stars for the food. 

Nothing memorable. I had the fettuccine Alfredo. It had a hair in it, but quickly replaced. 

By the way, the wait was 45 mins arriving at 7:30.
author: Tiger S.

description:
It is Olive Garden, you can't expect it to be awesome, but I still think the food here is pretty descent.... depending on what you are ordering.

I came here many times before, but recently I came here to get the never ending pasta bowl for $8.95! It is ridiculously cheap for all you can eat pasta, and unlimited soup or salad, and bread sticks. My favorite soup is the Zuppa Toscana because it has sausages and potatoes... unfortunately the quality of the soup is very inconsistent.... it is different every time I come here. 

Anyways... my review of the pasta bowl.... I tried three of the sauce... The chianti three meat, creamy parmesan portobello, and the five cheese marinara. The five cheese marinara was my least favorite out of the three I tried. The chianti three meat sauce was ok, but it is nothing compared to the creamy parmesan portobello. The creamy parmesan protobello was amazing, it reminds me of alfredo sauce, but you really do get the portobello mushroom taste in the sauce. It goes great with penne or fettuccine.

My boyfriend got the Parmesan Crusted Bistecca, and I got to try a bit of it and it was really good.

BUT it took FOREVER... because my boyfriend wanted medium-rare... and they came out with EXTREMELY well done.... it was ridiculous.... so we had to send it back and the manager came out and apologized... But when they came out with the new plate, the beef was even bigger than the previous plate and it was cooked perfectly. It tasted absolutely amazing, and the mash potatoes were really good too. 

AND because the chef messed up, my boyfriend got his entree for free.
author: Alicia W.

description:
As much as I expected for a restaurant seated next to stones town mall, it's crowded and fairly decent food with a hefty price tag. Unless you split the check with everyone there, the total for each meal is roughly going to be $15-20 each which seems a little pricy in my own opinion. But people do get a good amount of food, not including breadsticks and soup or salad.
Seating around dinner is usually heavy as the waits do take roughly 20 minutes to get a seat. But fairly sad marks go to waiting services, as they seem scattered around the entire restaurant instead of having their particular waitress-ing sections all together. It takes roughly 5, 10, 20 minutes in-between visits the waitress made to the table during the entire course. As much as she was going well to try and please. My biggest WTF of the meal involved one particular dish that one person in my company decided to get for their dinner. The  Grilled Pork Veneto had an interesting taste with the roasted garlic tomato sauce that was poured over the raviolis. To be honest, it tastes like chunky salsa on some pasta that seemed too bizarre! As much as I tried to hold onto my food, it still because a pricy meal with an odd taste left in my mouth and stomach.
author: A. R. G.

description: Horrible service!!! Our waiter was so slow to bring anything and forgetful. The soup was spilled all over the plate and looked so dirty same as the margarita I ordered so sticky all over the glass. He never checked on us and when our food came out we asked where is our appetizer He was kept telling I didn't forget ur appetizer then where the fuck is our appetizer??? When the appetizer came oh my god it was horrible. no dipping sauce nothing the calamari was stick together in big bundle. He even forgot the dirty plates on our table that he was carrying! I'm never coming back and If there was minus stars I would give them -5 stars!
author: Hool A.

description: Since I grew up in San Francisco, feeling like I am in suburbia is glamorous. I love the eggplant parm, endless breadsticks, chocolate mousse, and the minestrone soup. All of it was delicious. It's nothing crazy, but it's good and it's a ton of food, almost to the point of too much food. Our server, Cecilia was so on top of her game. She was funny, helpful, and took care of us. We had about a 30 min wait but we walked around Stonestown and loitered in the Apple Store with our buzzer. I have been here twice and loved it both times. Do it, you know you want to.
author: Julia D.

description:
We've been here twice, what's so good about it.  The first time we came, I had the chicken marsala.  The chicken breast is reformed chicken meat, yuk!!  The sauce was tasty though.  

We went again because there's not much of a choice of seat down restaurants at Stonestown.  Nothing on the menu appealed to me, so I had the soup and salad.  It was okay.

The service was good.
author: M. K.

description:
Diggging the food, not the service. ZUPPA TOSCANA AND THE GNOCCHI SOUPS. MUST. Their parmesan crusted chicken is a pleasant run for your tums too. 

SERVICE WISE? 
Honestly.. Why do lawyers work so hard to make money.. and yet they're still working hard in their career! Duhhhhh!!! Get a job at olive garden. Get paid to be a snob! 

Ive only seen 1 guy ever work hard here.. hes this asian guy, strong built? He's usually around the back area? 
Well you know how when you encounter servers and ask them YO DAWG, WHERE MY FOOD AT? OR YO BUD, MAY I GET A REFILL? And their answer is DUDE, IM NOT YOUR SERVER. Ill get em for you. How hard is it to go back there and get a bowl of something? Well this guy saw that the area around me wasn't too crack a lackin, so he would come by before our food went empty to refill everything. He put in 150%. It was amazing, I wanted to hand him the tip instead of leaving it to our server:( SUCKS BALLS. 

Oh and recently.. one time, our food literally took half an hr, and refills took another half an hr. My boyfriend and I sat there like =.=.... And the server comes up and goes OH SORRY. My replacement was supposed to come. Well if I had the choice, I'd go up to the replacement myself.. but um no. As a server, thats your responsibility. People really make me sick. I mean we got free dessert which kinda makes up for it.. but by then I was full and too upset to stuff more sweets into my body. 

OH SIDE NOTE: When I went to the restroom once(this is during the unlimited pasta for 8.95 which is still going on) I saw 4 workers by the kitchen chatting up their lives and laughing which angry hungry customers were painfully waiting for their food, and I heard the servers go "HAHAH LOOK AT HER! SHES GETTING FULL I THINK! IM GONNA WAIT ANOTHER MINUTE BEFORE HANDING OUT THIS BOWL OF PASTA" WTFFFFFFFFFFF DUDEZZZZ. 

Now my food is gonna contain spit, but ENOUGH WITH YOUR NONSENSE YOU DAMN "LAWYERS"
author: Wendy X.

description: Hmm..well, My mom and I walked in to make a reservation and the lady at the counter asked the manager to come here.  We waited for a good 30 minutes and we asked her if the manager was coming, and she said she'll be coming soon.  Another 30 minutes passed and we got pissed off and just left.
author: Adel H.

description: Pretty good for a corporate-owned place.
author: Joe V.

description:
Olive garden is five minutes away from my school. 

I've been here so many times, but never fell in love with it.
I don't even like the breadstick.

Service is inconsistent.
And there is always a wait, while nothing is worth waiting for. 

Okay, I like the soup tho. So I guess that's 1 star extra.
author: Marlis T.

description: Breadsticks and chicken gnocchi are the best tandem around. With that the tour of Italy is the go to dish to compliment a glass of Chardonnay. Food is always spectacular here but it gets really busy and full at the lobby at night. Waiting for 30-45 min for a party of 3 is treacherous. Fortunately it's worth it when endless pasta is available during it's season
author: Raymond L.

description: We knew what we were after when we went to Olive Garden. We got it. It was ... fine.
author: Karen C.

description:
food: 2/5
service:5/5
decor/cleanliness: 5/5
An Olive Garden like all the others

Ah, Olive Garden. I used to come here years ago when the food was still good. Now the food quality has gone down and I come here once in a blue moon. The good thing about this place is that I always leave with a full stomach and even some left overs. But that's only if i get a meal that comes with the salad or soup. I feel like the price is kind of expensive for the quality of food. When I go there, I definitely have to have a coupon or it's not worth it.
author: Cecile S.

description:
four stars!

+1 fast service. My coworkers came out here to catch up after work and got seated right away
+1 good service. Raf was really nice and sweet. He made recommendations since we were all looking to try something new.
+1 clean. no food stains on my fork and plate
+1 food yumyum more cheese with my salad please
author: Joanna S.

description:
A party of 10 arrives 45 minutes earlier than the reservation time.
Hostess flights me and said we cannot seat you earlier and  debate
this for 5 minutes and finally  seats in 30 minutes. Oliver Garden
why spend millions on advertising when your seating policy sucks!

If you like like cafeteria food ... this is your eatery.  All pasta dishes were served luke
warm.  Sausages were not grilled (steamed?) and Meat balls just average.  Soup and
Salads were OK.
author: Food Sage W.

description:
I love going to Olive Garden and getting their all you can eat salad, bread sticks and soup. Their minestrone is good stuff!!! 
Not really reasonably priced unless they have sales going on. Their endless pastas are another great deal. 
Their wine and desserts are too pricey for the quality for this Yelper.
author: joanna r.

description:
Where to start

Your like sizzler with delusions of Italian grandeur

Your "homemade sauces" taste like Ragu, and you're prices are COMPLETELY UNREASONABLE for the portion and the quality. You have NOW have a corkage fee (10 big ones) so the once great perk that you could bring in 2buck chuck from TJ's next door and at least get your buzz on with your crap food is sadly no more =(

Only perk would be that great unlimited salad/breadsticks deal EXCEPT your food gives me explosive fire breathing diarrhea at 4am EVERY SINGLE TIME I GO!!!

sorry for being descriptive...but had to make that point!

YOU SUCK OG...YOU SUCK THE BIG ONE!
author: Sachi P.

description:
Honestly, I feel like I wrote a review for  this place several times and it seems to get deleted but whatever.

I love Italian food so much that if I wasn't Filipino, I would wish to be Italian. To get my Italian fix I come here since it's close to me. I've came here so many times with my friends and my boyfriend. First time I ever came here was for my friend's birthday party. We had the whole back room to ourselves which was nice since there was a good amount of us. The only thing I remember is a bunch of my friends and I found their Andes Mints stack and took a handful of them LOL. Anyways, I came here recently and our waitress was really friendly and kept asking us if we needed a refill for our drinks and even more salad/bread sticks. I hate how they've been stingy with their bread sticks though.  That's the whole reason why i come to Olive Garden is because of that and their salad, haha. Really friendly staff but when it gets busy, it's busy considering this is the only Olive Garden in San Francisco and it's surrounding cities.
author: Janice V.

description: We really like this Olive Garden. I don't think we've ever been here without there being a huge wait, so we just go into the bar area and eat there.
