Every time we've gone, we've had a good meal. I loved their buy a meal, take one home deal. That was one of the best meals I've had in awhile. The server who helped us was awesome, and was totally happy to help us out and give suggestions. Overall this place is cool and worth the wait.
author: John T.

description:
Today, the wife and I had lunch here because my wife wanted some soup. She ordered the soup, salad and bread sticks and I had the lasagna. Everything that we ate was too salty. I asked our waitress if there was another soup (they had 4 choices on the menu) that was NOT so salty? She said that all their soup were like that. WTF! Why have a salt shaker on the table if they insist on making soup pre-salted to a point that makes you dehydrated afterwards. My lasagna was the same...lacking in quality due to their cook's excessive need to make everything salty!

Just piss poor! Never again will we patronize this place!
author: Andi L.

description: Saturday evening after shopping at the mall, decided to have dinner here.  After a long 45 minutes later we were taken to our seats.  Service was good.  Always love their drinks here.. daiquiri's, wine list, sangrias.  Their chicken gnochi soup tasted great.  By the time we devoured the soups, breads and salad we were filled.   If not for the throngs of people waiting to get a table here, the dining would have been pleasant.
author: Hema K.

description:
What.... the.... F&*#k is up with the wait time....

seem fairly empty and still made us wait..

the waiters need to come around more often or they need a button to alarm which table need service in general for all restuarants

food was cool nothing to hyped about except the salad, i love the salad the way its served it's just has the right  amount of dressing and the ingredients just looks fresh as it gets

but no ones likes waiting!!

the soups seem pre heated but im not complainning
author: Dylan C.

description:
Sometimes I don't know why I stop into chain restaurants thinking anything but mediocrity will come out of it.

I had a cheese ravioli with meat sauce and my pasta was dry, the meat sauce was literally loaded with 2x the daily maximum intake of sodium, and the bread sticks were stale. 

Service consisted of being checked up on once and having to wait 20 minutes for our waiter to come back to our area just to get a check. 

Next time I'll pass and go on back to North Beach.
author: Crystal C.

description:
After a long semester, my bestie and I came here for lunch after our last final. Since we go to SF State and we were craving carbs, why not Olive garden?

We got there on a friday at 10am, but I think they opened at 11am. No problem, we walk around the mall, give each other xmas gifts and drink some Starbucks. Time flew by quickly, and we went back at 11.

We were quickly seated. Although the food was good and cheap, the waiter was kind of late when it came to refilling our drinks or bringing us more bread. I mean, if its a busy house, I understand, but really, there was like 5 waiters and 5 people in the restaurant. 

I remember paying only $10 for my meal and drink. I'll probably come back again at the end of the next semester. Or if I crave italian food again.
author: Sophia G.

description: We were just in for dinner tonight.  We were celebrating my kid's b'day.  Our server Kristen was awesome.  Her warm smile and great service made our dinner even better.  Thanks for servicing water to my kid in a wine glass.  He was very happy and I really appreciated your patience with them.
author: Nancy T.

description:
I have had Olive Garden at many different location, including the ones in AZ & other CA locations.
This one located in San Francisco is by far the worst Olive Garden I've ever had.  
How can you go wrong with the bread sticks????  It's as if they did not bake it at all.  Please go to the other Olive Garden restaurants & see how it is done!
author: Ying S.

description:
So I came here a couple years ago for my friend's birthday and she came in late for her reservation and we all had to wait 2 hours! 

All the waiters are extremely courteous and willing to make small talk. They offered us wine, even though we were under aged, and they said even if we were babies they still would offer us wine, which was amusing. 

I ordered the strawberry sicilian splash (Italian soda) with whip cream and it was delicious. It tasted like a smoothie! Also ordered the Five Cheese Ziti Al Forno, which was somewhere between ordinary to good. Also had the sampler appetizer with calamari, pork ravioli, and mushroom w/cheese. I wasn't too fond of the ravioli because the exterior was too fried and hard. The ziti is accompanied with a soup or salad, so we chose the chicken and gnocchi soup. It was good! We ate it with the bread that came along with it. The bread combined with the soup was probably the best part of the meal! Afterwards I asked the waiter for the chocolate covered candy with green mint on top because I heard it was good, and it was! Price is $11-15. 

It was a bit annoying that there were screaming toddlers in the room, but the food and environment was pleasant nonetheless.
author: Vicki L.

description:
I'd like to be able to give a review based on a more thorough visit...  review the food, the cocktails, the service...  but I can't.  Our friends were inside eating and we were next door at the nail shop inside the galleria.  Our appointments went long, so we arrived at 10:05pm.  The door was locked and we told the hostess we knew we wouldn't be served, but that our friends were inside and we were their ride - could we sit inside with them while they finished their meal? She said she had to ask the manager to let us in and had us wait outside in the cold.  Her manager came out, and without asking us any questions or acknowledging what we'd told the hostess, also told us that we wouldn't be allowed inside and would have to wait out there for our friends to come out.  I mean, come on!  We both work at restaurants and have never witnessed this.  We didn't want drinks after 2am, we didn't want food after the kitchen closed, we just wanted to come inout of the cold and wait for our friends who were already inside!  Still shaking my head.
To add, I'm not one for dramatics, so I can't say they were both overtly rude, but they definitely weren't going out of their ways to be pleasant.
author: Tori T.

description: Went here for my sister birthday tonight party of three paid 86 not including tip I was disappointed in what I chose the eggplant with spaghetti the marinara sauce was too thick and the eggplant was soggy with hella cheese I did like the complimentary glass of Moscato but that's about it
author: Rashida S.

description: On my last visit to the Olive Garden, our server (Danika M), made us feel so welcome and taken care of. Our drinks and bread sticks were always full. 2 of us ordered the endless soup and salad, and she made sure that before we finished one, our next soup/salad was ordered. She was very knowledgeable about the menu and the whole experience was great!
author: Gina R.

description: Good place not the best service. We came in on Monday April 25th around 2:30 they sat us in the first room to the left at the first 4 person table against the wall. I can't remember the waiters names we didn't see him long enough to catch it. He was early 20s and black with his hair a little grown out. The food was ok my boyfriend didn't like his food they gave him a plate of noodles with barely any sauce. Half way threw our meal when we needed refills he was no where to be found we waited and kept eating. Within a 10 minutes we were both done with our food. We were full and dying to get a refill. After waiting another 5 minutes we decided to just pay the bill on the little monitor. The thing was blinking red the whole time saying it was out of paper but no one fixed it so we didn't get a receipt. We walked out with without even getting the tray of mints. In total we went about 25 minutes without a waiter. Which in not good to mean. I found it every rude he got a $2 tip we would have talked to the manager. It was that bad I will never go again .
author: Ileana L.

description: Don't let the haters dissuade you: Olive Garden is awesome. The bread sticks are like crack! The crowds don't lie. I'll take that 45 minute MUNI ride out to Stonestown for Olive Garden anyday. Thankfully you can have unlimited refills on bread and salad. My faves are the fettucini alfredo with steak. Can we say 3k calories? Also - the soups are awesome. All in all: awesome. Also much cheaper than going to some fancy pants Italian place.
author: Carlos A.

description: I was very impressed by the service for a chain restaurant. The food was as good as other olive gardens. We had the three course option with salad, an entree, and a dessert. It was pretty good portions for 12.95.
author: Timothy B.

description:
You know those Olive Garden commercials about "unlimited soup and salad"?
Well, after watching the commercial for the 30th time, I finally suggested we go to Olive Garden for a "healthier" (and definitely cheaper) meal option for dinner one evening.  I like soup, he loves soup.  I love salad, he likes salad.  We both eat a lot, so unlimited portions of each sounded like a good deal.

About 12 years ago, I had been to an Olive Garden.  
It was a funny story in that many people from my family had gotten together to help a relative move, and *I* was insistent that we should all head to Olive Garden because the commercials made the pasta look good.  *I* convinced the whole lot of us to go. It would require four cars packed full and a 10 minute drive but everyone agreed to go;  I was happy.  Later,  they all climbed into the cars to head to the restaurant, and took off before I had gotten out of the house.  Seriously - they left me behind because they forgot about me.  I sat by the garage in disbelief for 20 minutes - which was exactly how long it took them to get to the restaurant and realize I was missing.  Yeah, the family had a great laugh at my expense and still talk about the event, "Remember when we left Grace behind?"  

Yeah - very funny.

Anyhow, back to the food.  I believe I had a fettuccine alfredo on that day when I finally got picked up to go to the restaurant, and it was just okay.   I mean - I obviously never returned again for 12 years, so it couldn't have been that good.

In any case, one evening several months ago, we headed to OG, again based on advertising. 

At this particular location, service was a mixed bag.  Some servers were outstanding, others walked around with a sign on their forehead that read: 'Nobody Home".  We sat in a typical OG booth and perused the menu to see what was offered.  

There was only one kind of salad, but about five soups offered.

Let me put it this way.
Never before or since have I had a salad this boring.  BORING.
Each soup we tried was begging for a quick death.  It's hard to make all five soups bad, but somehow, OG managed to do just that.  Even accidentally, one of five soups should have been decent at least, but nope, they beat all the odds!

When a restaurant offers "unlimited" anything, one of the main concerns may be that people with enormous appetites will come and eat them out of house and home.  Well, OG has figured out the quickest way to make sure that not only do people not request seconds - they don't even make a second visit!

We looked at each other across the table and agreed that this was a good effort at eating cheap and eating healthy, but nope - this would not suffice.  Not for us.

Not in this lifetime.
We went home utterly dissatisfied and made instant noodles.

The upside, though, is that at least this time, I wasn't left behind.
author: Grace K.

description: Horrible service.  I am not sure if the sheer volume of customers caused confusion, but our waiter messed up my salad, forgot to substitute broccoli for asparagus, and completely forgot to place the order for my main dish. Also the absence of our waiter was annoying to say the least. Fortunately, we are not from this area.
author: Aaron W.

description: We came to this location years ago.  After a few years we decided to come in for lunch today, as we were in area. Bad choice, front hostess was condescending when explaining to me, after being called to be seated, that she hadn't noticed my baby in arms so we had to wait longer for another table that could accommodate a high chair. Not only did I ask for a high chair, but the baby in arms wasn't obvious enough I guess. Our server was super nice & polite, but only checked in on us once throughout our whole meal. Our food was cold, bland, yet over seasoned. Our veggies were dehydrated & wilted. Had to wait till the end of our meal for a coffee refill & food was not good. Overall unfortunate bad experience & will not be returning. Way too over priced for the low quality food & service you're getting!
author: ShNella K.

description: Went here for lunch today. I've been here a few times over the years, and they always make you wait forever to be seated. I wouldn't really put up with it on a typical day but I kinda have a thing for their salad and breadsticks and the capellini pomodoro was actually pretty decent. Olive Garden isn't really all that special, but for Americanized Italian it's not completely horrible, and plus you're sort of limited in sit down places at Stonestown where they'll allow you to catch up with friends for a good hour or two. Waitstaff was quite friendly and attentive, and they play ridiculously loud Fred Sinatra in the bathroom.
author: Natasha P.

description: We haven't been here in a long time. It feels good to return and have some fresh bread, salad and pasta! I love pasta! My son loves the Zeppoli - sugar-dusted Italian doughnuts served w/ chocolate sauce. Who can pass up chocolate? :-). A plus!!!
author: Mia B.

description:
Almost all the food here is terrible, don't even bother getting an entree as you WILL be disappointed... and then you will feel downright sick when you see your bill and realize that you just spent $18 on that terrible, tasteless crap. 

If you are going to eat here, maybe you have that faux Italian taste that only Olive Garden can deliver, stick with the bread sticks, soups and salad. If you must get more, stick with the pastas, the service is good enough that you might be able to write off the night as "OK".
author: Cole M.

description:
I almost feel guilty having to pick on poor Olive Garden, but... SLAMMMMM!

This boring location is nothing more than a few walls, carpet, and chairs thrown together to make a few bucks off of each party. There aren't even any plants nor greenery to soften the place up and make it more inviting. 

The food, as you might expect, is merely Italian-style crap, saturated in Italian-style dressing and Italian-style sauces.  Ordering the new  Pork Milanese (ooooh! they're calling it NEW!!) was the worst mistake I made all weekend.  *YAWN*
author: Daniel C.

description:
We LOVE the food each and every time we go. AND we HATE the service each and every time we go.  Their customer service stinks. Starting with the:
Hostess: Rude, thinks she was too cute to help anybody
Waiter: Tells is we cant have any refills on our BOTOMLESS salad.. WTF he dumb
Waiter #2: Says the kitchen closed already so no more bottomless Gnocchi soup. F youuuuuuuu!!
author: JASE B.

description:
For the record - the bar for great Italian food is set very high for my palate, personally hailing from a predominantly Italian portion of northern New Jersey [NO, not the Shore] where tomato-based palatable goodness was never far out of reach. I never once adhered to the propaganda that Olive Garden was anything close to that.
If the Zuppa Toscana wasn't so freakin' addicting, I'd never eat here. I actually am not very fond of anything else Olive Garden has to offer - whether it's the giant bowl of formed salt and water [olives and non nutrient dense iceberg lettuce], the mediocre pasta that they dry to cover with heaps of shredded sodium and saturated fat so you don't notice, or the phallic shaped rods of tasteless, oily, and sometimes even burned, carbohydrates they call "bread sticks." Doesn't matter. The Zuppa Toscana [a sausage, bacon, and potato soup that is the only thing that can soak kale or Swiss chard into deliciousness] usually makes up for everything else.
Not this last time. Customer service was so bad it prompted the necessity for a review. 
I came in for lunch with my usual lunch date on a lovely Tuesday afternoon last week. Our waiter, [I wish I remembered his name but he never introduced himself so I didn't even bother] was a monotonous and fidgety fellow whose only joy in life was to keep moving. *Think UPS Delivery guy skits from MadTV, but with a little more creepy eagerness and a lot less enthusiasm.* 
Anyway, he only seemed to feel his most purposeful when returning to our table to pick up ... God knows what ... a fork one minute... another fork another minute... an olive on the table... a plate here...  a plate there -- you get the picture. He kept asking if everything was okay - but walked away with another item from our table without waiting for an answer. He never once re-filled our water glasses. Weird. It was funny the first... four times. We were pretty jealous of the booth in front of us whose waiter was a very personable chap who seemed to have the ability to get along with anyone. 
So I got the lunchtime unlimited soup salad and bread sticks deal, hoping to have my fill of the Zuppa Toscana. Evidently - since I am not a glutton and decided four bread sticks was a little much for me and didn't plan on getting more than what was in the basket - giving my bread sticks to my lunch date "voided" the "unlimited"-ness. That's fine. I get it. But the waiter didn't tell us - until he cleared everything but the soup bowl from the table and we asked for a refill of the soup. "Oh I'm sorry," he said to the room, "You shared. According to policy, I have to charge you for another 'unlimited soup, salad, & breadsticks' deal." No, thanks.
Haha. No words, just disgust at the phenomenally disgraceful customer service. 
I mean, I wouldn't have minded had we gotten the warning before ordering or if he was a little nicer about it.. less creepy... anything. Eh. 
I am in disbelief because my last couple of soup quests were better than this. I gotta learn how to make it at home because I am never going back. While I do that, maybe Olive Garden can me a favor and get their employees some human interaction skills... or maybe just that one guy.

Thanks, creepy waiter asshole!
author: Rosavida C.

description:
Hey, Danika.  Do you know what good customer service is called?  It's called you not working at the Olive Garden.

Our server, Cassandra, was fantastic, though.  She got you an extra star.
author: Jimmie L.

description: Haven't been to olive garden for years i decided to go have lunch here with my boyfriend. It was around the afternoon 12-1PM so it wasn't very crowded and the service was decent. I ordered the Seafood Alfredo and it wasn't very good at all. The shrimp and the scallops were undercooked and tasted very fishy (which i wouldn't have mind if they were actually cooked properly). Around an hour after i left, my stomach started feeling uneasy and mind you i haven't had anything to eat before or after my meal at olive garden. I've been hopping in and out the bathroom since i got home and it has just been a terrible experience.
author: P T.

description:
Well, in the past two dozen years, every time I went to an Olive Garden I went with soup, salad and bread sticks.  This time, I ventured to the rest of the menu.

Mistake.

I got a chicken marsala thing, and besides the fact that it came with mashed potatoes which weren't great, I was underwhelmed.  It was $18 and honestly, I felt like I paid an extra $6 than what I would have wanted just so I could help pay for their tremendously crap commercials.

We did however get offered a tasting of a wine they were featuring.  This was a nice touch... except for the fact that it looked like the wine glass they put mine in was the same they gave to everyone else as well.

Our waiter was uninterested in our general enjoyment of the meal.  In fact, he also seemed to not be concerned that we were both considerably thirsty.

I don't know what it is about my girlfriend and I and chain restaurants...
author: Adam O.

description:
I've only been to Olive Garden twice in my life but I definitely like it. The highlight is definitely their GARLIC BREAK. omg sooooooo good. You don't need to eat it with anything else, but if you can dip it in some sauce or a soup, it's even better =) 

Always love the pastas here. Tried the seafood linguini (extremely creamy and filling) and the steak pasta. The chocolate cake is delicious too. It's not the best food in the world but definitely good, and gotta keep coming back for the all u can eat bread!!
author: Louisa L.

description:
Contrary to the slew of negative reviews, I'll admit it, I like Olive Garden.  Always have, still do, and probably will continue too.  Every time I've dined here, the service has been great, we've had tasty food, and the price has not been outrageous.  

My friend and I went there for an early dinner tonight (Sunday) and we were seated right away.  The drinks we ordered, vanilla cream soda and rasberry italian soda, were superb.  The food was served pretty quick and was great too.  I was really impressed with the salad that came with my manicotti, the Italian dressing was delicious.  The bruscchetta was a hit with me and my friend, we were hooked and inhaled most of it pretty quickly.  Our bread basket was also really popular, while the carbs were awful for us, it was very fresh and went well with all the other entrees we ordered.  Our waitress was very sweet and checked on us frequently, she was very busy but made a point to make sure things were ok with us.

Overall, tonight was another positive experience at the Olive Garden, and yup, I'll be glad to go back.
author: Swetha G.

description:
I came here with a couple of my friends early so we could avoid the wait. The wait is ridiculous here, it's probably the only "good looking" restaurant around the Stonestown Mall.  

I had a horrible experience here. Food poisoning from the Crusted Eggplant and Marinara.  Basically crusted eggplant with spaghetti and marinara sauce.  I felt horrible instantly toward the end of the meal.  I thought it was only because I stuffed myself.. but NOPE, I went home and discovered I had food poisoning. (Excluding details)  

The service is kind of crap as well. The food takes FOREVER to come out. Every time I go there it takes an hour!  The soups are okay, kind of salty and the salad is like any other salad.

Want good Italian food? Don't come here..
author: Josie L.

description: I've eaten here a few times. The food is decent, and the place seems clean. Unfortunately, the experience I had here last week was not good.  Either the server had never worked in a restaurant before, or the manager failed to train him. It's not rocket science to check on your customers once you have taken their order; it's supposed to be "unlimited" salad and bread sticks. Not here! When we got the first serving of salad and breadsticks, the server disappeared. Drinks had not been refilled, and the server was MIA. Finally, he shows up with our entrees. We ask for more salad and breadsticks. This time, he's AWOL. He never comes back with salad, breadsticks, water, refresh drinks, see if we're alive??? We finish the entrees, now here comes the server with a small container of marinara sauce...But what for? We have no breadsticks! (Hint....look at the table Einstein)  So the only thing "unlimited" here is how much patience you have. (And there is a limit there too)
author: ponyboy b.

description:
If you have a large party, Don't come here! No one taught the front reservationists (4-5 of them) how to manage the group.
Came to the restaurant today for lunch, party of 15. They told us  1.25 hr wait!  Wow! So, we wait.  As we are waiting, they were  seating the smaller groups pretty fast maybe  an average 15 minute wait.  Meantime, we are still waiting!
Talking  among ourselves, we couldn't figure out how come the folks who came later where given tables.  We were hungry,!  So, we ask how much  longer!  They still have not been able to put together a group of tables And chairs for our party.  YET, would they not have been able to gather  seats and tables before letting them go to the many people who came after us,!!! It really was not fair.

 They  don't accept reservation BUT if you talk to the restaurant manager he can bend the rules!!! We found out that there was another group  who were allowed to reserve.
author: Mary G.

description: I ordered Chicken Alfredo yesterday, and unfortunately I must have forgot to ask them to cook it as the Chicken was raw!! Disgusting and unacceptable in any half-way decent eating establishment. Never again.
author: Karl M.

description:
The Never Ending Pasta Bowl special is the only & most economical reason to come here!  And, that's what my bf & I did the other day since he has been waiting for it this year!  We also had a coupon which we could use, $2 off 2 lunch entrees..so in essence each of ours was $7.95 pretax & tip!    

Started off w/the Zuppa Toscana which was good, but needed to be a little warmer and a little more flavorful...I added a few shakes of pepper...better!  And lots not forget the warm buttery breadsticks, which are perfect for dipping, yummy!  For my first pasta I chose the new Roasted Portobello Pomodoro w/fettucine...it was aiiight.  Somewhat lacking, but okay.  The usual meaty taste of portobellos weren't coming through in this dish.  I had a taste of his fettucine Alfredo which tasted better, but I think the sauce needed to be thicker.  The waiter then told me the 5 Cheese Marinara was basically Alfredo mixed w/Marinara..so I got that with penne...loved it, the best one!  As I was finishing up my second bowl of pasta...I was gettin soo full!  OMG...wish I could've mustered up the strength to get another bowl of pasta w/ 5 Cheese Marinara.  I had a little part of my fettucine that wasn't cooked all the way, but for the most part the pasta was cooked al dente.  What I ate: 1 bowl of soup, 1 breadstick.  2 bowls of pasta...weak sauce! 

I can't bear to give it less than a three especially since our waiter was so nice and attentive.  Oh, and since The Never Ending Pasta Bowl promo is the same price day or night...if you have the dinner coupon go get it for dinner...it's $4 off 2 entrees!

Oh....and if you don't wanna feel so bad after you stuffed yourself with all those carbs...then don't read the nutrition facts at your table!
author: Cat C.

description:
Olive Garden is a good place, for pasta and bread sticks.  Not much of an authentic Italian restaurant, but I have to say it's good.  The specials, on the commercials, are the items that are the ones to go for.  I once chose the soup instead of salad, which was a bad mistake because it was bland. 
It's hard finding a good pasta place and my default is Olive Garden, if I don't want to go too deep into the city.  I have to say the price per plate is more than it's worth, but it's ok when I'm not paying for it.  The dishes range from $11-$20.  TIP: The more expensive the dish, the more delish it is compared to the rest.
author: michelle m.

description:
My meal there about 2 months ago was theeeee absolute last one.  
The only reason why I would go there again is if I am working at some SV company and a group of people drag me there.  I only went there because I had to get rid of the GC I got.  25 bucks.. My meal was like 15... I gave the rest for tip.  Beef something dish with pasta???... anyways the beef was rubbery.. def not 100 percent beef... its some mass produced beef alternative, the same kind Mcideees use in their McRib sandwhiches.....  Salad was crips but that's about it... no taste.. salad dressing was GROSS.    The last time I went before this was probably 5 years ago in Palo Alto with co-workers.  Good service though!
author: Demanding T.

description:
I've been there many times, but have been disappointed everytime. I could not share a dish with my friend without them charging me more money! The dishes are very dry or overflowing in oil :/ Another time the waiters were not helpful, they were not around or when they came they interuppted our conversations and did not what was on the menu. On top of that the wait was 2 hours.
Do not recommend this place.
author: George C.

description:
My coworkers and I decided on the Olive Garden because it was one of their birthdays. Unlimited soup and salad, sounds like a great deal right? Wrong. I've had better soup and better salad -- their soup was lukewarm and I had to ask them to reheat it for me. Good thing restaurants have microwaves (NOT!). Because it was a birthday celebration, the guys came out w/ cake....no, they ran out of cake so we got a few slices of something else instead. awesome (NOT!). Then, THEY CHARGED US FOR IT! WHAT?!?!! 

Oooh, and the best part: we had a party of about 12. 2 people were late and they refused to seat us. REFUSED! After asking them several times, my coworker finally asked to speak to their manager and asked them if they'd rather us leave than to seat us in their overly packed restaurant (they probably had 2-3 tables filled, the rest were empty). Were they saying we can't eat there unless all 12 people were present? What a stupid rule. We were very upset, also weary that our food would be filled w/ spit and snot.

Go elsewhere. Chain restaurant = high sodium + poor service.
author: Camille T.

description:
My review isn't about the food, but 5 stars for the helpfulness of the people working there. 

Long story short, I'm working on an art piece that is made out of empty glass bottles.  I've saved up 40 of my own, but I need more.  I called Olive Garden on a whim, and spoke to a woman named Emma.  I was expecting a quick "we don't have time for this, sir," but instead, she took time to go over to the bartender and check the recycling bin.  I stopped by and grabbed those bottles, then stopped by again at night and had a similar experience with a bartender who took time out of his shift to grab me 10 more bottles.  It was super helpful, and I'm almost done.  

My friend and I joked before I called that they HAVE to give me bottles because they're FAMILY.  Turns out, that's not far off.
author: Ryan N.

description:
Solid service and dependable venue for group dinners in the area.  Unfortunately, part of dependable is that you can depend on a ridiculous 90-minute wait.  But hey, at least you can stroll thru Stonestown while waiting.

I grew up thinking Olive Garden was a 5-star restaurant and it somehow still feels like a treat when I come here.  I think it's just really hard to mess up sauce over pasta, so I'm never disappointed.
author: Gary D.

description:
Main reason to come here? 2 words: Zuppa Toscana. That and the bread sticks. The rest is only ok. Not the greatest pasta place but it's not cafeteria style tomato sauce over noodles that other cheap places call pasta. It's good, but nothing to drive far for. Coupled with drinks with free refills, this place can be a great value. I usually am gorging myself on soup/bread refills and the entree is an afterthought (typically boxed unfinished) Their unlimited pasta specials are great bang for the buck although they didn't even advertise it on their main menu; my friend had to ask for it and they came back with a separate menu. 

Wait times for this place can be really ridiculous, especially for large parties. Best bet is just hang out by the bar area and swoop in quickly when someone leaves. Unfortunately those bar tables only seat like 3... maybe 4 if you really squeeze. 

I always order the Raspberry lemonade which apparently Olive Garden has spent years trying unsuccessfully to get the right mixture for... it's always either way too sweet or watered down. Oh well, at least it's bottomless.

Service-wise... I'm always flagging down another server or bus person for something. They really should just assume people are going to be constantly needing refills since that's a main draw this place. And what's with servers sometimes not bringing cheese for soup and pasta? The good servers are prepared but often you'll have to ask. Not good, but sort of understandable since the place is typically packed, but still not good. Bonus points for the Andes mints when you get your bill.
author: Peter W.

description:
I get crap for being a food snob a lot of the time, and I really resent that term because of the negative, uppity connotation that the word "snob" contains. I can be a foodie, yes. I absolutely love food, totally. But I am definitely not a snob. Authenticity and level of fanciness are both not concerns for me (unless the occasion calls for it), and all I really care about is that the price is right and that the food is tasty. I love fast food (McDonald's filet o'fish with fries? Amazing. Jack in the Box tacos? A freaking steal, anything at Del Taco, ahhh!), I have no problems at all with chain restaurants. Especially not psuedo-Italian chains. I love Macaroni Grill - they are delicious, I like Strings okay as well. Maggiano's was fine the one time I tried it. And Cheesecake Factory's pastas are very tasty. So, I was looking forward to my meal here at Olive Garden, where I simply wanted to carb up with something edible and fatty before a half marathon I was running the next day. 

It was disgusting. The sauces were incredibly salty - I went through three tall glasses of water halfway through my meal. The pasta was so overcooked and mushy that it melted in my mouth before chewing. The salad was made up of limp, iceberg lettuce. The bread tasted like buttered cardboard wrapped around bread from the Dollar Tree. And the prices are SO not on point - all entrees are at least $15-20 dollars. 

I'm so upset. A Lean Cuisine could've sufficed better, and when those are on sale at Safeway, they're less than three bucks. And delicious (hit me up for recs on what kind!)

Never again. I can't imagine why there's at least a half an hour wait, during any given mealtime related hour here (sometimes up to two hours during peak times on weekends. WTF) in a city where there is just SO MUCH more to offer . . . like at the food court in the mall, for one.
author: Betty W.

description:
I really don't think  this place is all that great but it will do before my many night classes. I usually eat at the bar and service is sooo slow. There's like NO ONE around me, yet I always have to wait so long to get my free refills on my soup! 

I usually just get their unlimited breadsticks, soup and salad. 

I will have to say, their Zuppa Toscana is the BEST! I can have seriously 5 bowls of that and I will be so content.
author: Willa L.

description:
11/30/11 with one other

We both havent been here in a while so we wanted to check it out to see if it was still the same. 

the server we had was great!, i wish i remembered her name so i can give her props. she checked up on us and was very nice and friendly. 

the food on the other hand, i had ordered the chicken Parmesan. with the zuppa toscanna soup. the soup was great and the bread sticks were yummy, but the chicken was very very salty. 

i was very disappointed about my main dish.. 

**stars given for service!! not for the food **
author: Jay R.

description: I will stop being a customer of the Olive Garden because their corporate ownership has decided to back some anti-employee legislation and I encourage others to follow suit. I am a union supporter. Florida Gov. Rick Scott (R) sided with Darden Restaurants (owner of Olive Garden and Red Lobster) that blocks local governments from implementing paid sick leave legislation, the Orlando Sentinel reports.
author: Edward E.

description: I don't really like Olive Garden and I think it's the PF Chang's of Italian food  (look up my previous review).  I came here for a friend's birthday and I ordered the chicken marsala.  Everyone in the party received their item except for me; understandable.  The server then came by my table and said that my order would be coming out.  The party was almost done and I just told them to cancel my order.  This is where they excel and why they deserve four stars.  The manager personally came out and apologized for the mix up.  She gave my order for free which I wasn't expecting.  This is the type of customer service where they go above and beyond.  I wouldn't come here as my first choice, but I wouldn't mind coming back if some friends wanted to come here.
author: A L.

description:
Just got back from eating at the Olive Garden for the first time.  I was with my husband who has dined at other Olive Gardens prior to us meeting and with my mom who had never been either.  We were on our way home from seeing "Wicked" to celebrate my mom's 81st birthday, we were all hungry and decided to go have some dinner.

We were told it would be about 30 minutes for a table, which was fine, gave us time to get a cocktail at the bar, go to the restroom, etc. and I think the actual wait was more like 20 minutes.  We were seated in a nice booth and I advised the hostess that it was my mom's birthday and if she could alert the server.   

Our server greeted us and said Happy Birthday to my mother, teased her about being 21 - she was humored (she's 81)...he was very nice.  We started with the Fonduta appetizer- which was YUMMY-- melted cheese blend (fondue) to spread on little slices of assorted bread.  Very, very good!   My husband had the garden salad and my mom and I both tried different soups- she had the chicken gnocchi soup and I had the potato soup- both very good.  The potato soup had a kick- but very good.

For our entrees- I couldn't decide, so I got the Taste of Italy- a small portion of chicken parmigiana, fettuccine Alfredo and lasagna.  I ate bits of all of it- think I liked the chicken best.  The leftovers will come in handy for lunch tomorrow.    But it was all very good.  Hubby had the mixed grill- skewers of chicken, beef and veggies- pretty much cleaned his plate.  Mom ordered spaghetti and meatballs- well it came as spaghetti and meat sauce.  We advised the server (who was not the one who took the order) and they brought out a side of meatballs very quickly.   Mom is a small eater, she said it was very good and now has 2-3 more meals from the leftovers. 

We were asked if we wanted to order dessert- which we said yes and I purposely spoke loudly around the server to my mom- saying "you want a scoop of ice cream on your birthday don't you?"- again trying to remind the server that we had a birthday.   We ordered our desserts and they were delivered- without any birthday celebration...perhaps they don't do that there?  I don't know.   I would have expected a candle in her ice cream at the very least.

The Black Tie Mousse-cake was delicious, hubby had the lemon cream cake and that was also very good.  Mom had ice cream. :)

Overall, good service and good food.  I would dine here again, although we don't have a convenient one to us- so it's not a place we'll go out of our way to re-visit.
author: Pam H.

description:
8/15/10

Went to California Academy of Sciences - SF, which was pretty awesome. I recommend to everyone to check it out sometime hehe. Soon afterwards, we were trying to figure out hmnn what's for dinner. Ahhh...i see Olive Garden...let's eat there! :)

We shared the Seafood Portofino pasta. Loves it and it was just the right amount for two of us. Ate some garden salad, breadsticks, and drank a glass of Moscotto wine that the server suggested. It was delicious! A must try if you're into sweet wine =)

[Positives]: plenty of parking, nice waiter...he was very attentive, the blinds were open and the sun was shining through and the supervisor asked if we want it to be closed...we didn't even complained...thumbs up!

[Negatives]: Long wait on a Sunday (45mins +)
author: Rose N.

description:
Recently two friends and I decided to eat dinner at this Olive Garden location. The food was decent, but honestly WAY overpriced. I mean the chairs are on wheels and you expect me to pay up to eighteen dollars for a mediocre pasta dish? I thought Olive Garden was supposed to be a more affordable place to dine. Guess not.

Thankfully the service was satisfying and that is what earns this place two stars. However, I don't think I will be returning any time soon.
author: Michael D.

description:
I ate here for lunch with my sister, auntie and cousins after a morning of shopping.  Coming from HI my sister and I always wanted to try this place out since we see the commercials back home but NO restaurant.  I hate those commercials! it just teases us with things that we don't even have =P  Anyway we came in at around 11:30 so it wasnt crowded with only a few tables filled here and there but as we dined more people were coming in. 

As for the food it was pretty darn good.  The price is also right because you also get bread sticks (yum) and a choice of their soups or garden salad to go along with your entree.  I ordered this apricot glazed chicken with broccoli, asparagus, and tomatoes and it was really good.  My auntie ordered the seafood alfredo which looked good but she didnt really eat because she was already full from the bread sticks and her minestrone soup that also looked very good.  My sister ordered the same thing as me but while I got the salad she got the chicken and gnocchi soup that was very flavorful.  Overall I'd definitely want to go back when ever I visit my family in cali and I just home they bring one to HI soon!
author: Kristen C.

description: On a random outing with my mom, we headed here for lunch. It's been way too long since I've been here, so I had to get reacquainted with the menu. I opted for the Ravioli di Portabello and my mom got the Grilled Chicken Spiedini. I loved their salad and bread sticks while Mom gave a thumbs up to their chicken and gnocci soup. Couldn't pin point any dryness when I sampled a bit of the chicken, which was good. When my order came around, there were only 6 pieces of ravioli on my plate. Trust me,  it was more than enough. The combo of the smoked cheese and portobello filling with the sun dried tomato sauce was crazy good. I'd order that again in a heartbeat.
author: Rhia R.

description:
I love olive garden! I love Italian food, I'm all for it ha ha. I've had better Italian foods, but olive garden is descent enough. I love having lunch here with my friends. Unlimited soup, salad and bread stick. Not that i can even eat enough to get refill on the salad and bread sticks, i get one refill of the soup and I'm already full

anyways, great customer service here, nice atmosphere, and unlimited soup, salad and bread sticks, yum!
author: helen l.

description: Got a bowl of uncooked pasta. Gross!! Probably won't be back.
author: Jessica C.

description:
This is an OK Italian chain restaurant.
The menu selection is limited. No veal. No vongole. No canoli.
Had a party of 12 for wifey's B-Day at their Stonestown location.

OK... They don't take reservations, so while waiting for the rest of the guests, we ordered drinks at the bar. Nice bar, friendly staff. Be warned, the bar tab must be settled before going to your table. Thing is... if any soft drinks (incl. ice tea) are ordered at the bar, those won't carry over to the table as "refill" when ordered again. YOU WILL BE CHARGED AGAIN. The host and waiter staff are very friendly, and very attentive. Excellent service overall.

The menu is pretty limited. You may not find the dish you would find at most Italian restaurants, like Veal Parmesan or Scaloppine. No pesto or gnocchi. They do have Spaghetti & Meatballs though. And what they do have on the menu is pretty good. I had the Seafood Potofino which is a hodgepodge of shellfish in a cream sauce over linguine. It was OK... didn't get very much for $18. As I looked over some of the other entrees ordered, the Stuffed Chicken Marsala was the most popular and got lots of nods for the garlic mashed potatoes it was plated with, also $18. Best dessert was the Double Chocolate Cake, $8, so sweet and rich they could've just put a Milky Way wrapper on it.

As good as the food was, it was overpriced, and not generous. They can't touch Bertolucci's or Westlake Joe's. Even Villa D'Este (only a couple of blocks away) is better with comparable prices.

It's OK... I'd go back if I wasn't paying.
author: Rick V.

description: The only good thing about this place was the serves. The food wasn't that great and even their bread-sticks are not that great and isn't the Olive Garden known for their bread-sticks? This place has become 'the new Sizzler's'" where random people shovel when they get a coupon or something. I think that was the case in our case because the place was packed and everyone was ordering some combo meal or something. I had some kind of chicken dish and the serving of chicken breast on my plate was laughable. Even the person serving me the dish seem embarrassed about it.
author: Some D.

description:
So after a day running errands throughout the bay area, my fiance and I thought that it might be fun to try someplace we have never tried before.  Thus our thought was hummm why not the Olive Garden, the commercials seem pretty nice, and people have said they taste good.  OK off we go!

When we arrived, it had a nice ambiance, a good flavor to the restaurant.  We were seated and once the waiter came, he asked if we would like to sample the wine of the day . . . (as he shows the bottle).  Umm . . . once we saw that the wine was a "SCREW TOP" there was no way I was going for it.  My fiance and I looked at each other and said "no thanks!"

Well maybe my expectation were too high, but when I asked if there were any daily specials our waiter was dumbfounded!  He was like "um . . . we don't really have any specials but we have this pasta bowl all you can eat . . . "  Wow, I would expect you to at least have some sort of answer.  Then I asked about the board in the front, and he said that they just randomly placed one of the dishes up and he would go check what was up there.  MAN he didn't even know what was on the board!

Well my fiance ordered Chicken & Gnocchi soup with a Berry Acqua Fresca drink and I tried the pasta bowl special.  As an appetizer we went with a sampler of Calamari and Stuffed Mushrooms.  As we waited for our food, we looked at the decor, which wasn't bad expect for our chairs.  The were cushioned chairs with wheels attached to it.  We felt as if we were sitting in a nursing home chair!!!!

When her soup came, so did the bread sticks and salad.  For this being my first time, they gave me the whole salad bowl and looked like we were to mix it ourselves.  Wait, isn't that what I am paying for?!?!?!?  My fiances soup was salty, but adding a little pepper helped (a little!).  The gnocchi was very grainy and it tasted like it was frozen and not fresh.  They plopped two large chunks of chicken into the soup as if it was just cut and dropped in.  Ughhh . . .  not good so far.  As for the bread sticks, we were laughing that they were a dinner roll basted with olive oil on top.  

Wow so far everything we could have done at home, and made taste better.

My pasta arrived at the same time as our appetizers.  (I ordered the whole wheat linguine with creamy portabella mushroom) Oh my gosh . . . BLAH.  The pasta was way over cooked and the mushy.  I couldn't even eat more than two bites.  It tasted like it was microwaved!  It was like the pasta was to match the chairs, I was really in a NURSING HOME!!!!  I asked for another pasta bowl, fearful of its taste geting the orecchiette with the three meat sauce.  This bowl was at least edible, with the sauce being decent.  The pasta this time was not over cooked but I could tell they were not fresh because of most of it being stuck together.  That saved my dinner, sort of =P

Our appetizers didn't help the situation because of the calamari.  I love fried calamari, one of my favorite dishes, even if the batter isn't great, most of the time I can forgive it but these were grainy and not very fresh.  There was no chewiness to it and just kinda broke apart in your mouth!  The mushrooms at least had a little better flavor, but still not a fan favorite, but by far the best dish eaten during the night.  Oh and not to forget our Berry Fresca Aquga, it well, tasted like Robitussin cough!   BLAHHHHH.

My recomondation, not for me, even though it seemed as if many people enjoy it, not for me.  This experience has shyed me away from any Olive garden EVER AGAIN
author: Tung L.

description:
Being a San Francisco native, going to the chain restaurants hasn;t been inbedded in my lifestyle.  For heaven;s sake, we don't even have an El Pollo Loco or an In 'N Out in the city.  Fast food is few and far between, not that I don't love me an In 'N Out cheeseburger with animal fries.  Yum....  Okay, off track.

Anyway, dining here or at Chevy's is a very unfamiliar doing.  But it's been done.  I'd say the food is still too expensive for the quality it is.  But it is good for groups.  The salad is not special, and I've eaten a ton...  I'm still thinking about the one from Urth Cafe in L.A.  Oops, off track again.  The pasta we got was only good because it was salty and not swimming in it.  And the pork dishes were a little on the dry side.  What was good was the bread.  Bread and butter save the day again.
author: Susan C.

description: My meal was TOTALLY awesome, it came with a side of leftover lettuce...on my fork. -_____-' I mean c'mon people, that is just gross. Not only was the wait one hour & 45 minutes, but the plates and utensils given to us were dirty! I swear this place would be a wonderful 5 star, if it wasn't for having this experience, THREE TIMES AT THE SAME PLACE. Food is great, waiters are awesome, but it's just not attractive when theres vegetables in my water. Not what I was looking forward to. To hell with this place. I just wish the damn pasta was not so good, it honestly keeps me coming back! Ahah.
author: Andrew G.

description:
I love Italian food and this place was great! 
I had the "Tour of Italy" which was 3 entrees: lasagna, breaded chicken, pasta. It was delicious! I tried some of my friends dishes & they were great also! This place is pricey and I would have to say it's not very reasonable.
author: Carmen L.

description: Where do I start with olive garden? I'm pretty neutral in this review because it wasn't bad but it wasn't good neither. I don't plan on going back and it's definately overpriced for what you get. I ordered lasagna, it tasted fine. Salad was ok. But I left hungry, the portions were small. Much better Italian food availible in SF. And in my opinion one of the weaker chain restaurants. Chevys next door is better.
author: Michael L.

description:
Came to Olive Garden yesterday for lunch. Had a party of 5 people. Their was no wait. Every other time I came here for dinner their was always a long wait. 30 - 40 minutes on a weekday. But no wait for lunch. Food was ok, we all know Olive Garden is a chain restaurant. Free salad and breadsticks are always nice. I ono why but I love the salad! hahaha. Had an entree and a soda. Total for me was $15. So not bad. 

Service was pretty good too! So cant complain about that!
author: Daniel S.

description:
We came here twice and, while the location has its problems, it has still been a good experience each time.

In terms of the food, its standard Olive Garden fare. For this who have never been, expect great salad and bread sticks mixed with okay pasta. The Alfredo is really good, for example, but the marinara sauce is...well its kind of bland like a normal tomato sauce.

The price is also a little high, but to be fair each dish comes with soup/salad and bread sticks. The best time to go however, and when we timed our second trip, is during the never ending pasta bowl. Oddly enough, the never ending pasta is just around $9, so its cheaper than a single, normal pasta dish.

As for the service, it is generally good. First time we went was okay, but the second time was probably some of the best service we have had (server Josh, who deserves the praise). One problem with this particular location, though, is that it's almost always packed. Its very rare that one will come to this location without a long wait before getting a table.

All in all, its a decent location. Ever so often one just gets a craving for Olive Garden salad and bread sticks, and although there are better Italian options this one will still probably be exercised from time to time.
author: Sami R.

description:
I love Olive Garden. Their food is great, but since it's a chain restaurant I am reviewing this based on their other factors, since the food is the same in all Olive Gardens. 
This Olive Garden has a Cafe in the front, where you don't have to wait to be seated if there is room. We have eaten there multiple times and it is a very cute area, but that unfortunately is also the cutest place to be in the restaurant. In the actual restaurant, the decor is awful; the chairs have office chair wheels on them, the lighting is dim and depressing and the service is not the greatest. If it were not for the food, this would not be my restaurant of choice.
author: Nicky H.

description: Ok, so a friend   an.d I decide to go from San Bruno  to  stones town,which is not that far,but with all l the variety we have on the Peninsula was kind of pushing our limit,so between having had to drive around for at least 20 minutes ,we finally got to this Olive Garden .Then we had to wait for another 10 minutes or so ,but whose counting rite? so to make a very potentially long story short, when we did get  our food about 45 minutes later our server Dom,a 21-year-old very nice young man  (DOM ) my sons name too,although was very helpful and informative and deserves to b recognized, Although I did not like the particular item I had ordered (shrimp scampi)YUCKO! tiny, tiny shrimp,BREADED.(who does that?Laying on a bed of soggy hot lemons.(I hate,HATE lemo.s ,and then, the Sauce,absolutely.was disgusting, I do better at home,My friend felt so bad gor me that she had to let Dom know,I asked her not but she did anyway,Dom was so sweeet and immediately said would take it back,but I didnt want to wait anothere  half hour or so  ,so he went to his manager and they decided without hesitation  to comp my lunch,I felt bad and had to ,despite my friends wishes,leave Dom a $10, he was worth it, I hope he or someone reads this and compliment his efforts to at least know I would go back if or nothing else,his smiling face.Gopd job Dom!
author: Margie R.

description: Unlimited Soup and Salad for lunch today and also the Lasagna Fredo which was yummy. They had a new mushroom potato soup, it was tasty. Now on to the service, I showed the waitress the coupon I had for 15% off, she said she will take of it later. Half way eating we get a bill. I looked at it and discount wasn't deducted. She tells me she would deduct it at the end?? What? Then why do I have a bill? I then asked her how does this work? How do i know how much to pay, should I deduct it on my own? I've never gotten a receipt just to get another receipt later. Idiot! I order my soup waited waited, she comes back, would you like some soup? WHAT?? I've been waiting for my order!..I asked for water..15 minutes later no sign of the waitress or my water. She finally comes back and asked if everything was ok? Uhhh..are you joking? My water!! Sorry this is crazy customer service, should be happy I gave her a descent tip at the end. I think her name was Giselle
author: Karen T.

description: How can I rate Olive Garden? With other authentic restaurants in the bay area it is hard to rate Olive Garden. For food taste, it's good. I give them props on the never ending pasta bowl. Authentic wise, zero! Yeah I know if I want authentic Italian food I'll have to go back to one of the restaurants that had a bunch of mafia looking good fellas working there or I can fly to Italy right? Of course to obtain anything authentic you would have to visit the mother land. This goes for Olive Garden. It will get you by in terms of eating "Italian" food but it's as non authentic as possible. Just look at this way. Would a Mexican say Taco Bell is authentic? Would a Hawaiian consider L&L or one of the "Hawaiian" joints authentic? Would a Chinese person consider Panda Express authentic? You get the picture.
author: Philip O.

description: Excellent Service, Food & Establishment.   The Seafood Portofino was Great!  Manager even acknowledged us personally.  Had my family for lunch for my wife's birthday and she loved it!  Thank you Olive Garden!
author: Troy A.

description: We went to Olive Garden in SF for an early dinner on Friday after Thanksgiving. They don't take reservations on Fridays. We got lucky and were seated almost immediately. Our waitress Esme was very nice and friendly. We enjoyed Smoked Mozzarella Fonduta, Stuffed Chicken Marsala and Braised Beef Tortelloni. The House Salad was fresh and crunchy. This place is family friendly. I will definitely recommend this place.
author: Wojciech P.

description: I give Olive Garden 3 stars, because it is always dependable for a pretty decent and not so pricey meal.  The unlimited soup and salad is a very good deal...the salad there is amazing for some reason...maybe it's the peppercini or the dressing...just so good!
author: Sandy L.

description: Not good. Not bad. Great service, but doesn't make up for the food. Actually, I've never really been impressed with Italian food... except pizza :)
author: Timothy L.

description:
Finally gave in to my curiosity after years of passing by. The wait was about an hour for a party of 2 so it wasn't anything out of the ordinary. 

Once seated we had to wait 3-4 mins before even being offered drinks. Waiter/waitress carrying wine as a form of marketing? LAME!! The first impression i got when my waitress came over holding half a bottle of wine was that she just finish bussing a table and was too lazy to put leftovers away. Unclassy and kind of ruins the dining experience. We ordered the sampler platter with calamari, fried zucchini, and stuffed mushrooms for appetizer. For Entree we had the braised beef tortelloni and ravioli de portebello. 

FOOD IS ABYSMAL! Salad and breadsticks were average, nothing as special as some of the other yelper's reviews states. Starting with the appetizers: calamari - soft and mediocre, stuffed mushrooms - chopped up random crap stuff into a mushroom, fried zucchini - over breaded. Their pasta was the worst pasta i have ever eaten in my life. We would've been better off buying a box of pasta from costco. The noodles were so dried out from sitting in the freezer that they were practically cardboard. YES! I AM 100% SURE THESE RAVIOLIS AND TORTELLONI ARE FROZEN!! It is NOT possible that fresh noodles taste this sh*tty. The Braised beef was the thinker of the night. There's tender beef and then there's Olive Garden beef. I'm curious what kind of chemicals they put in there to make the beef that soft. 

Overall I will NEVER be back and YOU SHOULD NEVER COME HERE EVER!!! I have NO idea why this place is prospering no matter how convenient the location is.
author: allen k.

description: Wow I have to say this place is going down the drain. I guess they put too much money into the construction of this place (by the way can't tell the difference) to care bout the food. I JUST HAVE TO LET U GUYS KNOW I GOT FOOD POISONING FROM THE APRICOT CHICKEN MEAL...I do not have a sensitive stomach nor do I have a weak immune system...n I threw up until I had nothing left to give on thurs night. I am so disappointed in this place...appetizers took forever to get to the table then bombarded us with salad n then gave us our meal 5 min later...I don't know how u go from taking forever to rushing us...waiter doubled charged us but reimbursed us...bread is nasty now n has no flavor...didn't get a refill on water until I was done eating...I don't know wat more I can say!! I told everyone in my family and they are disgusted and this is actually a place where my sister likes her bday dinner but No More!!!! Never again!!! Don't come here!!!!!
author: Krystal S.

description: I got 2 dinners to go and they were disgusting! They barely put any sauce on our pasta and forgot to put my appetizer in my bag. I will never go to another olive garden again. I know a few people who work at some Olive Garden's and they're always complaining about how repulsive their food is, but I thought why not give it a shot. WOW! My friends were not kidding sooooo nasty.
author: Karissa K.

description:
I've come here several times w/friends or just my boyfriend. I always got the Chicken Fetuccini Alfredo, but I chose something from the Nutritional Book and got the Grilled Chicken Penidi (or something like that). Which was 400 calories vs. my usual 2,000+ calories alone w/the fetuccini. 

I barely ate what I got. Our waitress was super nice. She was very attentive. She noticed that I barely ate any of my food so she insisted to not charge me. The manager comes up to me and asks if I'd like some chicken fetuccini to-go, and I declined. And they still charged me. Not that great customer service, why would you insist to not charge me but end up doing so? It doesn't make sense. If anything, I should've just took that fetuccini offer to-go. I gave more tip than 15% too. 

I won't be coming back anytime soon, only if I'm super craving Olive Garden. Otherwise, no.
author: Jessica R.

description: Waited for 20 minutes before we got served. Very disappointed. Wait time was ok but our server kept annoying us until we asked a manager
author: Yenn C.

description: Once in a blue moon I crave soup, salad and bread sticks. It's all I usually get and its always consistent. The wait can sometimes be long but it is in a mall and the only location in the city.
author: Roman I.

description: Always a long wait (45 to 2hr ) and if you do decide to stay and wait the service is mediocre.
author: Desiree B.

description:
i know for a fact that i have already written reviews for this place...more than once. but if they keep getting deleted i will keep posting.

so its a typical olive garden. salad and breadsticks are bomb. but last time i went they were out of breadsticks so i had to wait. 

used to come here a lot in college because it is right there next to state. be prepared for your server to be an undergrad. 

dont come here to ofter any more because i dont live in the neighborhood and the price of the food does not stand up to the quality.
author: Ashley H.

description:
Hi. I'm 23 years old....STOP referring to me as a little kid! Our server was quick to assume that I was under 21...which really made me upset. All you had to do is ask for my ID IF I actually ordered alcohol. But, he chose to embarrass me by looking at me and saying "And for you, we can make our drinks alcohol free...and we have sodas." 

Anyways, that night, I ordered the Pork Bolognese with cheese tortellini. it was tasty...but the tortellini was REALLY cheesy. 

There's always a wait here...even on a Thursday night. They really need to open up some more restaurants at Stonestown...
author: Allan M.

description: DO NOT GO  to the Olive's Garden (Stonestown) at a closing time!! They won't serve you even though they are still open for another hour. The only think I can figure because the workers dont get paid enough- They act really mean for no appearance reason!! My husband and I were very hungry- got to the restaurant just before the 10 pm cut off and we were almost denied serviced just because it was close to 10 o clock, but they were actually closed at 11. It doesnt make sense!!! and there were people still eating inside. Screw this place and will never come back here ever again and will tell this bad news to all my friends and relatives to make sure dont give them any business because they dont deserve it!!!!!
author: Erma N.

description: Only giving this place 4 stars because I love the soup, salad and breadsticks. This place makes me crave Zuppa Toscana soup all the time. The lunch price is definitely a good deal because it's only around $8-9 for unlimited soup and salad. Seeing as how I can normally finish 5 bowls of soup, it's worth it. The service for the most part is just average. I usually run into a lot of servers that aren't that great. In all honesty, the only reason I come back is for the soup.. nothing else.
author: travis t.

description:
I haven't been to Olive Garden since I left Atlanta. That was over 7 years ago. And for whatever reason, I thought Olive Garden was really cheap. Well, boy was I wrong. Not that it is the most expensive place, but Eugy and I went there for lunch on Friday and we managed to spend $84. Yes, that's right. $84... For lunch... At Olive Garden.... Something is wrong with that.. Really really wrong... 

The place was PACKED and instead of waiting 20-30 minutes for a table, we decided to sit at the bar and start eating right away. We ordered shrimp scampi and the really cheesy fonduta. The fonduta was disgusting... So disgusting that we could only take one bite and then we left it alone. I have to say, the shrimp scampi wasn't all that bad, for what it was, but WAY too salty. 

For entrees, I had the Tour of Italy which came with lasagna, fettuccine alfredo and Parmesan chicken. The fettuccine was alright, but nothing great. The parmesan chicken was actually pretty good, but not the sauce and cheese that topped it. Lasagna was decent, but again, nothing to get excited over. All of the food tasted like they got it from the frozen section at Costco and then just heated it up. Hmm...

Service was decent, but it better be since we were sitting at the bar, right in their faces. hah... 

Will I come back? NO. I certainly will not. But it was fun coming back after so many years, just to learn that NOT A SINGLE THING HAS CHANGED...
author: Jen D.

description: Have to write a review about dinner tonight. My entree lasagna primavera took forever to come out. By the time it did the rest of my family were already done with their dishes. The waitress was apologetic and took off the cost of my dish from the bill. Only plus for the night. .... Not worth the 30 plus minute wait time to get a seat.
author: Celeste W.

description:
When you really need a break from the crap around Lowell, this could just be that break.

The first time I came here was during a free finals block my freshman year. A bunch of my friends and I came, got a table (for 10ish, I think) in a snap and spent a good hour and a half unwinding in the middle of that super stressful week. The waiters were all really nice and asked us if we wanted extra (free) bread sticks to take with us when we left.

The food was par for the course, not much more, though. The fourth star is for service.
author: Elena C.

description:
Since my last visit to OG there has been a sad change to their dishes. First, we waited nearly an hour for a table, which was expected for a Friday night. We were given our beepers which started heeling soon after. We got excited but when we got to the hostess stand we were told the battery wad dying. So we took our place in the cold and waited.
Our server was Rafael. Got our orders put in and appetizers were up in a decent time.  We started with the calamari & stuffed mushrooms. Mushrooms were filled with a crab mix and topped with cheese. Calamari was just right without too much batter and still moist not dried out.
I had the Gnocchi soup & the Tour of Italy entree. Soup was good with enough gnocchi to satisfy the craving. Entree was a little disappointing. Chicken parmesan tastes like it was a frozen type. Not too tasty. Alfredo sauce tasted bottled. 
My kids ordered soups also which didn't come out till they were half way done with their entrees. Then it tasted like can soup but watered down...sad, sad.
Desserts were good but very small.
Not going to be on must eat list next trip!
author: Lana H.

description:
Olive Garden is good for a family style meal at an affordable price. Service is always outstanding. I don't know how they manage, especially when it gets busy. But they do and they make everyone feel right at home.

My sisters and I went in last night for a meal and it was busy, which says that the place is still very popular. We had to wait a bit but not too long of a wait. Our waiter was outstanding. Helpful, friendly and happy to be of service. 

The food is delicious for a chain franchise place. If you are on a diet or are not a fan of cream sauces and cheeses forget it. This place serves wonderful pasta and pizza creations with lots of cheese and cream sauces. 

Wine selection is pretty good as is their specialty drinks. 

Oh yes and try the desserts. We shared the chocolate cheese cake specialty. So yummy, layers of bitter sweet chocolate with mousse and cream cheese. Very rich, like most of the entrees as well. 

Parking available in the mall parking lot right outside. Be prepared to wait a bit when busy. Yet they hand out little remote beeping devices to let you know when your table is ready that way you can wait outside if you wish.  Neat idea! 

The salad is fresh and the bread sticks are baked to order as you sit down. Very good. Call in advance if you have a large party of five or more. It helps the staff to prepare, especially when busy. Check out web site for menu and prices. See the Sunday Chronicle for coupons. Often there are coupons for Olive Garden.
author: Jonathan F.

description:
Italian food.  This is a popular place.  Usually have to wait at least a half hour for a table.  They don't take reservations.

The food here would be pretty good if it were not so salty, especially the soup.  Service is pretty good.  I come because one relative likes it.  Bottomline for me: It's TOO salty...even for the potato chip lover that I am.  Too much of a good thing (salt) is bad here.  Would give it 4 stars if it were not so salty.
author: Sun W.

description: I was there with a big group (12), and got great service from the staff.  Plus, the group I was with loved the food.  Usually I make fun of the OG, but it was actually a great experience.
author: Jeffrey H.

description: All you can eat soup & salad. I usually there for Zuppa Toscana! I bet I can save a lot of money if I just learn how to make it myself...
author: Wendy L.

description: We have been coming to this Olive Garden for over 20 years .. and we have never been disappointed with the service ... We would like to say Thank you to our server Jasminn.. she just transferred from the Olive Garden in Oregon ..this is her 3 day here and her service was EXCELLENT!!
author: Nancy E.

description: My all-time worst dining experience ever was at this restaurant.  I was glad that there was a McDonald's nearby.
author: Steve G.

description:
Great family dining here, I'm not kidding!  

For round 2 of hijacking my weekend, mother-in-law pulled a trump card:  It's her names day.  To Russians, a names day is like a birthday.  It's a saint's day on the religious calendar, and everyone named after the saint gets a party.  Four saints are observed today:  Vera, Nadejda, Lubova, and Sophia.  Translated:  Faith, Hope, Love, and Wisdom.  

That's a lot of names, and they are popular.  Back in Shanghai, in the 1930s, half the Russian population would celebrate on this day.  

Mom asked me out to lunch to celebrate her names day.  OK, why not?  She picked me up, and I took a very interesting ride to the Olive Garden.  Have you ever ridden shotgun with an 81-year-old driver?  It isn't pretty.  

I had doubts about the Olive Garden.  It's a large-corporation chain, after all, and an intrusion of suburbia upon the city.  But it was her names day, and the honoree gets whatever she wants.  

There are usually long lines and a 1-hour wait at this Olive Garden.  Today, at 1 pm, the wait was 5 minutes.  Numerous dining areas wrap around the entrance, and we found ourselves in a little 12-table alcove decorated in an Etruscan style, with pictures of Rome on the walls.  It turned out we had both been to Italy, so the conversation became a pleasant comparison of notes.  

The waitress introduced herself, and the magic began.  The first thing I noticed was that the staff was polite to everyone.  From babies to great-grandparents with walkers, they had light banter and suggestions appropriate for all.  Our suggestion was to start with a Riesling and a sampler appetizer of stuffed mushrooms and chicken fingers.  The mushrooms were stuffed with clam meat, among other things, and the "fingers" were about 1" x 7", much more than I expected.  

When Mom asked for a salad and I didn't, the waitress brought two sets of plates and flatware, and there was still salad left over in the mixing bowl when we were both satisfied.  

Mom ordered the seafood portofino, hold the mussels, and the waitress said that would be no problem.  I chose braised beef and tortelloni.  The seafood was on a bed of capellini, and Mom had a smile on her face all the way through the meal.  The braised beef tips were medium-rare, maybe marinaded, and totally blew my mind!   Tender, and tasty, the beef was top quality.  Although I haven't been in one for 10 years, I fell in love with the Olive Garden all over again with that dish!  The tortelloni had asiago in it, and of course I ate it all.  

I had told the waitress it was Mom's birthday, and they did up a special presentation for dessert:  a black bowtie cake for Mom, and tiramisu for me.  Not a North Beach tiramisu, more like a Ben & Jerry's tiramisu, but it went great with my cappuccino.  

Mom swooped down on the check like a falcon on a field mouse, so I didn't get to see what the total was.  I'm guessing, from crib notes, that it was around $80.  But for me, it was free! 

Being kind to your relatives can pay back immediately.  And, as the afternoon food coma sunk in, I realized Mom had succeeded.  My original plan for the day had been sidetracked, and she got her celebration for her names day.
author: David D.

description: Don't get me wrong here, the food at Olive Garden is not bad. But the server is hurting their business and pushing their customers away. I came here with my bestfriend for dinner. I think our servers name was Cori or Cory. She looked like she did not have patience for anything. We took our time looking at the menu and still couldn't decide on what to eat. Cori, our server came by a couple of times and seemed irritated that we were still not ready. Lady, calm down. We finally ordered our food and enjoyed our selves while chatting. Cori comes and takes our food away without asking us if we were done. RUDE I TELL YOU! What is the rush?? She had an attitude when I spoke up and said we weren't done. She needs to attend a customer service class or shouldn't even work in the customer service industry. I'm telling you, she's pushing away the good customers away from Olive Garden. The people who work here are the face of Olive Garden. They should be representing Olive Garden, not destroying their representation. I will not return to this location again.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
I beg your pardon I never promised to goto Olive Garden.
How many bread sticks I can have?  there are free but very boring.
When you take the bread sticks you gotta your stomach full so oh oh oh oh oh easily
I beg your pardon I never promised to goto Olive Garden.

They can promise you things like all you can eat bread sticks & salad
but you don't find real Italian dish from the kitchen
So you better think it over
Well, if a sweet talking waitress doesn't make it come true
she would give you a pseudo Italian dish right now on a silver platter
But what would matter
So smile for a while and let's be jolly Italian shouldn't be so melancholy
Come along and share the FXXXin' pseudo Italian while we can

I beg your pardon I never promised to goto Olive Garden.
How many bread sticks I can have?  there are free but very boring.
When you take the bread sticks you gotta your stomach full so oh oh oh oh oh easily
I beg your pardon I never promised to goto Olive Garden.


P.S. Sorry but I couldn't help doin' this after that rice garden shit.
author: Nobu K.

description:
Look at any of their commercials and try not to laugh or scream BULLSHIT when they show their "chefs" in what seems to pass for an Italian kitchen. We should all know better than to think this place is AUTHENTIC Italian cuisine. It can come close sometimes but not really...

Had dinner there tonight. Wasn't awful, wasn't stupendous. It was the middle of the road good. Hence the 3 stars. Dur...The food was alright. The service...Kinda rushed...Not sure why. I mean, it's dinner. Stop showing up every 5-10 minutes asking if the food was alright. Maybe show up to freshen the drinks but not to ask how the food was. Seriously, the answer is not going to change unless the food on my plate was made from 16 pieces of chicken and prepared by 8 different chefs.

And the timing of the way the food was brought out. Kinda funny how the server said out loud how we're going to fit everything on our table. Well, maybe you should have staggered the ordering time between the apps, the soup and salads and THEN the entrees. Let us finish one thing then serve the next. I mean, isn't that the way things are in better restaurants? Oh, wait! This isn't one of those better restaurants. My bad...

And no matter how long the shift is, you still might want to smile. Make yourself look better so the diners will feel better. You know, warming up the group? Sometimes that leads to better tips. Oh well. Maybe next time.
author: Anthony L.

description:
The 5 stars go to the waiters that helped us, BUT 3 stars for the manager that moved us to another section, so they can seat a bigger party. 

Originally, we requested a waiter because this particular waiter was really nice. Finally, after we willingly waited for more than an hour & 15 min., we got seated in the waiter's section. After the waiter took the order for our drinks, the manager approaches us & asks us if he could seat us elsewhere, since they needed our table to cater to a bigger party. We were hesitant, because we would no longer have the waiter we requested, but he offered to give us a free appetizer & desserts. 

Don't get me wrong, the staff were really nice. It's just that it was an inconvenience that we were moved in the middle of being waited on. We could have eaten much earlier, if we hadn't wanted to request that one waiter. In the end, we couldn't have that person. Fortunately.. the waiter we ended up having was really nice as well. I just think that they shouldn't have seated us to the first spot if they planned on having a big party. I guess that bigger party were frustrated that they weren't seated. That was their mistake, We had already been comfortably seated. 

-MAK
author: Melissa C.

description:
I love coming here for the all you can eat soup, salad & breadsticks lunch special =) You might see some senior citizens, but that doesn't stop me.
I pile on the salad, breadsticks and the zuppa toscana mmmmmmmmm yummyyyyyyy!
