When I am here during other hours I go for the angel hair pasta tossed in a light butter garlic sauce w/fresh basil, tomatoes, melted mozarella on top, and 2 marinated shrimp skewers. The thing I really always look forward to is the zuppa toscana. I always ask for seconds even though it makes me look like a pig. Can't help it, I just really like it haha.
Can't wait for my next round at the all you can eat hahahaha!
author: Jenny W.

description:
I'm such a dork. I love Olive Garden. Yes, I said it. I openly admit to everyone. I really love this nationwide-suburban-pseudo-Italian chain restaurant.  (That statement probably just lost anyone who ever thought my reviews were at one time credible!) 

My mom called from North Carolina last weekend and asked what my plans were for that Friday night. 

"Will and I are going out to eat at the Olive Garden," I said. 

After a long pause my mom replies,

"Chantal, why in the world are you going to eat at the OLIVE GARDEN when you live in San Francisco and have hundreds of authentic Italian restaurants right outside your door???"

Good question, Mom. Good question... 

"I don't really know. I guess I just reeeeeeally like Olive Garden."
author: Chantal H.

description:
I hate olive garden. I hated when my mom dragged me there as a child. 
But I hate high and mighty pretentiousness more.
author: Texture D.

description: Its sad to see a restaurant as large as this one's attempts to cost save.  We ordered the sampler appetizer which is quite large and decided to split our main course.  We ordered a salad.  As u know they toss a whole salad in a bowl. They wanted to charge us for an extra salad.  I declined.  They produced the salad bowl with only one plate.  Even served the bread with no extra plates so I can't use the plate for the salad.   I'm sure they will give me a plate when our sampler appetizer comes and will start eating salad too. Nice try olive garden!
author: Bjj P.

description:
Worst food poisining of my life.

On my birthday.

The day before christmas eve.

I ate here last year as a reward for getting all my last minute christmas shopping done before my frantic drive to Los Angeles to go hang out with the parents and siblings for christmas.  I went there with my then girlfriend because I knew how much she loved their breadsticks and I had the steak medallions over pasta.  Most of them were dry and overcooked dispite the fact that I asked for medium rare, but one was luke warm and bloody when I bit in to it and I ate it anyway thinking I had scored.  I sure had.

An hour later the car was loaded for our trip.  I had a full thermos of coffee on the passenger seat and the gifts were loaded in to the trunk and across the back seat.  I had gone upstairs to get my jacket and suddenly had this wierd feeling and decided to lay down.

I spent the next 24 hours violently spewing hot lava from both ends and hallucinating and then dry heaving when there was nothing left.  Merry Christmas from Olive Garden!  Took me three days to recover enough to eat anything but soup and crackers and I've had acid reflux problems ever since.

My sweet girlfriend contacted them and told them.  They sent me a $50 gift certificate.

I have yet to use it.  I never will.  Not even for drinks at their bar.

If they had negative stars I would give it a -5.  At least.

Save yourself.  Eat elsewhere.  I haven't been to an olive garden ever since.
author: Theron L.

description:
Im not such a big fan of Olive Garden especially since that time my friend and I got our food like 45 mins later..his dish looked like it was microwaved and mine seemed like it sat under a heat lamp for half the night.

But of course there were also times where I had a wonderful time and enjoyed the food..my moms bf enjoys coming here every now and then and I guess who you come here with will actually make this place seem so much better.

Anyways though, a couple things I do enjoy
Their greasy breadsticks
Their zupano? tuscano soup.
Their thick angel hair pasta...which i guess wouldnt be considered angel hair anymore..but its too thin to be spaghetti..

The food isnt really that bad and it some of it can be a bit saltier then it should be. But a resturant like this pretty much falls into the whole Chevys, TGIF, etc, Group..

Long wait on certain nights..dont come here if your a pasta fanatic...
author: phillip w.

description:
Don't you always get so excited to go to the OG?  But after waiting an hour, hooving down your salad and breadsticks and eating a precariously mediocre main course.. you realize it's never really that great.

Why is this?

When I walk into Applebee's or TGI Friday I know what to expect.  But for some reason I always have such high expectations for Olive Garden.  I dunno peeps.
author: Derek B.

description:
Well I don't usually like waitng for the table as is the custom at this location.
The food is fairly good but I wouldn't say spectacular. I've had the spaghetti and a chicken dish here before and was satisfied.
The endless salad and rolls are okay. I usually don't eat an endless bowl as the entrees come fairly quickly.
If the wait in line would improve I'd say go for it, but maybe eat a snack to compensate for your wait. har har.
author: Wong, D.

description:
3 stars! That is generous. The is a Chain People. Don't Fool Your Palette!! Educate Your Palette. 

This is not real Italian Food. It is not even real food. They Microwave it before they bring it to you. Yeah they nuke it. Yuck.

I know they try to come off as very authentic and real. Well I know Italy. I know the Cuisine of Italia... and trust me Olive Garden is not it. But then again you know this. C'mon I know you are not dumb.

Skip this chain. Go to North Beach for some real Italian "Slow Food"
Buon Appetit  Infodiva is concerned about your health and eating habits.  Mangia
author: Infodiva B.

description:
Havent been here for like 5 years.  It's gone through a total makeover.  The seating is ALOT better.  The wait, I remembered used to be over an hour.  I got here today at 7pm, and it's Monday...so...you be your own judge.

The salad, delicious, better than HPR.
The sausage soup, delicious.
The appetizer sampler, we picked fried zucchini, stuffed mushrooms, and calamari.  Zucchini and mushrooms, great; calamari not that great.
The lasagna, extremely dry, I asked for a side of marinara sauce....then half way through the lasagna I asked for another side of marinara.

Verdict:  go for lunch when you can have the soup and salad special for cheap.
author: Jenny K.

description:
Food is ok for a chain. We went at 11:15AM on Saturday and sat in a booth. We had a server who had 2 tables in our section and more in a different area. The other server for our section gave her tables excellent service but we were left hanging for drinks, bread etc.
The price for brunch for 2 was extremely high...we could have gone to North Beach for the price. It will be a long time before we go back.
author: Robert A.

description:
I have to admit that when I was growing up as kid in SF, I didn't like eating at Olive Garden at all. But now as a post grad and returnee to the good ol' hometown, I quite enjoy this restaurant. 

My favorite and what I mainly come for is the stuffed mushroom appetizer (although I wish it wasn't so oily and greasy). It is so yummy! I still like it even though I know The Cheesecake Factory has cheaper and tastier stuffed mushrooms. Stonestown is still closer than downtown, though.

The service is great. I love how they always offer you a little taste of some wine or other drink right when you sit down. I've had one of the best wines here. It was sweet and taste like champagne. I like it so much, I had to get a glass.

Soup + salad + breadsticks are always a plus.
My 4 stars are mainly for the mushrooms + service. If not for those two, I would probably still agree with my kid self's opinion.
author: Jamie W.

description:
unlimited salad and bread sticks = GOOD IDEA

pasta and other entrees = BAD iDEA

if you want REAL Italian food, go somewhere else.

ps. does anyone still shop at Stonestown?!
author: Carol Y.

description:
HOLY SHIZZLE!!! Can you say very rude worker! 

The food was yummy! I really like Olive Garden's food. You get a lot of bang for your buck...one of the better italian food chains i've been to. But the service I received yesterday from the hostess was HORRIBLE!

I'm meeting a group of my girlfriends here for dinner on a Tuesday evening around 7:15. Ya don't think that you really need a reservation on a weeknight. I put our name down for 7 adults 1 child. The hostess was telling me there was a wait. She turns around and asks the manager how long the wait was. The manager looks at me and says it's an hour and a half to an hour forty-five wait. In my head I was like OH SNAP that's long...but I asked if I could still put my name down seeing as I was the first one there out of the party. the manager then looks at me and continues to tell me how long the wait is and how they have a bunch of big parties that night. I just look at her again and say okay but can i put my name down. Again she tells me how long the wait...i look at the girl that originally was helping me and ask her CAN I JUST PUT MY NAME DOWN? She says yes finally and gives me a pager.

As I am waiting for my friends I decide to put my name down at Chevy's to see how long the wait was there. It was only 20 minutes or less. So I had time to see what my friends wanted to do once they got there. As they proceed to arrive within the next HALF HOUR chevy's hadn't called my name...BUT the Olive Garden pager started flashing or buzzing. YES our table was ready and WAY FASTER! I realized that we had one more child with us for dinner so when I gave back the pager I apologized and told them that we needed another high chair. The hostess gives the pager to the mean hostess and tells her. The mean hostess rolled her eyes and said that our table would be ready in a few minutes! BIZZLE!!!!

Someone should tell her if she doesn't like her job she shouldn't be working there...i just wanted to throw something at her ugly face!
author: Jazmine S.

description:
It's time for me to finally publicly admit that I LOVE the Olive Garden. It's my guilty pleasure restaurant....so middle America trashy, yet so delish. This was my first (but not last) time at this location, and it was totally packed so we sat at the bar. The bartender was sort of hilarious/strange and poured us a buncha wine samples, then proceeded to pour our glasses to the brim. Like literally to the TOP of the glass. 

He charges us a grand total of $2.95 for my meal (well, my soup salad & breadsticks) and left a few other things off the bill. Undercharging and overpouring = fastest route to a huge tip.

I don't think the chain is fooling anyone into thinking they're fine Italian dining, but this was my favorite place as a kid, so it will always hold a place in my heart.
author: Kate P.

description: My waitress Caitlin was extremely nice and gave such great service! The salmon bruschetta was amazing! Such great flavor and this was my first time here and I can't wait to come back!
author: Arianna B.

description:
I went there with a party of ten, just regular dinner no special occasion like every other god damn table. The waiter threw the menu at me and then apologized. He look like he meant to throw it. The waitress brought the wrong food and dropped it on the floor while bringing the food to the table. She got the attention of everyone in the damn room for a good 5 minutes. Lamest place ever, I felt like I was in some cheap buffet in Reno or some Italian wannabe fancy diner.
Overall -- the place is a mess, the food is way too salty. C-R-A-P-P-Y!
the only thing good was the peach ice sugar drenched tea. 
By the way, my dog loved the fettucini though =) 
anyways...
Save your money and go to the food court and get some god damn corn dogs!
author: Ms T.

description: Stopped here in between classes. They have blue moon on draft! To all the people in a 15-20 min line, when they tell you to wait, why dont you sit at the bar? Alyssa, I think her name was, served us today and was so attentive and very sweet. Ate the caprese flatbread today, and was a little disappointed by the slight sog factor (yucky tomatoes..) but the bread sticks are still a win. Hey you, pumpkin cheesecake. Next week, youre mine.
author: katherine y.

description:
WHY do people wait for over an hour for this "Italian" food?  I've been here a few too many times, because my roommate likes it.  

You can get your standard pastas, but there is nothing outstanding.

Two stars just for the salad.  "Nuff said.
author: Michael M.

description:
very good Italian food - according to an Italian Brazilian.

I like it too.
author: Astro P.

description:
I came here when I was a kid once, I was clueless, but I remember loving the breadsticks. I came here over the summer with friends. There was a long wait. A LONG wait. The place is definitely clean. The bathrooms are definitely clean.

The food? Overpriced, the portions are puny. It's not worth it. I am not coming here. It makes me shiver just thinking about it. I don't even remember what I got, but I remember I thought it was overpriced. The only plus side to this place is the breadsticks. The waiter was pretty rude to us. It was either because our group was Asian or composed of teenagers.

I have yet to try the dessert, but I don't plan to be back to do so.
author: Glen H.

description:
So I finally tried Olive Garden.  After years of commercials and hearing about free breadsticks and never ending salad.

The breadsticks were eh.  The salad was the best part-- pretty much all lettuce and a little bit other stuff.  The chicken parmesan was gross.   I was very let down.
author: F K.

description: The food at olive garden is not gourmet real Italian food. I read an article comparing the food at olive garden to chef Chef Boyardee. I went to the stonestown location with my mother when it first opened. I had veal and the serving was so small only the size of a deck of cards. I reminded them of the tv commercial that went "we don't know the meaning of not enough." So, they said, "you can have more salad and bread sticks." I was so insulted that this remark stuck in my mind and after all of these years. They implied I was some sort of pig who would stuff her face with these huge doughy bread sticks. I was only referring to the commercial asking them to man up. I doubt these new claims of endless food. They will stuff you up with a lot of carbs, but when it comes to the meat, forget about unlimited food. They just out and out lie at Olive Garden. So, I have never been back, nor would I ever go back there again.
author: Laurel Z.

description: We went to try the 3 items for $12.99 deal on June 10th 2013 and I was very satisfied with the food and service by Cameron. I picked the grilled chicken and Cameron gave me an option to have the chicken with grilled vegetables. Two pieces of moist and tasty chicken was served over a bed of baby spinach and fresh grilled zucchini with basal sauce. I had the Zuppa soup at the beginning and perfect cup of Cappuccino after dinner. Great deal, healthy and delicious!
author: N C.

description: The manager who's name is Soma actually asked me to put my 2 1/2 pound REGISTERED ASSISTANCE DOG on the floor, who was quietly sitting next to me on his blanket. My dog is extremely well behaved and is trained to sit and wait till I'm done. I'VE NEVER BEEN ASKED TO PUT MY DOG ON THE FLOOR IN ANY OTHER ESTABLISHMENT IN SF OR EVEN TRAVELING OUT OF THE CITY! Soma claimed it was company policy. I refused & he let me keep dog sitting next to me (he couldn't force me to put my dog on the floor) but said it wouldn't be allowed in the future. Olive Garden's policies and food sucks so I won't be eating there again.
author: C H.

description: I remember watching "The Bachelor" a few years ago, and Andrew Firestone asked one of the girls who was from the Bay Area, "What is your favorite Italian Restaurant?".  She stuttered "uh The Olive Garden."  He then rolled his eyes like she was some sort of ditzy idiot.  But you know, the Olive Garden is in fact an Italian restaurant and the food is quite good.  Everytime my husband and I go there, it's usually a full house and significant wait.  Tonight we went there and the manager was so gracious.  Instead of having us wait for a table, he escorted us to an intimate table near the bar.  He checked on us a few times to make sure we were satisfied with the food and service.  Our server, David was quite nice and even took a $4 expired coupon I had for Olive Garden.  I couldn't believe he honored it, even if it was expired.  Nice guy.  I love this place and I wish they had an OG closer to my neighborhood.  Next craving for pasta, we'll be back.  Great cappuccinos too!
author: Terry S.

description:
My family and I spent over $200 for dinner and we were all very disappointed in our food...never coming back here again...

I ordered the steak rissoto with wild mushrooms and reduction sauce.

The steak was over-cooked but this was masked by the reduction that was made with cheap, bad tasting wine.  Every foodie knows that you don't make reductions with bad wine.

Besides being drowned in the worst tasting reduction I have ever had, the rissoto was over cooked.  My grandpa could have taken out his dentures and still said it was waaaay too soft.  What's up with that??

The only thing that was good on the dish was the wild mushrooms.

All I can say is that this was a very disappointing night for me AND for my family.

I don't recommend this place at all, but it's a chain so a bunch of people are still going to flock here anyways.  What has happened to the SF foodie scene???

Does anyone know any great Italian places in the city???
author: BigAppetite ..

description: Unless, you are meeting because of location skip it. With soooo many great options around you should not settle for this. I like the service. I like the parking. If you want soup out of a can and salad that is OK then sure go for it.
author: Mike D.

description: More sauce on the ravioli....that is all I have to say, otherwise, its good food, served quickly and is not a high end italian restaurant, so you get what you pay for.
author: Dennis N.

description: I try not to eat too many carbs these days, but back in my early college years I used to go here with a few regular friends for the soup and salad lunch specials as we were very broke (and still are mind you.) The only pasta dish I liked was the Seafood or grilled chicken Fettuccine Alfredo and the Mushroom filled ravioli with tomato/basil sauce. My favorite drink here WAS the Peach Iced tea Bellini but since reviewing the Vallejo location, and finding out they changed the recipe to include SPLENDA like sweetener in it, I refuse to go back until they return my ORIGINAL sweet tasting peach iced tea Bellini. It's quite sad as this placed used to hold such great memories for me and a few of my then closest friends. I will honestly miss those days... =(
author: Petra S.

description:
I had better food in an army barracks. 

at least there, I knew the ketchup they were giving me had less processed grounds than the mystery red sauce that awaited me here.

not too mention, this place, the only thing it did for me was make me say 'hospitaliano' to my bathroom as I sat there all nite from the painful realization I had not eaten italian food but I had ate Olive Garden.

at least, I got to read the entirity of a time magazine bc of this 'establishment'
author: Derek Alistair J.

description:
I hate those commercials where they have the relatives visting from Italy and their family takes them to Olive Garden for a traditional Italian meal. Are you kidding me?!? That has to be some kind of joke. 

I've eaten here several times and every time I've gotten sick to my stomach afterwards. The only reason I've ever gone there is because the wait at Chevy's next door was long. I've learned my lesson. I don't know why its taken me so long to realize that their food is garbage. Also the decor is pitiful and is in massive need of some upgrading. 

Don't eat here unless you enjoy spending your night on the toilet.
author: Andrea G.

description: All you can eat pasta is back again. I usually get my monies worth during this time because you get to chow down your first plate down and bring home a totally new dish to go for later. $8.95 you can't beat that when compared to most of their dishes are $15.95 and up!
author: Jeff C.

description:
Perhaps your parents are like mine and they insist on giving you gift cards for chain restaurants, no matter how much you protest. "There isn't a Macaroni Grill near me! I don't even eat at Red Lobster when I'm home!" If not, be thankful.

I've had an Olive Garden gift card in my wallet since Christmas 2005, wedged between my library card and a Lean Cuisine coupon. The last time I ate at Olive Garden was probably before a high school dance, and I honestly assumed there wasn't one to be found in the city limits. I was wrong!

I went to Stonestown this weekend (long story) and lo and behold, this is where San Francisco is hiding its Olive Garden. I know we have a choice of award-winning cuisines at our fingertips... but I'm genetically incapable of letting a gift card "go to waste."

Needless to say, the experience was predictably horrible. The dishes were all disgustingly huge and cheesy, my napkin had crusted bits of food on it, and about halfway through my soggy Caesar salad, the man in the booth across from me kicked off his church shoes and let them scoot out into the aisle. On top of all this, the prices were absolutely outrageous. What makes a mediocre chain Italian restaurant think it can charge $15.95 for anything? Turns out that gift card didn't even go very far.

Stay tuned for the next installment, wherein I review the TGI Fridays in San Bruno. :)
author: Christina S.

description:
My wife Becky and I just came here to celebrate our anniversary.  The Olive Garden is very special to us, since our first date was at an Olive Garden.  Sometimes though, we come here even when we're not celebrating any special occasion, just like in the commercial.  We have to be careful not to stuff ourselves with the all-you-can-eat salad and breadsticks before our Tour of Italy has even begun, LOL!

The veal parmigiana is my favorite entree here.  Funny, that's my favorite Swanson TV dinner entree, too.
author: Dave Y.

description: I went to celebrated my birthday with my family and by accident left my Iphone in the table  i realized 15 minutes later i went back hoping to get it back but i was not able to get it back cause nobody saw it  wooowwww!!! the restaurant wasn't busy that night i never expect this from this restaurant, so what kind of employees this restaurant have??? i'm so dissapointed with this restaurant
author: Betsy M.

description:
I like this Olive Garden because I know what to expect. The food is OK, but the service is superb. You cannot go wrong with the endless salad  bowl. And the bread sticks are good for sopping up the extra salad dressing on the plate. Or if you want more, out of the big Family Style bowl serving all at the table. 

The main dishes are Italian and huge. I try to stay away from the alfredos, the pastas and lasagnas. Usually do not succeed at it. They are not like mom made, but good enough for me. I will keep going for the service first, food second.
author: Alice K.

description:
Okay, come on people. 2.5 stars? Really? Thats the general opinion of Olive Garden? I mean - given - they certainly do not treat you like familly as their age old commercials boast. But have you had the ravioli di portabello? Little piece of pasta heaven. And the breadsticks?!?! One of those babies is a good 300 calories but it is WORTH IT!
But the real reason I hold this cheesy restaurant chain so dear to my heart? Its the only restaurant in walking distance from my school and serves as our frequent lunch and coctails destination. The coctails are strong enough to make even my decision sciences professors funny. For that I am forever greatful.
author: Taylor E.

description:
Refills on any soup and breadsticks are free. For under $6, you can get full off of the soup and breadsticks. You can even try all three soups. The Peach Bellini (relabeled as Bellini Peach-Rasberry Iced Tea on menu) isn't your average flavored tea. Nestea beverages can't compare to the Peach Bellini. It's full of flavor and you can actually taste the peach. 

The seafood alfredo, grilled chicken alfredo, and grilled chicken pizza are great.
author: Armstrong B.

description:
My best friends and I go to olive garden to unwind, hang out for a really really long time, drink a load of sangria, and get a little laughing out. 

Zuppa.
author: Annie T.

description:
Came here with a couple of friends to try the never ending pasta bowl.  I'm not a big pasta person, so you might see my decisions and think, "well that wasn't very smart." But hopefully someone who shares my taste will find it useful.

I decided not to opt for the unlimited meatball and sausage for an extra 2 bucks.  I figured I'd have my hands, or mouth, full with the pasta.  

I started off with Linguini and Alfredo sauce.  WARNING.  Alfredo sauce is thick, so it's not great to start off with.  Especially since the first bowl is huge.  It was good nonetheless, but it severely limited what I could follow up with.  Later on, since I was craving meat and pretty full already, I got a second bowl with angel hair pasta and meat sauce.  Quite satisfying.  

Our server was very nice, although sometimes forgetful.  Still, it was a nice experience.
author: Andrew T.

description:
Coming here is a gastronomic delight!!

 Their salads,eggplant parmesan and portobella mushroom ravioli are excellent. The portions are pretty huge too.  It's right next to the mall,so when they hand you the buzzer/pager you get to kill time(it can take some time before you get your seat).

The staff was friendly and service was prompt.

The desserts here are hard to resist too.
author: Natasha I.

description: I came here with the fam for my husband's birthday. Our waiter started off a little slow but overall we had great service. We all got the endless pasta for 8.95 which is a great deal. I added chicken to my pasta which I shouldn't of. The chicken has a weird soft texture which had gross grey dark parts. Blah!!! My orecchietti pasta was overcooked and my roasted mushroom sauce was a little bland. They give you so much pasta!!!!! I can't really see a lot of people getting refills? I love the breadsticks and salad. I'm not sure if I'd be back at this location but I'll probably come back to the olive garden in the future.
author: Selina S.

description:
It pains me to give this place just two stars when I have had such great memories here.  This review pertains to my last few visits and is indicative of a trend I noticed with the food quality here.  

I've been coming here since the late 90's and have always enjoyed their Chicken Parm and Tour of Italy, as well as trying their season specials and occasionally wandering outside of my comfort zone and trying something new.  The soup, salad, and bread sticks are consistently great and I love coming here for that.  Their entrees are a little on the salty side but I can't blame them for that since most American pallets enjoy saltier tastes as opposed to bland.  

The wait here is probably one of the biggest complaints here, but I did not factor that into my number of stars.  When I come here, I expect the wait and I plan around it so it doesn't bother me anymore.

I came here last year during their never ending pasta bowl special and was extremely disappointed with the pasta and sauces.  The pasta was either undercooked or overcooked and after sending two orders back because they were literally inedible in addition to the watery sauce, we just gave up coming here.  
A year later, I thought I would give them another try for my birthday.  As usual, the soup, salad, and bread sticks were all excellent.  When my Tour of Italy arrived, the Fettuccine Alfredo was severely undercooked.  Al Dente was the understatement of the century!  It was so hard to the point where I could have broken a tooth if I tried eating it.  I notified the waitress of the situation and she immediately took it back to the kitchen.  About 10 minutes later, she comes back out with a bowl of new Fettuccine and this time is is less undercooked, but what I would still consider very poor quality food for a restaurant under the Darden Brand and I am shocked that it was allowed to leave the kitchen at all.  About a third of the noodles were too hard to eat. When the waitress asked how the new batch was, I told her that it was still undercooked, but it was fine.  I felt bad enough for her already having to send one order back.  She said that due to the never ending pasta bowl promotion which was going on at the time, pasta quality may not be at its best.  I understand this, but quality should not have to suffer as a result of quantity.  

Because of this declining quality, I'm unlikely to return here in the immediate future.  If I do decide to come back after awhile, I will not be dining here while the never ending pasta bowl promotion is going on.  This used to be my go-to place in the past and I am sad to see how far food quality has declined in that time.
author: Chris L.

description:
Ok, so in my party there are four guys and each of us order the most expensive entree on the menu. No refills on soups, one breadstick each, sat us all the way in the back and did not pay one bit of attention to us.

They must have assumed since we are a bunch of young guys we wont tip very well anyway, so why waste any energy on us. We made their assumption come true, leaving a $100 bill on a $91 tab. I've never done anything like that in my life, I tip my hair stylist 33%.

This place used to be worth the long wait to be seated despite the slow service, but now its just terrible.

Additional two stars for the taste of the food.
author: Mikey D.

description: I was here today waiting for 45 minutes. The hostess told us there is a wait, but a couple show up and a table was ready for them!!  The table wAs not clean yet, the check wAs still there!!  What kind of service wAs that.  The food wAsnt that great! Our dinner takes two hours!! Unbelievable!!  Our server was good but the wait wAs crazy takes forever!!! I would not come back anymore!!! Worst place ever!
author: Terry L.

description:
Great Service! I loved my waiter, he kept a smile on my face.

It was however really crowded. I didn't like how they had an hour long wait for "normal sitting" but also had a "fight for a table" bar area. I thought that was a weird set up for a restaurant.
author: Melissa B.

description:
sunday morning...body aching from snowboarding the day before...and minor hangover from the night before.....what do i want this beautiful sunday morning.....something "clean"....to counterbalance all the grease eaten the night before...narrow the choice down to olive garden....

don't want to wait?...seat yourself at any available table near the bar area.....no wait...easy..simple....you might be quite surprised to know that olive garden here serves up a great colorful potent bloody mary.....$5.99 each......

the endless bread, soup and salad lunch was just what i was looking for....cheap eats at $5.99* ($9.99 after 4 p.m.)....endless soft warm bread....3 choices of great gourmet soups...and simple green salad with italian dressing....perfect cheap light brunch for a lazy morning/afternoon...

*it may not be on the menu...but ask and you will receive....
author: Hen A.

description:
Chain restaurants like the Olive Garden ("OG") usually suck donkey balls.  I don't like going to them and I don't like being seen in them.  

Since I'm currently striving to be a healthy, elitist bitch, the OG is off limits.  Except for yesterday...

I must admit that...I actually had a decent time there last night, despite a creepy bartender and a ton of (decent) back-fat-creating food.

We had a really nice college student waitress with big boobs and fried blond hair.  I'll betcha $5 she's from San Diego and shops at "Pac Sun".   Whatever, she let us split our checks!  She also put our food in to-go boxes for us (I'm so used to doing that myself!), and humored my drunk ass like a pro.

Pass the friggin bread sticks, yo.
author: Karen F.

description:
I would give this place ZERO stars if I could.  They advertise some incredible deals for this place on TV, so my boyfriend and I got tempted into driving out to the mall for the soup, salad, breadstick lunch.  What a mistake!

We got seated after a couple minutes of waiting and told our server that we were kind of in a hurry (wanted to catch a movie) and knew we wanted the SSBL.  We gave him our order right away, and he said he'd be back with our food.   After 35 minutes, we had only been brought our iced tea, without the sweetening and lemon that we'd asked for.  No breadsticks.  No salad.  No soup.  No nothing.

I wish I could say that we "dined and dashed", but we didn't.  We left cash for our teas, but I wished that I had had enough pennies in my bag to pay for it instead of bills.

What a nightmarish waste of time!!
author: Jenny K.

description:
I am reviewing this to bring it down.

People... this is SF.  Don't go to Olive Garden.  Don't go to North Beach.  Find one of the superb Italian restaurants all over the city... and eat well.

Olive Garden is poison and is destroying culinary culture with marketing dollars subverting the fact that it is all from a can, and the most important tool in their kitchen is a can opener.
author: Uncle Fishbits Aeneas X.

description:
I'm usually a defender of chains. No offense to any of you all here but I hate the people that go into these fast food joints or chain restaurants and bash them for having lackluster food or not providing that five-star, six diamond Zagat-rated, hullabaloo. For me, I know what I'm going into. If I'm going to a place that has cute candle-lit dinners and a bit more pricey plates, I expect it as long as they are attentive but leave me alone a little bit with the good company and fantastic food. When I go to McDonald's, I expect the food to be made quick, taste the same as when I had it last time, and be in and out by someone that knows what I'm ordering, what I ordered, and how to swipe my card. I don't confuse these two scenarios. It's why I don't mind giving bad reviews to that candle-lit restaurant when I feel like I'm at McDonald's or giving a five star review to a McDonald's that treats me like I'm at a fabulous place.

The Olive Garden at Stonestown, however, really sucks. I used to come here a lot when I was in high school just because it was close by, I love (American) Italian, and it was consistent. I knew what I wanted, I knew it'd be good, and I knew what to expect. My favorites used to be the fettuccine alfredo with some chicken, one bowl too many of the zuppa toscana, and mountains of bread sticks. The price would be good, the family (or friends) would be content, and the service would be just right and attentive. Everyone was happy and I would have happily given this place a four-star review.

I recently came here and noticed that a lot of the prices have changed. Now I'm used to things being priced a bit more, especially if it's worth it. However, this place has really changed for the worst! When prices start to go higher, I expect better quality food or at the very least, quality service. I had neither of these things on my last experience -- huge disappointment!
author: Rick C.

description: Olive Garden here is awesome!! I would come here with a large group of my friends, so there would be about 10 of us and we always come here for dinner events and their service is hella nice and their food is always good! :)
author: Tiffany T.

description:
Love this place. Go here all the time with the girlfiriends! OG has great service, great food, great location!

Try the soup/salad combo. If you want more than that, any of the pasta's! like i said this place is GREAT!
author: J-nine I.

description:
San Francisco is not, nor does it deserve to be, known for it's Italian cuisine. This would seem to give Olive Garden a relative boost. However, I'd rather have a serving of Lean Cuisine meatless lasagna then wait an hour or more to have the privilege of eating at the Olive Garden. They don't take reservations and it seems anytime you'd want to eat, you better bring a snack (waits of an hour or more on a Saturday afternoon? Huh?).

If you're stuck in Tampa Bay or Topeka, fine. Enjoy the Olive Garden experience. You're there, you're family. But in SF its inexcusable. It's not that cheap, even with the bottomless soup/salad/breadstick component. There are better Italian restaurants with comparable prices and shorter waits. 

... just none that sell their gift cards at Safeway.

Olive Garden escapes with a second star because I'm a sucker for the salad.
author: Ian H.

description:
If you love breadsticks and never-ending salad, this is the place... if you can't find anything better and this place is nearby, that is.

The food's usually OK to great... it depends... it pretty much is hit and miss at times. I've never experienced a bad waiter or waitress nor have I had problems with them. I would say on the food and service alone, I would give this place four stars.

But here's the problem... the price of the food doesn't usually correspond with the quality of the food. It's great, but not $12-20 a plate great. That, and it takes FOREVER to get a seat during their busy hours. The last time I went here, I have to admit, only took five to ten minutes to get a table. That blew my fucking mind. But usually when we try to eat here, the wait's been from 20 minutes to more than an hour... and quite frankly, I'm not THAT desperate to wait for Olive Garden food. 

If the food was cheaper and the wait was shorter, even by just a little bit, I'd probably give it the four stars it would warrant... maybe even five if seating was quick. But yeah, you can't expect much from chain restaurants that are usually placed near malls and shopping centers.

If you don't like the wait, then hopefully they have seats in the bar area. If it weren't for friends who knew about avoiding being seated at a nice table to go grab a table at the bar, I probably would eat less here. And knowing is half the battle!
author: Chris S.

description: i ca go everyday if i had the choice i just love the Alfredo sauce on everything !
author: Jessica M.

description:
Ohh Noo... the Olive Garden only has 2.5 stars here?  haha... 

I love the olive garden!  this will be short and sweet...

Unlimited SOUP AND BREAD... 
me as homer: "sssoooup...uggghhhh breeeeaaad"

Get that  Zuppa Tuscona Soup! and Dip the bread sticks in there.

I have so much that I NEVER finish my food here and always have to take it home to eat later!

If I could, I would just order the unlimited soup and just leave.  Be like "i'm full now See ya! :) "

Cheers!
author: Laurie H.

description:
I've had really good experiences at this Olive Garden in the past, but when I went last week I was disappointed. 

For some reason the dishes we ordered were really salty, especially their Capellini Pomodoro. High blood pressure runs in my family and all the salt was too much for me. 

Please note, service was great and I really liked their I liked their Chicken Carbonara dish. The pasta was fun to eat (like really skinny straws) and the chicken was tasty. 

If you end up going and you're not into salt, I recommend requesting minimal added salt. That's what I'm going to do if I ever have an Olive Garden craving again.
author: Mariko W.

description: It is what you expect from an Olive Garden. Overall a good experience when it comes to customer service, ambiance is nice, but the food seemed to be way saltier than it was a few years ago. I felt like a block of salt. Either way I'd go back if I had a craving.
author: Chris M.

description:
I love Olive Garden. I continue to eat at Olive Garden frequently (even though people laugh at me for it) for the following reasons:

1) Great service. Mostly young people work here (late teens to early twenties), so maybe that's not what you'd be expecting. But I've never had a rude waiter or waitress here. They've always been super friendly and attentive.

2) Great food. Though, to be fair, I have an unhealthy love of pasta and I'm not terribly picky. But I've never hated or even disliked anything I've ordered. Never even had a "eh" reaction. There are always a few things I want to order from the menu, and I'm always satisfied with what I end up with. Plus, the waiters/waitresses ask you if you want to add cheese to all your dishes: your soup, your salad, your already generously cheese-y pasta dish. As a lover of cheese, I approve.

3) Decent prices. My friend and I ate here all the time when we were jobless and living off our parents. Are you jobless and living off your parents? You can afford to eat here. Most meals are about $10-$15 each.

4) Convenient location. It's right next to the mall, San Francisco State University, the Muni Metro, and several bus lines.

The only thing about Olive Garden I'm not so crazy about it, is if you go there on a Friday or Saturday night, and you have like a 45 minute wait. Luckily the mall is next door, and there should be enough to amuse you there for 45 minutes.

EDIT: Went there earlier this week... Finally encountered two less than friendly employees. One was, I think, a food runner. The other person was covering our table while the original server went on break. They weren't rude per se, but it felt like they just wanted to get our table over with. A HUGE difference from the usually chummy and sociable waiters and waitresses I've gotten in the past. And they ran out of gnocchi at lunch time. :(

Also, the prices seem to have gone up. Either that, or I'm poorer now then I was as a highschooler.

Still love this place and would cram their cheese-laden dishes down my gullet any day of the week. The appetizer trio is the shit, and I love their banal and soggy salad, although I must confess I don't know what people see in the bread sticks.
author: Trish B.

description:
This was not planned, but just happened to be hungry & near by, so we entered the doors around 5pm. Even at that time, there were many tables already filled, but we only waited 5min. 

The service there was friendly & appropriate.

The Mixed Grill entree included salad & their famous garlic bread sticks. Steak, chicken, zuchinni & yellow squash grilled with lightly burned edges(just the way I like it) The grilled flavor & spices really stood out in the chicken! (hint: reduce carbohydrates by asking for double vegetables instead of potatoes)
author: GARY C.

description: Rudest and most incompetent management of the host function.  Went on a busy Friday night and was given a pager and told that there was a 40 - 50 minute wait.  Went for a walk around the mall and came back a half hour later and wanted to see how much longer to see if we should take another walk.  Hostess doesn't give full attention and after looking up the pager number says "you've only been waiting 25 minutes, sir.  Its going to be another 35 minutes."  To top it off, when the pager finally goes off another half hour later, we give the pager to the host and wait to be seated and the manager comes up and my wife tells her we are the table of 3 - the manager directs us to the other host to get a pager.  When I complain, all I get is an excuse that it was an honest mistake.  No, incompetent host management is what it is.  You can't keep track of anything.  Wait service was good and food was what was expected at a chain and another manager did stop by to ask again about what happened  - hosts definitely need training and the manager making excuses like that is not acceptable.
author: Davis L.

description: Been coming to this Olive Garden for several years and the waiters and waitresses are extremely nice, courteous, helpful, funny and respectful. I've never been dissatisfied coming here. I know there's a long wait sometimes but its worth it! The food is delicious and well made. Their breadsticks are perfection  love their pastas and I come here often for my friends' birthdays. Highly recommend this place. I dont know why this location has so few stars. If the wait time bothers you just come earlier. I always go early and the wait time is literally 10 mins max
author: Michelle C.

description:
I'm not a huge fan of the Olive Garden, but hey it's okay quasi Italian food for in a pinch.  

Went to this location after B2B because we were craving a good ol' carb o loading feast.  We all went in and were seated almost immediately.  After a bathroom run, we were all settled in for lunch.  Our server was incredibly nice and efficient, definitely no complaints about the service.  My complaint was mostly about the food!  Breadsticks, of course as always, were really good.  Our appetizers, were eh.  Just tasted like they were straight out of freezer bag, not fresh at all.  

I got their new, limited time only rigatoni stuffed with cheese with shrimp.  The shrimp were teeny tiny little shrimps.  And there were not a lot of them either.  The pasta and sauce were okay, but nothing to write home about.  All in all, not the best meal I've ever had at a Olive Garden.  My salad also barely had any dressing on it either.  Boo to that.   And the worse part?  The prices, oh jesus are they way overpriced!  

But it served the purpose; stuffing our faces post B2B race!  Nothing like carb o loading and then getting into a warm cozy, Tahoe settling in for a nice nap all the way back to the East Bay~
author: Sue Ann D.

description:
cmon guys.  Olive Garden really isn't that bad.  It's tasty, you get all you can eat breadsticks and salad or soup.... it's AMERICAN ITALIAN.  yup.  But it's decent, it's reasonably priced, it's clean, the noodles are good and al dente.  And service is almost always good.  You always walk away full from the Olive Garden.

ALL OF THAT is more than you can say for House of  "flies refuse to eat this steaming pile of shit " Nanking, which has a higher rating?  messed up.
author: Fong L.

description:
I was excited to eat here for the first time, but was not at all impressed by their service. 

4 stars: My dinner the Parmesan crusted tilapia was awesome  and so was the orange cream soda . 

-1 star: One of girlfriends dinner was the wrong dish so they had to go back and make what she ordered and she didn't get it till the end of the dinner. 

-1 star: My cousins dinner was a seafood pasta with mussels and there were no mussels. In the shells were slices of mushrooms.
author: Christina B.

description:
Didn't wait that long to be seated and served.  We enjoyed the food and service. Very friendly waitress and food was wow.  

O.G  is the best Italian restaurant, unlike other "pretend to be Italian business in SF".
author: Customer L.

description:
OK, so at 9 PM last night we finally settled on Olive Garden on our way back from Decompression. We were completely absurdly dressed given the venue (but we totally fit in at Decomp!!) and starving, me and Elyssa having been up for about 36 hours, of which all but 10 of them were exceptionally inebriated.

We got seated pretty quick, and then the fun began. Long story short (if you don't know the Olive Garden's menu, then sod off and die, it's just the same basic crap as any semi-Italian-ish place) we ordered quickly, and then waited. About 30 minutes later, no entrees. WTF???

I don't like waiting. I am not a patient person. I bitch to the manager. Instantly, all of our entrees appear, and they are now free. And if you know anything, it's that free food always tastes better (on a tangent, free drinks always get you drunker, but that's a different law of life).

So, kudos to you, Olive Garden. You have proven to me that customer service and a desire for customer satisfaction does indeed still exist. And for that, I give you 4 stars (and also the wine tasting...that was a neat touch).
author: Irene F.

description: I dont remember who our waiter was but he was sooo polite and had great customer service, ive come here for lunch and plenty of birthday dinners and the staff is always so polite! I have to say that day was one of the best restaurant experiences ive had.. Ever! The food was good, and everything just went so smooth, it made my day.
author: Jessica C.

description:
We were told it would be a 25-30 minutes wait. The guy took my name down and handed me a pager. We walked over to Borders which was right across the street. We browsed around the store a bit. The pager started to play a tune. We walked back to check on our status. We were told that when we were "out of range" it would play a tune. Then we were told we had 15 minutes left.

We walked inside Stonestown to pass some time. The pager lit up and started vibrating. We walked back to the restaurant but before we got there, the pager stopped vibrating. I hand my pager over to the hostess Tina. She looks at the pager with a puzzled look then looks at me. I told her it was vibrating but it just stopped. She looks at the sheet of paper with everyone's names on it. She said "I'll give you the next available table." The next table? Why were we paged then?

I gave my friend an irritated look. Tina or her co-worker gave our table away! We couldn't believe it. We sat down to wait for our table.

The host escorted two separate couples who arrived AFTER us to their tables. My friend went up to Tina to ask her when we were getting our tables because we were there before those other two couples. Tina said "I have to tell my co-worker that you're next. He doesn't know about you guys."
What?!?!? Isn't that why I along with everyone else give the host or hostess our names? Isn't that why they write it down?

Another hostess walks over to a woman next to us who just arrived and sat down. She asked her was she next. She said no and looks over at us. My friend and I exchanged looks. The hostess asked herself out loud "who's next?" I couldn't believe it! She looked at the paper of names. I walked up to her and informed her that we were next. She was very rude to me. She said "where's your pager?" I told her I gave it to the other hostess and I point to her. She asks again in a louder and meaner tone "where's your pager?" I also raise my voice slightly and said "I handed it to her already." She asks me "what's your pager number?" What?!?! Why would I look for the number on my pager? I told her that I don't know the number on my pager.

Tina then decided to speak up. She said to the other hostess "Yes she is next." The hostess walks us to our table and in a very fake voice says "Your server will be right with you. Enjoy your meal."

We waited for about 8 minutes before our server greeted us. She was really nice. She was the best employee that we came across that day. We both ordered a pizza because it comes with unlimited soup or salad. We both love the Zuppa Tuscona soup. I got the Italian soda with Vanilla. My friend got the Italian soda with caramel. While looking at the drinks part of the menu, I noticed that it didn't have any prices listed. That's something I didn't like.

The pizza was very good. The crust was soft and not dry like most pizzas. There were only a little toppings on the pizza. And I do mean a little. In my opinion, that is not enough. The drink was good. They put too much ice cubes in it though. Yes I know that is how they make money.

20 minutes into our meal, I heard the hostess call my name. I was shocked! To think if I didn't say anything, we would still be waiting for a table. They truly lack communication here. I don't know how they keep this restaurant running.

I saw a group of 5 hosts and hostesses study the paper with everyone's names for quite a long time. They never called the next waiting customers and walked away. A few minutes later, a different group of hosts and hostesses went to look at the paper for a long time. They also didn't call anyone's name off it and walked away. I'd like to think they were all new employees. Sadly, it is not the case. I have seen most of them the last time we ate there and this was well over 2 years ago.

I overheard an employee say to her co-worker "today was a good day." Today was defined as "good"? I don't want to know what a bad day looks like.

Each table was spaced apart nicely. The chairs were comfy and rolled easily. Which made getting out of the chair a breeze. They give you an Andes mint with your bill. I love these mints! It sure beats the regualr red and white "star" mints you get at other restaurants.

Would I dine here again? I'd say that I would only for the food but not the service. The servers all seemed friendly and knew what they were doing. It was all the hosts and hostesses that were completely lost and clueless when it came to taking and dealing with reservations. I think they need a better system and definitely more training.

Though I hate the wait times, I am really surprised by the negative reviews on the food. 
Chicken Scampi, my mom's favorite is light, healthy and flavorful. The Sausage Rustica which is no more was pretty good. Never had overcooked/undercooked pasta or a sauce with no flavor. With breadsticks and salad, I never leave here hungry. My sisters love it here, too, but when they want to take me here for my b-day, I always say I want to try someplace new.

I generally leave other more authentic/classic Italian restaurants kind of bored and underwhelmed, but the Olive Garden (authentic or not) serves up a nice varied menu to accomadate whatever mood your stomach is in....unless your stomach wants something trendy and hip.
author: Stan P.

description: I love olive garden. Always a must stop because we don't have one in Hawaii
author: John A.

description:
OMG.  Lots of people eating here and waiting, you would think the food was out of this world.   it's awful.  No taste.  Pasta overcooked with the sauce just running off.   Very pricey for what you get.  I don't mind paying high prices for good food, but do mind if the food is tasteless and it's like eating a frozen dinner at home!

Service is good, but doesn't make up for the bad food.
I will not be returning.
author: Kendall R.

description: I get these gift certs from AE because my man likes this place.  He always orders whatever specials they have with pasta w/ seafood.  I love their bread sticks, what a CARB..to go with my linguine and chicken, yes, it is good for a chain, what else do you expect.  Check out the lines, 30 min wait, all the time.  We also tried the one in Hayward, but atmosphere is much better here in the Stonestown Galleria.  We are always so full that we never do dessert, what a waste..
author: Leslie Y.

description:
So I went back to Olive Garden @ Stownstown... and let me just say, BIG MISTAKE! I ordered a soup, forget which one, had ground beef in it. It didn't taste bad, but as I was finishing up and on my last spoon-full, I saw a HUGE and I mean HUGE (crap eating) fly in my soup!!! 

Never again, no thank you to Olive Garden... I will pass!!!!!!

The managers were of course nice about it, but I couldn't eat after that or drink and felt sick the rest of the day and night!!
author: Trina K.

description: Bad service. Terrible managment.  I've been to different restaurant and love dining but this place is just terrible.  The service highly questionable.  The wine glass have lipstick marks and fingerprints.  The food always makes me sick for some reason - is it bad food preparation in the kitchen. Pay cash dont give you credit card out here.  The management is really doing a poor job.
author: Nix L.

description:
I came here after my graduation with my family. I have to say the service here never disappoints me. 

The price was okay. A little above my average but that is okay. 

I always order the seafood alfredo. It is my favorite. and the breadstick is just a blast. Nothing beats the breadsticks there. But i wish they had more variety of soup though. 

The fried calamari was awesome. Never gets old. If you ever past by stonestown, you will see it. And maybe you can stop by and check it out. But a warning though. You might have to wait a  little if you go at the wrong time.
author: Andrew H.

description: the bathroom was the best part of my meal... Because it's where i could return the food i ate. The unlimited pasta bowls are so nasty and it has barely any varieties. It is overpriced, super long wait, and the drinks take forever to make.
author: Fitch J.

description:
The motto here is, "We treat you like family," or something along the lines of that. And it is true, considering they're like that aunt of yours that keeps stuffing you beyond your limits. 

The portions are crazy, and I personally can't finish my meal. So what I do is stuff the breadsticks in my purse and eat the soup & course. The food is divine, though & the staff is pretty nice. 

I just wish that there weren't so many calories in each dish ]:
author: Annie D.

description:
Ahhh..you can never go wrong with the classic Olive Garden food. Not the best Italian food ever, but you can always rely on not being horrible! 

I was pretty pleased with this visit. The food was excellent. I ordered the Lasagna, and the 3 item appetizer (the baked ravioli was good!). And of course you can not leave without having the Zuppa Toscana soup! I think that's the best part of the meal!! Yummy creamy potato and meat soup!! The salad is always good too (great dressing). Plus unlimited REFILLS FOR FREE on the soup & salad! Score!!! :) 

Service: The service is average, and so waitress was pretty nice. She helped us right away. Occasionally stepped away a lil too long since I started to get thirstier watching my empty water  glass. But overall she was very pleasant. 

Environment: I always found the restaurant to be comfy. I love to sit in the big rolly chairs. And it's always clean. 

So for what you pay, which is average $10-15 per plate. You get a decent amount of food. I always walk out overstuffed and happy! I don't come here often, so it was nice to visit again!
author: Catherine O.

description:
The food is just ok. It's like any other Olive Garden. The demographic is a bit annoying (if you know Daly City, you know what I mean) with them all letting their obnoxious kids run around screaming. 

The service is great, probably one of the more friendly staff I've seen at an Olive Garden. As I said before, the good is average. It's nice that it's attached to the mall, one of the few full-service restaurants that's attached to Stonestowne. 

Oh, and their house white wine isn't half bad. For the price you can't go wrong, and if you want a consistent food experience, this is the place.
author: Andrew B.

description:
Not the best food but not the worst.  I have always hated the Olive Garden.  There, now it's out.  BUT unfortunately, the BF for some reason loves it.  But he's also not big on fine dining.  He likes chain restaurants and loves the Olive Garden.

I have now come to accept it and once I get that in my system I can make the best of it.  At least it's always clean and the service is decent and the food is consistent, you always know what you're gonna get when you order something. 

The breadsticks are okay, and the tomatoes in their endless salad are good.  The appetizer sampler is okay- everything is fried so how can you go wrong with that?  The one thing I usually order that has never let me down is the Garlic-Herb Chicken con Broccoli which is a rosemary-seasoned chicken breast sauted with fresh broccoli in a garlic cream sauce over orecchiette pasta.........and it's actully ok.  I've had better, but this fills me up and tastes okay.  :)  Pretty much when I order I know i'm not going to get the most flavorful meal in the world, but I'll get a decent one, get filled up and that is good enough sometimes.
author: Denise B.

description:
Been here with friends. I like the atmosphere and I like how you can get big tables and everything, but seriously...the service is inconsistent. Three stars because the last time I went with friends, the waiter was decent and friendly. Not five stars because the time before the last time I went....the waiter spilled the whole tray of drinks on our table and what pissed me off ESPECIALLY is that he spilled it on the BIRTHDAY girl...Yeah. And we had to PAY for those drinks too...No discount. Needless to say, he didn't get a very big tip. 

So as I was saying, food is good...service inconsistent. I guess it's hit or miss??
author: Alison N.

description:
2.5 stars...an extra half star for the memories

Back in the days when I was 16, I thought I was fine dining when my friends and I would actually dress up in our sun dresses (remember those?)  to eat here.  Now, how retarded were we???  Well..we were young and stupid.  I'm glad I'm not 16 anymore....
author: hello k.

description:
The wait service wasn't great. Since they're all pretty much college students and not trained in being helpful to the customers. Just bring the food, get anything else?, here's the check, now GO!

My friends and I (around 10) were there. The waitress was serving ice water and spilled it on me, not a little, a whole glass from the tray. I understood since it was from the tray and it gets tipsy. She said sorry and ran off. She didn't come back...

I'm there wet and freezing and out of napkins to dry my self off. Another waitress comes in and asks me WHY ARE YOU WET? DID YOU POUR WATER ON YOURSELF? uhhh nooo one of YOUR people did it to me and never came back. She answers with an OH and says she'll bring me a towel...NEVER HAPPENED! I eventually got dry by the end of the night, no help from them.

Oh the food...since it's Italian and I guess okay priced since it's a chain, it's good to fill up fast and bulk up on carbs.
author: Kimberly S.

description: Why I'm doing a review for them, I don't know. I guess I'm bored but that's where I went out tonight for my mom's birthday dinner. First, they got our orders all mixed up with another table. In the end, everyone ended with what they ordered but with a lot of clarification. I'm big on competent customer service. I had to cancel two orders because the waitress did not explain to my stepdaughter that the chicken cesear salad was different from the included soup or salad option portion of her entree. Then they forgot the stuffed mushrooms for appetizer. By the time we remembered we ordered it, we were practically full from our dinner. The food was alright. The only thing that I really liked was bruschetta but I could make it at home.
author: Sharon B.

description: I decided to have lunch here today because I felt like having salad.  Well, I ordered soup and salad with mussels for appetizer.  I am not sure if it was after the salad, or the mussels that my stomach felt very queasy.  the server, who was very sweet and attentive did check-in a few times to see how everything was, but wanting to be "nice", I said everything was alright.  It wasn't until we were done, that I felt very sick and had to go to the restroom.  My nausea continued till I got home.  I decided to leave my "brown bag" in the restaurant since something in there must have made me very sick.  The food didn't taste great + it made me sick,, but the server was great, thus 2 stars!
author: Marivic T.

description: I've come here several times with my boyfriend's family on different occasions. The wait time during dinnertime was crazy every time we've been there so we try to arrive before the crowd. The service is good. The quality of the food has been on and off so I don't quite know what my food will be like the next time I visit.
author: Judy Z.

description: My wife and I love to eat here especially for the chicken alfredo. But! we ate there this past Sunday and the chicken alfredo was very dry! We hope this was just a one time bad day. Hope this review helps.
author: Robert F.

description: Having been to the olive garden about three times, I can accurately say in 3 phrases that sums up this place: unlimited breadsticks and soup, crowded, and waiting time. Their breadsticks are the best ive ever eaten, while their 4 daily soups are standard but a tad salty. Their dishes are fairly sized and a tad overpriced, and somewhat tasty, but I have to say Ive never gotten full without eating at least 2 bowls of soup and breadsticks. They have a decent variety of Italian cuisine and wine but the main problem is how crowded this place gets. If you get here during dinner time rush hour, your party will be stuck in waiting for your table traffic for at least 45 minutes. They do give you these remote alarm things so you can explore stonestown mall while you wait but still nobody likes to wait. I would recommend this place as long as you come early.
author: Robert Y.

description:
There is always a wait.

What bullshit.

The food here is good and I always leave satisfied. So why isn't it worth waiting an hour and a half at prime time or otherwise half an hour? I could just go shop around to kill time. I do love that.

This is the question I ponder as I type this review.

And I just cannot condone it. It is just not worth waiting more than half an hour for Garlic Chicken Parmesan and bread sticks. It is some intangible element. Maybe someone could send me a PM who has figured out why it's not worth it. I think it has something to do with the mass produced chain restaurant feel.
author: Joe Z.

description: Upon arrival we had a short wait which was nice, and were greeted by an energetic waiter. We order an appetizer and drinks and then continued to look at the menu. We finally decided what we wanted and ordered, I asked for the unlimited soup and salad, and my boyfriend asked for Steak Gorgonzola-Alfredo. The overall service could have been better. I had to ask twice if we could get another basket of breadsticks and the waiter barely came around so I was only able to ask for a refill on my soup once, even though it was supposed to be unlimited. The waiter constantly refilled my boyfriend's drink without my boyfriend asking, but never asked or looked at mine, which made me have to ask. The quality of the food was little to be desired. My soup tasted pretty good, but its overall look was very unappealing, and the Steak Gorgonzola-Alfredo that my boyfriend ordered looked NOTHING like the picture on the menu. The sauce was clumped on one side, and the four pieces of meat looked like shriveled up hamburger. Not only did his meal look terrible, but it tasted awful as well. It was so bad that he didn't eat but a couple bites and didn't take it to go. What is very distressing is that we spent $18.29 on this Steak Gorgonzola-Alfredo and it was horrible.
author: Samantha S.

description:
Great for filling that casual dining guilty pleasure!  However, be sure not to make it a habit.

Highlights
+ Lunch prices (chicken parm is good, not great)
+ Unlimited breadsticks, soup/ salad- need I say more!
+ Minestrone soup for being surprisingly healthy
+ Lunch til 4 lets you kill two meals at once
+ Yum, yum garlic breadsticks
+ Option for multigrain pasta (although it wasn't that good- maybe a bit undercooked)
+ I STILL love the gratis chocolate mint.  I wish I could buy them!


Drawbacks
- Took me 10 minutes to get seated in a restaurant where I could count 10 empty tables!
- RIDICULOUS AMOUNT OF SODIUM.  I looked at nutrition info after, but between 2 soups, a few breadsticks and chicken parm (lunch portion!) I had 5000mg of sodium, 250% the recommended amount.   If you have sodium issues or high blood pressure, I would be very cautious here!
- Chicken/gnocchi soup wasn't great
- One of the other waitresses was hawking their wines, so decided to offer a complimentary sample of a MOSCATO pre-meal.  She said it was a sweet white, but apparently didn't get the memo that moscatos should only be consumed after the meal.  I think that anyone that cared about this wouldn't find themselves in olive garden anyway :-)


Overall:  Not fine dining, but a great occasional indulgence.
author: Jeff A.

description:
Okay, I admit I am a HUGE fan of Olive Garden.  It's consistently delicious! I always tell myself to try something new but I always go to my staple choices here.  A delightful delicious dish is the RAVIOLI de PORTABELLO. No I'm not a vegetarian, I am a carnivore, but this dish is so filling and tasty!  Don't knock it because of it's lack of meat.  
I only tried this one years ago, because my mom ordered it.  I tried her plate and was hooked ever since.  I don't even remember what I used to get before I tried this dish.
Besides you get so full off of soup and breadsticks, I try to skip appetizers, otherwise I'll never make it to my entree! 
My soup is always the same, ZUPPA TOSCANA, absolutely delicious slightly spicy Italian sausage, tender Kale, and little tiny soft chunks of potato.  It's absolutely the perfect soup, and yes I always get seconds! yes you can get unlimited soup.  They rarely offer seconds, but go ahead and ask and they're always nice about it.   
Breadsticks are perfectly buttered and with a hint of garlic.  But I cannot completely enjoy it without ALFREDO dipping sauce, then and only then am I in breadstick heaven.  
Yes I know food chain restaurants are frowned upon, but I don't care, Olive Garden has absolutely delicious Italian food.
author: Kim L.

description:
Food : 4 stars (for the price you pay, it's pretty good)
Service : 4 stars (Great service after being seated, but prepare to wait 30mins to 2 hrs to get in for dinner because they're always so busy)

If you have much free time on your hands to shop around in Stonestown mall while waiting, then this might be a good place to go for cheap (with all the breadsticks, salad, and soup refills) but fairly good italian food.

Dishes to try : zuppa toscana, seafood pasta, venetian apricot chicken, etc.
author: D Y.

description: I have been coming to this place many time with friends and family throughout the years and I still like it. I love their cocktails and my favorite are the peach daiquiri and the Tuscan sunset. I'm also I huge fan of their bread and salad. I do enjoy most of their dishes and every time I go there, I have great time. I do recommend this place to everyone and it is a great place to bring kids!!
author: Diana P.

description: I love Olive Garden and I love this one especially because it is in San Francisco.  They are always packed with people and there is usually a wait.  There is a wait because their food is good and the price is right, especially for San Francisco.  This is a reasonably priced restaurant (yes its a chain, so what) with good food for the price.  The service is very good here too at this location at Stonestown.  I really like that all you can eat salad and warm breadsticks that come with each meal.  I give them five stars because for the price they charge, their quality is worth five stars.  I don't feel ripped off when I eat here unlike many other places in this city.   I only wish they would build more of these so this one would not be so crowded.  I have never had a bad meal here, ever.
author: Jeff W.

description: I work nearby and Love to go here for soup,salad,and breadsticks! Cant beat that!
author: Christina O.

description:
My friend received calls and letters (which were sent by overnight UPS, I'm told) from the Director of Operations and the General Manager of Olive Garden apologizing for the event. In addition we have received $150 total in Olive Garden giftcards.

We are very satisfied with the response, especially the apology we were expecting, from the superiors of the manager we had problems with.
author: Vivian W.

description:
Located convenietely by the Stonestown mall, so the parking is there..

The food is pretty good...I never been to a place where they served me food like that...the salad, people askin to put cheese and stuff on my food for me...felt weird

Best part about the place....THE CHAIRS HAD WHEELS...I so wanted to race my friend across the room, but I hear they frown on that kinda thing
author: Mike V.

description:
Had my worst dining experience in years at this Olive Garden last night.  -We were told a 30 minute wait, and waited 90.
We watched as several tables remained open while dozens of people waited.  I guess they were short of staff for bussing tables.  We saw some tables sit dirty for nearly 20 minutes.
Wait staff were not that friendly, slow, and made a few mistakes.  I was never offered a refill for my diet coke, and they never brought enough water for our table.
I got a dish- the capellini pomodoro, that I enjoyed 2 weeks before, but this time it came out with a very different taste from before.  I guess there is not much consistency in the kitchen.
We won't be going back to this location, as it just seem all in all poorly managed and organized, causing everyone to wait longer and the food quality to be subpar.  I suggest the Gold Mirror on Taraval for a great Italian dining experience!
author: Michelle R.

description:
People!  It is just Olive Garden... come on... don't hate so much... don't tell me you went in thinking it was going to be a trip back to Italy... of course not... it is a chain and as such... you need to rate it as such.  Not in comparison to a fine authentic Italian Ristorante.  

So, that said... this is a review for the Chain known as Olive Garden.  We all have moments where we just are plain hungry and if you happen to be at the mall... hey, you just might stroll in.  Yes, the wait is ridiculous at times, but they don't hold a gun to you to stay... there is always the other chain across the way. :)

Let's see... the one thing you will find at this place is that since everything is pretty much done cookie cut... you will pretty much always get the same thing... it is consistent... unless someone dropped a salt shaker in the pot or something.  

What do I like getting here... well, I am a simple gal... and one dish I enjoy here is the capellini pomodoro... simple angel hair pasta with lots of tomatoes.... can't go wrong with that... on a good day I will order chicken with it... they charge you a little extra... but no biggie.  then there are those bread sticks that are made with some crack on top because I am telling ya... you have one... and next thing you know... you had about 4!  Yeah... I am pretty sure it is some form of crack... then you have the salad... I like their dressing... a little on the salty end... so, I can't have too much before I feel like I need to swallow a gallon of water, but that is ok... I have plenty of refills on my ice tea... which I do not sweeten... I never do... their tea is pretty good... doesn't have the over brewed flavor that some other places tend to have.  So, again... I do not complain.  

And after shopping all day... I will actually contemplate ordering an appetizer.  You ca never go wrong with the stuffed mushrooms... hey... they are cheesy!  And also... they have a Mozzarella Fondue of sorts with bread... yummy... cheesy, cheesy!  

So... that is about it... this place is what it is... and for the amount of food my friends and I manage to eat and take in to-go containers... it is not a bad deal... 

So, if you are looking for a romantic Italian Restaurant to propose to someone at... of course this in NOT the place... but if for some reason you think it is... hey... nothing wrong with that... you do your thing... remember... at the Olive Garden... we are all Famiglia!

Minus 1 star is for the service.... very hit or miss... you can be left out there in the cold for quite some time... bring your own bottled water to save you from getting the Heimlick Maneuver done while eating your food with my drink to wash it down... hey... you never know... you might save someones life!
author: Amelia M.

description:
greaaat service
Nice location, friendly waiters.
But it is better when they accept reservation.
When  my sister birthday, we couldn't eat there because the waiting time is over an hour. And it is already pass 8 o'clock.
But great service
author: fenny g.

description:
I am sorry to say but this place is a total disappointment. They are shady as hell with the portions. My dude had the Chicken Parmigiana and he was supposed to get two pieces of chicken, it wasn't the first time we've gotten it and it's supposed to come with two pieces. Two, not one. Rip off. I've had three separate bad experiences at this establishment. I swear the first time it was the chicken piece gone M.I.A. the second was during their never ending pasta bowl. There was nothing never endind about that. They trick you with givin you the first bowl in a HUGE plate then totally downsizing on the next time around. We wanted to try all the combination and our waitress didn't seem too happy with that. The meatballs we added came as followed, 3 on the first serving, 2 on the second and I believe half on the third. The last time we went we had the two appetizer which consisted of the stuffed mushroom and the pork stuffed ravioli. The ravioli was super hard lol hella over fried. Frozen taste to me. The mushrooms were fine I give you that, but definitely a little on the greasy side. And dudes chicken Alfredo was like kid sized hahahaha it sucked for him but luckily I never finish all my meal since I fill up on bread which this time was only like brought out once! What the hell happened to the unlimited soup and salad, WTF, I know it;s a fucking recession but fuck you aint gotta be so cheap! Blargh.the food wasn't the business I regretted going back a third time and our waiter the last time actually stopped me in the middle of my order to go talk to an annoying random dude who was behind a glass window next to us waving at him! I swear idk what up with people nowadays.. when a bitch is hungry you gotta get me my shit. Gracias.
The Mexicans
author: Julie N.

description:
Olive Garden - when you're here, you're family.

40-minute wait on a Monday night for a party of four.  No problem, we can pop over to Chevy's next door for happy hour first.

Chilled prosecco with sliced strawberries: nice touch!  Complimentary wine tasting before that, but it was watered down wine?!  That's kind of gross.

I LOVE the unlimited breadsticks and salad.  More so the salad, that could have kept on coming if we weren't too busy being obnoxious.

Stuffed mushrooms (six per order) were delicious.

Shoutout to Yumi - you rock!  Service with a smile is a definite plus.
author: Jenny L.

description:
Party of six for dinner.  We waited approx. 50 minutes.  Okay, I know, who waits that long for chain grub.  We don't go here often (my 3rd time ever).  But we were treated and I figured I would order safely and not all Indiana Jones.

The cool part about waiting is that you get a vibrator, er, pager that vibrates.  You can take it with you to Border's across the street while you wait.  Time was well spent as I perused through Skin Art and other flesh bearing mags.

The srever was prompt to greet us.  He brought our drinks came rather quickly.  He was attentive all night and he gets 5 stars.  The salad is probably the most popular feature.  It is crispy with a  robust dressing.  I had two and a half servings.
