My entree was the braised beef & tortelloni.  Tortelloni's are a bigger tortellini.  It consists of sliced short ribs & portobello shrooms.  The tortelloni's are filled w/asiago.  Yes, its heavy but it was damn good.  I was in shock that I found a dish that would make me want to come back again & again.

Never thought I'd rate OG so high.  Bonus for treating the kiddies well, too.  Although the wait was spent flippin' pages next door it is still brutally long.  Minus a star for that.  Otherwise, my experience was a success.
author: Pete M.

description:
What can I say? I'm a sucker for pasta and there's something about the Olive Garden that brings out the midwestern PWT side of me. The BF always thinks I'm joking when I suggest eating here, but no, I don't joke about pasta. Somehow I manage to be super picky about upscale restaurants but still manage to forgive a multitude of sins when it comes to crappy chain restaurants. Oh well, such is the duality of life...

The only dishes I ever order here are the chicken alfredo or the garlic herb chicken con broccoli. Does anyone else think it's retarded that the only "Italian" word in that is "con", why not just say with? I guess it ups the authenticity, no? 

I also think it's hilarious that they, on occasion, serve complimentary wine samples. Especially since all the wine here is TERRIBLE. It's all so sweet and syrupy *disgusted shudder*. Of course I always take advantage of the free wine, since I'm a wino, but I don't enjoy it.

There isn't really anything else I can say that hasn't been said...Avoid the breadsticks (not tasty and supposedly 140 calories apiece!) get your salad tossin' on and save half your entree for later.
author: Melanie V.

description:
salad was awesome...it was so fresh and crunchy..yummmm....

and the entrees were delicious too. However quantity was smaller for the price.
author: rue s.

description:
Served my bf and me wine once even though we're strictly under 18. Servers are nice but since they have so many customers to take care of, service can be a little lacky sometimes. I like their salad. Tiramisu, I had better elsewhere. The chocolate fudge, just like brownies. Free breadsticks and salad refill is probably the only thing worth it, not cause I'm Asian, but cause their food ain't worth the money we pay. But honestly, since this place is close, I'll come here maybe to celebrate tiny anniversaries or parties. 


The first time was coming here with my bestfriend though, and the service was horrible, sadly.
author: Vivian L.

description:
Olive Garden.. YUM.. each time my girlfriend and i plan to go eat here, we get really excited! The reason why is because.. well they have UNLIMITED BREADSTICKS, which is FREE =) anything free is good for me. The only bad part about olive garden is all the trouble of parking and waiting to get seated. Because its next to stonestown, you'll be compteting with shoppers for parking spots. Also, because of its popularity, the wait is usually about 50 mins long on a busy night.

Other than that, the food is off the heezy my neezy! Me and my girlfriend always get the same dish because it never gets old to us and we're too scared to spend money on something else and possibly not like it! I dont remember exactly what its called, but the chicken con brocoli is really good. The salad is good because the dressings not too heavy and it fills you pretty good. The zuppa toscana is really good and the free breadsticks compliment it very well. 

By the time the entre arrives, we barely have room in our stomachs to finish half of it! But we dont mind brining it home to eat later on. Any place that can fill our stomachs really good BEFORE we get our appetizing entrees is a good place to us. Olive Garden deserves 5 stars! 

We dont recoomend getting orange juice because it does not come with ice, the peach ice tea is really good though - aimFee
author: AimFee G.

description: Yeah....I would have never even came here but my parents are old and visiting from Seattle. For some reason, my elderly mother has a thing for some stuffed chicken Marsala. We went here reluctantly.....it was lunch on a Friday and they were completely under staffed. We waited a ridiculous about of time to get a table. OVER 30 minutes. My mother, who is extremely ill was forced to stand the entire time were were ignored at the front desk. Service was so slow, I would have walked out on any other occasion. The food was bland and tasteless. I forced my date not to even finish his so I could just take it home and season it. The grossest meal I have had in a long time. You will have to kill me before I go back to this dump.
author: Jena D.

description:
Ahhhhh, how I miss home! I remember when Mom made her famous pasta; it was overcooked and the sauce was pretty tasteless, but we were together, a family. Remember when the plastic breadbasket stuffed with Pillsbury breadsticks? Remember the wine she'd bring to the table, you know, the one that was a step away from boxed wine?

Dust off those memories and come on down to Olive Garden. You'll feel like a moron waiting for the Celeste Pizza, Hamburger Helper Italian style, and Kraft macaroni, but you didn't have to heat it up, and you're out of the house! SUPER BONUS... you get Andes mints after lunch/dinner with your check! Mom didn't do that!

Hospitaliano! When you're there, YOU ARE FAMILY! YAY!
author: Fawn L.

description: Had the salad and new asiago ravioli and chicken.  Wasn't really expecting a lot because it is Olive Garden, after all, but I was impressed by the chicken.  I think they used breast tenders so it was really, well, tender, not tough like breast meat can be.  It was seasoned just right, too.  A little pricey for lunch, but I was satisfied.
author: C L.

description: I like Olive Garden but it has gotten really bad lately, I went there on 3 separate occasions with 3 different waiters, all were bad! They didn't refill my drinks and got annoyed that I asked for the grated cheese to be on the side dish like how my daughter loves it.  One thing is that the food is always consistent.
author: Sheree A.

description: I think people go there because there is lack of competition.  The waiter took 5-10 mins to come over after we were seated and asked  "do we know what you want?". He was in a hurry. Here's the really bad part - we added an extra order of all the shrimp you can eat for $4.35 extra.  It was a terrible deal. The first serving sprinkled on the pasta was not much, some small breaded pieces half an inch. When we asked for a second helping of shrimp since its advertised as all you can eat, we got a one inch tube with four tiny breaded shrimp. It fitted on a tablespoon.  So we asked for more. Along came another four small shrimp another tablespoon. Olive Garden should be embarrassed to do this!!!  Its shameful to call it a serving!  The soup comes in a half filled bowl. They really are scrimping.  It was low quality stuff and plain. BS advertising. Each serving needed a long wait for the waiter to show up and what came along wasn't worth the wait.  This was our dining experience on Saturday evening. Oh and when we asked for tomatoes instead of more salad, we got a few small slices I'd say half a tiny tomato.  We gave the waiter a good tip still because its probably the restaurants fault and not his on serving four shrimps and half a tomatoe as "all you can eat".
author: Jane S.

description: Ugh, this place is the worse. The menu has not much to chose from besides heavy pasta dishes....they are not even truly Italian! There are very few items to choose from on their menu that are grilled. The veggies aren't cooked...they come barely steamed, not even seasoned. I am dragged here by my in-laws who seem to think this place is good. 1. Service is bad 2. Restrooms are dirty 3. Food is bad.....if you have to come here, drink a BUNCH of wine.
author: Nicole F.

description: i love their bread sticks and soup!! if they will ever have just break sticks and soup on their menu i will come here just for those 2 items! I LOVE their minestrone soup, i get this every single time i come here. Their menu changes from time to time with new items for limited time offers. They offer the bottomless pasta from August - October i believe.
author: Jenny G.

description: was at the olivegarden a few week ago and went to sit down for a meal that seen on tv , it said 11.99 take one home when we got there it was not the same as on tv. it was two little items and the otherone were higher at 13.99 and up plus 5.00 for each add on. sad sad want eat there again .
author: Jerry W.

description: Came here yesterday for Father's Day, waited for 1hr 30 mins but worth the wait. All the waiters were very nice and attentive! The food was delicious as always! Definitely coming back!
author: Athena C.

description: I'm one sick puppy and I wanted my soup.  I wanted the unlimited soup, salad and bread sticks! YUM! I know Olive Garden is fast food Italian, but sometimes I just gotta have it.  Also, the hostess and waiter was super nice especially if there were hoards of hungry Christmas shoppers.
author: Amy L.

description:
Tried the never-ending pasta bowl for the first time a few months back. I thought I was going to be in pasta heaven. Wrong. The tomato sauce was so bland - I left full but not satisfied.

What I liked getting here was the Chicken Marsala and farfalle pasta dish with chicken in a lemon butter sauce which they don't have anymore. 

Just wasn't what it used to be.
author: Christine C.

description: More like a 3.5. I've never had Olive Garden before, but wanted to try. I guess I'm addicted to chain restaurants. There was a wait, but the bar was empty. I don't understand why people over 21 are willing to wait when there is open seating at an empty bar (silly booth snobs). Anywho, I did not expect a big salad bowl to be served after I ordered and anyone who knows me knows that I have impulse control. I got full off of the salad, but I'm a trooper and ate half of my pasta, as well. The pasta wasn't bad (don't remember what it is was). If I worked in the area I would probably get lunch there a lot. I won't go out of my way to go there, but I won't oppose...unless something more delicious is offered.
author: Sunie K.

description: I had dinner here (1st time) last night with a friend. We ate at the bar, since there was a 20-25 minute wait for a table. I ordered the Minestrone soup and Seafood Brodetto, which is seafood stew. It was a great meal! I had an easy time deciding what I wanted, because each item had listed the calories on the menu. I tend to order stuff on the healthy side.  Service was great. Food was delish. I'd come back to try their other items.
author: Annette L.

description: I am learning that the boyfriend and I have terrible luck with chains. He had lipstick on his "clean" wine glass and we waited about 30 minutes for our breadsticks which our waiter swore were just put in the oven. I realy like their Five Cheese Ziti, but we realized we aren't sure their food is worth the prices. I feel like OG will always be a decently safe option but we were very disappointed in our service and experience today.
author: Lauren J.

description:
Hmmmmm...I have to admit that I was a little suspicious going into this one.  I had been seeing their recent commercials advertising their new "Rollatini" dishes.  "OH MY GOD!", I said to my fiance, "They are making up new words now!"  Meanwhile, one of my friends who has just recently had a baby and has been spending lots of time in the house was watching the same commercial and thinking - DELICIOUS!  So, I decided I should meet her and the kids there so that she could try these "Rollatini".  

The service was fine and the food was what I expected, sort of middle of the road - not bad, but not particularly memorable either.  One thing I found kind of odd was the children's menu.  They have given all of the food names and characters - Bene Breadstick, Ricky Ravioli, etc.  So after her older kid orders, we are presented with a basket of well, Bene Breadsticks.  So, I say to her - "Would you like to eat Bene the Breadstick now that you have read about his travels?"  Luckily, she's smart and right on the border of getting the adult menu, so she got the joke.  I'm just imagining some other poor kid going - "Nooooooo Mom!  You can't eat Bene!"
author: Squirrel L.

description:
Fond memories.  I met this gorgeous enterpreneur (or enterpreness?) and once had dinner at the Hayward location where she first had me try, of all things, creme brulee.  Yes, Hayward OG used to serve creme brulee!!!

Back to Stonestown:  decent score for their new "New" Braised Beef & Tortelloni.  Not too heavy on the sauce, tender beef slices, delicious but not enough portobello mushrooms.  Zuppa Toscana for starter is always good.  Experiencing these other Italian restuarants did make me look past any Olive Garden for some few years now, but this, at least in Stonestown with their new tortelloni is still a safe choice.  I'm sure it's always packed here, which is why walking in past 1:00 pm is pretty smart...not too crowded.  I say "why not?"
author: Erick ..

description:
Food: Not bad. I love getting the chicken parmigiana here, it is a little salty but overall it always satisfies my appetite. Also the pasta E Fagioli soup is pretty good. Also the bread sticks and salad never gets old! Not my first choice for an Italian restaurant but not my last.

Price: Not bad. You get a lot of food for your meal.

Service: Okay, usually pretty prompt when I have gone.

Location: Located at Stonestown mall. Parking available in the lot, underground, or in the Nordstrom lot. 

Atmosphere: Nice, big restaurant and plenty of places to dine. Does get crowded though!
author: Miss H K.

description:
I love the Zuppa Toscana, but everything else about this particular location makes me want to barf.

I won't even talk about the food .... um, yeah.

Here's a typical experience for ya to consider.  I walk into this place, and I give them my name to get a table for 2.  I'm told there's a 45 minute wait, and I'm given the light-up coaster device.  45 minutes is a bit of time to sit in the waiting area with the various rug rats and their ugly parents.  So, my friend and I wandered over to the Borders Books.

Some time passes by, and the coaster starts lighting up.  I gather my friend, and we start walking over to Olive Garden.  Suddenly, my coaster stop lighting up when I walk in the door.  When I take it over to the host folks, they look at it and ask if I was sure it was lit up.  Uhhh.... yeah.   They say "It'll be about 5 minutes."  15 minutes later and several other groups of 2 people getting seated later, we finally were seated.  What the heck is up with flipping my coaster lights on and then dissing me for a bunch of other folks who apparently submitted their name later?

So .... yeah .... if you have to ask, don't bother coming here.  I'll be making my own Zuppa Toscana from  now on.
author: Jamie W.

description:
Endless breadsticks, por favor!

Other than that, Olive Garden's stuff is just too creamy for me. Every time I order their pasta I always ask for "light sauce." I mean, really, is it necessary to drown my pasta? No, not really. But, the minestrone soup is good & the italian sodas refreshing. 

In all honesty, I just come here looking forward to their breadsticks.
author: Steph W.

description:
My Review is of the Customers of the Olive Garden
 
It is amazing to me that you expect so much from someone (anyone) who is serving you. Without even considering that they have one of the hardest jobs that a person can have & yet you are all impossible to please. They have no control over the prices, portion, late food arrival, or items that they are out of and yes, believe it or not they do get busy. God forbid that someone else should bring over your DEMANDED items. It shocks me that some of you who are OBVIOUSLY impossible to please are surprised when a server looses patience with you and gives up. That's because they know you;re not going to tip them enough for the trouble of putting up with you! YOU WOULD DO THE SAME THING!!! Most of these kids are poor college students with MUCH more important things on their mind than making sure YOU are perfectly happy. GIVE THEM A BREAK
author: Kim S.

description: I havent been here in 5.5 years ,its my son's 12 th bday and I wanted to try this place for a change instead of usual elephant bar but damn from checking in  requesting a table for party of 10 this dumb blonde said oh its 45 mins wait ...whoa really oh ok its damn slow thursday 5:30pm, I dont see a packed dinning room ,i asked why 45 mins  wait?? dumb blonde responded in a rude sarcastic manner oh its because u have a bigger party ,,so there are plenty of open tables to accomodate 10 people .Whatever ! so sure we stick around then gaved us a pager and since theres damn 45 mins wait we asked the pager works in the mall so we can kill time in the mall till the tables are ready oh yeah 10 mins inside the mall the stupid pager sound off,WTF ! so hurried back and our damn table is all the way in the secluded room far back ,,I am very irritated already but our server made it up he got our orders and got the our food served fast,Salad is alright,soup is great,garlic bread are dry,fettucine alfredo bland need salt,seafood lasagna overstuffed with riccota cheese,blood orange tea no flavor tasteless,appetizer brusetta taste canned tomatoes too plain not enough basil,calamari no seasonings just like regular fried squid no wow factor,overall I WOULD NEVA EVA EVA COME BACK! this is why I havent been here in 5.5 years,and this it.It was a big mistake to go here as the alternative, should have stick with original plan Buca De Peppo or Elephant Bar,NOT WORTH GOING AT THIS OLIVE GARDEN! Food dont wow me at all,service stinks,I wont be surprise if they end up like Chevys next door out of business,...
author: Nina B.

description:
I love it when people review this place and complain that it's not real Italian cuisine.  Brilliant observation, Einsteins.  That's like saying Taco Bell lacks a certain Mexican authenticity.  Olive Garden is what it is...very Americanized Italian food - and it actually does this pretty well for a chain restaurant.

The wait at this particular location can be unbearable, though.  If you plan to come for dinner on the weekend, better make it a very early one unless you want to wait up to 90 minutes for a table.  The bartenders are very good here, though, and they can make the wait much more tolerable.

Let the haters hate on this place as much as they want.  I've never left here feeling unsatisfied.  Just show up, plan to wait, and enjoy a consistently decent meal.
author: Steve C.

description:
I like to eat at this place with friends, sharing dishes.  The wait is a little long, but it's located at a mall, so you can walk around.
Their dishes are okay, not good, but edible. I like their appetizers, salad, and dessert.  The triple black tie mousse is delicious.  Me and my friends always get that.
Go there for the appetizers, salad, and the black tie.
author: Chatree T.

description:
I love Olive Garden!!! This is one of my favorite place!!!!!!!

Waiters and waitresses are nice and very helpful. I have been going here since I attended SFSU and I got my friends liking this place too. The food is quite a bit expensive but I still like them. I love their Fried Calamari!!!

I can't give it a 5 star just because they don't take reservations and the wait is way too long during the weekend. I still like this place
author: Jen T.

description:
All i can say, you go with the bread sticks, salad, and soup, then your good to go, but Olive Garden has a lot of faults yet a lot of good aspects.

Service: Geez, its too hectic to rate the service. Every time i go, it changes. Sometimes its good, sometimes its decent, and a lot of the time it is an utter failure w/ service. But hey, the important part is they get the food out decently fast and the waiters are not usually annoying.

Food: Also pretty hectic to rate. The only almost constant aspect of Olive Garden when u go there is their soup, salad, and bread sticks. Its always fresh and delicious. The entrees, however, are a different story.  Most of the time they are pretty good, on rare occasions they are great, but god, when its a bad day, its so bad u want to just leave and not pay. Highly recommended u go to lunch and get all u can eat bread, soup, and salad.

Truth be told, Olive Garden needs to become more consistent w/ their presentation of food, service, and quality of their food that isn't bread sticks, salad,  and soup. If i was to rate those 3 choices, they'd get a 3.5, but in the end run, i'd recommend Olive Garden for lunch and when u feel like taking a risk to have good food yet 16.792% chance of having bad food.
author: Dylan T.

description:
This place is somewhat inconsistent. The prices suck for the portions. I'm not sure if the chefs really taste what they're sending out. Even though every experience has been a mixture of good and bad ones, I've still consistently been going here for the past several years out of convenience. At times my food is pretty decent, and at other times it's down right disgusting. When I went there with my brother last Wednesday, I ordered the parmesan crusted talapia which was pretty decent; my main complaint would be that the amount of angel hair pasta they gave me was a joke. My brother ordered a tortellini dish with steak and boy were the tortellinis in the dish horrible. They were overly salty and bleeeeh. The soups and breadsticks are consistently good. I wouldn't really reccomend this place for it's entrees though. 

Oh yeah, HORRIBLE wait times.
author: Julie L.

description:
1 star for food
2 stars for service

My boyfriend and I got to chain restaurants every once in awhile because he's from the Midwest and they're nostalgic for him.  So we hit up the Olive Garden by Stonestown awhile back.  

Honestly I'm not going to comment on the food.  Its not worth my energy.  The service was above and beyond what I would expect at an Olive Garden.  We walk in and there's a 20 minute wait, no biggie.  I would've waited for 20 minutes regardless.  However, there was a little platter of breadsticks and smoothies waiting for us.  Such a nice touch.  The staff at the hostess table were really friendly  

Our waiter had a glass of wine waiting for us when we got to the table.  Granted the wine was nasty and he prob just wanted to sell us more stuff, it was a nice touch.  He gave us opinions of the menu and suggestions of what to order.  And they weren't even the highest price items.  He offered friendly conversation and a smile.  

I wish they had better food because I would come back again just for the service.  Maybe next time I'm hung over and want to eat my weight in breadsticks :)
author: Angela S.

description:
I had the Tuscan Garlic Chicken ($15.25) here, and absolutely loved it.  I couldn't get enough.  Actually, I got just enough since I was totally stuffed.  Before the entree, I had the Zuppa Toscana soup, which I would also recommend.  It's got Italian sausage and potatoes in it, kind of a nice kick too.

Service was just fine on a weekday evening, although I did make it there pretty early.  As I left, I saw a large number of folks waiting for tables.  The chairs are on wheels.
author: M C.

description:
Olive Garden has decent Italian food, but definitely not the best. I've ended up here once in a while, especially when my best friend persuades me that we NEED to eat here (every other month). 

I'm always extremely full after a meal here and I don't know if that's a good thing. Their breadsticks are good but better when I dip them into my Zuppa Toscana. Their garden salad is simple and flavorful.

I had high expectations from Olive Garden, but have sinced been lowered everytime my entre comes around. Their main dishes aren't as good as they are hyped up to be. The Tour of Italy is pretty satisfying, but that's about it. 

I plan to bring some diversity to my palate, so I won't be returning any time soon.
author: Winnie L.

description:
Olive Garden? It's more like SMOHLIVE Garden? 

Olive Garden on a Sunday was not a very good FunDay :( 
I usually visit northbeach for my italian cravings but we were ravished..

I ordered  the short ribs (4) with a small piece of portabela mushroom in the center. All on top of flavored rice $18. Even the picture showed 4 small portions of meat. I asked the waitress "DUDE REALLY SMALL pieces" She insisted it was enough and tasted good. I said "YO do i look like an guy who will be satisfied with 4 pieces"? (note question mark after closing quote) She even said its alot and worth it.   Hmmmm   I told her I wasn't into appetizers.  Secretly I was gonna fight her and not eat anyway appetizers just to see if the 4 pieces was enough to satisfy me.   So i said OK lets do it. Ordered the sampler and a soup.  10 minutes later i only I Nibbled on the sampler that had Calamari, Raviloi and stuffed mushrooms.  Sip a few spoonfulls  of chicken ganocci soup.    THIRTY FIVE MINUTES later.  All of the food on the sampler was finished.  I was using the Bread sticks to soak up the leftover soup.  All of a sudden  BANG.. a waiter tipped over a serving cart.  Our waitress comes over and said "im sorry i gave them your order with the appetizers"  In reality (Simon's reality)  they made us wait and get full off of the bread, sampler and soup.   By the time the main meal arrived we already full.. BY, THE, WAY,  The shortribs were soft, moist, juicy and flavorful.  BUT THE SIZE OF an IPOD Shuffle!  Think about it 4 ipod shuffle size... They got me on this one..

its hit n miss with this place..  Marinate the above and Shuffle yourself to a restaurant away from the Mall..

We are all traveling on our own separate rivers...  I will see you at the Beach..

Simon...
author: Simon L.

description: i ordered the seafood Alfredo which is really good but the mussels tasted so damn old! i told the server right away and got it taken off. the tomato bruschetta wasn't that good and the soup i ordered was good. my favorite thing to order frm here is white chocolate rasberry cheesecake, its hella good.
author: Linda A.

description: Zuppa Toscana is too watery, lacking in taste. They removed the Seafood Portofino and replaced it with a lesser dish with less food in it but jacked up the price.  Why are you screwing up the good thing you had before.  Worst than that, you spent too much money on remodeling and it look no better than before.  Why are you messing up?  Another friend went there and was totally dissatisfied also because we all expected you to stay consistent and keep what is good. The bread sticks even, was too salty.  Go figure!  We ain't going back there until you say you have reverted back to your old authentic "Italian" not American manner of cuisine and cooking.  Get it right again pls.
author: Jimmie D.

description: The staff does a great job of putting up with costumers. People who come in to this place and try to take advantage and seeing how much free food they can get should be ashamed of themselves. If you want free food go to a soup kitchen.  Everytime I go into this place I see the servers doing the best they can. People if u want a soup or a salad buy it stop trying to weasel it out of the servers. Nothing is free in life get over.  If you r one of these people I'm talking out about do me a favor and stay home..
author: Trey S.

description: The poorest excuse for Italian food I've ever had. Overpriced, totally flavorless garbage.  None of the flavors and aromas associated with good Italian cooking. Horrible eggplant parmesan. You get better from the frozen food case at Safeway. Horrible, watery spaghetti. Undercooked with watery chopped tomato topping. Horrible fettuccine alfredo. The sludgy sauce is like white glue. Horrible green salad with throat-cutting cider vinegar dressing. No balsamic vinegar. The greens are a Safeway-quality iceberg lettuce salad pack. Don't be taken in by Olive Garden's slkck TV ads and menu graphics. The food is awful. They can't even make a decent plate of pasta.
author: Pam J.

description:
Buona festa, what a joyous day! Hey!
Life's good fortune's sure to go your way...
Go on, sit back and just relax and fill your plate the Italian waaaaaay
We're so glad you came to celebrate with us today. Hey!

Yes, I used to work there. So I know that the waiters are REQUIRED to bring wine to your table and talk to you about it and then offer you a sample. I really hated that part of working there, but when i am a customer i must admit i am disappointed if the lazy waiter doesn't bring the bottle... OF COURSE i want a sample!!!

Anyways, these are things I recommend: salad, marinara or alfredo dip for your bread, minestrone soup, shrimp primavera, tour of italy, chicken marsala, stuffed chicken parmesean(expect 40 minute wait), grill assortment, chocolate almond amore, any of the desserts except the berry thing they microwave and plop hard ice cream on top of.
author: Jessica W.

description:
There are only 2 roads to drive when you enter Olive Garden; otherwise, following other options will leave you heartbroken: do takeout or eat with a group. 

Btw, try Olive Garden needs a branch in Oakland, Alameda and San Leandro! EXPAND, DAMIT!
author: Carl Z.

description:
I really love this place.
When you go there, sit at the bar and get much faster service.
Also, Shelly if THEEE prettiest bartender ever.
author: John W.

description: Always good to me, family favorite. Love soup and salad of course especially for lunch. Went for my birthday most recently and to the waiter it was nothing special, he was so unsocial, clueless, probably should have just washed dishes! Not like it ruined my day, but maybe have something special on birthdays, even had to ask for mints, unbelievable.
author: Stephanie W.

description: I have been to this Olive Garden about 25 in 12 years I live on this side of town.  Now before I start let me tell you I am 1st generation Italian and my grandfather was a great cook spent his cook career on Mulberry Street in Little Italy, NY.  Yes I lived on the East Coast until 13 years ago.  Now knowning all that I have to say this food is good.  My three kids love coming here and they just change the menu and things are very taste.  But what impress me today was we had kids free coupon and we thought they expired tomorrow but they were only good for tomorrow.  The manager said wait let me see what I can do and came back and took the kids meals off.  Then came back again and gave us more coupon.  This is great customer service!  For this I gave them 5 starts.      I had the panni caprese and it was very good.
author: Grace M.

description:
Ok, don't judge me, but I love this place.  Service is always good, food is hot and fresh and for the most part tasty, and it is super-kid-friendly.  The wait, not so bad when you send the wife into the mall.  :)   Seriously though, get here before 5 or you'll wait an hour+

My only complaint is the make-shift smoking section right outside the entrance door.  I hate hanging out waiting in range of the beeper only to breath smoke!

Bread sticks are buttery, soft and good to dip.  

Kids menu is good too.

All in all it's a great place to fill up after a little shopping.
author: LeftCoast Y.

description:
Olive Garden is the shit when you want carbs, guaranteed...It is descent food and a sorta expensive price, but I have to admit I do leave satisfied...Stuffed Chicken Marsala is always safe and good, salad dressing is superb, and the bread sticks...well...can't really ever go wrong with the bread sticks...

Wait Staff is definitely cool peeps...Since you most likely have to wait, and you sit down to finally eat, and then bam!...something in your food is not right...Just ask for what you like and you shall receive...They are pretty much on top of it....
author: Stephanie O.

description: STAY AWAY.. i mean it STAY FAR FAR AWAY....me n my friend was craving for  italian food.. and we came here.. big mistake.... the wait was an HOUR.. for TWO people.. hmm wells the guy that seated us was sweet.. our server was horrible.. we order our drink and order... she gave us 3 bread stick for two people... so are we suppose to like get one each and spilt the third one.. ehhh... the salad had too much dressing.... soo our food came out and i had order da eggplant .... and it was nicey n oily.. yuck... ugh... our server came around mayb once? or twice to refil our drinks and she put the wrong drink in my friend drink.. hmmmmmmmm overall i went home wit a tummy ache.. and left a 3 dollar tip.. GET BETTER SERVERS!!!.. food was icky ..=/ stay away...
author: jeannette L.

description:
really i give it four stars.

for the reason that....their food is GOOD.  

all you can eat salad or soup...do the soup.  especially the pasta e fagioli soup.  i could eat that for lunch dinner and the same thing the next day.

the pastas are all good of course but i prefer getting a mixture of things so if you need to have a variety you might not be disappointed if you get one of the tours.  you'll know what i'm talking about when you go in.

best time to go really is early lunch.  you have to beat the crowd to enjoy eating here.  another thing about when to go.  when they have their unlimited pasta/sauce dishes.  that way heavy eaters can really enjoy the pasta and soup all they can eat.

now about going before the crowd goes.

olive garden has a sad sad policy.  they do not allow a waiter or waitress to have more than 4 or 5 tables.  so if a group likes to sit and talk and sit and talk more after eating the table isn't rushed along and you have to wait and wait until you get a seat.  the other thing is they also are first hirers....what i mean is olive garden will hire BRAND NEW waiters or waitresses.  if you have NO EXPERIENCE then this is a good place to start...well, not really.  with only 4 or 5 tables per person you can't get them in and out enough or fast enough to get ANY TIPS.  So sadly your service suffers here and there.

if you go for the food its great.  if you hate slow or mediocre service then this drops a star.  the people try and are great...they just aren't in hotel and restaurant management.
author: Bing D.

description:
I had an early dinner at the Olive Garden Sunday, March 6.  The service was great, our waitress very attentive and - I have to say - the wait staff there looks like they were hired by a Disney Channel casting director, all very attractive, but not much diversity!  In fact, their parent company seems to have a blemished history when it comes to human rights issues and anti-discrimination, but my cousin loves their salads and desserts, so I didn't make an issue of it.  

I ordered the special they are advertising on TV and here on Yelp (the gorgonzola and pear ravioli with shrimp drizzled with a sweet balsamic sauce) which was good -but a bit on the sweet side (I should have known) and the shrimp were smaller than what's seen in adverts.  I'm paying the price today for such a rich meal - tummy trouble due to over-indulgence and high calorie intake...  The crowd waiting to be seated as we left was incredible, clearly this place is popular - if you don't like waiting for a table, get there before 6pm on a Sunday.
author: Joe B.

description: To me the Olive garden is just a glorified italian Denny's... and just like dennys there are certain menu items that keep me coming back for more.  The zuppa toscana soup is the MAIN reason I keep coming back, in fact if they ever took it off the menu I probably would never return.  The salad and bread sticks are always good and there is almost always something edible on the menu (i usually get something of their special menu) but I will always miss the CHICKEN VINO BIANCO which was removed from the menu years ago (I would go more often if this came back).
author: Evan O.

description:
Let me start off by saying, I'm Olive Garden's biggest fan!! If I could, I'd have OG cater our wedding!! Everyone knows I'm such a fanatic, I even thought of getting their logo tatted on me, AHAHAA!! Anyways, with that being said you know I go in with high expectations of consistant yummy food and that I don't even look at the menu because I know exactly what I want and how I want it (I'm very particular about my food). I came here with my Fiancee for a special occasion and we recieved great service from Gloria (who has a great accent by the way)!! Man, even though we asked for a bazillion things to go with our food i.e. chilli pepper flakes, extra marana on the side, extra tartar sauce on the side, and lots of refills on the soup!! Through it all, Gloria happily got it for us!! We ever felt "bad" or "ashamed" when asking for all the extras. She seriously nailed everything and really made our night go smooth. 

Thanks Gloria, who ever hired you, and the Olive Garden. You guys always make my visits PERFECT!!
author: Missie R.

description:
Love italian food.. i try something different here every time. and olive garden never ceases to impress me with the taste.. i have never had any food taste bad here! the only problem is that its a long wait for a table!!!! other than that.. food=good... you are stuffed because of the  bread sticks they keep feeding you.... the food is also reasonably price.. which is what every girl loves! especially when she rather go SHOPPING!!!

-x3 shells
author: Lily X.

description: Service was great.  Our waiter was very attentive.  Food was ehhh a bit pricy for the small amount of food you get and the taste, hmm i think i can make better.  wait not "i think" i can make better!  The best part of the meal was definitely the salad.  The most annoying thing about this place in my opinion was the beat down atmosphere.  i felt like i was at denny's.  our table was a mess because it wasnt stabilized.  the minute he rested his arms on the table, my glass of water nearly spilled.  i gave 2 stars only mainly because it was mediocre.  the service i would give 5 stars.  but i wouldnt come back here.  i've made it clear to him, i would not like to eat here again.  he was fooled by the commercial.  YOU shouldnt be fooled too!!!!
author: Mimi S.

description: One of the best Olive Gardens I have ever been to. Its always a wait that is well worth it. Service is good food is great and we go there often
author: Niecy H.

description: I have to admit our service at this place was one of the best experienced.  Our waiter (Kevin V) did an excellent job making sure everything was perfect when I brought my parents there for an early dinner.  I love how the menus keep changing and the food was excellent.  All in all the experience was great.
author: Brian C.

description: Our server was great and he was very personable.  My complaint is with the wait; not that it was long which was to be expected during lunchtime but the fact that they kept on giving us the wrong estimated time.  If we had known that 20 minutes meant 45 and that 5 min meant 20, then we would have gone to the food court instead.  They would have lost us as a customer for that day but not for life; with them stringing us along, they have lost us as a customer for life.
author: T S.

description:
We've definitely had better tasting Italian food, with better prices and bigger portions!!
We had the Shrimp Primavera, Seafood Alfredo and Minestrone soup. Portions were so measly that we thought.. WTF, what did we just order?!?!??!!?!?! Plus it tastes bland.. 
Seriously not worth the price. The breadsticks were pretty nice, though we won't come back to Olive Garden just to have it...
author: Roland R.

description: I fell in love with Italian food because of olive garden. They have the best zuppa tuscana and breadsticks With the delicious chicken fettuccine Alfredo and peach-raspberry ice tea. We recently decided to order the sampler for the stuffed mushrooms and the calamari. Also the lasagna fritta is awesome.
author: Shirley Z.

description: I've recently been coming back to Olive Garden for their soups and salads. Their Zuppa Toscana soup is delicious! I've also noticed they have alot of new additions to their menu, which I must say aren't too bad. Even though it's a typical boring chain, it's a place to grab a quick no-fuss bite.
author: Vivian D.

description: Tonight was my first time here. The wait was about an hour but I had friends to keep me company and we went to the mall so the wait wasn't a big issue. Our server, Joshua, was incredible! One of the best servers I've encountered. I ordered off the 3 course for $12.95 menu. I got the chicken gnochi soup, chicken mozarella penne, and strawberry cake dessert. The soup was really good and went well with the complimentary breadsticks. Joshua informed us that there was unlimited soup and we could try other soups or salad off the $12.95 menu too but I passed because I wanted to save my stomach for the entree. The entree was far from the picture and I thought the portion was small. I ended up having to almost force the food down. I thought the entree was too condensed and tasted a little too fattening. The dessert was comical because it was so tiny. I didn't really care for the dessert because I was already pretty full but I wanted something sweet to end the night. All in all, a great night. Incredible service from Joshua but the food was 3 stars. I gave an extra star because of the great service. One more thing that was very convenient was that Joshua offered to give us separate bills so it wouldn't be a hassle when it was time to pay. That was very helpful!
author: Vivian L.

description:
The few times before my most recent visit to this Olive Garden weren't too bad. But this last time I went with my roommate it was just a big disappointment. We went in the afternoon this past Tuesday, and got Adam as our waiter after waiting for him to show up to our table for 10 minutes. Once he did show up, he informed us that they were out of Peach Bellini Iced Tea, which was a bummer since that's one of the things we go for! I mean come on, isn't is one of their primary iced teas? Oh well on that, can't complain too much.
What I can complain about is the rest of our service. We each ordered the unlimited soup and salad lunch special. We've gone for this a few times before and didn't really have a problem. But this time it was bad, and it wasn't just the food.
We each got the Zuppa Toscana soup first. Our salad and breadsticks came to us about ten minutes later, and about 15 MINUTES AFTER that, our soup FINALLY arrived. Our salad bowl was empty by this time, and Adam didn't even offer to get us another refill of it (um, hello, unlimited salad where???). The soup was obviously the bottom of the bowl stuff. There were just tiny bits of potato in the soup, about one tiny thing of greens, and little to no sausage. I felt like I was eating salty, semi-chunky water. After we finished those soups we had to wait for about another ten minutes before we saw our waiter again, who came up to us with the look of "so, are you done, or what?" Rude. So without being asked "if we would like anything else", we each ordered the Chicken Gnocchi soup.  Ten minutes later our soup shows up. Right when he placed it in front of me I was relieved because it seemed to be nice and freshly hot. Boy was I wrong about the fresh part. The last few times I've gotten this soup there is plenty of Gnocchi and very good chicken in it. This time, I move my spoon around, and had ONE Gnocchi. My roommate looked at me and I could tell hers wasn't the best either...she didn't have ANY Gnocchi in hers. Even worse, the chicken was so gooey and mushy it dissolved in your mouth like an overcooked potato. We thought about saying something, but figured by the time we even saw our waiter again, and got another fresh thing of soup that WASN'T from the very bottom of the barrel, we'd miss our next class which didn't even start for 45 minutes. 
When Adam showed up again, he didn't ask how anything was or if we would like anything else; just gave us our check...with broken Andes Mints :( 
I have thought about calling them and letting them know I wasn't happy with my service. Maybe Adam was having a bad day, or maybe he's always like this, and that needs to change.
I will go back, but be sure to request that I don't have Adam, and hope I get some good Gnocchi soup next time.
author: Kelsey A.

description: i LOVE it when Olive Garden offers that all you can eat pasta deal!! Their salad is just amazing along with their customer service! Great job to Olive Garden located at the Stonestown mall!
author: Kristen F.

description: soup and salad is my favorite.  friendly staff.  but was a little upset with our waiter.  we had asked for bread sticks about 6 times and never got any.
author: Aaron L.

description:
Wow. Today was the second time in my life I've ever patronized the Olive Garden. The first time was at this particular location, like today. I was fourteen and it was my first date. I remember telling people where we ate and even in pre-hipster, pre-StuffWhitePeopleLike 1994; people would roll their eyes and scoff at how inauthentic the OG is.  I always kinda suspected that they were just being jaded. I mean, duh, it's a chain. Pasta Pomodoro's a chain and so is Macaroni Grill. I like eating at those places. But this place is is ridiculous. Most overpriced restaurant ever. We wanted something inexpensive, specifically the soup + bread + salad thing, but they don't do that on Sundays apparently. We ended up getting soup and salad anyway and at full price. We should have just gone to the food court for that, I know. I liked the Zuppa Toscana, but it was really salty. The Grilled Chicken Caesar was gross. Iceberg lettuce, I couldn't taste anchovy or garlic. They just dump some supermarket crap dressing from a bottle all over it. And the croutons were stale. 
Oh, and our waiter decided to end his shift mid-meal. We thought he got sick or somebody died. Nope, he just felt like it, according to our new server. Who even does that? And then this new server started griping about her job to us and how he does that all the time, and how "shady" he is, and how shady she's not, etc. Then she starts bitching about the aluminum takeout containers and how small they are, and in Seattle, where she's from they actually have styrofoam. Lots of unsolicited information from that one. At least she was attentive. She also hooked us up with that salty soup. Lots of it. So that one star on my review is for homegirl from Seattle. Also, I think this place is due for a remodel. The interiors are uglier than Sizzler's.  It totally reminds me of a cafeteria in an old people's home. I mean, who the f*ck puts casters on restaurant seats?
author: Jennifer C.

description: Just had another great meal at the Olive Garden.  I had the BEST waiter ever. His name is Joshua and he was absolutely exceptional.  He is friendly, upbeat, and very knowledgeable of the menu. He is an absolute delight and a great asset to the Olive Garden!!
author: Nancy S.

description: I used to love coming to Olive Garden. I loved their complimentary salad, breaksticks and soup. Their menu is a bevy of yummy dishes. However lately for the past few years (granted I haven't been here in about 6 months as of right now), the food quality has gone waayyy down. We went there several times thinking it was a fluke or just a busy night. Nope quality went down, their pasta was more than al dente, it was just bad and inedible. I guess it was raw or something. BLeh. i never send food back, but several times we've had to send the pasta back (once during Never Ending Pasta Bowl and another just regular entree time). How do you mess up pasta?! You're an "italian" restaurant that serves pasta as a staple! That's like Chinese restaurants messing up RICE. Oh man... sucky sucky. And I really want to come back and try their new dishes but after having one too many bad dishes/incidents we might stay awhile longer or indefinitely. What a shame.
author: Grace L.

description: I love Olive Garden, but I'm kinda embarrassed to admit it cuz its pretty uncool.  But I adore the salad and breadsticks and the lasagna.  Ever time I go here I eat so much that I swear I'll never go again, but that feeling never lasts long (less than 24 hours).  The only negative thing is the wait is always so darn long, no matter what day you come in and I usually go on weeknights.  I'd hate to see what its like on the weekend.  At least theres a mall there and you can take the buzzer thing pretty far away from the restaurant.
author: Maureen K.

description: Olive Garden was a perfect choice for me when I was tired of the food sold on campus (SFSU) and when I had a couple of hours between my classes to grab a bite to eat with a friend. The wait is not bad, the staff is really friendly and talkative, and I have yet to dislike any of my meals here, which contain huge and fattening portions that I can never finish! *sigh*
author: Narina A.

description: The soups are good the main dishes are universally awful. The service people all seem to be SFSU students trying their best at their first job and failing miserably. Once I had to ask for butter THREE times, the waitress finally brought it after the meal was over. You would be better off buying a can of Progresso at the market for a buck and eating at home, better ambiance and far better service. Oh yes, they make you wait for a table even if the place is empty, again, the receptionists are also SFSU students that also havent been trained. Actually if you want to go to a comedy club go here instead its cheaper and pathetically funny.
author: Alex B.

description:
I'll give two stars to the great service I've experienced here. 
But to the overcooked pasta and watery sauce? NONE!
You can get better Italian food elsewhere or at other Olive Garden locations.
author: Millie N.

description:
num num num.

holy fat girl. the girls and the baby went in for dinner tonight and im still stuffed. we had the fried ravs and calamari. delish. bread sticks w/ alfredo and salad. then shared the tour of italy and that new lasagna thing with sausage. the lasagna thing wasn't good. which sucked. we had some almond frozen chocolate drink. DELISH! 

our server was great very friendly and had an awesome memory.
author: Angelina M.

description: An Olive Garden is an Olive Garden. Consistent, affordable, generic Italian food. I enjoy it as much as the next person. So why am I writing a review? Because this past Saturday my friend and I came here for lunch and we were creeped out. Why? Because the staff was SO nice. TOO NICE. EERIE NICE.
author: Jenna L.

description: "I wouldn't take a SHIT in the Olive Garden"    - Kevin Nealon (Weeds - Season One)
author: Thömas F.

description: This place is pretty good however it's a little pricey for being the Olive Garden.  It's by no means worth the $15-24 per plate of food they charge.  But if your coming for the soup and endless salad and breadsticks, you will definitely get more than your money's worth.
author: Andrina H.

description: Jesus Christ, really people?? What were you expecting from Olive Garden anyways!  I always find that the service is pretty decent, the food is what it is, and the BREADSTICKS are orgasmic.  When I know I can only shovel one or two more bites of pasta down my gullet I always flag down the waiter to bring us more breadsticks so I can take the garlicky, carbaliciousness home.  Usually around 2am you will find me eating breadsticks all alone in the dark, because I'm not good at sharing.
author: Emily X.

description: I have been to Olive Garden at Lakeside numerous times over the past few years. The food is alright, but my problem lies with the service. On every occasion, the service lacks quality. Recently, during a lunch break from my job at my mom's dental office in the medical building, a fellow employee and good friend of mine and I decided to have lunch at Olive Garden. The restaurant was barely occupied, yet the service level represented an overly crowded restaurant. As mentioned before, the food is not the problem with Olive Garden. At the end of lunch, we were in a rush to head back to work, yet out waiter was nowhere to be found when we needed the check, and once we finally got it and were in need of change, we had to find another waiter to give us our change. Once I see improvement in the service, I will be glad to change my review to 4-5 stars.
author: Kevin H.

description:
Everything here was so horrid, I only sat for 5 minutes and left. I am writing this right after i left this place not too long ago. I arrived here not even 9:00 and was waiting for a seat for three. The hostess said the wait would be only 15 minutes or less. I waited for 30 minutes till I was seated. 
I notified the host that I would have a third person joining, she informed me that they had to arrive inside before 10:00 pm. It was understandable, however it was minorly ridiculous that we wasted an extra 15 minutes of dwaddle. I was also seated next to the door. It was freezing with wind, is it truly a good idea to seat people next to the door, when there were clearly at least 7 tables available from the entrance to the corner of my seat? 
Fine. We decided to just eat as soon as possible and leave before this "door close". We waited for about 5 minutes until the server came. I straight up politely explained my situation to her about my third party member. She explained that once it becomes 10:00, no one can come in nor out. So, does that mean we must all leave before 10? Or are we locked up. Exaggerated, but that was a poor explanation. 
We decided to leave, as our patience wore. What triggered me the most to write this, was the moment we said "Nevermind, thank you." the waitress (By the name of "Sherry", excuse me if that is the incorrect way to spell it) scampered off to another co-worker and I could instantly tell she was, as people say, "talking smack" about our departure. How do I know? The facial expressions, constant look backs with the co-worker (whom was A white male), and the eyes. Those gestures Can only be one thing.
I understand the customer is never 100% correct. However, that was the most rude moment of the night. I know very well waitresses and all employees would put up a mask to serve just for the tips and job keeping. Do you honestly believe they work to serve? No, all employees work for money. If you decide to "talk smack", at least be discreet about it. 
Sherry, if you are reading this, be more discreet about your smack talking. You were rude, fake, and it was pure disrespect. We had no disrespect in leaving, as we left quietly with no complaint. However your atrocious behavior was disrespectful. I don't know how long you've been at food services, but girl you need to step up your game. Maybe even not work for it, regardless of pay.
I hope the management sees this as not a rant about the closing time an rules. But rather a notification about some of their employees and their lack of respect for others. This could've been avoided easily if Sherry didn't be so obvious as to being a smack talker. Who knows who more of your employees are like that? 
I won't be returning to this Olive Garden anymore, as their employees can't even keep their facade of "I'm here to serve you". The worst kind of customer service.
author: Iris L.

description: This location is excellent. I love the free breadsticks and limitless pasta. Many people talk bad about Olive Garden and that's fine... MORE PASTA FOR ME!!! LOL :) They don't know what they're missing!!
author: Jeremy L.

description: This is the first time I visited in a long time maybe 15 years and it's still very bad.I ordered the soup,salad,breadsticks and boy was it bad.I tried 2 soups 1creamy white italian and minestrone soup and both were very salty and the breadsticks wasn't baked all the way still very light almost not baked. the service was very slow and it wasn't even 1/2 full 2 people came in 25 minutes after us and got served at the same time , kitchen needs help and they need to watch all that salt.I will never go back again, even my daughter said this was real bad and she goes they 2 times a month.Just wasted $56.00 what a waste I would have been better off in the food court. very dissatisfied
author: Joe S.

description: Came back on a Sunday afternoon, and there was definitely a wait. We decided to be easygoing, especially because time was an issue, and ate at the bar. The bartender and barback were both really nice and attentive. Nothing was bad throughout the meal. The soups were especially good (I believe they were tuscan something and gnocchi w/ something). We had the steak pasta, which was a special, and I was impressed with the way the steak was cooked. I expected something more on the dry and tough side, but it was tender and juicy. My least favorite was probably the mushroom ravioli I ordered. It was too much on the pasty side, and I probably couldn't have been able to tell that it was mushrooms if I hadn't ordered it. My hazelnut latte would've been much better if it was hot, rather than just warm. Otherwise, everything else was superb, not something I expected from Olive Garden.
author: Elaine H.

description: Went there today. Some times I just want to go there for the salad and breadsticks. I had the Chicken Parmigana. It was good, but what made the experience even better was my waitress Angela T. She was great. Kept my breadsticks full, my Ice Tea filled as well. She was very personable. She even didn't mind my sense of humor. (Which some people can take the wrong way). But all in all it was worth the stop and I was treated like family.
author: Timothy M.

description: I love real italian food, so much so that I am embarrased I ate at the Olive Garden - even the name sounds putrid when you think about it...there are no gardens anywhere near these places, and the olives are far from being even remotely good olives.  OG, I would give you 0 stars if possible, how can you make me feel ill on soup, salad, and breadsticks? I didn't think it would be possible, but lord knows it is.  Welcome to a glorified, Italian McDonalds.
author: Jeffrey R.

description: Absolutely not fine dining but if you're at the mall anyway and you've just had a frappucino and gone to Clare's and  Hot Topic and Brookstone you may as well continue to live the suburban lifestyle and eat dinner at the Olive Garden.  I'll tell everryone we took the M back to Embarcadero and ate at the Ferry Building, okay?
author: Maria D.

description: A notch or so above Pasta Pomodoro. Definitely not a destination unto itself, but if you're at the mall and looking for something more substantial than the food court options, this is fine for what it is - edible Italian food at reasonable prices.
author: Gourmet G.

description: What can I say, I love Olive Garden.  Whenever I see the commercial I have to go!  As far as Olive Garden's go, this one is pretty good! Very friendly waitstaff.  There is usually a wait on weekends, but I just hang out at the mall or the Borders nearby.  My favorite are the soups.
author: Britany F.

description: This is how you eat at Olive Garden.  Order whatever entree you want.  Eat all the salad and bread sticks you can since its unlimited.   Make sure you eat more salad than bread sticks so you can take a shit after 2 hours of eating break sticks and salad.  After you take a shit go back and eat more salad and bread sticks.  After then 4th hour ask for a to go box for your entree.  Go home with lunch for tomorrow.
author: Fatty A.

description: I came here like in middle school their service is good is you can get their attention.  I like their free salad and breadstick.   I would want to try the never ending pasta.
author: John F.

description:
I love their breadsticks. I love their pasta. I like their service. I just wish they would take reservations! Since it is located in the center of everything (mall, school, etc.), it is always poppin' with people! Other than that, go for it--that is, if you don't mind waiting forever.

Note: Don't worry though, the wait is not and will never be as long as the one at Cheesecake Factory in Downtown.
author: Katie N.

description:
Several reasons why I won't go there again:
a. Bread stick tastes good, but was way too slow. Other restaurants deliver bread before you order, we waited for at least 10 minutes after we ordered.
b. The dishes were overpriced. We ordered a Chianti Braised Short Ribs and Parm Crusted Tilapia. The boneless ribs were full of BBQ source, yet I can still taste the gamey flavor. The Tilapia was tasteless and in small portion.
c. The Cocktail was bland. I mean, it feels like that this place runs out of liquor.
author: andy s.

description: You can never go wrong with their all you can eat salad, soup and breadsticks meal.  If you want real Italian food, head over to North Beach!
author: La C.

description:
Nowhere on earth and especially not San Francisco is a meal of pasta and bread that has the taste of paper worth over ten dollars.  And also, while I am ranting -- I am entirely sick of restaurants that are built to the scale of rural Nebraska cattle slaughter houses.  The process is always the same.  1.  Shuffle your mindless body through the doors.  2. Step up to the "hostess" and request seating.  3.  You are delivered a bulky, vibrating mechanism to alert you when your table is ready.  4.  to waste time, stick said mechanism into your pants to experience the most exciting feeling of the evening, because it certainly wont be your meal.  5.  Machine rings, get up from your exciting and atmospherous lobby seat and shuffle your by now, mindless corpse to your uninviting table seated in a large room with four hundred other new members of your "Italian extended family."  6.  Pick your grubby, un-original, tasteless gruel from the menu and await service.  7.  Blow your head off, because you just ate at Olive Garden.  (If you didnt plan ahead to bring in a gun, simply pick up your butter knife and gouge out your eyeballs)

My new rule -- any restaurant, especially a chain like the O.G. that cannot serve you right away is not good enough.  Screw that concept.  You are not a person here, you are another number on their corporate service chart.  Don't eat here and pick a real Italian restaurant instead.
author: Taylor P.

description: One word - breadsticks.  Just be sure to get the bangin' alfredo sauce for dipping.  Decent service but such a long long wait, no matter when you go.  As chains go this place is good but not where I'd pick if I was craving authentic Italian food.  Nice portions on the salad too  -  very generous and they have a decent wine menu.
author: A H.

description: fine, but a typical american somehow artificial flavor ! cant compare to san francisco food, but its good !
author: Shadi K.

description: Good food the wait for a table is long first come first serve in bar so grab the table when you can. You can eat in the bar.
author: Steve S.

description: The only time I ever come to the Olive Garden is when there's some kind of all  you can eat deal cause everything else is a rip off.  And even then, the Olive Garden is pretty nasty.  The salad is OK, the bread sticks are free and salty.  The portions are a little too big, they really should be focusing on quality over quantity.  But this is a big nationwide chain after all.  They're just trying to fatten us up for the kill.
author: Tony L.

description: Olive Garden is pretty consistent throughout the state. There is a wide selection of pastas, which are ok. What me and my boyfriend go for, however, is the calamari appetizer and the unlimited Zuppa Toscana soup. Every time we go, we just order a bowl of soup and get unlimited refills. Oh gosh the soup is to-die-for. A bajillion calories but worth every bite!! The calamari is very delicious too. The service ranges, depending on who you get. Of course, you can't expect much from an Olive Garden. I highly recommend you go and just order soup or salad. It's cheap and it'll get you full with the breadsticks that come with it! =)
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Ok. I have to admit, I love their breadsticks and salad... And I would come back here many many times, just for the salad and breadsticks, but the pasta is not as good as you expect it to be. What's with this place, that everytime you go here you have a minimum wait of 30 minutes. It's not THAT special. I think it's kinda overpriced, I mean $13 for Spaghetti with Meatballs? The pastas are not very special.
Last time, I went here with my boyfriend for lunch, I ordered the unlimited breadsticks, salad and soup and he ordered the Chicken & Gnocchi Veronese Pasta. Apparently you also have a Chicken & Gnocchi soup, so he got that instead of the pasta. We said something about it, and the waiter came back with another bowl of Chicken and Gnocchi soup, ehm?? That's not what we asked for at all. So, we explained it to him again, and you know what he said "owh, Im so sorry, do you want another bowl of soup?". Ehm, no, he wanted the pasta. My boyfriend decided to just let it go and eat the soup, I mean, he had 2 bowls now. Afterwards he didn't apologize for anything. 

I was honestly expecting some kind of discount, or a free drink.. But I guess that was too much for our waiter. 

I know this usually doesn't happen, and we were probably unlucky, but still. I wish there was something he'd do to make it up to my boyfriend, especially since he had been craving pasta with chicken for days!

All my other experiences at Olive Garden were OK. I have to say, if weren't for the delicious breadsticks and salads, I would never come back here, cause all the other things are waaay overpriced, and the long wait is definitely not worth it. 

Never been here, go for the unlimited soup, salad and breadsticks for something like 7 bucks, isnt it? GREAT!
author: Helen D.

description:
Now, I'm not saying "four stars" because this is a foodie experience.
I'm saying, if you happen to be in Stonestown shopping at Borders, and get hungry, walk over to The Olive Garden and get a decent meal as opposed to McDonalds or Chevy's.  At The Olive Garden you can get a decent glass of wine, adequate salad, and pasta that is acceptable.  The service has been hit and miss at times but recently it has improved.  Will this be a fine dining experience? No.  Will you get your money's worth? Yes.  The bathrooms are clean, the food is very acceptable, and you don't drop large amounts of money.  Would I suggest this as a place to impress a first date?  Probably not.  But I go there with my husband and we have a decent time and enjoy the easy going atmosphere.  No one says you have to eat at high end expensive restaurants every week, don't bother, this place is a good lunch place or a place to drop in.
author: Sarah H.

description: The menu is edible. For all you broke folks or all my high rollers, just sit down, take a look at the menu and/or eat the menu, then leave.
author: fuck you p.

description:
It was my first time here last month after a failed attempt due to the long wait time. The key is to go for the early dinner. I had the calamari for an entree and it was a bit salty for me. I had the peach ice tea and loved it! The waitress was helpful, but when she took my order for soup she must have entered it wrong and I didn't catch it. 

Pretty good food for a chain restaurant.
author: Jen C.

description: I know better now to have Italian in North Beach or elsewhere but back in the day when I lived in malls part time, Olive Garden was not a bad choice to settle on.
author: Debbie Y.

description:
With strictly edible pasta, the Olive was only an option for us because it was kid friendly and offered large portions for the money. No more.

On our last two visits, the portions were shockingly small. My husband and I both got the eggplant parmesan and received only two slices of eggplant, thin as a quarter. Add in the smallest portion of pasta on the side I'd ever seen, and we both left the restaurant hungry. $10 bucks for something that probably cost them 50 cents to make. Our daughter's kid's meal was also insubstantial.

Oh and that unlimited salad and breadsticks... we had to ask twice for refills, and the clothe napkins are now paper.

We won't be back, despite the 10 bucks left on that gift card we got for Christmas.
author: Tami C.

description: Haha.. alright, so let me say this upfront - who cares about how average the food is - it's the "hospitaliano" we came for! I love their spaghetti with meatballs, even if the meatballs looked as though they were perfectly scooped like slick ice cream. The service is always very good and the waiters (mostly college kids) probably put up with douchebags all day (see the movie "Waiting.")
author: Jonathan L.

description: I don't hate the place, but I don't really love the place either. The only thing I really liked was the neverending pasta. Got to eat two different pasta bowls for the price of one regular one.
author: Sonlay V.

description: If you stay at this Olive Garden late enough and try to order a bottle of wine, they'll offer it "to go".  Good game.
author: Sam P.

description:
no reservation equal hell of a wait. theres usually a lot of people here and it's usually packed. this place is convenient because theres a lot of parking spaces and theres a mall. i came here with friends and boyfriend for dinner. it was a huge wait. we finally got seated, the server was pretty funny (i forgot his name.) we got everything we need and the food we ate was pretty satified.

bread sticks gets really boring. lol
author: Valerie N.

description: I looooove Olive Garden! 5 sexy stars, baby! Nothing beats the Tour of Italy - fetticini alfredo, lasagne, AND chicken parm? Need I say more? What's even better than the Tour of Italy is ordering take-out. You might think to yourself "How do I get unlimited salad and breadsticks if I order take-out?" Have no fear, they give you more salad you could ever want, plus throw in 3-4 more breadsticks than your stomach can handle.
author: Susan L.

description: Why are people so embarrassed to eat food?  Eating at the Olive Garden is not ironically cool nor is it a guilty pleasure.  Are people so self conscious they can't admit to eating?  It is what it is an f-ing chain restaurant.  I like the Olive Garden.  They have veg options that are filling and yummy.  Who can turn down bottomless salad and breadsticks?  The salad dressing is awesome.  Of course there's a standard wait at every OG  but whatever go in the afternoon and try to avoid it on the weekends.
author: Joni S.

description: The food in general is okay, nothing to brag or scream about. Feels like eattiing expensive microwave food at times with a salad and soup. Service here seems to be great all the time, never having a grumpy waiter yet. Parking is great sense it's at a mall and while you wait for your seating you can explore the mall.
author: David M.

description:
I love the Olive Garden.  You get okay food but for a good price for the amount they give you.  The salad, the breadsticks, you have heard it all before.  I have been to many different locations of this chain in several states and always enjoyed myself.

It has been a few years since I had been here and unfortunately it was a big let down.

The salad was not properly dressed.  There wasn't enough.  Yet some how it was still wilted and soggy.  Also, thank you for the two tomato slices that came in our salad for four.  I am sure everyone can attest that half a tomato in your salad is adequate!

The breadsticks looked beautiful in the basket.  The smell was great (yah carbs!), but were really salty.   And I mean, I like salty.  If you are going out to gorge on endless salad and breadsticks AND have dinner, you typically aren't worried about salt content.  But this was too much.  My guess is the used salted butter and put a salad/seasoning mixture on top.  My lips are still dehydrated.

I got the Eggplant Parmigana.  The taste was pretty good.  It is hard to make a fried dish not taste greasy so I take no points away for that.  I do however wonder why I got the world's smallest slice of eggplant known to man and how they were able to 1) cut it that thin 2) cook something that thin 3) why the heck was it that thin?  They either need to give you a thicker piece or lower the price a couple of bucks.  

Along side the eggplant was a side of pasta.  The sauce seemed "homemade".  The tomatoes in the sauce were sweet and flavorful.  Too bad someone forgot to put other herbs in the sauce though.  That was kind of weird.  I wasn't aware that basil or oregano was too expensive for an Italian restaurant to have.  Hmm.  And while I am on my high horse of complaints let me say the noodles were overcooked.  I am not a one year old in danger of choking on al dente pasta.  I can handle it.

Let's not kid ourselves, it's the Olive Garden.  Sure, it ain't nothing fancy, but even with low expectations, I was still let down.
author: Kalin P.

description:
This place is alright, the portions are HUGE!! Oh my goodness after the bread sticks and salad I could only eat like a quarter of my entree! Our waiter was really nice, it was his second week and he did a pretty good job! He was very friendly and amicable when he was saying bye to us he told us about his cool yellow vespa, we saw it out front it was pretty sweet.  Anywho, the resturaunt is really big and i think it has like a separate room for if you wanted to have a party or something.  I ordered the Garlic-Herb Chicken con Broccoli, although I was expecting it to be with potatoes and not pasta but it was pretty good, the pasta it was on top of looked like thick little fisherman's caps.  Some bite were kinda salty, the cream sauce is really garlicy and god but the whole dish is very filling, i would suggests sharing this with someone. There two pieces of chicken and everything, so sharing wouldn't be that big of a deal.
Its extremely easy to get to, by just taking the underground muni and getting off at the mall
author: Sloane G.

description: Pretty solid place for Italian.  It's not the best Italian food but it's good.  The potato soup is great and the pasta is alright.  It gets 3 stars cuz they have a pretty good bar that can make you some great margaritas.  Parking is good since it's in the mall.
author: Allan T.

description: mmm Olive Garden! Its was the only one in the area when I lived in San Francisco and because their service is sooo shitty, I began to hate olive garden! The hostess stand they were talking about their personal life out loud for everyone to hear (super unprofessional things. Once I heard them talking about birth control because someone was fu**ing too much") I was disgusted!! The waitress was sooo snoooty! At one point I had to stop and ask her "is everything alright?" to which she replied "fine." I understand your job can be tough at times I work in the customer service field as well, however its your job!! I was so annoyed I never returned to Olive Garden again. I do miss the yummy food tho! I'll never return to this location everyone is snooty and unprofessional!
author: Veronica M.

description: It reminds me of being in Vegas -- the cavernous themed restaurant, noisy kids, bored waitstaff, and the zombie-like patrons shoveling the all-you-can-eat food into their gaping maws -- minus the smoke and the Keno and the proximity to gambling.  It's not real Italian and it's not real good, but it's better than Chevy's if you're at the mall late.  Best thing I've had there -- the limoncello lemonade.
author: Andi T.

description: I love the braised short ribs.  Not all they served are pasta as what others think.  I don't like it when they ask what kind of drinks you want and mention if you want any wine; however, the bread taste really good so they are forgiven.  The price isn't that bad either.
author: Bernard V.

description: I just come mainly for the salad and the breadsticks! It's all you really need to feel satisfied.  The thing that deters me from coming are the long waits--you are better off coming during brunch hours rather than dinner hours because it gets super crowded!
author: Mel P.

description: I liked this place a lot but its way too expensive our bill was over $100 and the food was just ok.  The salad was really good, I got the Chicken Marsala, that pretty much sucked.... the flavor was bad.  I have had marsala swansen tv dinners tasted better.  The waitress was hot and so was the hostess which was a plus, they also gave me a free glass of wine to sample which was cool.  The bread was good and the desert was pretty good too.  This place is only ok because its way to expensive for only averagae food, but the restaurant atmosphere is nice and the service was A+,  if the dinner was better i would love this place, but it wasn't so I give this mixed review I can see y this place doesnt have more stars..  This is a good place to take a date, its busy too we had to wait 15 mins to sit the place was PACKED!! check it out I know they have good things on the dinner menu just not the chicken marsala....
author: Chris B.

description: Ehhh.....I think it's way too expensive to eat here casually on the weekend. The lunch menu only exists M-F so you have to order from the dinner menu, even at 11 a.m. on the weekend. Entrees seem to average $14-$20 and if you order the appetizer combo as a meal they charge an extra $4.75 for salad!
author: T. W.

description: This is the place to take Seniors for lunch on a weekday and it is a happy medium because they are happy, you are happy because it they are happy.
author: miriam b.

description: Unfortunately, I don't have much for a review. I mean, I tried going to this place, at least 3 times. But the wait was outrageous. I'm talking 1 hour, at least. It's just not worth it, right? That's what I hear. So I figure I'm not missing much....If you want to try this place out, be my guest. But don't get mad at me when I walk by you with a satisfied appetite, while you're in front of the place with the rest of the refugee camp, still waiting to get a table.
author: M S.

description:
Well, I hadn't been to this location in soooo long.

We started out with the rolls and the salad which were both good.  

My dinner was just so-so.  I had the portobello mushroom ravioli.  It was a bit dry and the mushrooms were also a bit dry.  

The chicken marsala was a bit salty and the sauce on the potatoes and veggies was a bit overcooked.

The service was really good.  Although the server kept trying to upsell us on alcohol and other items, it was in good spirit.

We brought a cake and they were nice enough to bring plates and extra napkins and utensils.

Wish there were more juice selections.

The tables are placed with plenty of room in between them which is really nice.  

The bathroom were fairly clean.

At 6:30 we waited about 20 minutes for a table of 3 adults and one child.

Total price was around $65.
author: Brian L.

description: I haven't been here in quite a while and probably won't eat here anymore.  I used to really like the zuppa toscana, the appetizers, and angel hair pasta.  For some reason, the last couple of times I had the zuppa toscana, it was super salty and almost unedible and the appetizers made me so bloated afterwards I wanted to throw up.  And it wasn't just me either.  My friend felt exactly the same way afterwards.  Also, the minestrone soup has a strong alcohol taste to it.  I think they put wine in it, gross.
