No more Olive Garden for me ever again.
author: Stewie G.

description:
the food is not my type at all, last time i went there because my boss took all employees there to have lunch.

i think the food is disgusting, maybe i dont like italian food at all.

i dont like pizza, italian noddle and so on. i like chinese food only.

i will not come back this place even you point a gun at me.

sorry about my english is so-so. hope you know what i mean.
author: ppoo l.

description: Been here quite a few times and I'm always satisfied with service and the food.  I sat at the bar this time and was served by Jason and the service was top notch.  I really like their salad, breadsticks, and adding an appetizer combo (calamari, ravioli, and stuffed mushrooms).
author: Neville B.

description:
ewww olive garden does not taste good....
it's so bland! 
i'd chose pasta sauce in a jar with overcooked spaghetti by a 10 year old kid any day over olive garden...
if it was a choice between olive garden and chevy's next door, i'd go with chevy's fo' sho'
author: charlotte s.

description: Bringing the suburbs to San Francisco, Olive Garden delivers large helpings of mediocre food at reasonable prices. I probably lose all credibility by giving this place 2 stars, but it's satisfying when you're hungry.  All the people in line can't be wrong, can they?  Don't answer that.  And, don't get in line, just go to the bar area and grab a table.
author: Tim G.

description: Why does a 2.5 star place always have a wait, even during the afternoon on weekends?  I haven't been here for dinner in years because the wait is way too long and the food isn't that great.  My husband and I recently tried the unlimited soup, salad, and breadsticks lunch.  We tried all of the soups.  The  Zuppa Tuscona soup is the best one by far but it was too salty.  The salad is decent but nothing special.  The food just isn't anything worth coming back for so we probably won't be dining here again anytime soon.
author: Stacey L.

description: I kinda want to give it 3 1/2 stars.  Does that completely discredit my other reviews?  I hadn't been to an Olive Garden in years and really had no desire to, but I have to say, the warm breadsticks and endless salad did my heart some good.  Maybe it was purely nostalgic, I mean I did grow up in the suburbs.  So many Friday nights spent there eating as much Alfredo sauce as I wanted with only my teenage metabolism on my side.  I was impressed to see that they offer whole wheat pasta as a carb-friendly alternative.  That's progress!   Final word,  it's Olive Garden, you know exactly what you're in for.
author: Rachel C.

description:
why do i always order an entree when i know i'm gonna get full off of the breadsticks, soup, and salad?

i usually only get the stuffed chicken marsala and the chicken alfredo here.  both were probably cooked earlier in the day & warmed up, but hey, it fills you up!
author: Ray R.

description:
i forgot that i like olive garden. not that it's not memorable (as i've had good times with friends here), it's just that the wait can be pretty long. two of us came here recently and the wait was nearly an hour!! for two people! but they have this cafe that is first come first serve. if you see someone done with their table, you can swoop in on it and fight with other people who are also eye-ing the table like hawks. and if you do get the table, you can enjoy being stared at the by horde of hungry people waiting for a table.
there's also the bar area that is also first come first serve. we managed to swoop on those seats, and it was actually pretty nice. we were in our own little niche and dude, the waiter/bartender's right in front of us, so it's not like it was hard to flag him down.

the food now. first off, minestrone that's vegetarian. oh frickin' yeah! that's what i'm talking about. and i must say, i really enjoyed this minestrone. one of the better ones i've had. i remember the salad being ridiculously good, also. but i had to try the minestrone. the breadsticks are super yummy, soft and cheesy. my entree, i tried the eggplant parmigiana. that pasta was cooked to perfection, but the eggplant was more fried stuff then eggplant. but then again, i'm so biased towards luigi's (in daly city) eggplant parm. overall, the dinner was good. i just prefer to get my eggplant parmigiana elsewhere. 

and the BEST thing about this place? they give you andes mints right after. those have got to be the best chocolate mints on this planet. love love love 'em.
author: Veggie J.

description: I really did not like this place at all. I went there with my parents because I heard great reviews, however, that is not what I saw. We ordered a chicken tenders appetizer, which turned out to be dry. The service was horrible! All our food came separately instead of all together at once. There was at least a 5-10 min gap. When my food finally came, everyone was already done with their food. The waitress even brought the bill while I just started on my food AND without asking about dessert! Wow, I am DEFINITELY NOT going back. I will not recommend any of my friends to this place.
author: Tiffany Q.

description:
soooooo slowwwwwwww!!!!!! 
and it was the end of the night and there weren't even that many people there. =( 

i really only like their breadsticks. that's IT.
author: Rosalee C.

description: Food and atmosphere good. Service terrible.
author: Anthony W.

description: 3 stars because of the memories and friendly staffs. Honest, olive garden does not have the best Italian food....in fact, it's not even authentic Italian food! So why do I come here? I don't know. I really like the atmosphere and the setting. I do not prefer food court meals after a nice day of shopping. I would like to sit down and have waiters serving me. =)
author: Jenny K.

description: The parking can be a pain  Then once you get in you have to do a LONG wait if it's after 6pm.    If you decide to wait for a table the service is good.  One time (and I kidd you not) they ran out of salad!!!
author: Iliana C.

description: service is pretty good the food is really good especially the bread and soup. the seafood Alfredo recommended
author: Joaquin S.

description:
It's a-ok but it's no real "Italian" restaurant. 
It's pretty much the McDonalds of all Italian restaurants. 
Sometimes the food just taste like microwavable entrees. But sometimes there are some dishes that do taste good.. and not all microwavey tasting... like they really made it. But there's nothing too special about this place. I guess to other people it's a big deal because somehow there's always a long line. But I do enjoy some of the food here. It' just not a place to get all excited about.. and don't think it's authentic Italian food. ... cuz it's kinda not. Oh yeah, i celebrated my birthday here one time. Some of the workers sang happy birthday... and it was really scary ='( 
Bloop!!
author: Mila B.

description: first of all, is it possible to give negative stars? Second, the first time I ate at this establishment I experienced a seizure.  Later found out that the waiting staff were extremely reluctant to call an ambulance.  The second time I decided to give this place another chance, it was awful.  Not only were my friends and I harassed by a man who invited himself to our table twice and was shaking profusely the entire time.  The service was awful, our waiter forgot to bring us our waters, then forgot a diet coke, and failed to bring olive oil and vinegar for the table when we asked him three times.  The three of us at the table have all had restaurant experience and know what it is like to be a waiter/waitress on a busy night.  we came on a tuesday. it was not busy and our waiter obviously had extreme difficulty tending to our needs, especially when we were one of his only 3 tables.  We were extremely unsatisfied to say the least, by our service and the food which was terrible as well.  I ordered a $6 glass of chianti and it tasted worse than two-buck chuck from Trader Joes.  My friend ordered a margarita and it tasted like lime-juice.  If your looking for a nice place to eat while shopping at this establishment in the Stonestown area, I highly reccommend the McDonalds just a few doors down.  Great place for breadsticks.
author: Aurora D.

description:
i hate coming here to dinner because of the long wait, but doing some shopping or flipping through the magazine at borders is a great way to kill time. i love coming here to lunch break from school. and there's no wait! i usually get there at 11, when the restaurant opens. 

as for food: seafood portofino and grilled shrimp caprese with the zuppa toscana and i love the bread =]
author: Jen P.

description:
I don't care what people say, i LOVE the olive garden. You have to know what to order. I tried the stuffed chicken marsala once, and it was waaaay too salty. so i just opt for my usual: chicken scampi, although they've changed the way they cook it. They used to simmer it for a long time so the meat is super tender and can be cut with your fork, now they simmer and then fry so the meat is a bit tough. Oh well, still good though! Never get the salad cus i hear they grab em with their hands? Plus it's not that good. Get soup! my favorite is the Zuppa Toscana, it contains sausages, potatoes, and kale. The broth is a white cream but not too thick and creamy. Oh it's perfect! 
Other great dishes to try are: Tour of Italy, Veal Parmigiana, and Chicken Gnocchi. 
Oh yes, a pitcher of sangria is only $20, you won't get drunk off of it, then again, who gets drunk at olive garden? That's just not civil.....go next door to chevy's for that!
author: Linda L.

description: This is actually the second time im writing this review, because I changed my opinion on this place. After that last time I have come back here several times, and it's better every time. The service is faster, the food is bigger and better, and he line is shorter. But this is during lunch, this place is crazy during dinner. But if your in the mood for pasta and breadsticks this is the place to.
author: Nikita K.

description: I've came here several times and the food and service for me is always good. Prices are fair; it'd be nice if they were a buck or two cheaper, but it's not bad. Italian food is my favorite, so it's one of the few Italian restaurants I can find in the sunset. If you know any better Italian restaurants that's inexpensive, feel free to let me know!
author: Pudgy G.

description: My Husband & I have been going there for over 6 years now , ALOT. And we can't say enough good. Yeah , sometimes there is a long wait but we feel it's well worth it  and you just have to expect it. We recommend the peach iced tea. And the prices are good.  And the breadsticks are the best ever ! Where else can you get unlimited breadsticks and salad and free refills on your tea and they let you take it home too. We both can eat alot and still bring home the next nights dinner for two and all for under $30 and sometimes under $20. Always have great staff and employees working too.
author: Laura C.

description: YAY! Their artichoke dip ROCKS! =) And their sangrias was a bit super sweet, but still tasty. =) The wait kind of sucks though...=/ but the service was good overall. Happy Birthday Sylvia! =)
author: Irene L.

description: Olive Garden is very accomodating to big groups and since everybody loves pasta and Italian food, you can't really go wrong with bringing a big party to Olive Garden for a meal.  It IS a chain restaurant, but the food is decent, though not very exciting, and the servers are friendly, though they can be a little inattentive when there are lots of huge groups to attend to in the dining room.  As much as I don't want to like Olive Garden, I have to admit that I love their minestrone soup!  I liked how they gave out Andes mints customized with their own wrappers at the end of the meal.  Oh, and the free crayons, too!  I would give Olive Garden a 3.5 stars, but will round up to 4 stars.
author: Karen L.

description: great calamaris. and i used to have my favorite dish over at Olive Garden which is the seafood ravioli, but they took that dish OFF the list, sadly i don't have my favorite dish over there anymore. PLEASE BRING IT BACK!!!
author: Sandy L.

description: I am addicted to their salad and breadsticks.  This is usually where one of my girlfriends and I end up when we finally are able to find a mutual day to get together and catch up with each others lives.  I don't like coming here with a big group.  The wait could easily be 2 hours for big groups.  Service can be a hit or miss.  It totally depends on your server.
author: Stella C.

description: I came here for a celebration dinner with my team. I regretted it when we were seated. I enjoy the breadsticks. &We laughed at the fact the my friend was drenched in water when the waitress spilled it on him. The food was not the best I've eaten. The waiter constantly came back over&over again making us order when not all of the people have arrived. Gratitude fee is a given& the mints. I pretty much only enjoyed the breadsticks & mints, Chicken Caesar was not the best.
author: Jenny L.

description: The food was ok... nothing great. I got their soup, salad, and breadstick combo.  The best part about this place is that I went on a weekday for lunch with my cousin and our two infants and they had these carseat slings.  It was great they were secure and sat higher up to us than leaving them on a chair.
author: Sheenie L.

description: If you've never tried OG, got to do it once. But only ONCE!  The food is so-so...nothing original, just alot of cream and cheese in almost every single dish! I don't think I left full but more bloated....
author: Shirley M.

description: I absolutely love Olive Garden. As a pasta fanatic this was one of the places I love to come to stuff my face. I love the service, the atmosphere in the restuarant and the endless salad and delicious bread sticks. I would recommend the fettuccine Alfredo and their cheese ravioli in cream sauce, not a good diet choice but definitely worth going to the gym the next day to burn it off. My friends love to come here with me and order their choose three appetizer option and get the toasted beef ravioli, mozzarella cheese sticks and chicken fingers which are very yummy!!! This is a fancier restuarant so it's pricey!!!
author: Shirley E.

description: I love going here for the food.as for the waiters I would rate them a 3. They Take to long and as for the breadsticks they always seem to make you wait alot to give you more. I do love their chicken Alfredo,tour of italy
author: Jocy l.

description: What more can be said about the Olive Garden. It's definitely nowhere near the standard of yumminess found in the North Beach restaurants, but on the other hand, if you're hanging out with your buds or fams from outside of the Bay Area, Olive Garden is a good "go to" place, since they're not used to the idea of searching for an hour for a "primo" parking spot. The food is edible, you get lots of salad, beverages and bread sticks. Not such a bad deal.
author: brenda b.

description: I've only dined at Olive Garden a few times. My usual is the Tour of Italy (Fettuccine Alfredo, Lasagna, Parmigiana Chicken)  which is mediocre.  Maybe that's why I haven't been there for years. Recently I saw a commercial for unlimited salad, bread sticks, and soup for approximately $6. How can I resist?! So  I persuaded three of my girlfriends to come out on a Sunday lunch to take advantage of the promotion.  We all had three bowls of soup, two servings of salad, and at least 3 bread sticks. I  think we did well for what we paid.  Thank goodness we planned on some shopping at Stonestown afterwards.  Although we left Stonestown empty handed, we definately burned off some of our lunch!
author: Lily T.

description:
am i being mean?
the waiters or the waiters that always assisted me were always rude and unprofessional. i had a soup that came along with my entree and it came to my table half splashed onto the plat below it . disgusting presentation. i know maybe im just picky but if u had seen it.. you wouldve thought twice about the service here. the food took forever to come like at least 30mins for just my dad and i.. and gah... way too salty
author: fionion f.

description: The food is inconsistent, and sometimes you'll have to wait forever for a table. The staff is really nice, and it's pretty clean in there.
author: Katherine C.

description:
1.5

OKay this place is so gross, I hate this place...

1. The pastas taste really blah, could eventually give you a stomach ache. The food taste really bland yet heavy at the same time. After eating a plate of pasta I feel like I need to run 5+ miles to work it off. The unlimited salads and breadsticks is what I come here for, the salad is okay, but omg the BREADSTICKS is what I really come here for... They are so good.. so soft and warm yumm.... I always ask for more when I'm leaving so I can eat it while I'm at home. The pasta tastes really un-authentic...
2. The service is okay... I had glasses of peach iced tea poured on me and my friend once... this waitress thinking she can make it to our table sucessfully with 10 glasses of ice teas/sodas, tripped I believe and all of it spilled on my and my friend, but thank god I could react fast enough that I didn't get that wet. But my friend wasn't so lucky... she got her whole pants wet. Okay moving on, they are nice, but not that nice, after spilling so much on us we would hope for no charge on the drinks, but I was wrong... okay I might be coming off a little cheap, but cmon I had my order forgotten at CPK and they gave it to me for free... a little generous dontcha think? I guess o.g and cpk aint the same thing but still. Olive garden is not my thing.
3. The wait for this place is rediculous, seriously people, do you really think its worth waiting 30+ minutes for this kind of food? I'd rather go to pasta pomodoro if you wanna eat at an italian chain... At least pasta pomodoro has good tasting dishes...

overall this place is not a place where I would come back to... long live the breadsticks though. hopefully they will be unlimited forever!
author: Johnny T.

description: This place is located very close to the mall. In fact the entrance is a couple of feet away from the Olive Garden entrance. Eh no biggie. I knew all about the mall before I came. One thing I will never forget is that there was a line for DAYSSSSSSS we had to wait about 30 min before we were seated so we sat at the bar and got the peach sangria pitcher (yummy!). That held us over until we were seated. We ordered ( I don't remember the meal) a salad and extra bread sticks. It wasn't bad but it wasn't so spectacular that I actually remembered. I think it was the chicken Parmesan. I do remember asking for extra bread sticks (hey I LOVE bread). The service was good and we got our food in a timely fashion. Hey retail is retail be it food or clothes. Or is it the chain store thing? Ahh who cares I would go back.
author: Falana H.

description: Can't ever go wrong with Olive Garden.  Usually very fast, can be a little bit slower on popular nights/times.  Free salad and breadsticks are the best.  The salad is amazing.  The food is always good and the waiters friendly.  It hasn't changed much since they got there.  I think ambiance could be worked on.
author: The C.

description: This place always serves exceptional pasta. Sometimes the wait can be long on weekends if you are unlucky. Staff is friendly and gives good service. Environment is clean and nice. Some dishes with cheese were overly cheesy. But definitely TAKE advantage of the never-ending-pasta. I attacked about four plates. =P
author: Jonathan L.

description: Why?  Why would anyone eat here, when you live in SF?!?!  I actually went here while at the mall one day and had the worst service and food that tasted like it was re-heated frozen food from Costco.  Plus there was a 30 minute wait!  I don't care if your at the mall, get in the car and drive somewhere else.  I only give it two stars, because the salad is decent and you get all you can eat....so that's cool.
author: Pele N.

description:
Usually I try to give stars based on location-specific stuff, because a single location within a chain can't help their menu or decor.

This is an exception. I've gone here two or three times, and the service is always prompt, my food comes out at the correct time and temperature. The servers have to do their corporate-mandated spiel, including offering white zin at each table, but it's not their fault.

So why two stars? Because it's still Olive Garden. Unimaginative food in crappy atmosphere. Sorry.
author: Matt G.

description:
bad service.

bland food.

what happened? used to be a nice.

not coming back for a looong while.
author: Mai G.

description: I don't come here for the pasta or entrees...I come here only for the daily special of unlimited soup, salad, and breadsticks before 4pm. I fill myself with at least 3 bowls of zuppa tuscana and two plates of salad and find myself thirsty the rest of the day and night. Is it worth it? Yes. Usually the servers come around often enough to check on if I need a salad or soup refill, so the service is attentive enough.
author: Tiff L.

description: Lack if service, On my visit to the Olive Garden today I noticed that my server was lagging on my food and drinks. Ten minutes for a budlight and a second beer that I never received. Although the food is good for the most part and the salad is always great. The service that my group received was awful.
author: Raul D.

description: ambiance was really nice, might have worked for a romantic dinner, but the food falls flat.  a $13 spaghetti and meatball dish that really tastes uninspired. spinach artichoke dip wasn't tasty.  breadstick had no seasoning, generic.  u can make all this at home for a couple bucks.
author: Ethan L.

description:
I will visit more often.

I have to agree with previous yelpers that this olive garden leans towards hiring college students who aren't well verse in the talent of customer service.

I was there today for the first time (01-26-09). We were seated promptly.

The server was manny, but it took him a cool minute to show, but the calvary handled things until he was able to provide us with nice service.

Manny smiles alot, and thats not a bad thing. Oh yeah, I was served by Barack, not our newly elected beloved commander in chief. But, I know he is the man because of his name.

CUT THE COLLEGE STUDENTS SOME SLACK! it's hard to deliver service with the higher that giraffe pussy tuition on your mind.

~The mind of minolta
author: Degrick M.

description: All my friends make fun of me because of how much I love olive garden but I do!! I can go eat at olive garden every day if I could... Just kidding. But I love this olive garden because it's walking distance from sf state which is pretty much the best thing in the world. My favorite plate is chicken Alfredo and I always get that I never switch it up. I know I should buy I just always crave this and wouldn't want miss out on it if I'm already there. The couple f times that I've tried something else I've just been disappointed! Soo chicken Alfredo it is :) I love the peach raspberry iced tea and the strawberry limonata? I believe.. Salad and breadsticks are always great of course and so are the servers. I just hate the long wait sometimes :/ but I usually just go over to the little bar area which is first come first serve so it's always a little faster :) overall, love olive garden and this one is great.
author: Vanessa P.

description:
I realize that The Olive Garden is not at all the best dining establishment in the world.  But in a different location than this one, I'd had pleasant experiences with medicore faux Italian food.  And because I'd been craving such a thing, and my boyfriend and I wanted something a little "different" from our most often visited eating establishments, we decided to make the trip.. 

So we take the sexy Muni trip with all the sexy people on the train, because they are always so repulsive and disturbing, (sorry.. ..  well, not really).  We finally arrive and are sent to wait, which we had expected, and are fine with.  We're seated, and excited to get to eat those breadsticks that you have to eat with alfredo sauce because the artificial garlic sprinkles they put on it are the only flavor you will get from the bread itself.  

I have soup, Minestrone, that comes with little broth, three shell noodles, and enough beans to make me full.  My main entree, Herb Crusted Chicken w/ Broccoli, or something along those lines, which comes with "creamy" garlic sauce.  Our entrees comes out.  Mine is severly lacking sauce, I taste it, and taste nothing but pasta, there's an underlying layer of what looks like water, olive oil, and maybe, just maybe garlic, so I ask the waitress if it is possible to get more sauce, she takes my plate, and the waiting begins.  I know it takes a bit of time to make sauce, but not as long as before I get my entree back.

I get it back, a much more healthy amount of sauce, but..  runny.  I am dissapointed.  My noodles are cold, my plate is hot, my sauce is lukewarm, more flavorful, but lacking the correct texture.  If you're going to list this dish as coming with "creamy" garlic sauce, make the sauce creamy, it is not impossible.  Later when my complaints start to irritate my boyfriend, he asks the waitress about it, and she gives some answer about how since it is garlic sauce, it will naturally not be creamy, even despite the "creamy" description in the menu.  I'm not an idiot, I can make sauces myself, garlic sauce doesn't have to be runny.  I am not hungry anyway, since I ate breadsticks and soup.

On top of the lacking food, I believe our waitress was the least fake nice.  I need everyone to pretend like I am important and loathe me when I am not paying attention.  I want my drinks refilled immediately when they are low.  I should not have to ask for a refill.  

It made better leftovers, but still, not so great.
author: Karissa B.

description: I had one of the worst dining experiences ever at this place. The food was like fresh from a costco bag to our table. We arrive at 8:30 pm. Number one the girl told was that will be 45 minutes for a table or we can go to the bar that was full too. Waiting by the bar 5 minutes later a table for two came up. We wait and ask another waiter if we could sit, she answer first came first serve, so I m glad we were at the right place at the right time otherwise the 45 minutes will be. We wait for ten minutes to be help while sitting in the table, the table was still dirty. When the guy stop at our table he told us that the bus boy was doing a horroble job, 5 minutes later we found out that he was the bus boy. When the server stop by to help us out, they never wipe the table so I had to had dinner with left overs from the last party. Order a soup, chicken and gnocchi. When they brought it up, was a mix of alfredo sauce ,water and vegetables, very unfortunate I only found 2 pieces of chicken and NOT 1 piece of gnocchi for my entertainment. Went for my chicken parmegiana. Wasnt bad at all. Crispy chicken with good marinara sauce on top and a small crust of cheese. Nothing bad there. The bar have 6 stools, so when we finish our dinner a couple left the bar. So the restaurant was still full, 4 seats of the bar full of 6 in the bar. All of a sudden the bartender start turning off the lights of the bar in a completly mood: " I have to go home". At that point we had already order the check, which was taking too long but we realize that places like this we dont need in San Srancisco. I always had the wish and desire to try out OLIVE GARDEN, but now after my experience at this location I dont think that I ll try it again.....
author: Alex M.

description: When, oh when, will I learn never to go back to The Olive Garden ?  I think now.  Since the dawn of man, the service is absolutely Candid Camera horrible, the food is way over-priced and far below average.  I am simply amazed that they have stayed open at all - let alone in the premier "attached to a mall' location.  If anyone ever sees me enter the Olive Zone ever again, please push me in the direction of Chevy's or  anything-on-a-stick at the mall itself.  Really.  Ever.
author: Mary N.

description: Okay, so I definitely love Olive Garden but I do have to warn you... There is almost ALWAYS a pretty long wait and if you sit in the "patio" section you won't get as great of service as you would at a normal table. Here are the good parts: Staff is usually friendly, you typically get your food in a timely manner, and (if you order soup-salad-breadsticks like I always do) it is pretty inexpensive and tastes AMAZING. The bad: We once ate in the patio section and it appears we were being waited on by the bartender guy with the longggg black hair. We were seated at a normal table and it seemed like he was more interested in chatting it up with the people at the bar. We waited for 20 minutes for him to finally come back to bring us refills, and ultimately just asked a passing waiter if they could bring it to us since he wasn't paying attention to us. We were there for like an hour and he only came to our table twice: once to get the order and once to bring our food. To top it off, there was a LONG BLACK COURSE hair in my food.... hmmm, my hair is light colored so it couldnt have been mine. He took the bowl back and asked if I wanted another one... Ya, no thanks. We left soon after. Just beware of this server's loose hairs and your food! One server who was amazing was Lou (?) I believe. He is young (maybe early 20s?) and was very attentive and fun! Got our food super quick, always had a full drink, and he went beyond the normal job requirements and asked us our plans for the day and even wrote us a little card to say thank you and to enjoy the rest of our day. GREAT SERVER!
author: Ky L.

description: Last time I was there... the server thought my friend and I were skipping school (high school). When we told Him that we were older he was so embarrassed he gave our table to another server. haha other than that OG is always a safe and good way to go.
author: Victoria M.

description:
oh man I love Olive Garden!
the breadsticks, the soup!
I had the steak pasta...i forgot what it was called, but wow..my girlfriend's meal was great too
hosts looked young..some were nice, while the others just wouldnt smile..our server was great though
definitely coming back..just wish it werent so packed!
author: Rick G.

description: The short Filippino waiter, Nate, is very rude to customers. As soon as my boyfriend and I walked into the restaurant, Nate bursted out into laughter as he walked right up to me. What rude customer service for a restaurant for such a great location!
author: Tina H.

description: I like the idea of free salad and bread sticks.. but other than that theres not much of a RAVE I hate eating here for a large group of people cause the bill is so hard to split actually I hate eating in a large group of people PERIOD. Also, my boyfriend ordered wine.. which was baad.. it was suppose to be free ya know complimentary.. bs! they charged 3 dollas. & nobody said anything when they were handling the bill.. wouldn't even let me see thats not olive gardens fault. But olive garden is olive garden not my fave.. because their bread sticks aren't like other Italian places, i like the olive oil and vinger.. olive garden doesn't have that which sucks! and you have to order special sauce for the bread stick.. I'ma try that one day. & you don't even want to hear about my last visit.. some guy had either a heart attack or a stroke in the middle of my meal. :[ poor guy, I felt really bad for him because he was so healthy but he was okay when the emt came.
author: Carolyn Y.

description: Never again... after a lengthy wait on a cold, windy, foggy evening we were finally seated way in the back in the overflow room.  It was as chilly as the weather outside.  Our orders were taken and we received our salad & bread.  The waitress informed me they ran out of soup and were in the process of opening a new bag.  Bag?  I thought they made fresh soup everyday!  As I waited, everyone else was finished with their meal I thought I could fill up on the all you can eat  bread sticks and salad... which I had to keep asking for.  When my meal finally arrived in a very small bowl... I was truly disappointed with the portion and the taste, well let's just say Campbell's soup beats OG hands down!!   We were all disappointed in this established restaurant and decided the prices were too high for what they served and would make this our last visit here!
author: deborah s.

description: better than delfinas!  okay, i said that to stir shit up but i had to raise the o.g.'s score a notch.  come on, people!  it's the fucking olive garden!  what do you want?!  $7.99 gets you soup or salad, breadsticks and unlimited pasta (AND they have decent veggie and vegan options.)  I always have such a good time here too because you can be loud and gross and totally american and no matter how disturbing you are, you know these waiters have seen worse.  waaaaay worse.  look, the last time i ate here the paramedics had to be called because a woman started having a heart attack.  this is the best part: i overheard some people waiting in line say, "at least that clears up a table!"  GOD BLESS AMERICA!
author: Laura B.

description: Food is pretty good but not super great. Almost worth the price. To me a bit expensive for casual Italian. I love Italian food so I'm biased to give a higher rating.  About $18 for a Chicken and Shrimp Carbonara. Did you know that the carbonara has about 48 grams of saturated fat?! Damn! Or the Asparagus and Shrimp Risotto has about 17 grams of saturated fat? Damn!!  This food is deadly. The wait can be long on the weekends, but once seated, you can get your food fairly quickly and service also seemed to be fine.
author: Dijon Y.

description: me and a freind went to eat here recently and this place wasn't all that bad we didn't wait that long to be seated like about 10 or 15 minutes when we ordered the food came preatty quickly i had spaghetti and meatballs and my freind had chicken alfredo the food was preatty good and the staff was helpful and freindly the bread sticks where hella good also the salad i had wasn't that bad either i would probably come here again ....
author: Jose C.

description: the people are ass****s, the food sucks, my lasagna is cold, there a pubic hair in my food and MY NIPPLES ARE HARD
author: Ernesto A.

description: I don't know what possessed us to eat here, but I definitely wasted an hour or two of my life because of it. I know I shouldn't expect much from this so called "authentic Italian" restaurant, but as a consumer you at expect it to be satisfactory. As is always the case at this place, we had to wait nearly an hour to be seated. Upon being seated we waited what seemed like forever for our server to notice we even existed. It also was upsetting that after taking our orders it took a while for them to bring us our drink orders and the complimentary breadsticks. By the way, the breadsticks I think we're the only highlight of our meal. The Zuppo Tuscano was okay (they told us they ran out of  this momentarily... WTF!), the Stuffed Chicken Marsala was kinda salty, and the Steak Tuscano was dry and kinda oily. I definitely don't recommend this place to anyone, especially since there are a lot more Italian restaurants that is many times more better than this place. Stay away from The Olive Garden.
author: Rommel N.

description: If Nathaniel is the guy waiting on your table, please step away from this place. He has an attitude. He brought our food after multiple requests and did not bother to apologize. Food was nice, but this guy served us real tiny portions than what I usually get. He overcharged us than what was mentioned in the menu. His attitude kept us away from speaking to him and ask him about it. Did not provide us the mints either. Horrible service from olive garden for the first time. I used to be a regular here, but will never go there again (Chevy's is next door!!!)
author: Tom J.

description: The food was what I expect at olive garden, but our waiter, Keith, was outstanding.  It is rare to receive this quality of service in a chain restaurant.  Unfortunately, the manager did not want to hear my compliment. What's up with that?
author: darren f.

description: nah..I guess generic Italian food is not my thing
author: Lerka J.

description: This place is one of my favorites. Although the lines are usually long it is worth the wait. The place is always so spotless. Great for dates are a night out with friends. Good costumer service (- mins the wait )!
author: lilpandagirl P.

description: I'm not a big fan of Olive Garden...now.  When I was in high school though (and even when I was at CCSF), Olive Garden was about as high class of a restaurant that I would ever go to.  The bf at the time and I used to go here ALL THE TIME.  Now I go maybe once a year - with family.  Because when you're here, you're family!  So I went this past Friday night with my parents for a quick meal.  The wait was 60 minutes (!!).  They gave us the little vibrating pager thing so we walked around the mall.  When you get too far from the restaurant, the thing starts playing music.  Really loudly.  And it's like it knows when you're in a quiet store because it seemed like it only played music when we were in a store versus out in the mall area.  So embarassing!  We finally just went back to the restaurant and only had to wait 5 minutes to be seated.  I do like their chairs with the wheels.  Those are kind of fun to wheel around in for a while.  I ordered the chianti braised short ribs.  Maybe it's because I had such low expectations but my food was good!  My short ribs were super tender and the risotto was really good!  I only ate about half of my meal because I stuffed myself with salad and breadsticks already, but I took the rest home to eat for dinner the next night.  Two meals in one!  I probably still wouldn't come here often.  I hate the long waits and the food is generally subpar - especially for the price.
author: Kris L.

description: i ate here twice and for some reason i became sick. i had the worst stomach ache it hurt so bad. i never want to come back here. their food sucked big time. the soup didnt even look like someone had prepared it, looked like it came straight out of a can. im sure there are better authentic italian restaurants in the city.
author: Bianca B.

description: don't bother to come here. the food is okay but the service is bad. go find a real italian restaurant with better food and service.
author: Lynn P.

description: i know i know, what the hell was i doing in a chain italian restaurant? how could i when i live in fabulous san francisco? how could i shame mario and luigi like that? well.... i was hungry and they had the 'tour of italy', so shutup. my roommie and i decided to fill ourselves up with this psuedo italian food and loved every freakin minute. sure the marina sauce was nothing special... sure the ambience was super cheese... and sure, i could have gone to gaspare's and been blown out of my shoes but i didnt. i went to olive garden and had the tour of italy and too many bowls of salad and wayyyyyy to many bread sticks. +3 for the fact that they keep bringing me more and more food and -2 for the fact its an olive garden. great service though. loved the waitress.
author: Aly L.

description: i like olive garden because of the tasty bread that they attempt to fill your stomach with before you get your main course. the food was good but not the best. i don't like being in stonestown though so that automatically gave it a little lower rating. plus REALLY OILY PASTA
author: Eric Y.

description: Olive garden (in general, not this one) is one of my sisters favorite restaurants. My ex's daughters's too. n loves it.  Everyone always raves about olive garden, and its all over the commercials. Yet, this was only my 2nd time EVER at an olive garden. the first was yrs ago in Rhode Island.  the second was a month ish ago, on a saturday night.  we had to wait of course... but not too too long. chain places, esp ones with a mall, always have waits. j and i had the salad to start, which was pretty good. nothing totally special, but unlimited. b had the soup, which he liked. b always has the soup, you'll notice, if you read a lot of my reviews lol. i am not a big pasta eater. usually i avoid it. but i was starving and i was curious about olive garden, and since im there, i should eat whats best. so i had angel hair. and i forget, some forgetable other stuff was in it. it was tasty. i liked it. everyone liked theirs. the breadsticks were tasty. but nothing was special. im not sure why so many people love this chain so much. this particular one was fine though, the service was fine. it was a typical chain type place. :)
author: Merredith L.

description: It's the freakin Olive Garden fo god's sake! What do you expect? When you want generic italian, why not? (When you want generic mexican, Chevy's is right next door!) I have to agree, I love their salad and their vegetarian options actually aren't too bad.
author: Ro F.

description: Don't go here if you have a big group! It was the worst experience my family has ever had! First of all they don't have reservations, which is very lame and the seating area is the worst! It is so small and barely any seating. It all started out when we got our pager they said it would be a 35 to 40 min wait ok wasnt bad. An hr later we asked them what is taking so long and they said "oh sorry we lost your reservation"! How do you lose a reservation? They didn't even write our names down. So we are still waiting and waiting and finally the manager or owner told us they were sorry and will get us seated shortly...that was the worst part! You know its bad if they offer to give us free apetizers and a free meal for the birthday boy and to top it off free desert..oh and when we left they chased after us to give us a $20.00 gift card..like we will come back? Maybe if its just 2-4 people, but never a huge group again! The food is just ok! It is very Salty! I'd probably prefer Authentic Italian! The only good thing I would have to say is our service was great! Hank I think was his name but he did a great job keeping up with us and was very nice! He gets a Star!
author: Laura A.

description: Have you watched any of their TV ads? If you do, then it's all imaginary. My bf and I decided to visit Olive Garden at the Stonestown Mall since we're thinking about going to the Borders there. How should I describe our experience... hmmm it's awful. We ordered the sangria that not only tasted way too sweet, but it doesn't taste like there's alcohol at all. What kind of sangria was that??? We sat down and the waiter got us some wine. She was nice, so I have no complain on here, but some other waiters were rude. No smile, no apology, no nothing, just whatever. Great. The entree came very fast; I had lasagna and my bf got meatball spaghetti. Put the two entrees in one word: awful. Then the appetizers came... it was wrong... so they took it and got another one. *sigh* When did it happen when appetizers came after entree? We had the sampler, which was also awful. Dude, this is just totally awful. Of course we didn't finish the food. So we were gonna bring it home until the bag they gave us broke and the food fell all over. Maybe it's fate...
author: dannydan d.

description: Okay I haven't been here for a while (last time was my birthday party with like 15 people) so I totally forgot about the WAIT! Omgosh we had to wait a whole hour even though we arrived at 6. Good thing Stonestown is there because I can go SHOPPING !! yay! I put the beeper in my bag and proceed to shop. I get all the way to H&M and the thing starts playing a song so I run .yes I RAN there. People probably thought I was crazy, but man was I hungry. Then they tell me that it was because I was OUT OF RANGE and that I still had to wait 20 mins!!! OMGGosh. Pretty pissed. Anyways had a pleasant dining experience. A+ to the waiters there. They were so nice and helpful. They even have their own Olive Garden Birthday Song! Good Food. Free Salad/Soup/Breadsticks and good sized portions too. I was lured here by their Chicken/Steak Crostada (Mhmm) commercials and I was quite delighted.
author: Claire F.

description: unlimited salad soup and bread sticks is pretty good.
author: Young M.

description:
after our previous good Olive Garden experiences, we went here when visiting SF
we were late, just 20 mins short of closing time 10 pm
the service we received was crappy !!
the salad given with the dinner entree was served even before our appetizer arrived
we had different server come each time needed
the cheese bought to grate over the salad was never even asked as we had already started eating the salad
the entree, Manicotti Formaggio was not at all well prepared
why not refuse entry to the restaurant in the first place rather than spoil the guests evening
author: Chi G.

description: The food is good. The waiters were really nice and cheery, which made me feel better about my bad day. My friends and I were seated within fifteen minutes, which isn't bad, considering my friend once waited fifty for a table. I ordered calamari, salad, peach iced tea, and chicken parmigiana, which came pretty fast, and was hot. The chicken was a bit dry and bland, but the sauce made it better. The pasta that came with it wasn't as great, but it wasn't a problem. The breadsticks looked a bit greasy, so I didn't take any, but the salad was good, except for the onions and peppers.  My friends ordered soup and chicken scampi with angel hair pasta. It was an overall great experience, except for when the bill came, which calculated over fifty bucks, for only three people. We were shocked, but paid it and took off, a bit unpleased that we didn't get our money's worth.
author: Peyton L.

description: This is the second time I've been to Olive Garden; I first heard of it while living in Eugene, OR and a friend wanted to go there also...  we never had the chance and am glad we didn't. After my first experience here (invited guest) I called my Eugene friend warning her to NEVER go to this chain restaurant. The first time wasn't good at all and though this wasn't much better, I did eat something that was much better: the squid in a sampler was very good, and the closest I've come to as far as GOOD squid cooked "right" in the states. That was it....  the place was busy and moving, and I ordered the house wine, and cannot understand why kids working as waitress/ers do NOT know how to pour wine!!! arrrgh!!! Otherwise, a chain restaurant in every sense of the word and while today's experience went fairly well, on my own and paying (I didn't pay today) I wouldn't have come here. As always, too dam cold, my waiter was like "DuH", and the place ~ if you've ever been to Italia (si, I have) the place wouldn't look anything like this! It was very sterile!
author: Tony L.

description: olive garden is fine dining for the middle class.  their portions are huge, and you can get a dinner entree with unlimited breadsticks and soup/salad for less than $20.  i usually go to this place for lunch in between classes for their soup and salad combo (unlimited) and their peach bellini iced tea.
author: rachface -.

description: I've came to this place twice . Most recent time was last week or so . Suprisingly , me and my friends didn't have to wait . But we DID only have three people in total and it didn't seem all that busy . They have pretty good Italian food . The bread is okay but not really that good . The salad is okay .. it's very big hehe . The lasagna is way too salty . The Garlic-Herb Chicken Con Broccoli was decent .. I actually almost finished the whole thing !! Hehe . My friend got a braised beef with tortellini which was good .. I loved the tortellini . It was very yummy and falvorful hehe . The Sicilian splash was very nice and refreshing . The Peach Iced Tea was very good as well . Very flavorful and they actually put pieces of peach in there !! Not too sweet but just right . Service was kind of slow .. took them forever to get a to-go box and the check . The to-go box was cute though . It's those aluminum thingys you use to make chicken pies . The atmosphere is nice .. not too overdone , makes me feel at home in a way . Btw , if you plan on visiting .. be sure to come here ahead of time because like The Cheesecake Factory and Buca di Beppo , you have to wait a long time . I think this place takes reservations though . The good thing is that you can shop while you wait .. but be sure not to go too far because the thing they give you  goes off on the second floor of Stonestown .
author: Eileen L.

description: Stopped by for dinner after some Christmas shopping at Stonestown's Galleria. The food was okay. Don't expect authentic Italian though. The service was great and the wait wasn't too long.
author: sebastian p.

description: The place is usually busy, so most of the time it take forever to get a seat. However, the food is great. The waiters are outgoing and active. The free breadsticks are alright, but isn't all that great. My mom can make better, haha.
author: Michelle J.

description: I had one bad experience at the Olive Garden in Stonestown and I have not been back.  The waitress who waited on our table  was not customer oriented,  she should not have been hired to work there at all.   For one, our breadsticks never came.  Everytime when we were able to get her attention, her excuse was they ran out of breadsticks and are baking more.  What was strange we noticed all the other tables had breadsticks brought to them by their server.  And how can a restaurant who advertised  themselves as an all you can eat breadsticks, soup and salad joint, run out of breadsticks.  Finally about an hour later, our breadsticks arrived.   There were only 4 sticks in the basket when we had a party of 5.  She was the Olive Garden idiot.    I was so frustrated that evening I wrote to their corporation complaining about the waitress.  Corporation sent me a $35.00 gift certificate to return to Olive Garden.  I just passed the card on to a needy person.
author: Eatalot Y.

description: This place always seemed packed.  I was there one day at 3 pm, and there were tons of people waiting?!!??  I do like the food and atmosphere though.  The breaksticks and salad are good; the pasta isn't bad but not the best.  The service is inconsistent.  They try to sell you the wine all the time.  I like the ravioli.
author: Amy V.

description: i feel like a dork rating olive garden, but i'm doing it anyway cause i was pleasantly surprised. when my dad told me he'd take me here for their endless pasta bowl, i wasnt too excited. the wait still sucks (45 mins on a monday night!). the staff is pretty young and extremely nice and accommodated our huge baby stroller ("When you're here, you're family" : check). i never liked ordering the endless pasta bowls because unlimited pasta and unlimited breadsticks usually means endless constipation for me (tmi?) But i was surprised to find that you can now add unlimited meatballs and sausage to your bowls for only $2 more. and they don't skimp on the meat (2 huge sausages per bowl). i also liked that they had one whole wheat pasta option, so there's my fiber. and if you really wanna take advantage, order another bowl, take a couple bites, and box it for a midnight snack. 3 stars cause their food still doesn't taste Italian.
author: Douglas F.

description: i ate there with some friends. food was not bad. however, me and all my friends had a bad stomach ache afterwards. i think maybe one or two of my friends felt sick. also..this other time a waitress accidentally spilled water on me and me and my friends waited for the food too long.
author: Serene N.

description: Seriously, the OG is what it is. This is not a fine dining restaurant so don't expect too much people. I actually used to work at this OG a few years back. And although i left on somewhat bad terms, i would STILL dine here. I guess i have somewhat of an upperhand since 1) ive tasted every single thing on the menu and 2) i know how they operate. I know when the best times to go are. And a little secret to share with you all, if you come in on a weekend for dinner and its super crowded, sit at the bartop or anywhere in the cafe. There is no wait to sit there but you get the same service and food. The only negative aspect of this place is that sometimes you get stuck with a shitty server. Oh and another tip, this place is big on customer service. Complain to the manager and 9 out of 10 times, whatever your complaint is about, you get comped. Unless you complain about your drink or entree that is halfway consumed lol. All in all, i love the OG food and their peach bellini iced tea. Great place to go for a cheap date or to pig out.
author: Liss E.

description: One day I saw the all you can eat pasta on commercial for $8.99! Damn.. I'm there!. So after the gym, we decided we were starving. I mentioned Olive Garden, but these guys were iffy due to their reputation. But, I insisted and so we went. The wait was 1 hour and 30 minutes.. WTF? Though I could not pass up all you can eat pasta for $8.99. Luckily, Stonestown Galleria was still open. Hour and a half later we ordered the all you can eat (+$1.99) if you want meat, but I don't recommend it. The meal came with endless salad, soup, and breadsticks. We decided to leave the breadsticks alone and save our stomach for the pasta. The all you can eat pasta deal consisted of 5 different pastas and 5 different sauces. You can mix and match as you like. Surprisingly, OG offered whole wheat as one the pastas. Anyways, 4-5 orders later we were STUFFED!. Will I do it again? In a heartbeat.. even though the pasta was mediorce at best... Oh.. and the waiter was super attentive on this busy night.
author: Simon S.

description: went to olive garden after shopping. what a mistake! we ordered off the lunch menu. when we got our lasgna i couldnt believe how small it was and it was overpriced for size. mine wasnt cold but it wasnt hot either. ive had better tasting lasgna that i bought frozen.
author: louise d.
